Job Description:
Job Summary:

As a Certified Behavior Analyst at Step By Step Academy, you will play a pivotal role in designing, implementing, and evaluating behavior intervention programs for children with diverse needs. You will work closely with our team of professionals to develop and execute strategies that promote positive behavior change and enhance the quality of life for our clients. Your expertise will contribute to the success of our mission to provide comprehensive and evidence-based services to those we serve.

Key Responsibilities:

Conduct comprehensive assessments to identify behavioral needs and develop individualized behavior intervention plans.
Implement behavior interventions using a variety of techniques and strategies.
Monitor and analyze data to assess the effectiveness of behavior intervention plans.
Collaborate with clients, families, caregivers, and other professionals to ensure a holistic and collaborative approach to behavior support.
Provide training and support to clients' families and caregivers to promote consistency and generalization of skills.
Maintain accurate and organized records of assessment, intervention, and progress data.
Stay current with research and best practices in the field of behavior analysis.

Qualifications:

Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) certification.
Master's degree in Applied Behavior Analysis, Psychology, Education, or related field.
Strong understanding of behavior analysis principles, strategies, and methodologies.
Experience conducting functional behavior assessments and developing behavior intervention plans.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Compassionate, patient, and empathetic demeanor.
Proficiency in data collection and analysis.

Job Types: Part-time, Full-time

Pay: $60.00 - $76.00 per hour

Ability to Commute:

Miami Lakes, FL (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

_Function in a supervisory capacity and provide oversight to all areas of programming including the training of direct support professionals, and person centered strategies consultants (if applicable) .

_ Assist in the development, facilitation, and follow-up training in Applied Behavior Analysis, using both discrete trial training and natural environment training models of teaching.

_Facilitate and assist in the development and identification of resources and support information for clients and their families

_Provide model teaching and other direct instructional supports including, but not limited to, practicum supervision/teaching, class instruction and in-service instruction to other support professionals.

_Assist in the development and implementation of assessment tools, to conduct functional assessments and analyses when appropriate, and to develop appropriate behavior strategies to teach appropriate behavior and reduce maladaptive behaviors.

_Provide ongoing support and training to direct support professionals, ABA implementers, and other individuals in support roles for families.

_Ongoing training and supervision of paraprofessional staff in implementation of ABA principles and methodology and behavior reduction strategies.

_Create ongoing data collection system to establish baseline and programmatic efficacy for all consumers, and to analyze data on a frequent and ongoing basis to guide programming.

_Develop behavior plans/treatment plans for all consumers with a focus on teaching and other antecedent strategies for reducing problematic behavior(s).

_Meet as needed with supervised staff to discuss ongoing consumer issues and to provide support when necessary.

_Review and sign off on behavior plan/treatment plan training for all field staff and provide field supervision when necessary.

_ Utilize Set Works website to enter session notes within 72 hours of each session.

_Provide consultation services and to maintain ongoing communication with all constituents (other supports, parents, community, and community agencies).

_Keep current with the literature, new research findings and resources. In addition, continuing education courses to maintain BCBA certification are necessary (32 credits every 2 years).

_ Maintain all data, paperwork, and communication between personal care staff and families, and to provide ongoing feedback to government related agencies that contract with such families.

_Perform other duties as assigned.

About Us:

Little Tesla Pediatric Therapy is a thriving, family-owned ABA practice dedicated to providing comprehensive therapeutic services for children aged 0-21. Our multidisciplinary team, which includes Board Certified Behavior Analysts (BCBAs), Occupational Therapists (OTs), Speech-Language Pathologists (SLPs), and Physical Therapists (PTs), collaborates to create a holistic and individualized approach to care. At Little Tesla, we are passionate about making a positive impact in the lives of children and their families. We strive to practice quality over quantity.

Job Description:

We are currently seeking a dynamic and enthusiastic Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) to join our team at Little Tesla Pediatric Therapy. As a BCBA, you will play a crucial role in developing and implementing behavior intervention plans, collaborating with our team of therapists, and working closely with families to support the unique needs of each child.

Responsibilities:

1. Conduct comprehensive functional behavior assessments and develop evidence-based behavior intervention plans.

2. Collaborate with our multidisciplinary team, including Occupational Therapists, Speech-Language Pathologists, and Physical Therapists, to provide integrated and holistic care.

3. Provide ongoing supervision, training, and support to behavior technicians and other team members.

4. Collaborate with families to ensure a family-centered approach to intervention and treatment planning.

5. Monitor and analyze data to evaluate the effectiveness of behavior intervention plans and make data-driven adjustments.

6. Maintain accurate and up-to-date client records, progress notes, and reports.

7. Stay informed about the latest research and advancements in the fields of Applied Behavior Analysis, Occupational Therapy, Speech-Language Pathology, and Physical Therapy.

Qualifications:

1. Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) certification.

2. Master's degree in Applied Behavior Analysis or a related field.

3. Experience working with children aged 0-21 with developmental and behavioral challenges.

4. Strong collaboration, communication, and interpersonal skills.

5. Ability to work collaboratively within a multidisciplinary team.

6. Commitment to family-centered and evidence-based practices.

How to Apply:

Interested candidates should submit a resume to info@littleteslapediatrics.com. Please include "BCBA Application" in the subject line. Applications will be accepted until 12/31/2023.

We aim to continually establish best-in-class standards in integrity and quality for not only ourselves, but also in the field of ABA. We work courageously and with accountability to focus on the individuality of each child, collaborate with client families, and generate permanence in client outcomes. We strive to hire and to invest in our greatest asset - our employees, who are the heart of Acorn Health.

You'll have the opportunity to work in a team-oriented environment and engage in a wide range of activities, focused on providing behavior analytic assessment and treatment services in our clinical centers, at client homes, and/or in community settings.

What our BCBA Program Supervisors do:

Oversee client treatment from assessment through care delivery
Conduct initial and follow-up functional, behavioral and developmental assessments
Develop, oversee and implement client's BIPs and Treatment Plans
Serve as the clinical lead on client cases, providing supervision to Behavior Technicians
Monitor and review client programs to analyze data, measure progress and make necessary changes to the treatment plan
Observe program implementation, and provide training on interventions as needed
Work closely with clients and their families providing family training and support
Meet with primary caregivers to discuss observations and concerns
Collaborate with colleagues, parents, and schools to share information and implement best practice intervention programs across settings
Promote awareness and disseminate information regarding ASD and Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) through training and presentations, both on- and off-site
Attend and participate in team meetings where ideas, success stories, and recent research topics are presented for discussion and use in treatment

Why work for Acorn Health:

Competitive salary
Paid Parental Leave
Incentive Bonus
Paid time off and paid holidays
Medical, dental and vision insurance
Retirement Plan
Life insurance, long term and short term disability
CEU opportunities
Professional development funds
Career development opportunities, including Acorn's Leadership Development Institute
Opportunities to collaborate with and learn from our Clinical Advisory Board led by Dr. Greg Hanley
Positive and collaborative environment
Balanced caseloads and flexible work environment
Supportive administrative back office

You're perfect for the position if you:

Possess a master's degree in ABA or a related field
Have active Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) certification
Have knowledge of best practices in the treatment of autism
Have Experience working with children, adolescents, young adults, and their families
Are able to communicate effectively, verbally and in writing, in English
Have reliable transportation, a valid driver's license, and satisfactory driving record
Meet the physical requirements of the position, to include lifting of packages, or equipment, and accessing non-barrier free premises
Enjoy working in an interdisciplinary team approach to develop and implement client treatment plans
Have strong organizational skills, are detail-oriented, able to maintain records, prepare reports and reliably develop timely correspondence related to work
Are able to pass a background check
Have the flexibility to work independently when needed, but also enjoy working as a part of the larger team

Apply to join our team today!

Your positive impact on our clients and their families will be significant, and you will expand your knowledge and expertise ready to take on additional challenges and grow your career.

The Team

Healthier Choices Management Corp (HCMC) is a U.S. based, publicly traded company specializing in providing consumers with healthier alternatives to everyday lifestyle choices. HCMC is an established 15 year old company, with an excellent leadership team that has continued plans for growth!

Under its wholly owned subsidiaries, Healthy Choice Markets, Inc., Healthy Choice Markets 2, LLC, Healthy Choice Markets 3, LLC, and Healthy Choice Markets IV, LLC, HCMC owns and operates Ada's Natural Market, a 18,000 sq. ft. full-service grocery store serving Fort Myers, FL, along with three (3) Paradise Health & Nutrition locations in the greater Melbourne, FL area, two (2) Mother Earth’s Storehouse locations in Hudson Valley, NY, and eight (8) Green’s Natural Foods locations in Westchester, NY and across New Jersey, all serving their respective local communities. These stores provide all-natural and organic products in a friendly and helpful atmosphere, with aisles of traditional grocery complete with frozen, healthy home, vitamins & supplements, health & beauty, fresh produce, hormone and antibiotic free meats and bulk foods. Ada's Natural Market and Mother Earth’s Storehouse also offer chef-prepared ready-to-go foods, a 100% organic juice & smoothie bar, a free-trade coffee bar with fresh-baked-daily baked goods.

Healthier choices extend past just healthy eating. HCMC, through its Healthy Choice Wellness Centers, offer premium and optimized whole person-centered care and services, tailored to promote and maximize one's general health and well-being. Healthy Choice Wellness Centers’ services are designed to address one or more common concerns, including but not limited to immunity, anxiety, mental fortitude, sports recovery, and more. Through these services, which include IV Nutrient Drip Infusions and Intramuscular (IM) Injection Treatments, Healthy Choice Wellness Centers seek to provide healthy alternatives that treat the mind and body to its core, thus offering optimized Healthier Living.

Job Title: Board Certified Assistant Behavior Analyst (BCaBA)

Job Category: Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA)

Location: Brooksville, Spring Hill, Inverness, Port Richey, New Port Richey, Dade City, Zephyrhills

Travel Required: Travel Required

Salary Pay Range: $45,000-62,000 per year

Position Type: Full time and part time hourly available, salary position available after 90 days

Perks: W2 Employee, Weekly Pay, Supervision for BCaBA/BCBA professional development, company paid team outings quarterly, small caseload

Benefits: 2 Weeks paid time off, 5 paid holidays (3 mandatory, 2 of choice), 401K with up to 4% matching, HRA $100/ month, personal Anytime Fitness gym membership, Mileage reimbursement between clients

Work Equipment: Company issued iPad, Company issued Laptop, Online Data Collection

Job Description

ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Conduct functional behavioral assessments, including functional analyses, and provides behavior analytic interpretations of the results.
Designs function based behavior plans and supervises behavior analytic interventions.
Effectively develops and implements appropriate assessment and intervention methods for use in unfamiliar situations and for a range of cases. Seeks the consultation of more experienced practitioners when necessary.
Teaches others to carry out ethical and effective behavior analytic interventions based on published research and designs and delivers instruction in behavior analysis.
Creates and implements appropriate function based replacement behavior trainings.
Provides on-going training of caregivers.
Collects and analyzes data using paper and electronic data collection systems.
Completes on-going monitoring and evaluation of all behavioral objectives.
Completes all required documentation and provides to all appropriate parties. This documentation includes but is not limited to the following: contact and service logs, session notes, supervision documentation of supervisees, assessment reports, monthly summaries of monitoring including the who, what, when and where of the monitoring event, behavior analysis service plans and services provided including graphic displays of acquisition and reduction behaviors related to implementation of the service plan, bi-annual reports
Supervise RBT's as needed for caseload
Attend all required and/or appropriate meetings including team meetings, case meetings, parent meetings, school meetings, or any other meeting required in regards to client service provision or employment.
Follows all conduct guidelines and disciplinary standards as described by the Behavior Analyst Certification Board.
Meets all requirements of the Behavior Analyst Certification Board for continuing education and renewal and/or recertification requirements.
Receive supervision from a BCBA and follows the Behavior Analyst Certification Board’s policy on supervising
Ensures the required documentation is completed daily
Communicate daily with stakeholders (BCBA, parents, teachers, etc.)
Utilize electronic data collection system and inputting programs.

- Ongoing supervision is provided under the direction of a BCBA on the principles and procedures of behavior analysis, data collection procedures, management of staff, and the implementation of skill acquisition and behavior reduction procedures

QUALIFICATIONS AND EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS

Board Certified Assistant Behavior Analyst Certification from BACB

Basic Life Skills Certification (or in person CPR certification with in person evaluation)

Florida Medicaid Number (or eligible for Medicaid number- never been terminated from Medicaid)

NPI Number

Consent and Pass Level 2 Background Check

PREFERRED SKILLS

Works well independently, can lift 25 pounds, able to work with children, excellent interpersonal and communication skills (spoken and written), familiar with iPad

ADDITIONAL NOTES

Must be able to commute independently to service clients in home/ school/ community settings.

As a Business/Procurement Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in streamlining our procurement operations by providing accurate and timely data analysis and entry. Data Analysis: Conduct thorough analysis of procurement data to identify trends, cost-saving opportunities, and process improvements.

Data Entry: Ensure precise and efficient data entry, maintaining data integrity within our systems.

Reporting: Create and maintain reports that provide insights into procurement performance, supplier evaluation, and inventory management.

Process Optimization: Collaborate with the procurement team to identify and implement process improvements to enhance efficiency and reduce costs.

Vendor Evaluation: Assist in evaluating vendor performance based on data analysis, contributing to supplier selection and negotiations.

Compliance: Ensure compliance with procurement policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements through data analysis and reporting.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Business, Supply Chain Management, Finance, or a related field.

Strong analytical skills with a keen attention to detail.

Proficiency in data analysis tools and software (e.g., Microsoft Excel, SQL).

Exceptional computer skills, including data entry and database management.

Strong communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams.

Prior experience in procurement or supply chain analysis is a plus but not required.

Competitive salary and benefits package.

Opportunity to work in a dynamic and innovative environment.

Chance to make a significant impact on our procurement processes.

Career growth opportunities within our expanding organization.

If you are a quick thinker, adept at data analysis, and passionate about optimizing procurement operations, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Job description:

The healthcare Data Analyst will provide meaningful insights to the organization by analyzing data using best practices. This is a pivotal role in supporting data-driven decision making. Proficiency in Excel, a strong analytical mindset, and an interest in healthcare are essential for this role.

About the Company:

Founded upon the principle to preserve physician independence by delivering value-based healthcare, Advanced Management USA offers accountable care management and consulting services to physician practices and hospitals. Our services focus on positioning providers to be the central coordinators of healthcare, while achieving the three-part aim of improving patient experience, population health, and healthcare value.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Analysis:

- Responding to requests for data by determining user’s needs, collecting, organizing, and analyzing data, and providing accurate and complete information.
- Working with other analysts to evaluate the performance of practices, facilities, provider services and utilization.
- Identifying trends, patterns, anomalies, and areas of opportunity.

Reporting:

- Creating charts, graphs, and other visualizations.
- Running production reports.
- Presenting findings to relevant team members and stakeholders.
- Creating and updating templates.

Quality Assurance:

- Validating analytical and production reports to ensure accuracy and completeness.
- Collaborating with team and notifying of any potential issues/bugs to resolve issues.

Communication:

- Completing projects by coordinating resources and timetables with user departments and data team.

Continuous Learning:|

- Follow and implement industry trends and best practices.
- Implement strategies of improvement.
- Taking initiative to improve methodologies and contribute to team success.

Additional Duties:

Handling team concerns in a helpful and objective manner.
Abiding to all HIPAA, confidentiality, and privacy laws.
Providing insight and suggestions for process improvement.
Other duties as assigned by management.

Qualifications:

To perform the job successfully, an individual should have the following competencies. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Computer Science, Healthcare Informatics, Statistics).
Strong knowledge of data, data objects, data structure, and industry standards.
Advanced knowledge of Excel (e.g., pivot tables, index-match, macros).
Knowledge of SQL, VBA, and visualization tools.
Proficiency in MS Office stack (Excel, Word, SQL Server Suite, PowerPoint, Outlook, Teams).
Ability to work independently and as a member of a team.
Excellent attention to detail and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Attendance/Punctuality - Consistently at work and on time.
High accuracy and extreme confidentiality a MUST.
Strong internet research capabilities.
Knowledge of legal and ethical consideration related to patient information (e.g., HIPAA, PHI, PII)
Basic knowledge of Python (preferred).
Familiarity with healthcare data and the Accountable Care Organization (ACO) model (a plus).
Ability to lift and/or move up to 10 pounds.
Eagerness to continuously learn and adapt to new methodologies and technologies.

OVERVIEW

The Data Governance Analyst reports to the Data Governance Lead and will play various roles in the overall governance of enterprise data. The Data Governance Analyst will take an active role in supporting various enterprise and data governance-related projects through the creation and development of data governance, data dictionaries, policies, processes, and procedures that promote best practices and support the mission of the data and analytics team. Additionally, they will be responsible for working with internal business and IT teams to identify, develop, track, report, and improve current data quality management capabilities for the enterprise. The Data Governance Analyst will also be charged with ensuring a robust well-governed process as it relates to the existing data content management systems.


DETAILED ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

Further enterprise data governance processes within the areas of Data Quality, Document, and Content Management, and Reference and Master Data Management.
Collaborate with Data Governance leadership on prioritization and scheduling.
Assist in the development, creation, and implementation of policies, processes, procedures, and standards related to governing data and metadata across the organization.
Support various IT and data-governance-related projects and project tasks as assigned.
Work with data owners to develop and implement plans for managing data.
Assist other teams in the review, collection, and correction of data artifacts.
Serve as a liaison between the IT department and business units.
Communicates with the user community any global changes to master data files.
Educate employees on data governance best practices.
Monitor compliance with data governance policies and procedures.
Identify and track metrics to measure the effectiveness of data governance.
Prepare reports on data governance activities.
Keep abreast of new technologies and trends in data governance.
Conduct audits of data to ensure accuracy and completeness.
Investigate and resolve data quality issues


WORK EXPERIENCES

3+ years experience working with data in a manufacturing corporate setting
OpenText or other related document and content management related experience is required
3 year’s SAP experience or equivalent ERP system required
Knowledge and understanding of GS1, ISO, and other global standards organizations
Strong ability to document detailed processes and procedures.
Strong understanding of data governance concepts and principles
Experience developing and implementing data governance policies and procedures
Ability to analyze and interpret data to identify trends and issues
Excellent communication, presentation, and project management skills
Bilingual – Spanish is preferred
Understanding of data catalogs


EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor's Degree required with 3+ years related business experience


ESSENTIAL CAPABILITIES (KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES)

Analytical Skills – Ability to analyze information and make deductions based on available data sets. Ability to track and report data, as needed.
Organization – Strong organization skills, attention to detail, and follow-through to resolve any outstanding issues.
Computer Proficiency – Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)
Energy – High positive energy to take on continuous and complex business challenges in a fast-paced environment. Persistence to drive to solutions despite obstacles and/or competing priorities.
Flexibility - Adapts to change and different ways of doing things quickly and positively; does not shy away from addressing setbacks or ambiguity; deals effectively with a variety of people and situations; appropriately adapts one’s thinking or approach as the situation changes.
Ethics & Integrity – High degree of personal integrity in all business dealings.
Execution – Attentive to detail and demonstrated ability to deliver on accountabilities to help the business and the team be successful. Track record of high performance.
Communication – Excellent written and verbal communication skills; appropriately communicates at all levels of the organization.


LOCATION OF ROLE

West Palm Beach, FL

Business Analyst

Are you a tech enthusiast who loves solving complex problems?
Do you have a keen eye for detail and excellent analytical skills?
Would your friends describe you as a self-starter who takes pride in your work and enjoys collaborating with others?

If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you at The Greentree Group!

WHO WE ARE

The Greentree Group is a dynamic, innovative, and thriving company that specializes in delivering advanced technology solutions to federal, state, and commercial clients. With a team of highly skilled professionals, we provide cutting-edge services and are always pushing the boundaries of what’s possible.

What sets us apart is our commitment to excellence and our passion for the work we do. At The Greentree Group, we are driven by a shared sense of purpose and a desire to make a difference in the lives of people around us. Whether it's helping our clients achieve their goals, developing innovative solutions to complex problems, or giving back to the community, we are dedicated to making a positive impact.

We also believe in investing in our people and providing them with opportunities for growth, development, and advancement. We offer a dynamic and supportive work environment, a culture of continuous learning, and a wide range of benefits and perks that promote work-life balance and personal well-being.

Whether you're a seasoned expert or just starting out in your career, if you're passionate about technology, committed to excellence, and eager to take on new challenges, we want to hear from you!

ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY

As a Business Analyst, you will have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and collaborate with a talented team of professionals in support of a client in the Tallahassee, FL area. Your role will be responsible for monitoring and evaluating software development and system modernization activities in a state-wide implementation effort. Join us and be part of our mission to make a difference!

SOME RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO:

Research, understand, and interpret functional and nonfunctional requirements to include business and stakeholder requirements, data and information requirements, data integration, metadata, data quality, service levels and performance.
Articulate technology in terms stakeholders can understand, and articulate business concepts and processes to the technical team.
Participate in developing business cases, defining high level business objectives, and developing key success factors for solution delivery.
Manage and maintain the Project Risks, Action Items, Issues, Deliverables and Decisions (RAID) log and other Project logs.
Review test plans for acceptance testing to meet user-defined requirements, as directed by the Department.
Oversee and assist the team with testing on system changes by executing test scenarios and record the test results, defects, and resolution of defects.
Provide analytical research and complete tasks.
Review project deliverables and tasks for accuracy, completeness, and quality.
Provide post-implementation support.
Participate in weekly and monthly status meetings, project meetings, and stakeholder meetings.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, or other related field and technical knowledge and understanding of information technology infrastructure and software development practices and techniques. Relevant experience on a year-to-year basis can substitute for specific degree requirement.
Minimum of three years of experience gathering, documenting, and managing business and technical requirements for system implementation.
Minimum of three years of experience collecting and analyzing data, and software process evaluation and improvements.
Minimum of three years of experience working both independently and as a member of project team, in the analysis, design, development and implementation of a complex system implementation.
Minimum of three years of experience in developing detailed project documentation and presentations.
Minimum of three years of experience assisting customers with development of business cases with application testing and implementation.
Minimum of three years of experience in meeting facilitation and documentation.

DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Experience providing consulting services to a government client or agency.

The Data Governance Analyst will play a vital role in ensuring the accuracy, security, and compliance of HR data within our organization. You will collaborate with stakeholders to develop and enforce data governance policies, implement data quality standards, and drive data-related initiatives. This position also serves as a technical point-of-contact for the assigned functional area and assists subject matter experts with ensuring data integrity, testing of system changes, report writing and analyzing data flows for process improvement opportunities. This position will also support HRMS upgrades, patches, testing and other technical projects as assigned.

Responsibilities:

Essential duties include, but are not limited to:




Develop and enforce data governance policies, procedures, and data standards to ensure data integrity, accuracy, and security.
Collaborate with HR leadership to develop and implement a comprehensive data governance strategy for HR data, aligning with organizational goals and compliance requirements
Collaborate with functional users and IT in the review, testing and implementation of HR system upgrades or patches.
Maintain data integrity and facilitate effective decision-making across the HR function.
Recommend process/customer service improvements and serve as a key liaison with third parties and other stakeholders (e.g. Payroll or Training) providing overall project management for the given HR initiative.
Identify opportunities to leverage HR data for strategic initiatives, reporting, and analytics
Assist in the maintaining data integrity by running queries and analyzing data.

As the Business Analyst - Supply Chain for the CAPP Division, you will be responsible for managing the metal material planning, procurement, and delivery to ensure the efficient and effective movement of materials from suppliers to the appropriate CAPP Sites. You will play a critical role in optimizing the supply chain processes by identifying and addressing bottlenecks, risks, and opportunities for improvement and support the organization's supply chain needs to run smoothly and efficiently to ensure a profit, material continuity.

Key Responsibilities:

Metal Material Management
Responsible for planning, purchasing, and monitoring the metal materials, track to production volume, monitor customers' purchase trends and determine the CAPP Metal needs by utilizing forecast inputs from Sales, other customer knowledge, information, market studies, historical information, market data, sourcing feedback/guidance and collaboration efforts with cross-functional teams.
Accountable to coordinate activities related to the planning and procurement of raw materials and contribute to the global balancing of Materials within Global Planning, ensuring efficient and effective procurement & inventory practices and optimizing the balance between quality, service, reliability, and cost.
Align and collaborate with Metals Sourcing to determine Metal Suppliers per Metal Specifications, tonnage, timing to ship, timing to receive, logistics and handle purchase order management based on the allocations defined.
Monitor supplier performance and assist sourcing with managing supplier relationships to ensure that materials are delivered on time and meet quality standards. Ensure Material deliveries are on time and work with appropriate stakeholders to uphold material continuity and on-time delivery.
Analyze data and methods to predict and improve a company's delivery of products and services to its customers. Manage and oversee the calculation of metal needs and be the SME for metal specification communications among cross-functional teams.
Extract and manage, monitor and all reports regarding Metal Planning, Deliveries, Specification, and overall strategy of metal materials.
Identify and mitigate supply chain risks, such as disruptions in supply, transportation, or demand, and implement contingency plans as needed. Publish key reports of Mill Tonnage supply Monthly, Post tons required, purchases and allocations by mill and ending coil tonnage each month.
Identify and support continuous improvement opportunities to reduce material leadtimes, specification segmentation, and improve efficiency to supply chain and operational process; Contribute to the development of business system initiatives and enhancements.
Inventory Management
Conduct demand forecasting and inventory planning to ensure that materials are available when needed and in the appropriate quantities.
Collaborate with key stakeholders and subject matter experts within each business unit to develop and implement appropriate inventory strategies and forecasting processes.
Maintain the required inventory to run the production and sales process smoothly, having material available, improve order fulfillment, right amount of stock and mitigate having the wrong inventory on hand.
Support supply chain metrics and key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure and monitor performance of material in inventory and supplier inventories.
Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements related to the supply chain.
Sales Inventory & Operations Planning (SIOP)
Support the setup and implementation of a scalable, sustainable process for Sales, Inventory and Operations Planning process. You will work with account managers, operations personnel, financial analysts, and senior leadership as we continue to define and develop SIOP to support an integrated business planning. Coordinate and support reviews as required and identify obstacles and roadblocks to implementing SIOP, develop and communicate possible solutions.
Drive transparency, accountability, and continuous improvement through solutions to track key assumptions, inputs, and outputs; Provide business data analysis to support and implement new business initiatives.





Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in supply chain management, logistics, business administration, or related field
Minimum of 7+ years of experience in supply chain management, preferably in the manufacturing industry with 3+ years' of analytics experience or working in an analyst role or similar to
Must be comfortable in a fast-paced environment with the demonstrated ability to effectively manage multiple priorities to completion
Ability to lead cross-functional teams in a matrixed, geographically dispersed environment and working across organizational boundaries to ensure successful project implementation.
Strong organizational, communication (oral and written) and time management skills
Strong computer skills and proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite and data visualization tools
Strong problem-solving skills
Strong analytical skills and experience with data analysis and modeling tools
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and suppliers
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and other analytical tools
Knowledge of supply chain management software systems and enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems
Familiarity with regulatory requirements related to supply chain management
Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment

Overview

Support the Enterprise Data Governance (EDG) Office in the development of information lifecycle management requirements, guidelines, and best practices for effectively managing enterprise data across the end-to-end data lifecycle. Provide guidance to stakeholders on the collection, discovery, management, access, use, security, retention, and retirement of data assets. Understand business needs and identify opportunities to mature information lifecycle management capabilities. Support the Enterprise Data Governance (EDG) Office in the development of data quality requirements, standards, frameworks, capabilities, and best practices. Provide guidance to stakeholders on developing and implementing data quality strategies and capabilities that improve data accuracy, reliability, and integrity while ensuring fit for intended use. Understand business needs and identify opportunities to mature data quality capabilities. Support the Enterprise Data Governance (EDG) Office in the development of metadata requirements, guidelines, and best practices. Provide guidance to stakeholders for establishing processes to identify, inventory, and capture accurate, complete, and quality metadata. Understand business needs and identify opportunities to mature metadata management capabilities. Support the Enterprise Data Governance (EDG) Office in the development, implementation, and management of Navy Federal's data governance policies, standards, and procedures. Assist in implementing and managing frameworks designed to identify, evaluate, and manage data governance controls across the organization or a particular business. Identify, measure, and report on compliance with data governance requirements.

Responsibilities

Support the drafting, publishing, managing, and enforcement of data quality requirements, standards, frameworks, capabilities, and best practices in collaboration with EDG office workstreams
Perform data quality control assessments
Support the development of data quality metrics in partnership with key stakeholders
Provide advisory services on implementing data quality capabilities (e.g., including data profiling, data quality checks, data quality strategies, data issues, data quality monitoring) within a business area or across the organization
Provide technical training and documentation on data quality policies, standards, procedures, and capabilities in collaboration with EDG workstreams
Provide requirements for optimizing data quality processes and data quality technology solutions
Perform analysis on data quality trends across the enterprise
Conduct research on industry best practices for data quality management including data quality methodologies, frameworks, issue management, tooling, and reporting
Perform other duties as assigned

Define metadata requirements, standards, and best practices for metadata repositories and solutions
Providing ongoing support for metadata implementation, testing, and integration
Conduct metadata management training
Provide technical training and documentation in support of metadata policies and procedures
Provide advisory services on increasing quality, accuracy, and completeness of metadata
Establish requirements and provide best practices for capturing end-to-end data lineage
Develop metadata metrics for monitoring
Support the drafting, publishing, managing, and enforcement of Enterprise Data Governance (EDG) Office policies, standards, and procedures in collaboration with EDG Office workstreams (Data Governance Program Management; Metadata Management; Data Quality; Information Lifecycle Management).
Support the development of guidelines, job aids, and best practices for effectively governing Navy Federal enterprise data.
Partner and coordinate implementation of EDG and InfoSec policies, standards, and procedures with key stakeholders (e.g., Information Services, Enterprise Risk Management, Records and Information Management, Legal)

Identify data governance related regulatory and contractual constraints by Legal, Regulatory Compliance, and Procurement in partnership with Ecosystem governance.

Job Title: Data Analyst - DOD Top Secret Clearance
Job Description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!

We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.

SUMMARY

The Data Analyst will use technology to mine complex, voluminous, and different varieties of data from various sources and platforms, in order to collect, analyze, and compile data to meet customer needs.

• Python experience required.

Python, JavaScript, R, C/C++, SQL, Go, Flask, React, SQLAlchemy, CI/CD preferred.
DoD Top Secret clearance and eligible for SCI access and ACCM read-on.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Essential duties and responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Analyzes local, national, and global trends to identify new sources of data and methods to improve data collection, analysis, and reporting.

Determines technical issues and remove corrupted data & fix coding errors and related issues

Works collaboratively with Intelligence and Data analysis teams to produce qualitative and quantitative data analysis that supports Intelligence products and processes.

Builds data solutions, tools, and capabilities to enable self-service frameworks and/or automation for data consumers to monitor, extract, and report on data.

Works with IDST members and USSOCOM leadership to identify process improvement opportunities, propose system modifications, and devise data management strategies for the enterprise to improve the quality and usability of data.

Uses statistical tools to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets.

Plans daily activities within the guidelines of company policy, job description and supervisor’s instruction in such a way as to maximize personal output.

Responsible for aiding in own self-development by being available and receptive to all training made available by the company.

Responsible for keeping own immediate work area in a neat and orderly condition to ensure safety of self and co-workers. Will report any unsafe conditions and/or practices to the appropriate supervisor and human resources. Will immediately correct any unsafe conditions as the best of own ability.

CNI CORE COMPETENCIES

Responsible for the integration of CNI Core Competencies into daily functions, including commitment to integrity, knowledge/quality of work, supporting financial goals of the company, initiative/motivation, cooperation/relationships, problem analysis / discretion, accomplishing goals through organization, positive oral/written communication skills, leadership abilities, commitment to Affirmative Action, reliability/dependability, flexibility and ownership/accountability of actions taken.

COMPLIANCE

Promotes and encourages a culture of compliance with all applicable rules (federal, state, local, Federal Acquisition Regulations, Code of Federal Regulations, Prime Contract requirements, etc.) for themselves and the company as a whole. Fosters an environment in which they will report any violations or reasonably suspected violation of CNI policy, FAR, and/or CFR and are comfortable discussing the myriad compliance, conflict, FAR, CFR, etc. issues that arise during the performance of a government contract

EDUCATION / EXPERIENCE

Bachelor's degree in a computer science discipline or equivalent and a minimum of 3 (5) years of relevant experience. Experience providing services similar in required tasks, scope, and complexity.

Python experience required.

Python, JavaScript, R, C/C++, SQL, Go, Flask, React, SQLAlchemy, CI/CD preferred.

CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATION

DoD Top Secret clearance and eligible for SCI access and ACCM read-on.

JOB SPECIFIC KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES

Knowledge/experience with Microsoft Professional Suite (Word, Excel, & PowerPoint).

Excellent oral, written, presentation and communication skills.

Excellent facilitation and collaboration skills.

Proven ability to take ownership of deliverables and drive successful execution.

Ability to negotiate with peers and senior leaders to come to an agreed upon and productive solution to business problems.

Strong analytical, problem-solving skills and critical thinking skills.

Exceptional customer service skills with ability to build positive, professional relationships.

Ability to communicate/explain technical information clearly and concisely to a broad range of people with varying levels of technical expertise.

Exceptional organization skills with ability to prioritize tasks and to effectively manage multiple projects and priorities.

Ability to work under pressure and to meet tight deadlines.

Ability to work both independently and in a highly collaborative, team environment.

LANGUAGE SKILLS

Ability to read, analyze and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations. Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers and the public.

MATHEMATICAL SKILLS

Job Title: Marketing Analytics Data Analyst - CRM, Marketing
Job Description:
Are you interested applying your Customer Relationship Management (CRM) skillset to a Fortune 100 retailer? Do you have an innate curiosity to seek out insights and provide recommendations utilizing cutting edge technology and data? Are you looking for a career where customer acquisition, engagement, and loyalty problems come across your desk every day? Do you want to apply your knowledge of customer data and analytics to help solve constantly changing business and customer facing opportunities? Are you interested in utilizing your Alteryx and Salesforce skills to positively impact crucial business decisions?

The CRM Data Analyst is responsible for developing customer and loyalty analytical solutions that support marketing campaign strategy development, execution, and insights. The CRM Data Analyst will bring descriptive analytical skills and direct marketing channel experience to thoroughly understand how to market to our customers most effectively through disciplined segmentation and targeting efforts. This position uses data analytics to uncover trends in customer loyalty and consumer behavior that drive decision making that improves profitability and performance of our stores, products, and services. This position requires an agile software development mindset and the ability to deliver end-to-end full-stack solutions, including ideation/brainstorming, data/feature engineering and cleaning, data wrangling, coding, testing, deploying, data visualization, and maintenance.

Responsibilities include:
responding to analytical requests that provide data driven business insights and recommendations (including development of interactive dashboards and leadership reporting) across Publix business areas, including: Marketing, Corporate Purchasing, Real Estate, and other support areas
developing descriptive analytical models to provide business insights and recommendations across Publix business areas, including Marketing, Corporate Purchasing, Real Estate, and other support areas
the development, execution, deployment, and improvement of team data asset production processes, weekly reporting, automation, QC/data validation, gathering info from SMEs
participating as the primary analytical support for data driven cross-functional strategic initiatives
identifying and engaging in opportunities to grow knowledge and skills related to best practices in analytical technologies, methodologies, verification, knowledge of data sets, drawing insights, and communicating learnings

Support Revenue Assurance activities by developing reporting to identify exceptions to business and process rules, identify opportunities to increase internal controls, and drive awareness of our overall success in those efforts.

Build dashboards and consolidated databases using data acquired from reports and internal systems.

Research/evaluate new analytic methodologies, approaches and solutions.

Business Requirements Analyst

Position Summary: The Business Requirements Analyst is responsible for gathering, analyzing, and documenting the requirements for a new software system. They will work closely with stakeholders, both internal and external, to ensure that the software system meets the business needs and is delivered on time and within budget. The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical and communication skills, with a keen eye for detail.

Key Responsibilities:

Requirements Gathering: Conduct interviews, workshops, and observation sessions with key stakeholders to gather detailed requirements for the new software system.

Documentation: Create clear, concise, and comprehensive requirement documents, including use cases, functional specifications, and data flow diagrams.

Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with project managers, developers, QA teams, and other stakeholders to ensure that requirements are understood and can be effectively translated into technical specifications.

Validation: Ensure that the documented requirements align with the business objectives and validate them with the stakeholders.

Requirements Management: Maintain and update requirements as changes occur during the development process, ensuring that all changes are properly documented and communicated.

Analysis: Identify gaps between current processes and the proposed software system, recommending solutions or changes as necessary.

Prioritization: Assist in prioritizing features and requirements based on business value, risks, and dependencies.

User Acceptance Testing (UAT): Support the QA and testing teams by providing clarity on requirements and assisting in the development of test cases. Participate in UAT to ensure the system meets business needs.

Continuous Improvement: Keep abreast of industry best practices and methodologies to improve the requirements gathering and documentation processes.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in business analysis or a related field.
Strong understanding of software development lifecycles and methodologies.
Proficient in requirement management tools like JIRA, Confluence, or similar.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Certification in Business Analysis (e.g., CBAP, CCBA) is a plus.

THE OPPORTUNITY:

We are seeking a highly motivated and analytical Operations Data Analyst to join our team and support our Senior Vice President (SVP) of Operations in overseeing our diverse network of Grower processing facilities. This role plays a crucial part in gathering, analyzing, and presenting data to enable informed decision-making and process improvements within our operations department. As a Data Operations Analyst, you will work closely with the SVP of Operations to provide valuable insights, streamline operations, and enhance overall efficiency.

Key Responsibilities:

Data Compilation and Analysis:
Collect, organize, and validate data from various sources, including internal databases and external resources.
Conduct thorough data analysis to identify trends, performance metrics, and areas for improvement.
Develop and maintain data models and dashboards for real-time monitoring and reporting.
Report Generation and Presentation:
Create detailed reports and presentations using tools like Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and other data visualization software.
Translate complex data into clear, concise, and visually appealing presentations that can be easily understood by non-technical stakeholders.
Performance Metrics Tracking:
Monitor and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess the operational performance of our Grower processing facilities.
Work with the SVP of Operations to establish benchmarks and set targets for improvement.
Process Optimization:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify operational inefficiencies and areas where improvements can be made.
Propose data-driven solutions to optimize processes and increase productivity.
Documentation and Reporting:
Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation of data sources, methodologies, and analysis processes.
Regularly report findings and progress to the SVP of Operations and other stakeholders.

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE:

Bachelor’s degree in business, Operations Management, Data Analytics, or a related field.
Strong analytical skills and proficiency in Microsoft Excel, data modeling, and data visualization tools.
Excellent presentation and communication skills, with the ability to convey complex information to a non-technical audience.
Attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy.
Ability to work independently, manage time effectively, and meet deadlines.
Prior experience in data analysis and operations support is a plus, but not required.
Experience in business intelligence tools (Power BI, Tableau) would be a plus.
Exposure to Lean Manufacturing would be preferred.

This Data Operations Analyst role provides a unique opportunity to work closely with senior leadership, contribute to the optimization of our Grower processing facilities, and have a direct impact on our company's success. If you are a dedicated and detail-oriented individual with strong analytical and presentation skills, we encourage you to apply for this exciting position and be part of our dynamic operations team.

OTHER DUTIES:

Job Summary:

About the Role & Team

At Disney World Shared Services Procurement Services, we provide a variety of services in support of The Walt Disney Company and its Affiliates around the world! Making buying decisions, managing warehouse inventory, processing orders, expediting, setting up new vendors and stock keeping units (SKUs), managing change orders, resolving vendor payment issues, providing customer service, managing key clients, and ensuring compliance to company policies are some of our primary responsibilities.

DWSS Procurement Services provides domain expertise as it relates to procurement related activities at The Walt Disney Company. We use a variety of purchasing and inventory management systems (e.g. SAP, NALA, Amos, etc.), and are called upon for our expertise in understanding how the process and/or systems work.

What You Will Do

The Purchase to Pay – Project Data Analyst will lead procurement activities during the upcoming F&B system replacement that will support Disneyland Resort and Walt Disney World. The role will focus on current system data that will have to be translated to the upcoming system. You will handle data cleanup and assist with data migration and testing, as well as analyze data for decision making recommendations. You will be an active participant in the design of the new system to clearly align data expectations and results, and actively test systems and data to ensure a smooth launch. During final rollout, you will assist in further training and documentation of system data points as needed, correcting data as needed. You will lead transferring legacy system data to excel formats, ensuring accuracy across Food and Beverage systems. You will perform testing, reconciliation, and audit tasks, ensuring smooth data moves between core systems.

Work multi-functionally to identify, define, collate, document and communicate the data migration requirements

Assist in designing, planning and leading the data migration process

Work across multiple functional projects to understand data usage and implications for data migration across multiple Food and Beverage business systems

Analyze, extract, manipulate and migrate information and data from legacy data management systems, into excel uploaders

Perform data migration audit, reconciliation and exception reporting

Lead cross-program data assurance for physical data items in source and target systems

This role is an 18 month Temporary Assignment.

Basic Qualifications

Experience writing SQL Code

Familiarity with Smartsheet and Snowflake

Self-starter, ability to work under tight timetables and fast paced situations, fluidly shift with changing priorities, and effectively handle ambiguity

Solid experience facilitating, gathering and development of requirements for solutions

Experience leading a large volume of work, prioritizing to ensure results are achieved

Must possess excellent business communication, writing, and social skills

Experience creating presentation materials to communicate project updates

Comfortable when communicating with executive level (Directors, VPs) in presentations, working sessions, and 1-on-1 interactions

Company Overview

With $5 billion in revenue and 3,800+ employees in the U.S., Mexico and Canada, TBC Corporation is a leader in the mobility industry and one of North America’s largest marketers of automotive replacement tires through wholesale and franchise operations. TBC serves wholesale customers in the United States, Canada and Mexico through TBC Brands, NTW, TBC International, and TBC de Mexico. Additionally, TBC responds to the needs of consumers in search of total car care at more than 2,000 franchised tire and automotive service centers under the Big O Tires® and Midas®. TBC is headquartered in Palm Beach Gardens, Florida. TBC markets on a wholesale basis to regional tire chains and distributors serving independent tire dealers throughout the US, Canada, and Mexico. TBC has 20 proprietary brands of tires specializing in passenger, commercial, farm and specialty tires. In 2005, TBC Corp. was purchased by Sumitomo Corporation of America (SCOA). SCOA is the largest subsidiary of Sumitomo Corporation (SC), one of Japan’s major integrated trading and investment business enterprises. In 2018 Michelin, the largest tire manufacturer in Europe, invested in the company which is now a 50:50, privately held joint venture between Sumitomo and Michelin.

Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst who will support our Enterprise with insights gained from analyzing company data. The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for process optimization as well as operational enhancements to drive revenue growth, expense reduction and/or increase cash flow. They must have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, & building and implementing models and dashboards. They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of non-technical stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes.


This role will be a Hybrid work environment.

Job Responsibilities
Utilize data analysis and data mining tools to identify business opportunities (toppling growth, cost reduction, cash flow enhancements) and process improvements.
Build out dashboards for the Supply Chain team to measure KPI’s vs history and targets.
Analyze data, pull out key insights, and clearly communicate findings to stakeholders. Partner with key stakeholders on potential solutions.
Develop data models and algorithms to apply to data sets, to help in decision making when analyzing opportunities and the potential changes.
Design and implement processes for items requiring ongoing monitoring as well as those to measure success of changes implemented.
This individual will be one of the go-to contacts for sourcing data from various systems, understanding the data elements and KPI definitions, and developing new analyses and dashboards
Qualifications
Experience using statistical computer languages to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
Data integrity focused, ensuring proper controls are in place and outputs are complete and accurate.
Develops high quality end products with well-designed visual appeal
Adept at identifying opportunities for process improvements and efficiencies.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.
This is an entry-level position for someone with 2 years or less experience. Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent experience) in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics with the following technical capabilities:
Coding knowledge and mastery in one or more languages (eg. SQL, Python, R, SAS, C/C++, Java, etc).
Experience with querying databases. SQL Server and/or Teradata is preferred. Cognos and/or TM1 experience is also a plus.
Experience working with and creating data architectures is a plus.

Competitive compensation
401k plan with a company match. Immediate 100% vesting
Comprehensive benefits including medical, dental and vision
Company paid short term disability and employer subsidized long term disability

Discounted tire purchasing

SouthState Bank is a nationally chartered bank that provides consumer, commercial, mortgage and wealth management solutions to more than one million customers throughout Florida, Alabama, Georgia, the Carolina’s, and Virginia. With its Correspondent Banking Division, the Bank serves clients coast to coast.

The Check Fraud Team is responsible for protecting the Bank and its customers from check fraud, minimizing check fraud losses, and supporting branches and bank personnel when check fraud occurs.

The Deposit Operations Check Fraud Analyst’s primary responsibility will include, but not be limited to, the monitoring of real-time queues responding to high-risk alerts for checks drawn on our SouthState Bank accounts. Resolve queued transactions within service level agreements to reduce potential losses.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS


Analyze check fraud alerts and identify fraudulent items when compared to legitimate ones.
Ability to research/analyze data and recognize/evaluate patterns of customer activity.
Escalate cases to the Financial Investigations Unit when applicable.
Meet or exceed the accuracy, productivity and all other goals assigned by management.
Interact courteously and tactfully with managers, co-workers, customers and/or vendors.
Can be flexible to work weekends, holidays and/or extended hours as needed.
Accepts other duties as assigned by the manager.
COMPETENCIES


Strong analytical and account research skills are required.
Ability to work well under pressure, maintaining composure and meeting deadlines.
Work as a team with co-workers to ensure all functions are completed timely and correctly.

Education : High School Diploma.
Experience : A minimum of two years of banking and teller experience is required.
Very good knowledge of Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) and other state and federal regulations pertaining to check fraud and check processing.
Certifications/Specific Knowledge: F amiliarity Fiserv Premier core system preferred.
Demonstrated ability to problem solve, strong written and verbal communication skills.
Basic proficiency with Microsoft Office including Outlook, Word & Excel with strong analytical skills.
Excellent organizational skills and ability to prioritize multiple assignments and to meet required timelines.

New Employee Orientation

Continuously update skills by participating in professional training

Must be able to stand and/or sit for long periods of time. Must be able to effectively access and interpret information on computer screens, documents, reports, and cash denominations, and identify customers.

This position is located in a cubicle environment that may be noisy throughout the day. It is also located inside a cooled and heated facility with ability to go to a break room or rest room during breaks.

Telecommuting roles, no matter if hybrid or 100% full time telecommuting, must have a secure home office environment that is free from background noise and distractions. This area also requires a reliable private internet connection that is not supplied by use of cellular data (hot spot). Cable or fiber connections are preferred. Responsibilities


This position utilizes data analysis, data mining, pattern analysis, data visualization, reporting, and data management skills. Has basic expertise in the data science methods used to analyze data, and knowledge of data types, topics, and scientific challenges and approaches. Executes analytical procedures in the framework of a specific project work request. Modifies scripts or software applications to support data management, data extraction and data analysis as required. Contributes to the interpretation of data analysis and to writing reports. May help customers understand the data set and provide training and suggestions for improvement on the data request. You will be a pivotal member of the Digital Innovation Lab (DIL), a hub of creativity and technological advancement on our Florida campus. The DIL is a collaborative space that fosters the development of machine learning and AI to drive innovation and enhance patient care. Our diverse team of data scientists, statistical programmers, biostatisticians, and consultants, works across various specialties to catalyze discovery and translation, generating new insights and ideas that drive research and development. This role is designed for those passionate about leveraging technology to make a meaningful difference in healthcare.


Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in a domain-relevant field such as engineering, mathematics, computer science, statistics, physics, data science, health science, or another analytical/quantitative field. Ability to develop predictive models to address various business problems through leveraging advanced statistical modeling, machine learning, or data mining techniques, is preferred. Demonstrated application of several problem-solving methodologies, planning techniques, continuous improvement methods, and analytical tools and methodologies (e.g. machine learning, statistical packages, modeling, etc.) is required. Incumbent must stay current on healthcare trends and enterprise changes. Interpersonal skills and time management skills are required. Requires strong analytical skills and a commitment to customer service.


Preferred Qualifications

The preferred qualifications are a guide to the skills and experiences that would be beneficial for the work you will engage in. We do not expect you to possess every qualification listed, and we encourage you to apply if you meet a subset of the following criteria:

Nice to Have

Knowledge and experience in multiple programming and domain-specific languages (we primarily use Python, R, SQL, and Linux/Unix scripting)
Practical experience with reproducible research and version control systems like git, ensuring the maintainability and scalability of code bases
Experience with deep learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch or TensorFlow) to implement various model types (e.g., CNNs, LSTMs, RNNs, object detection models)
Desire to bring new ideas to the team, the ability to work independently and continue learning in the rapidly evolving field of AI
Excellent communication skills, including technical writing and formal presentations

Bonus Points

Experience in processing and analyzing/modeling time series, waveform, and image data
Familiarity with cloud computing ecosystems and their foundational technologies (e.g., virtualization, Docker, storage solutions, horizontal scaling)
Experience in developing proof of concept APIs/Applications utilizing Python or R frameworks (e.g., Dash, Streamlit, FastAPI, Flask, R Shiny, and Plumber)
Basic understanding of traditional statistics (e.g., experimental design, regressions, significance tests, confidence intervals, p-values)

Description:

Inter Miami CF seeks a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst to lead, control, and generate partnership packages for prospects and partners. This person will evaluate, analyze, and propose value propositions based on market and industry trends. The BI Analyst will also help administer and maintain the Club’s CRM and asset inventory system, while working to organize and model research, customer and financial data to support business decisions, sales, and go-to-market strategy. The role is responsible for ensuring accurate data in our system to support analysis.

Requirements:

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:

Create customized sponsorship packages for IMCF partners and prospects. This involves continuous communication and coordination with the Business Development (BD) department, PA team and the BI analyst to gather sufficient insights for tailoring proposals to each partner and category. This includes both physical on-site assets and digital assets for partners.
Co-Responsible for managing TRAK system/platform. TRAS is a software that captures all the commercial activities of the Business Development (BD) department, as well as the club's retail inventory and the control of the activation of sponsorship packages /assets by the PA (Partnership Activation) team.
Responsible for controlling and creating commercial assets, ensuring they are correctly included and utilized in sponsorship packages and proposals: 1)Continuously maintain and update the catalog of assets, ensuring all information is recorded in TRAK platform. 2) Monitor inventory of commercial assets, their usage, and their availability.3) Ensure that commercial assets are implemented and delivered as agreed upon.
Stay informed about industry trends by generating benchmarks and best asset creation and activation practices.
Identify new value propositions and projects for partners/prospects by collaborating with other club areas and staying up to date on new possibilities for club assets.

Job Description:

Airbus is an international pioneer in the aerospace industry. We are a leader in designing, manufacturing and delivering aerospace products, services and solutions to customers on a global scale. We aim for a better-connected, safer and more prosperous world.

A commercial aircraft manufacturer, with Space and Defence as well as Helicopters Divisions, Airbus is the largest aeronautics and space company in Europe and a worldwide leader.

Airbus has built on its strong European heritage to become truly international - with roughly 180 locations and 12,000 direct suppliers globally. The company has aircraft and helicopter final assembly lines across Asia, Europe and the Americas, and has achieved a more than sixfold order book increase since 2000.

Airbus Commercial Aircraft is looking for a Fleet Efficiency Data Analyst to join our customer support department based in Miami, FL.

You will be part of a team maintaining fleet efficiency customer dashboards and digital control room, focused on our LATAM airline customers.

Meet the team:

The Customer Support team provides aircraft operations support throughout the aircraft's operational life. The team coordinates, implements and monitors all services customized to meet the customer’s specific needs, to ensure a positive customer relationship. Our Field Service teams provide technical support so our customers can operate safely and efficiently. Being based at our customers' facilities enables us to have a strong customer relationship and understanding of the airline's technical and operational needs.

Your working environment:

The Airbus Training Center (ATC) in Miami provides flight and maintenance crew training for Airbus airline customers – primarily for those based in the Americas. The custom-designed, 110,000-square-foot complex trains more than 2,000 cadets each year in a range of (six) full-flight simulators, innovative computer-based training classrooms, and cabin door and slide trainers – all simulating the A320, A330, A340 and A350 XWB families of aircraft. In Miami you’ll also find the Airbus Latin America headquarters. A team of 60 employees there provides sales, marketing, contracts, customer support and communications for the region’s commercial aircraft, helicopters and space & defense divisions.

How we care for you:
Financial Rewards: Competitive base salary, incentive compensation which may include profit sharing schemes, retirement savings plan and the ability to participate in an Employee Stock Ownership Plan (“ESOP”)
Work/Life Balance: Paid time off including personal time, holidays and a generous paid parental leave program.
Health & Welfare: Comprehensive insurance coverage including medical (traditional and high-deductible health plans), prescription, dental, vision, life, disability, Employee Assistance Plan (“EAP”) and other supplemental benefit coverages.
Individual Development: Upskilling and development opportunities through our global Leadership University, including unlimited access to 10,000+ e-learning courses focusing on ways to develop your employability, certifications, career path as well as the opportunity to participate in accelerated development programmes and both national and international mobility.

At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and accessibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

Your challenges:
Supporting all programs and customer services organizations
Promoting fleet performance tools and support to LATAM customers
Monitor fleet performance of the Americas customers in respect to safety, relicability, and economics
Assist operators in reducing the learning curve and acquire good handling methods by providing necessary transfer of knowledge support

Your boarding pass:
Graduated in engineering, aeronautical studies or aircraft systems
Bachelor’s degree, preferred
2 years of experience in related fields
Knowledge in airline maintenance & engineering activities.
Knowledge in line maintenance operation on Airbus A/C (preferably on A320 or A330 or A340 family)
Knowledge of airline engineering
Knowledge of FAA/EASA Regulation (minimum JAR121, JAR145 and JAR66) is a plus.
Knowledge about airlines’ organization and operation
Good knowledge of customer needs in terms of maintenance & engineering operational activities
Experience in technical service/support field is a plus

Authorized to work in the United States.

Data Analysts use technology to mine complex, voluminous, and different varieties of data from various sources and platforms in order to collect, analyze, and compile data to meet customer needs. Data Analysts will perform the following duties:

Identify new sources of data and methods to improve data collection, analysis, and reporting

Collect customer requirements
Determine technical issues
Design algorithms and data manipulation capabilities using R, Python, C++, JavaScript, Go, and other known programming languages.

About Bloom Medicinals:

Bloom Medicinals is a leading cannabis company with a strong presence in Ohio, Maryland, and Missouri. Our mission is to provide safe and high-quality cannabis products to our customers while maintaining the highest standards in cultivation, production, and dispensary operations.

Position Overview:

We are in search of a proficient Data Analyst to join our IT team at Bloom Medicinals. In this role, the Data Analyst will play a pivotal role in connecting with APIs, crafting robust database structures, contributing to the design of our data architecture, and ensuring strict adherence to our data governance policies. Additionally, experience with data lakes and Power BI is highly preferred. As part of our data-driven journey, you will also collaborate in implementing machine learning and predictive models to further enhance our decision-making capabilities.

Key Responsibilities:

Data Analysis: Undertake rigorous data analysis endeavors, unearthing meaningful insights and patterns to proffer actionable recommendations, consequently buttressing our strategic decision-making processes. Your role is pivotal in influencing business decisions.

API Integration: Connect to APIs, thereby obtaining pertinent data, with unwavering focus on data accuracy and reliability.

Database Design: Spearhead the development and maintenance of our database structures, consistently adhering to best practices in data integrity and security.

Data Architecture: Assume a central role in the design and optimization of our data architecture, aimed at accommodating the ever-evolving data requisites of the organization.

Data Governance: Diligently uphold data governance policies and best practices to ensure unwavering data quality, security, and compliance with regulatory stipulations.

Data Visualization: Leverage your adeptness with tools such as Power BI (or comparable platforms) to craft intricate, interactive dashboards and reports, thereby effectively conveying data-driven insights to stakeholders.

Data Quality Assurance: Put in place data quality checks and validation mechanisms to ensure airtight data accuracy and consistency.

Machine Learning and Predictive Models: Collaborate on the implementation of machine learning and predictive models to augment our decision-making capabilities, thus contributing to our data-driven strategy.

Additional Skills: Must have in depth Excel experience. Prior familiarity with data lakes is a highly advantageous asset. Proficiency in data visualization tools, notably Power BI, is markedly advantageous.

Analytical Aptitude: Showcase a formidable suite of analytical skills and problem-solving acumen, characterized by meticulous attention to detail.
