Job Description


About us:

CitrusAd provides e-commerce retailers with a SaaS digital advertising platform that unleashes the potential of an online shelf space. Through its white-label Retail Media Platform, CitrusAd empowers retailers to monetize their site traffic using personalized advertisement solutions including Sponsored Product listings, Responsive Display Banners, Email advertising, Branded Landing pages, and much more.

At CitrusAd we strive for simplicity, ease and transparency in all we do so that we can deliver outstanding value back to our retailers and brands. Our IT team is on a journey to position our CitrusAd at the forefront of technological advancement - as such we are on the hunt for an Insights Analyst for our growing analytics team.

As an Insights Analyst you’ll be the go-to for providing clear and comprehensive market analysis; and interpretation of key drivers in the US region. You’ll have a choice of being either based in our Tampa (Florida) or Los Angeles (California) office.

You'll be supporting both our Network Sales and Retailer Sales teams to drive insights back to our customers (retailers, brands and suppliers). As such we require a strategic, analytical and results focused professional who is developing their career towards being seen as the market industry expert to all associated internal and external stakeholders. Your ability to be able to communicate and 'tell a story' with the data is just as important as your technical ability.

About you:

You’ll be working with a diverse mix of creative, curious and smart people who really care about making a difference for our customers. You will have a mind for getting things done and a heart for people and you will set the bar high through the quality of the work you do. You’ll have a technical mind that lives in the data and is able to extract meaningful insights (ideally from an advertising technology background). You’ll be able to live in both worlds (a technical and a commercial world) with key skills in storytelling.

About the role:

It’s an exciting environment where no two days are the same. But on a typical day you might find yourself:

Sourcing, identifying, and drawing conclusion from raw data
Working closely with the relevant business stakeholders to identify various business intelligence and analysis needs to support the decision making within the relevant functional domain
Intercepting business ideas/questions/concerns - translating them to the hypothesis, identifying the required data points for hypothesis assessment, retrieving required data from the database, conducting the analysis, circulating back to the business the findings and related business actions
Asking probing questions to ensure the business problem and the analysis requirement is clearly defined
Developing, updating, and automating reports and dashboards using the visualization tool i.e. Domo, and ensuring data quality, data integrity, and the provisioning of clean and accurate data
Working with our Network Sales and Retail Sales teams to analyze the data to spot trends or patterns, and use the analytical skills to find correlations in complex data sets
Working with stakeholders and direct teams (across our Network Sales and Retail Sales teams) to define their requirements and build data assets
Helping the analytics team enable self-service reporting & analytics capabilities across the organization
Working closely with BI Developers to design, build and deploy data models for business consumption
Supporting the deployment of standard Data Assets & tools
Enabling the organization to realize value with Data and Analytics
Defining business requirements by analyzing the problem, facilitate workshops, and assist in defining solution
Performing complex ad hoc data analysis to validate requirements and to present information and findings to the business
Developing insights and reports to drive increased value to our retailers and brands
Working with the broader Data & Analytics team to design, build and deploy the self-service data assets
Leveraging domain knowledge of data lakes, data warehouses, reporting and BI solution and architecture to develop fit for purpose data assets
Providing ongoing support the business teams to ensure re-use of developed assets and alignment of new requirements to the defined data architecture and self-service capabilities
Setting standards and procedures to enable self-service data and features to pass through the complete data/analytics lifecycle, from prototyping through to automation and production at scale
Delivering the technical solution to integrate data assets into a streamlined business insights platform to support our objective of a data-driven organization;
Be involved in data stewardship.

What you will have:

Strong in senior client engagement and aligning reporting and analytics solutions to business needs
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
5+ years’ experience in BI, Data Analyst or Insights Analytics roles
Experience with data warehouses and dimensional modelling, in particular building effective presentation layers
Proven expertise supporting the ecommerce business and working with very large and complex data
Understanding and experience of ETL and data structures, data modelling e.g. data warehousing, and data marts
Proven experience in using analytics to obtain insights and drive recommendation to make actions to improve and optimise business process and solve the business problem
Highly proficient with SQL with the ability to write very complex SQL
Advanced in BI visualisation tools such as Domo or Tableau is essential
Strong analytical mindset and skills - A/B testing, regression, hypothesis testing
Demonstrated stakeholder management and communication skills to translate analytical solution outcomes in the context of business impacts and benefits to a non-technical audience.
Statistical programming language like Python or R is a plus

What we offer in return:

Develop your skills with support from a skilled and approachable team
Opportunity to join an established, well-backed and growing business
Work alongside some of the industry’s best (A great chance to learn)
Genuinely flexible work arrangements and ‘dress for your day’ dress code
Work in an informal, fast-paced and fun environment
Opportunity to see the impact and results of your work every day
Awesome company celebrations

Our culture:

Our culture is simple: work hard, change the world, and have fun doing it. There is no hard and fast way of achieving this, which is why we let our employees determine how we do things. Finding the solution is your job, giving you a reason to find it is ours. We as a management team are very aware of what we know and what we don't, and have a good recipe for what makes a good team member and team.



Additional Information


About CitrusAd

CitrusAd is a leading retail media company and part of Epsilon, a global advertising and marketing technology company. The CitrusAd platform sits at the center of Epsilon’s comprehensive, scalable retail media network offering. By harnessing the power of first-party data and industry-leading identity resolution, the unified, self-serve platform delivers shopper-relevant advertising experiences on commerce websites and across the open web resulting in higher conversions. Leading retailers across the globe rely on CitrusAd to help grow retail media as a core function for incremental media revenue and sales volume that delivers great ROI for brands. For more information, visit citrusad.com.

When you’re one of us, you get to run with the best. For decades, we’ve been helping marketers from the world’s top brands personalize experiences for millions of people with our cutting-edge technology, solutions and services. Epsilon’s best-in-class identity gives brands a clear, privacy-safe view of their customers, which they can use across our suite of digital media, messaging and loyalty solutions. We process 400+ billion consumer actions each day and hold many patents of proprietary technology, including real-time modeling languages and consumer privacy advancements. Thanks to the work of every employee, Epsilon has been consistently recognized as industry-leading by Forrester, Adweek and the MRC. Positioned at the core of Publicis Groupe, Epsilon is a global company with more than 8,000 employees around the world. Check out a few of these resources to learn more about what makes Epsilon so EPIC:

Our Culture: https://www.epsilon.com/us/about-us/our-culture-epsilon
Life at Epsilon: https://www.epsilon.com/us/about-us/epic-blog
DE&I: https://www.epsilon.com/us/about-us/diversity-equity-inclusion
CSR: https://www.epsilon.com/us/about-us/corporate-social-responsibility

Great People Deserve Great Benefits

We know that we have some of the brightest and most talented associates in the world, and we believe in rewarding them accordingly. If you work here, expect competitive pay, comprehensive health coverage, and endless opportunities to advance your career.

Epsilon is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Epsilon’s policy is not to discriminate against any applicant or employee based on actual or perceived race, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy), marital status, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, mental or physical disability, religion, creed, color, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression (including transgender status), veteran status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law. Epsilon also prohibits harassment of applicants and employees based on any of these protected categories. Epsilon will provide accommodations to applicants needing accommodations to complete the application process.

Dept Number/Name: 4-5218-000 / Student Success-Sarasota-Manatee campus

College Division: Sar/Man-Academic Affairs/Student Success

Salary Plan: Administrative

Job Code/Title: 3214 / Fiscal & Business Analyst I

Hiring Salary/Salary Range: $50,000-$55,000

Position Number: 00017730

ORGANIZATIONAL SUMMARY: The University of South Florida Sarasota-Manatee campus provides high quality bachelor's and graduate-level education and scholarly activity in a personalized learning community that prepares successful leaders and responsible citizens.

The Student Center is an approximately 30,000 square foot facility, which serves as the living room of student life at the USF Sarasota-Manatee campus. The Student Center is a joint shared facility with the campus?s 200-bed residence hall. The student center is anticipated to open in August 2024 and houses three ballrooms, an e-gaming room, convenience store, and lounge/study spaces. The following organizations are also housed in the Center: Student Government and its agencies, the Office of Student Engagement, New Student Connections, Orientation, USF World, and the Dean of Students Office. The Center also supports retail operations, such as the USF Bookstore and USF Dining.

POSITION SUMMARY: The Fiscal & Business Analyst is a professional position that is responsible for budget and accounting for all aspects of the Student Center and Activity & Service fees. This includes billing, fiscal operations, reconciling, processes, purchasing, and payroll. The primary purpose of this position is to monitor and analyze budget and accounting data to ensure compliance with policies, regulations, and accounting principles; develop and maintain budgets; safeguard unit property and assets; provide professional business support to student initiatives; and keep financial offers informed regarding the financial and budget status of their departments. The Fiscal & Business Analyst reports to the Director of the Student Center.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Accounting & Budget: Perform analysis and reconciliation of auxiliary, E&G, and/or A&S funds for departments in Student Success, Student Government, and student organizations. Prepare financial reports, statements, spreadsheets, ad hoc reports and consolidated financials, which are used by management/accountable officers to make financial decisions. Perform analysis of departmental financial statements, including review of budget to actuals/variance analysis. Advise management of under/over and prepare transfers as needed. Perform detailed review and analysis of expenditures versus budget for designated funds. Prepare reports and processes for billing and accounting for the new Student Center, which will include monitoring and reviewing monthly facility billings and auxiliaries and preparing appropriate paperwork. Provide support for the preparation and submission of Student Success annual budget requests. Co-advise the Student Government Campus Activity & Service Fee Recommendation Committee. Assist with the development of procedures for training, and budget collection and development. Manage interim funding requests for SG, Student Organizations and A&S funded departments. Provide fiscal backup support for Student Success A&S and E&G budget funded departments.

Fiscal Operations: Ensure strict guidelines are adhered to in regards to the Controller?s Purchasing, Pcard, Travel, and Student Government Statutes, as well as OneUSF Student Success Resource Management and Development (RMD). Responsible for Student Engagement, Student Center, Fitness Center, Student Government, and student organization accounts, including purchasing, cash management, payment of invoices, reconciliation of department ledgers in accordance with University Policies and Procedures. Ensure purchase transactions are completed accurately and timely. Work with vendors on issues related to late payments and troubleshooting lost invoices/payments. Monitor and process Pcard transactions for various Student Success departments. Submit paperwork when needed for Pcard increases. Initiate and prepare non-payroll expenditure transfers, payroll expenditure transfers, corrections, and budget transfers to correct any discrepancies and allow for appropriate funds.

Business Services: Provide professional business and accounting support to A&S funded entities and to student initiatives. Provide advice to student clients and communicate information to students and advisors. Develop and implement training for Student Government students involved in the annual Activity & Service fee allocation process. Provide budget and financial training sessions to A&S funded entities. Provide training sessions to students regarding purchasing and travel policies and procedures. Advise students and professionals on fiscal and business matters. Provide budget updates to student leaders, student organizations, and professionals. Serve as a liaison between Student Success and Student Government areas by solving problems, providing advice, and providing professional support.

Inventory & Property: Oversee the annual inventory process for property purchased with A&S funds and prepare inventory related reports. Monitor A&S property and oversee the property check-out process.

Performs other duties as assigned.

POSITION QUALIFICATIONS:
MINIMUM:
This position requires a Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business Administration or other field directly related to the position's specific responsibilities and 0-2 years of fiscal related work experience; or a Bachelor's degree in no specific required field and two years of fiscal related work experience; or four years fiscal related work experience

PREFERRED:
Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, business administration, or related field, and three years of fiscal related work experience. Master?s degree in business administration or related field is preferred.

SPECIAL SKILLS/TRAINING:
Analytical thinking skills. Problem solving. Ability to work within a team. Effective communication skills. Excellent customer service skills. Knowledge of accounting, consolidated financial reporting, reconciliation of multiple accounts, accounts payable, accounts receivable and journal entries.

Position Overview:
This position leads, performs, and reviews the full reconciliation process for all Treasury owned bank accounts. Monitor and analyze transactional data from internal systems and external banking portals. Participates in new product and service implementations, daily banking operations analysis, works with several departments to resolve reconciliation issues, and initiates / leads process improvement.
This role will be hybrid; in proximity to our St Petersburg, FL office.
Key Responsibilities:
Performs daily and monthly reconciliation of Treasury bank accounts. Identify and research reconciliation issues and propose resolutions
Complete daily positive pay decisioning and compliance reporting
Develop relationships across Company by providing excellent customer service
Represents department in corporate project initiatives
Supports the development and maintenance of various financial institutional relationships
Oversight of key company reports to mitigate Company risk exposure
Responsible for the opening, closing, and modification of bank account structures, maintain appropriate signatories, and ensure appropriate bank account services
Drive best-in-class financial and operational controls to ensure compliance with internal and external auditing (SOX) standards
Document and maintain Policy and Procedures and Standard Operating Procedures of the cash inflow / outflow processes of the Trust
Identify areas of process improvement to increase departmental efficiencies
Responsible for tax service products reporting
Maintain accurate records and establishes strong working relationships with all business lines and accounting groups
Perform investigation and follow-up on exceptions; resolve with appropriate personnel
Performs other duties as assigned
Professional Experience:
2-5 years of experience in Treasury, Finance, or Accounting with sufficient experience in accounts reconciliation and banking operations knowledge
Detail oriented with exceptional accounting, analytical and organizational skills
Intermediate knowledge of general ledger accounts, demand deposit accounts, and trust account intricacies.
Ability to prepare and analyze data and prioritize work effectively
Strong technology software skills: MS Excel (Pivots, VLookup,etc), MS Access
Team player with ability to work effectively with other teams, lead project initiatives, and solve practical problems
Ability to fit-in and stand-out in a highly collaborative environment.
Highly extroverted with strong written and verbal communications skills.
Strong attention to detail with exceptional documentation, analytical and organizational skills.
Comfortable and flexible with multiple priorities in an ever-changing, growth environment
Intermediate knowledge of general ledger accounts and trust/custodian bank account intricacies
Education:
Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance or related field preferred
Certified Treasury Professional certification preferred but not required
Work Environment:
Travel requirements to (primarily) domestic destinations should not exceed 5%.
A standard work week exists but with the understanding that additional time/effort outside of the usual parameters can/will occur based upon priorities.
A standard business environment exists with moderate noise levels.
Ability to lift and move approximately thirty (30) pounds on a non-routine basis.

Position Summary:

We are looking for an Operations Data Analyst to join our growing core technology team. The Operations Data Analyst is a crucial role within an organization, responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data to support and optimize various operational processes. This role is essential for making informed decisions, improving efficiency, and ensuring the smooth functioning of the company's day-to-day activities. The successful candidate will turn data into information, information into insight, and insight into business decisions.


Primary Responsibilities/Essential Functions:

This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the teammate occupying this position.

Conduct detailed data analysis on data used across business units to evaluate business processes, improve existing features, and create new ones
Perform various data analytics using SQL, MS Excel, and statistical models to examine data, identify trends, patterns, anomalies, and extract actionable insights
Gather and compile data from various sources, including databases, spreadsheets, and operational systems, ensuring data accuracy and completeness
Provide relational database expertise to construct and execute SQL queries for data analysis
Develop and generate regular and ad-hoc reports and dashboards to communicate data-driven insights to stakeholders
Collaborate with operational teams to identify areas for process improvement through data-driven recommendations
Design, develop, and provide expertise in tools, techniques, metrics, and dashboards for insights and data visualization to address business needs
Create data visualizations, such as charts and graphs, to effectively communicate findings and support decision-making
Develop and execute tools for monitoring and reporting on data quality
Promote and enforce data quality management principles, including metadata, lineage, and business definitions

2 to 4 years of industry experience as a Business/Data Analyst
Experience data analysis using tools such as SQL and Excel
Practical knowledge of data in various forms (data warehouses/SQL, unstructured data environments/PIG, HIVE, Impala)
Familiarity with BI reporting tools (Power BI, and/or Tableau)
Experience working within process management and improvement methodologies
Experience in quantitative analysis and statistical modelling would be helpful
Ability to act with integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software
Embody goTRG’s company values: Team, Innovation,Partnership, and Sustainability
Strong time managementand project management skills

Ability to work independently, multi-task, and deliver quality work in an efficient manner
Ability to manage competingpriorities

Demonstrated initiative

Job Description
About Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University:

At Embry-Riddle, we take pride in our position as the world's largest and most comprehensive university dedicated to aviation and aerospace. Located in Daytona Beach, Florida, and Prescott, Arizona, our esteemed residential campuses offer a prestigious educational experience. However, our commitment to education knows no borders as our Worldwide campus expands our reach globally, providing a world-class education online and at approximately 110 locations across the United States, Asia, Europe, and Central and South America. This breadth of reach ensures that students can access our exceptional programs without geographical limitations.

With a history spanning nearly a century, we have continually adapted to the dynamic needs of the industries we support. In the Academic Year 2022-23, we welcomed over 11,100 students to our residential campuses and over 19,000 students at our worldwide campus.

Join our global community and embark on a journey of academic excellence and limitless possibilities. Employees working more than 30 hours a week can enjoy medical, dental and vision benefits, an amazing retirement plan with immediate vesting that includes a 6% gift and up to 4% match, free tuition for employees and their immediate family members, and a generous personal leave program. To find out more about our benefits and why ERAU has been named a “Great College to Work For” for 13 consecutive years, visit our
careers page
.

The Opportunity:
The Department of Institutional Research at Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University is currently recruiting for a Data Analyst to join the team. The Data Analyst will provide critical support in the facilitation of timely and accurate collection and retrieval of University data for official external reporting and internal decision-making. The Data Analyst will focus on data provision and analyses of academic course and faculty-related information, and will serve as a central data provider in a multi-campus environment, each with their own distinct profiles, reporting requirements, and decision-making needs.
Responsibilities include the following:
Develop a thorough understanding of university data sources and the flow of data throughout university systems. Understand the appropriate use of each.
Extract data from university enterprise and warehouse sources. Verify data accuracy; initiate and resolve data quality issues.
Use statistical software programming language to manipulate data and produce vetted, official datasets for multiple uses.
Maintain an understanding of external reporting requirements and activities such as IPEDS, Common Data Set, college directories/rankings, etc. Prepare and submit university summative data.
Develop and maintain reports and dynamic visualizations for university decision-making. Use appropriate applications and data to assist administrators, faculty, and staff in obtaining timely, accurate, and relevant information. Provide training for the use of self-service tools and dashboards to university personnel and/or teams.
Maintain up-to-date documentation on all projects, processes, and reports. Independently establish and manage project timelines.
Collaborate with other IR, IT, and Business Intelligence staff, as well as functional area subject matter experts, to clarify reporting methodologies, establish data standards and definitions, provide consistency and ensure accuracy in reporting.
Provide input for developing and improving systems and procedures. Represent IR on campus-wide committees as needed.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree with an area of concentration in Data Science, Data Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, or any field with a strong analytical focus.
At least one year of experience working with data analytics.
Experience working with a multitude of higher education divisions, especially Academic Affairs and Registrars.
Experience with a statistical programming software package (e.g. SPSS, SAS, R) and creating tabular/graphical representations of data. Preference for SPSS.
Experience with data analytics/visualization software, such as PowerBI, Tableau, or OBIEE.
Knowledge of relational and dimensional databases.
Understanding of a database querying language, such as SQL.
Knowledge of institutional research and its practices..

About the Role & Team

The Disney Enterprise Technology mission is to deliver technology solutions that align to business strategies while enabling enterprise efficiency and promoting cross-company collaborative innovation. The team's vision is to design, build, integrate, and deploy highly effective and stable core business applications and platforms for the Enterprise and Corporate Functions. We lead with a Business Architecture framework and own Core Finance function domain technology roadmap and management of the supporting platforms.

The Associate Analyst, PPM will facilitate portfolio planning activities including value, cost, and risk analysis, and delivering insights for Portfolio leaders to act on. They will use knowledge of agile methodologies, technology delivery best practices, and reporting / storytelling to collaborate with planning and delivery teams to optimize portfolio value, and will contribute to the development of standard methodologies with a focus on evolving planning and reporting tools and processes. This is a highly collaborative role where partnership with many technical and non-technical teams is essential. The Associate Analyst, PPM reports to the Sr. Manager, Business Performance.

Assists in identifying problems and shortfalls and proposing solutions.

Collaborates effectively and builds positive relationships with partners across the organization.

Good communication and presentation skills, both oral and written. Ability to communicate well to both technical and business audiences.

Results oriented, biased toward action.

Join Fintech in Tampa as a Data Analyst!

Fintech is the leading business solutions provider of affordable technology built to simplify beverage alcohol management for any business, of any size, that sells alcohol. We empower retailers, distributors and suppliers by automating essential manual processes and data insights associated with product catalog management, alcohol invoice payment, customer sales management, and industry data collection. With over 30 years of industry experience and unwavering dependability, Fintech delivers an immediate ROI to over 900,000 business relationships nationwide.

The Data Analyst is responsible for transforming data into insights that drive business value. A successful Data Analyst will be able to understand business challenges, translate them into technical requirements, leverage data analysis tools & techniques to develop business solutions, and clearly communicate results to internal and external stakeholders.

Essential Functions:

Translate business questions into specific data and reporting requirements
Design and develop business analyses & reporting that answers key business questions
Analyze data to uncover key insights, create visualizations, craft a coherent story, and present findings
Define data engineering requirements in support of data and analytics business use cases
Define acceptance criteria that is clear and testable
Review data engineering outputs to ensure they meet the business needs
Ability to read and write SQL queries
Work side by side with data engineers to deliver high quality products
Take initiative to learn new things and grow rapidly from constant exposure to innovative ideas, concepts, and patterns as well as the ability to share those findings effectively

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
2+ years of recent experience in a business intelligence analyst or data analyst role
2+ years of recent experience with SQL programming
2+ years of recent experience with data visualization tools required; Power BI preferred
Strong Excel and Power Point skills preferred
Ability to work independently with internal stakeholders to meet the data needs of the business, translating business needs into data and analytical requirements
Ability to deliver results of analyses in a clear and effective manner to all levels of technical expertise
Excellent written, verbal, presentation, and communication skills
Proactive work style and creative problem solver who can handle multiple projects, demonstrating a strong work ethic
Excellent attention to detail, quality, and follow-through; commitment to continuous improvement and the elimination of performance variability

Job Description:

Responsible for identification and definition, acquisition and preparation, control, disposition, and archiving functions within the Integrated Configuration Management (ICM) discipline including:

Developing and maintaining ICM and Records Management plans (both NASA and Contractor) in accordance with Center Business Management System (BMS) procedures, and facilitating BMS audits.
Working with internal and external customer organizations to ensure ICM requirements are integrated into LX processes and procedures.
Identifying and resolving issues, and developing mitigation plans; preparing and updating manuals, instructions, and operating procedures.
Defining and analyzing ICM Tool requirements in support of the Program Data Architecture.
Participating in and supporting projects related to the analysis and recording of data structures and process flows.
Developing and maintaining diagrams, data and documents, spreadsheets, and presentations for the LX team’s technical documentation; adding and modifying data and documents for internal websites.
Managing, reviewing, and tracking the entire lifecycle for LX Program and project document and technical assessments requests under ICM control.
Document and assist with EGS Program and Cross Program milestone technical reviews.
Researching and developing customer and other user requirements for integrating and upgrading ICM Tools and processes.

Additional Duties:

Facilitating the evaluation and testing of new products, programs, and applications, as well as reproducing faults for advanced troubleshooting and resolution.
Interfacing with the EGS Program and other Programs/projects for Information Management (IM); preparing, reviewing, and processing data and associated IM documentation (Charters, Directives, Requests for Deviation/Waiver, etc.).
Determining current capabilities and data handling requirements to support the IM process (e.g., document schema, business data, and documentation management [TechDoc]).
Providing back-up support to Data Quality Assurance (i.e., Technical Writing).
Writing data analysis reports and providing metrics.
Supporting IM for all ICM process documentation.

Required Experience and Skills:

6-8 years of Records Management/Data Management experience
5 years of specialized experience in management analysis, business process reengineering, organizational performance assessments, strategic planning, project planning, performance monitoring, etc.
2-4 years Integrated Configuration Management experience
Experience in mentoring/coaching others
Principles and practices of data management
Microsoft Office Suite

Education

Bachelor’s degree in Business Management, Economics, Engineering, Science or Math is preferred

Desired Skills / Abilities / Certifications:

Prior NASA/KSC experience; direct EGS Program experience is a plus
Familiarity with Kennedy Space Center Records Management and Data Management Policies
CM/DM Certifications are a plus
Good organization skills to balance and prioritize work in a fast-paced environment
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Ability to efficiently multitask

“Trulieve Grows One Patient at a Time”

Strong relationship skills both internal and external (vendor)

Date: Nov 16, 2023
Location: Miramar, United States, Florida, 33025
Company: Teva Pharmaceuticals
Job Id: 51810
Who we are
Together, we’re on a mission to make good health more affordable and accessible, to help millions around the world enjoy healthier lives. It’s a mission that bonds our people across nearly 60 countries and a rich, diverse variety of nationalities and backgrounds. Working here means working with the world’s leading manufacturer of generic medicines, and the proud producer of many of the products on the World Health Organization’s Essential Medicines List. Today, at least 200 million people around the world take one of our medicines every single day. An amazing number, but we’re always looking for new ways to continue making a difference, and new people to make a difference with.
The opportunity

Teva Pharmaceuticals USA, Inc. is seeking an IT Business Process Analyst III (Miramar, FL) to be responsible for understanding the intended business use of IT systems and partner with those stakeholders to achieve the business needs as implemented in the IT systems. Involved in full life cycle management of the systems (SDLC) from definition of business and technical requirements, determining the best technical solution, development, and testing activities during the system implementation and life cycle management, maintenance and support of all systems in scope.

Manage the various vendors supplying systems technology for all systems in scope.
Support projects outside of the business stakeholder area as talents across the R&D Clinical IT area are most efficiently leveraged.
Employ critical thinking to understand the business processes, partner with the business stakeholders, and serve as IT liaison on site for any business need or query.
Support the business in other work streams such as: Inspections, Testing, Integration, Reporting, Validation, and Change Management activities, in addition work closely with different functions in the organization to support the ongoing activities (procurement, YR, finance, legal).
Accountable for planning and execution of annual operations plan for systems in scope in alignment to the global R&D IT AOP including budgeting and project planning/scheduling.
Ensure and execute E2E IT Project Management throughout project lifecycle from initiation to execution, including URS definition, Scope, Risks, Resources, Costs, and Timelines as well as coordinating with other technical resources (e.g. information security, 3rd party IT vendors, ITO, etc.).
Provide daily and routine support, monitoring, handling simple and complex issues raised by end users.
Serve as liaison between the vendors and users for effective communication for resolution of issues including designing and conducting tests and support for the mechanisms to troubleshoot or verify correctness of fixes.
Analyze code development for strategic changes and bug fixes for legacy Java applications using Java, SQL, JavaScript, and Tomcat.
Create applicable GxP required documentation including design and testing specifications, installation instructions, and the necessary steps to support the system once implemented.
Telecommuting is permitted 2 days per week.
Your experience and qualifications
Requires a Bachelor’s degree or foreign academic equivalent in Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering, Electrical/Electronics Engineering, or a related field.
Plus 3 years of experience in the job offered or 3 years in a related occupation including Business Application Analyst, Software Engineer, or related experience.
Position requires 2 years of experience with SDLC, GxP, and SQL.
40hrs/week.

The IT Business Analyst will support the business Operations, Sales and Finance departments. Essential Functions

Support Operations, Sales and Finance departments with best in class process improvement through the latest technologies. Capable of gathering requirements and interacting with the business in non technical terms.

Convey business requirements to technical teams using tools such as logical diagrams, use cases, Visio process flows, data samples, and functional requirements documents.

Devise or modify procedures to solve complex problems considering system processes, operating limitations and business risks.

Work with the IT project management team to prioritize changes and define project scope.

Perform gap analysis, defect identification and tracking, and manage issues and risks to closure.

Create and present reports to senior management to support recommendations.

Required Skills & Education

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent education and/or work experience.

Working knowledge of SQL reporting/scripting.

Experience with Field Service and Machine Learning platforms is highly desirable.

Proven experience and success with Sales and Customer service platform technologies.

The Data Analyst reports to the CIO and is responsible for collecting, cleaning, and interpreting data sets to answer a question or solve a problem in a fast-paced environment. This individual is required to work with a diverse group of stakeholders including executives and other business partners. The primary function of this role will be analyzing data to inform stakeholder decision-making.

Examples of Work

Primary responsibilities include the following:
Data Collection and Processing: Collect and compile data from various sources, ensuring data accuracy and completeness. Cleanse and preprocess data to prepare it for analysis.
Data Analysis: Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and correlations in the data. Utilize statistical methods and tools to analyze large datasets and extract meaningful insights. Develop and apply data models to predict outcomes and support decision-making processes.
Data Visualization: Create clear and compelling visualizations, such as charts, graphs, and dashboards, to present data-driven insights to stakeholders. Communicate complex data findings in an understandable and actionable manner.
Reporting: Generate regular and ad-hoc reports based on data analysis results. Prepare and present reports to management and other stakeholders, highlighting key findings and recommendations.
Data Mining: Utilize data mining techniques to discover hidden patterns and insights in large datasets. Identify opportunities for data-driven process optimization and improvement.
Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data-related requirements and provide analytical support for various projects. Work closely with data engineers and other IT professionals to ensure data accuracy, consistency, and availability.
Tools and Technologies: Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, R, Python, or statistical software packages. Familiarity with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms.
(These essential functions are not to be construed as a complete statement of all duties performed. Employees will be required to perform other job-related duties as required.)

Open Requirements/Supplemental Information

Bachelors’ Degree from an accredited institution in a relevant field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related discipline. A Master’s degree or higher is preferred.

Preferred Skills:

Knowledge of statistical analysis methods and techniques.
Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and techniques.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to convey complex data findings in a clear and understandable manner.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently or as part of a team.
Familiarity with big data technologies such as Hadoop and Spark.
Experience with database management systems and data warehousing concepts.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Proficiency in programming languages like SQL, R, or Python.
Experience with data visualization tools and techniques.

Business Data Analyst

Position Description
We're a passionate team of tech enthusiasts and professionals on a mission to reshape the future. We've got everything from cutting-edge projects that challenge your skills to a supportive and inclusive work environment that fuels your growth. Plus, we offer unparalleled opportunities for professional development, empowering you to stay at the forefront of the ever-evolving tech landscape.

We are seeking to hire a seasoned Business Data Analyst to join our team. The Business Data analyst will perform routine business analysis such as elicitation of data and analytics requirements and creating business/technical documentation, logical/canonical data model, as well as performing data profiling and analysis, data mapping, data quality checking and investigation, and participate in the test process of the final solution.
This opportunity requires that the selected candidate be onsite at Fort Lauderdale, FL location a minimum of 3 days per week.

Your future duties and responsibilities

Act as a bridge between the technology domain and the business domain of an organization.
Responsible for eliciting, understanding, interpreting, and representing business requirements and acting as the conduit between the customer and technical teams to ensure requirements are understood.
Provide subject matter expertise on the use of data as well as educate teams on business model, metadata, and standards.
Responsible for understanding source systems and their data models.
Develop source to target mappings for data lineage.
Document source architecture to include data flows.
Responsible for analyzing data to validate business domains and requirements.
Responsible for data profiling and ensuring data quality requirements are accurate and complete.
Act in an advisory capacity in data model reviews, architecture approach and solution design to ensure high quality deliverables.
Responsible for partnering with management and business units on innovative ways to successfully utilize data and related tools to advance business objectives.
Works with governance council to establish data governance standards and guidelines.
Assist with business data lake testing / experimentation.
Assist with coordinating data dictionary completions.
Mentor Project DA resources

Required qualifications to be successful in this role

Bachelor's degree in business administration, Computer Science, or related field
More than 5 years of experience as a Business Analyst
Strong background in data analysis. prior experience as a Business Data Analyst mandatory
Strong SQL and experience with data mapping, validation, cleaning, and manipulation
Experience with the elicitation of requirements and utilizing the requirements to create business documentation (BRD's/ FRD's)
Prior experience working in an Agile project team is a must.
Backlog development / Backlog refinement / Sprint planning experience
Experience using Azure boards and Azure DevOps is a plus (Jira or an equivalent platform is acceptable)
Excellent verbal and written communication skill and Interpersonal and consultative skills
Analytical thinking and problem solving
Knowledge of the business and technology structure

How to Claim Veteran's Preference

Since 1945, the Florida Legislature has made a provision to give preference in the hiring process to United States war veterans in recognition of their military, naval, or air service who meet specific conditions. The conditions are as follows:

Veterans with a VA service-connected disability
Spouses of veterans with permanent and total service-connected disability
Honorably discharged veterans with wartime service.
Unmarried widow or widower of a veteran who died as a result of a service-connected disability
A veteran who has served in a qualifying campaign or expedition for which a campaign badge has been authorized, to include the Global War on Terrorism Expeditionary Medal.

Florida International University honors this policy and will comply with Veterans' Preference guidelines when filling staff positions. Any applicant claiming Veterans' Preference will be required to attach a DD214 with each application submitted for verification.

If there are any questions concerning Veterans' Preference, please contact Talent Acquisition & Management by calling 305-348-2500.
For additional information on Veterans' Preference, visit http://www.floridavets.org/.

College Division: Research-Patents and Licensing

Salary Plan: Administrative

Job Code/Title: 3214 / Fiscal & Business Analyst

Hiring Salary/Salary Range:Commensurate with experience.

Position Number: 00042395


ORGANIZATIONAL SUMMARY:

The Technology Transfer Office (TTO), under USF Research & Innovation, USF System, is responsible for the identification, evaluation, development, protection, and utilization of intellectual property rights that result from USF System research activities and from the activities of USF System researchers in affiliated hospitals and other off-site facilities. TTO has 18 full-time employees and 8-10 graduate student interns and undergraduate student assistants. Clients are mainly USF faculty, staff and student researchers and innovators, but also include venture and technology companies desiring to license USF inventions and technologies. The annual budget is approximately $5 million.

POSITION SUMMARY:


The Fiscal & Business Analyst I serve as a liaison among departments stakeholders in order to gain understanding of the structures, policies, and operations of an organization and recommends solutions to enable the organization to achieve its goals.The position works with department administration to define, validate and implement the optimal solutions for the Technology Transfer Office needs. The position performs professional accounting activities for specialized, complex and/or functional areas requiring the expert knowledge and professional application of accounting principles, practices, and techniques in accordance with industry standards, current laws, and university policies.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Plans, directs, organizes, and schedules activities of one or more specialized accounting functions for the Technology Transfer Office Accounts. Analyzes, develops and documents accounting and cost procedures and controls related to assigned tasks. Researches and evaluates pertinent professional and related legal literature to establish and/or recommend changes to accounting procedures and operations.

Provides operating cost visibility, direction and consultation to university officials relative to fiscal planning, control, and expending of university assets. Prepares and/or directs the preparation of special statistical reports, detailed cost accounting information, surveys or analyses of complex and difficult nature for management. Provides internal/external training both orally and in writing on accounting systems, procedures, and practices.

Interprets various accounting data, analyzes reports and recommends and/or initiates actions to be taken. Ensures all financial records, and statements are in line with laws, regulations, and generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP). These records and statements may include the balance sheet, the profit and loss statement, the cash flow statement, and tax returns.

Working with the Minuet database software to process royalty distribution according to University policy 0-300. Generate various invoices complying with license deals performed by the Technology Transfer Office. Advise users on the functionality and capabilities of specific applications. Advise department leadership in acquisition of new software. Aid in the formation and accounting practices for all IP related revenue and expenditures.

Performs other duties as assigned

POSITION QUALIFICATIONS:

MINIMUM:

This position requires a Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business Administration or other field directly related to the position's specific responsibilities and two years of fiscal related work experience; or a Bachelor's degree in no specific required field and three years of fiscal related work experience; or six years fiscal related work experience.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor's degree and four years of fiscal related work experience: knowledge regarding technology commercialization business practice. Expertise in Microsoft suite platform (Excel, Access, Power BI).

Brooksource is looking for an intermediate to advanced technical Business Analyst who is currently residing in Tallahassee or is open to relocating to Tallahassee to work in a hybrid environment. This position is supporting one of the largest state agencies in FL working to enhance applications and systems that support internal employees and agency customers. This business analyst will work within a full lifecycle development team, working as an intermediary between business stakeholders and technical teams. They will be providing oversight to development activities and have access to SMEs that have created and support internal systems and applications. This BA will be involved in, and work in concert with other team members, to analyze, design, implement, and test solutions.

Primary Job Duties/Day to Day Function:

· Research and understand business processes and their inter-relationships within the agencies central IT office
· Research and understand the Identity Administration and Governance Platform that the agency will be using and enhancing.
· Gather and document business and technical requirements.
· Coordinate and lead the activities of the development team.
· Collaborate with the technical and functional teams to develop technical specifications and other documents in support of the Identity Administration and Governance solution.
· Coordinate data migration and development teams.
· Create detailed use cases, business rules, and requirements.
· Develop Test Plans and Test Cases.
· Coordinate and oversee the User Acceptance Testing and Regression Testing.
· Track bugs and backlog items using Microsoft DevOps.
· Provide daily updates to the Project Management Team.
· Perform oversight reviews of deliverables for compliance with department standards.

Specific Knowledge and Skills:

· Business Analysis: Ability to perform detailed research, business analysis, as-is and to-be analysis, process modeling. Use of software tools is required and include, but are not limited to, MS Word, MS PowerPoint, MS Excel, and SmartDraw.
· System Analysis & Design: Ability to perform System Analysis & Design using a variety of modeling methodologies and techniques.
· Facilitation: Ability to expertly facilitate workshops and meetings with stakeholders.
· Technical Understanding: Technical knowledge and understanding of IT infrastructure and software development practices and techniques.
· Project Management: Knowledge of State of Florida Project Management Rule 60GG-1.

Required and Preferred Experience:

· A minimum of 3 to 5 years of solid business/systems analysis experience and software development projects is required.
· Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Excel, Word, PowerPoint, required.
· Experience working with Microsoft DevOps is highly desired.
· Experience with Microsoft DevOps is highly desired.
· Certified Scrum Master (CSM) is highly desired.
· Experience with directing and managing project resources is highly desired.
· Experience with configuration and customization of Commercial-Off-The-Shelf products, is highly desired.
· Experience with data migration is highly desired.
· Knowledge of change and release management is highly desired.
· Experience working with Microsoft Power BI is highly desired.

It's an exciting time to be a member of the Fisher Investments Technology Department. We're investing in the future of our firm's technology and are building our team to achieve global growth. We are looking for a Business Analyst to support our Technology Business Services team. If you are looking for an opportunity to make a difference as we develop scalable and strategic solutions to support our global growth, we want to hear from you!

The Opportunity:

The Business Analyst (Portfolio Management Technology) will perform daily health checks on Fisher’s OMS platform – Charles River – to ensure the following: System is up and running, daily data feeds are processed, system workflows remain operational and connectivity from Charles River to Brokers and Custodians are working (FIX, SWIFT). The Business Analyst will also step in to support the various business stakeholders in different aspects of the Order Management and Execution Management System. You will report to an Application Development Team Leader.

The Day-to-Day:
Troubleshoot any outages identified during health checks
Engage vendors and our teams to resolve any issues identified
Communicate Issues Identified:
Alert our users and other technology partners of any issues
Daily interaction with users:
Field issues reported by users throughout the day and perform necessary troubleshooting
Field training requests from users
Formulate and articulate ideal solutions in partnership with the stakeholders to gain operational efficiencies over time
Track Production Issues
Log and diagnose production issues and track resolutions to follow
Periodically communicate status or project plans to all partners
Identify trends and take proactive steps to prevent incidents
Coordinate and plan for regular maintenance schedules
Your Qualifications:
3+ years of experience supporting Investment Management - Order Management systems including system configuration & parameter maintenance, user interface configurations & permissioning
18+ months of experience performing start of day health checks on order management systems including FIX heartbeats, data loads, batch completions
3+ years of experience performing business analysis and troubleshooting of issues reported by users on Order management platforms such as Charles River
18+ months of experience with user communications to effectively notify users of planned or ad hoc downtimes, maintenance schedules
Bachelor's degree (B.A.) in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or an equivalent field
Why Fisher Investments:

We work for a bigger purpose: bettering the investment universe. We take great pride in our inclusive culture, our learning and development framework customized for every employee, and our Great Place to Work Certification. Description

Job Summary

The NCPS Access Improvement Analyst is responsible for analyzing scheduling processes, resource allocation, referral coordination and patient flow to optimize access to care at NCPS. The analyst will support through creating reports/updating dashboards, creating policies, and implement process improvement initiatives. The analyst will collaborate amongst project teams, NCPS team, Scheduling, Contracts, Finance, IT, Revenue Cycle, Procurement, and operations process owners.

Job Specific Duties

Supports in planning and implementation of projects to include program design, creating, and executing project plans. Supports stakeholders in multiple and simultaneous projects through all phases of implementation including tracking timelines and deliverables.

Identifies access process improvement opportunities and proposes/implements data-driven solutions to optimize service locations, fill rates, volumes, and available appointment times by specialty.

Runs reports and analyzes data to ensure projects are within scope, on budget, and assigned to the appropriate team(s).

Creates ad hoc reports via Excel and/or PowerBI dashboards.

Interprets data and reports to develop conclusions and recommendations.

Assesses clinician schedules for opportunities to improve slot fill rates, availability, and no-show rates.

Responsible for managing access and scheduling initiatives through the life cycle including planning, tracking, analysis, and reporting.

Works closely with leaders and staff to define opportunities, plan improvements, and track towards future performance.

Assists in the preparation of performance reports, risk assessments, executive briefings, and required progress status reports and deliverables.

Provides financial and performance status information to the project team.

Assesses appointment scheduling process and workflow for continual improvement at both the practice and medical group level.

Ensures project reporting reliability and sustainability, through data analytics and internal reporting sources.

Coordinates the development of best management practices and disseminates lessons learned to appropriate staff.

Monitors and evaluates the efficiency and effectiveness of service delivery methods and procedures.

Supports the team with Practice Plan informatics and overall reporting needs.
Qualifications

Minimum Job Requirements

Bachelor's Degree in Healthcare, Business, Accounting, Engineering, Information Technology, or related field

1-3 years of experience in the healthcare environment, preferably in patient financial services, project management, and/or medical group practice

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

Master’s degree preferred.

Ability to plan time effectively, balance multiple tasks, work within stringent timeframes, and drive projects to completion.

Conflict resolution skills and team approach to resolve challenges to advance project.

Able to handle multiple assignments, set priorities, and meet deadlines.

Ability to effectively plan/organize large and complex projects.

Understanding of cost, schedule development, and controls.

Ability to analyze project control requirements and develop tools and processes to enhance overall effectiveness.

Solid analytical ability with excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Ability to prepare written and verbal reports to project team and management regarding program performance.

Hands-on experience with earned value methodology and monitoring including calculation and analysis.

Able to communicate at all levels to convey project information.

Able to deliver engaging, informative, and well-organized presentations.

Able to work in a team environment.

Ability to maintain confidentiality of sensitive information.

Broad knowledge regarding practice operations, revenue cycle/insurance requirements, and best practice implementation.

Able to analyze clinician schedules and identify process improvement opportunities.

Demonstrates experience in process improvement, patient flow, and throughput.

Computer Savvy with advanced proficiency in Microsoft office tools, including Excel (pivot tables and advanced formulas), Teams, Visio, and PowerPoint. Ability to learn appropriate software application(s).

Overview:
Data Protection & Compliance Analyst within the Global Data Protection Office (GDPO)

SHRSS is seeking a highly motivated, goal-oriented, dedicated Data Protection & Compliance Analyst to join our exciting and fast-paced Global Data Protection team in Davie, Florida. Working with the GDPO, the Data Protection & Compliance Analyst will assist in providing advice to business teams, while providing compliance support on all aspects of Global privacy laws and regulations, with primary emphasis on GDPR, CCPA, Privacy Shield and state data breach notification laws. The Data Protection & Compliance Analyst will also assist in refining and standing up new data protection readiness programs necessitated by evolving global data protection laws and regulatory frameworks. Our team is growing and if you are equally passionate about privacy, data management, and career growth, an opportunity at Seminole Hard Rock may be a great match!
Responsibilities:
Experienced with Reviewing and Process Data Subject Access Requests (DSARs).
Manage process of responding to DSARs, ensuring compliance with regulatory timelines.
Management of information based on initiatives within the GDPO.
Generate and manage data mapping, records of processing activities, DPIAs within the organization.
Familiarity with privacy and data protection concepts strongly recommended.
Work with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment between privacy laws and regulations and business imperatives, including by developing practical solutions.
Assist with development, implementation and maintenance of privacy and data protection policies and standard operating procedures for HIPAA, GDPR, CCPA and other emerging domestic and global privacy laws.
Manage vendor on-boarding, analyze vendor risk assessment, and reviewing vendor security and infrastructure architecture.
Managing vendor audits and requalifying them on a scheduled plan.
Must be attention-to-detail oriented. Strong multi-tasking skills and the ability to prioritize competing demands.
Self-motivated and passion to exceed expectations.
The ability to present information verbally, as well as in written reports is required.
Experienced global data protection office operations within the business.
Ability to cross-train and work collaboratively with the GDPO and compliance team on day-to-day occurrences.
Assist in department initiatives and special projects.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in MIS, CIS, Computer Science, Cyber Security.
CIPP/US, CIPP/E, CIPM, and/or CIPT or other relevant privacy certification highly desirable.
Minimum of three (3) years of experience in a GDPO compliance role.
Experience with design, implementation and maintenance of privacy compliance policies, procedures and programs.
Experience in reviewing and annotating contracts in regards to privacy and information security concerns, as well as, working as a SME for the Legal department and privacy representative with the organization’s Vendors.
High level of personal integrity and confidentiality.
Specialized knowledge of GDPR, CCPA, TCPA, CAN-SPAM and other emerging privacy laws and regulations.
Demonstrated ability to translate regulatory requirements into practical and actionable elements while supporting business strategy.
Experience in performing privacy risk assessments and ongoing privacy compliance monitoring activities.
Have experience with compliance management tools.
Microsoft Office suite is highly desirable.
Strong technical skills following best business practices.
Ability to effectively operate both independently and as part of a team.
Good written and verbal communication skills.
Act proactively.
Data Protection and/or Privacy background is a plus.
Gaming experience is a plus.

Job Title: Wholesale Lending Credit Risk - Data Quality Analyst II - Officer (Hybrid)
Job Description:
The Data Quality Analyst II is a developing professional role. Applies specialty area knowledge in monitoring, assessing, analyzing and/or evaluating processes and data. Identifies policy gaps and formulates policies. Interprets data and makes recommendations. Researches and interprets factual information. Identifies inconsistencies in data or results, defines business issues and formulates recommendations on policies, procedures or practices. Integrates established disciplinary knowledge within own specialty area with basic understanding of related industry practices. Good understanding of how the team interacts with others in accomplishing the objectives of the area. Develops working knowledge of industry practices and standards. Limited but direct impact on the business through the quality of the tasks/services provided. Impact of the job holder is restricted to own team.


The Institutional Credit Management (ICM) group is looking for a Data Quality Analyst II to join its Wholesale Lending Credit Risk (WLCR) data team. ICM has been established with the objective to provide an integrated “end-to-end” credit underwriting, identification, measurement, management and monitoring for the wholesale credit businesses across the enterprise. This is an exciting opportunity for an action-oriented, highly motivated individual looking to thrive and build a career in a highly visible, challenging, and dynamic team in a front-office division.

The WLCR Wholesale Lending data team within ICM is responsible for monitoring and resolving Wholesale Lending data quality issues, for owning data remediation efforts of known issues, and for owning 1st Line data quality reporting and detection.

Responsibilities:

Build subject matter expertise on Citi’s wholesale lending products and data architecture
Assist the team in measuring operating standards and KPIs/metrics for the Data Quality program
Perform analytical assessments of data quality concerns within credit risk systems which include multiple layers of enrichments and coded logic
Support downstream consumption plans with back office technology partners to ensure completeness and consistency throughout data flows
Act as a change agent to implement best practices and ensure transparency and consistency across teams

Qualifications:

Up to 1 year of experience
Analytical and practical problem-solving abilities
Preferred familiarity with wholesale lending products and credit risk concepts
Sense of urgency and ability to manage multiple competing priorities while delivering results quickly and efficiently
Intellectual curiosity, analytical, and conceptual thinker

Education:
Bachelors/University degree or equivalent experience

Founded in 1965, Herc Rentals is one of the leading equipment rental suppliers in North America with trailing twelve month total revenues of nearly $2.7 billion as of June 30, 2023. Herc Rentals’ parent company, known as Herc Holdings Inc., listed on the New York Stock Exchange on July 1, 2016, under the symbol “HRI.” Herc Rentals serves customers through approximately 373 locations and has approximately 6,900 employees in North America.

The Business Operations Analyst will assist with functions related to Operations support. The Operations Analyst provides comprehensive and effective support to Herc Rentals’ field operations. The Database Analyst is responsible for data gathering, preparation, modeling, and report development to support the business. This role collaborates with the Data team to analyze data stored in on-premises Data Warehouses, Azure Data Lake, and Synapse, and creates reports and dashboards using Power BI.

Primary Responsibilities:
Gather business requirements for reports and analytics.
Write queries in SQL, DAX, and Python.
Design and develop reports, data sets, and data flows using Power BI and SQL Server Reporting Services.
Program databases with stored procedures and user-defined functions.
Work with organizations data warehouse.
Transform and move data from various sources using Azure Data Factory, SQL Server Integration Services, and Power Query.

Secondary Responsibilities:
Manage computing and data resources on-premises and in the Cloud (Azure, AWS).
Support SQL Server services.
Program and script in C#, Python, R, PowerShell, JSON, and XML.
Assist in backups, restores, high availability, disaster recovery, and security.

Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree in a related field.
Minimum 4 years of experience in Data Analytics or Data Warehousing.
Experience with Microsoft Azure Data Lake, Azure Synapse Analytics, and SQL Data Warehouse.
Knowledge of data visualization best practices.
Proficiency in C#, Python, or R.
Deep understanding of data warehousing concepts.
Strong team player with excellent customer service, communication, and prioritization skills.

Business Intelligence experience.
Fundamental understanding of object-oriented programming.
Knowledge of the maritime industry.

SUMMARY/OBJECTIVES

SouthState Bank is a nationally chartered bank that provides consumer, commercial, mortgage and wealth management solutions to more than one million customers throughout Florida, Alabama, Georgia, the Carolina’s, and Virginia. With its Correspondent Banking Division, the Bank serves clients coast to coast.

The Check Fraud Team is responsible for protecting the Bank and its customers from check fraud, minimizing check fraud losses, and supporting branches and bank personnel when check fraud occurs.

The Deposit Operations Check Fraud Analyst’s primary responsibility will include, but not be limited to, the monitoring of real-time queues responding to high-risk alerts for checks drawn on our SouthState Bank accounts. Resolve queued transactions within service level agreements to reduce potential losses.




ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Analyze check fraud alerts and identify fraudulent items when compared to legitimate ones.
Ability to research/analyze data and recognize/evaluate patterns of customer activity.
Escalate cases to the Financial Investigations Unit when applicable.
Meet or exceed the accuracy, productivity and all other goals assigned by management.
Interact courteously and tactfully with managers, co-workers, customers and/or vendors.
Can be flexible to work weekends, holidays and/or extended hours as needed.
Accepts other duties as assigned by the manager.



COMPETENCIES

Strong analytical and account research skills are required.
Ability to work well under pressure, maintaining composure and meeting deadlines.

Work as a team with co-workers to ensure all functions are completed timely and correctly.

Qualifications, Education, and Certification Requirements

Education: High School Diploma.
Experience: A minimum of two years of banking and teller experience is required.
Very good knowledge of Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) and other state and federal regulations pertaining to check fraud and check processing.
Certifications/Specific Knowledge: Familiarity Fiserv Premier core system preferred.
Demonstrated ability to problem solve, strong written and verbal communication skills.
Basic proficiency with Microsoft Office including Outlook, Word & Excel with strong analytical skills.
Excellent organizational skills and ability to prioritize multiple assignments and to meet required timelines.
Must demonstrate initiative, be self-motivated, flexible and adapt to changing priorities.

TRAINING REQUIREMENTS/CLASSES

New Employee Orientation
Annual compliance training
On-the-job training
Continuously update skills by participating in professional training

PHYSICAL DEMANDS/WORK ENVIRONMENT

Must be able to stand and/or sit for long periods of time. Must be able to effectively access and interpret information on computer screens, documents, reports, and cash denominations, and identify customers.




This position is located in a cubicle environment that may be noisy throughout the day. It is also located inside a cooled and heated facility with ability to go to a break room or rest room during breaks.

Telecommuting roles, no matter if hybrid or 100% full time telecommuting, must have a secure home office environment that is free from background noise and distractions. This area also requires a reliable private internet connection that is not supplied by use of cellular data (hot spot). Cable or fiber connections are preferred. Requirements are subject to change, as new systems and technology is delivered.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

TRAVEL

Occasional travel may be required for outside meetings and/or training.

Software Resources has an immediate, long term contract job opportunity for an Optimization Analyst with a major corporation in Orlando, FL.

Design of Experiments
" Develop hypotheses and testing plans based on data-driven insights and industry best practices
" Design and execute A/B/Multivariate tests across our digital platforms, including our website, mobile app, email and other outbound channels
" Partner with technical, development teams to ensure activation is validated and aligns with test design.
" Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in A/B testing and optimization.
Optimization Analytics
" Monitor test results and provide regular updates to stakeholders
" Use statistical analysis to determine test significance and make data-driven recommendations for optimization.
" Inform test opportunities through the utilization of analytics tools that provide channel reporting, heuristic evaluations, heatmaps and session recordings.

Optimization Strategy
" Collaborate with cross-functional teams, channel leads and vendors to identify areas of opportunity for A/B testing
" Ability to interpret and analyze data, draw meaningful insights, and make data-driven recommendations for optimization strategies.

Requirements
Conditions of Employment
Must be a US Citizen.
Must be determined suitable for federal employment.
Must participate in the direct deposit pay program.
New employees to the Department of the Navy will be required to successfully pass the E-Verify employment verification check. To learn more about E-Verify, including your rights and responsibilities, visit e-verify.gov
Within the Department of Defense (DoD), the appointment of retired military members within 180 days immediately following retirement date to a civilian position is subject to the provisions of 5 United States Code 3326.
Males born after 12-31-59 must be registered for Selective Service.

You will be required to obtain and maintain an interim and/or final security clearance prior to entrance on duty. Failure to obtain and maintain the required level of clearance may result in the withdrawal of a job offer or removal.
You will be required to complete training, obtain, and maintain a government credit card for travel and travel-related purchases.
This position may require travel from normal duty station to CONUS and OCONUS and may include remote or isolated sites. You must be able to travel on military and commercial aircraft for extended periods of time.
Qualifications
Your resume must also demonstrate at least one year of specialized experience at or equivalent to the GS-07 grade level or pay band in the Federal service or equivalent experience in the private or public sector. Specialized experience must demonstrate the following: 1) Utilizing analytical and evaluative methods to perform surveys and compliance of resources to improve organizational effectiveness and efficiency; 2) Applying regulations and directives governing classified document control in order to ensure security of command classified material; 3) Developing new and/or modified processes and procedures to perform management analysis for assigned programs; and 4) Preparing written documents and/or presentations to facilitate the spread of information.

Additional qualification information can be found from the following Office of Personnel Management website: Management and Program Analysis Series 0343 (opm.gov)

Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., professional, philanthropic, religious, spiritual, community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment.
Education

In lieu of specialized experience, you may qualify with the following education or combination of both education and experience:
Successfully completed a Master's or equivalent graduate degree
or
2 full years of progressively higher level graduate education leading to such a degree
or
LL.B. or J.D., if related to the position being filled

A transcript must be submitted with your application if qualifying using education. See Required Documents for additional information.

You may submit a copy your degree(s) if specific coursework does not have to be verified.

Are you a veteran claiming 5-point veterans' preference or claiming sole survivorship preference? You must submit a copy of your latest DD-214 Certificate of Release or Discharge from Active Duty (any copy that shows all dates of service, as well as character of service [Honorable, General, etc.] is acceptable) OR a VA letter that shows dates of service or service connected disability AND character of service. If you have more than one DD-214 for multiple periods of active duty service, submit a copy for each period of service. If you were issued a DD-215 to amend aforementioned information on the DD-214 you must submit that too. If you are not sure of your preference eligibility, visit the Department of Labor's website: Veterans' Preference Advisor

Are you a disabled veteran or claiming 10-point veterans' preference?
If you are eligible to claim 10 point veterans preference you must submit a DD-214 Certificate of Release or Discharge from Active Duty as described above for 5-point preference.

You must also provide the applicable supporting documentation of your disability (e.g. disability letter from the VA) as described on Standard Form-15 (SF-15). http://www.opm.gov/forms/pdf_fill/SF15.pdf.

Are you an active duty service member? Active Duty Service Members are required to submit a statement of service printed on command letterhead and signed by the command. The statement of service must provide the branch of service, rate/rank, all dates of service, the expected date of discharge and anticipated character of service (Honorable, General, etc.).

Documents submitted as part of the application package, to include supplemental documents, may be shared beyond the Human Resources Office. You may sanitize these documents to remove said personal information before you submit your application. You must provide an un-sanitized version of the documents if you are selected.
