Education must be accredited by an accrediting institution recognized by the U.S. Department of Education in order for it to be credited towards qualifications. Therefore, provide only the attendance and/or degrees from schools accredited by accrediting institutions recognized by the U.S. Department of Education.

SS&C is a global provider of investment and financial services and software for the financial services and healthcare industries. Named to Fortune 1000 list as top U.S. company based on revenue, SS&C is headquartered in Windsor, Connecticut and has 20,000+ employees in over 90 offices in 35 countries. Some 18,000 financial services and healthcare organizations, from the world's largest institutions to local firms, manage and account for their investments using SS&C's products and services.
Job Description
Operations Analyst
Location: Jacksonville, FL
Get To Know The Team:
Join the company ranked #1 on the list of Best Places to Work in Jacksonville. SS&C Advent, the world's leading provider of automated solutions for investment professionals since 1983, is seeking a talented Operations Analyst at the Advent Outsourcing Services office in Jacksonville, FL.
Advent Outsourcing Services is the leading outsourcing provider to the global financial industry, capable of meeting the most demanding requirements for efficient, secure and scalable back office processing, portfolio accounting and financial reporting capabilities. Training will be provided for this entry-level position.
Why You Will Love It Here!
Flexibility: Hybrid Work Model & a Business Casual Dress Code, including jeans
Your Future: 401k Matching Program, Professional Development Reimbursement
Work/Life Balance: Flexible Personal/Vacation Time Off, Sick Leave, Paid Holidays
Your Wellbeing: Medical, Dental, Vision, Employee Assistance Program, Parental Leave
Diversity & Inclusion: Committed to Welcoming, Celebrating and Thriving on Diversity
Training: Hands-On, Team-Customized, including SS&C University
Extra Perks: Discounts on fitness clubs, travel and more!

What You Will Get To Do:
Daily download of transactions, prices, and positions from various electronic interfaces.
Manage reconciliation of client accounts and transactions.
Audit internal systems to match custody statements.
Calculation of investment portfolio performance figures.
Prepare daily, monthly & quarterly investment reports.
Resolve client inquiries & data related issues.
The Impact You Will Make:
Proficiency with Microsoft Office (specifically Excel, Word, and PowerPoint) is required.
Bachelor's degree from a 4 year college or university.
Investment industry experience or a degree in Finance / Economics is preferred.
Experience with Advent software products (Axys, APX) is preferred.
Required critical traits include:
Exceptional communication, both verbal and writing, skills.
Detail-oriented with strong organization skills.
Excellent critical and strategic thinking skills. Must be able to quickly gather & analyze data.
Excellent multi-tasking skills.
Ability to build relationships, both internally and with clients.
Results oriented.

Company Description


Correct Craft is a strategic plan driven company that highly values its culture. That is why we focus heavily on maintaining a highly relational culture, following the Correct Craft identity pyramid that captures both what is important to the company and how we conduct ourselves. Our focus remains on the three pillars of our company – People, Performance, and Philanthropy. For more information please go to www.correctcraft.com



Job Description


The Business Intelligence Analyst is directly responsible for working within the data analytics team and each Correct Craft company to track operations and analyze data trends to support strategic business decisions. This position will develop new reports as well as support routine maintenance for existing reports. Additionally, this position will implement reporting from new or existing datasets and ensure data integrity in data operations. This position will work with internal and external customers to support business intelligence and and data analytics initiatives.

This position will travel approximately 10% of the time. This is an onsite role in Orlando, FL.


Key Responsibilities:

Build, develop and maintain data models, reporting systems, data automation systems, dashboards and performance metrics that support key business decisions.
Oversee new dataset creation and ensure compatibility through architectural structure.
Connect to various systems using backend databases.
In-depth understanding and experience with Microsoft BI stacks such as Power Pivot, SSIS, SSRS and SSAS.
Query and execute formulas to prepare data in a suitable format for visualization.
Generate automated multi-page reports that refresh based on a set schedule.
Provide routine support for all companies’ business intelligence needs.
Organize and drive successful completion of data insight initiatives through effective people and resource management, communication, and collaboration with stakeholders.


Qualifications


Education and Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Finance, Accounting, Math, Economics, or related field.
Understanding of business operations fundamentals and workflow.
Proficiency in Microsoft Power BI, Excel, and Smartsheet.
Expertise in writing SQL queries for data analysis and validation.
Experience with business intelligence tools.
Ability to work with customers to frame project implementations.
Experience with database management and architecture.
Marine, Engineering or Manufacturing experience preferred.
Experience with cloud development and data infrastructure preferred.

Required Skills and Abilities:

Ability to read, analyze and interpret complex technical documents.
Exceptional verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills.
Ability to present information effectively and persuasively.
Organizes and prioritizes critical tasks to meet project timelines. Identifies resources required to complete tasks and escalates issues when conflicts occur.
Ability to make sound judgments and take the initiative to establish priorities, meet deadlines, and make decisions within the functional area of responsibility with minimal direct supervision.

Additional Information

Paid Time Off

JOB SUMMARY
Provide day to day production support to one or more of the following PeopleSoft Financial & HR modules: Accounts Receivable, General Ledger, Accounts Payable, Asset Management, Purchasing/Inventory or HR, Payroll & Benefits. Perform as the functional lead and own overall responsibility of assigned modules in support of Accounting and HR staff. Responsible for application design and specifications for the PeopleSoft Financial & HR systems. Support the PeopleSoft Accounting, Financial and HR system interfaces from the company core business & Banking systems. Develop and design new reports/queries as requested by the Accounting & HR staff.
EDUCATION: Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance or Information Systems or in a related field
EXPERIENCE: Three years experience using PeopleSoft 8.x Financials & HR in one or more of the following modules: Accounts Receivable, General Ledger, Accounts Payable, Asset Management, Purchasing/Inventory or HR, Payroll & Benefits. Functional Lead experience prefered.
LICENSE: Valid Local Driver's License and Valid Passport.

Job Title

Digital Marketing Analyst

Become an integral part of the greater media department within Amadeus. Our Web/SEO team is exclusively focused on the creation & optimization of customer websites and their organic traffic generation. We work alongside our paid search counterparts to strategize and drive direct revenue for our customers.

Summary of the role:

The Digital Marketing Data Analyst will play an integral role within the Digital Marketing team by delivering accurate Analytics insights for the company, the team and our high value clients. He/She will focus on collection, analyzing and processing of data to help drive decisions for product and customer delivery, working from the Digital Marketing team alongside with Digital Media, Web and Product teams to conduct data analysis that help improve our clients’ web ecommerce conversions.

In this role you’ll:

Deliver digital marketing services for a portfolio of independent hotels and mid groups as well as SEO and Web Analytics implementation projects.
Act as the digital marketing team regional champion for Web Analytics architecture, Google Analytics tracking, data analysis and best practices for our clients’ analytics set up.
Deliver Web Analytics reporting for your client portfolio by using Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Google Data Studio, Google Search Console and other tools (Bing Webmaster Tools, SEMrush, Screaming Frog, MOZ, etc).
Communicate and manage concerns from clients or other stakeholders by pro-actively problem solving.

About the ideal candidate:

Education: Bachelor's Degree in Digital Marketing, Marketing or Hospitality
3+ years of experience in Digital Marketing and SEO
2+ years of experience on Web Analytics, GTM and Google Analytics
2+ years of experience in hospitality
Business understanding: Digital Marketing, Web Analytics, SEO, Paid Media, Content Marketing.

Skills:

Computing: Basic understanding of the purpose of programming languages such as HTML, CSS, and other relevant coding languages; familiar with a Design process, have a basic understanding of UX and Usability & Design tools.
Languages: English as primary language, Spanish is a plus but not necessary.
Specific Knowledge: Digital Marketing, SEO, Content Marketing, Google Analytics, Paid Media.
Google Analytics Expertise (technical knowledge, usability, setup).
Other: Hospitality industry knowledge

Excellent communication skills, both internally and externally

Ability to anticipate risks and take appropriate action

Is a role-model in all aspects of Digital Marketing skills

Work with cross-functional teams to efficiently complete digital marketing/website projects.


What we can offer you:

Get rewarded with competitive remuneration, individual and company annual bonus, vacation and holiday paid time off, health insurances and other competitive benefits.
Work from anywhere: onsite, hybrid or fully remote.
Professional development to broaden your knowledge and enhance your skills with on-line learning hubs packed with technical and soft skills training that allow you to develop and grow.
Enter a diverse and inclusive workplace, join one of the world’s top travel technology companies and take on a role that impacts millions of travelers around the globe.

Application process:

The application process takes no longer than 10 minutes!
Create your candidate profile, upload your Resume/CV and apply today!

What You Need To Know

Open your future to incredible career potential. Work for an industry-leader who invests in their people. Southern Glazer’s Wine & Spirits is North America’s preeminent wine and spirits distributor, as well as a family-owned, privately held company with a 50+ year legacy of success. We were named by Newsweek as a Most Loved Workplace and are included on the Forbes lists for Largest Private Companies and Best Employers for Diversity.


As a full-time employee, you can choose from a full menu of our Top Shelf Benefits, including comprehensive medical and prescription drug coverage, dental and vision plans, tax-saving Flexible Spending Accounts, disability coverage, life insurance plans, and a 401(k) plan. We also offer tuition reimbursement, a wellness program, parental leave, vacation accrual, paid sick leave, and more.


At Southern Glazer’s, you’ll enjoy an environment where continuous learning and growth are supported and experience a culture where you are respected, and your voice is heard. If you’re looking to fill your glass with opportunity, come join our FAMILY.

Overview

The Analyst is a critical member of the OSM team focused on supporting corporate, divisional and functional leaders with strategy development, executive decision making and initiative implementation. As we identify and execute business improvement opportunities, you will have the unique opportunity to work with seasoned business professionals to develop analytical, problem-solving and communication skills in a dynamic and exciting industry. This team will ensure you have the opportunities and support needed to reach your professional development objectives.




Additionally, this position could serve as a stepping stone to a management position within OSM or the broader company. The Analyst is an integral part of a working team, providing support on a multitude of projects that span across SWS divisions and business functions. You will be responsible for providing analytical support on these projects as well as ad-hoc requests, as required. You will also be responsible for supporting the design and generation of financial and operational models and reports; provide project team support in such areas as new business acquisition and market entry, supplier and customer relations; and will develop analyses and presentation materials needed for the OSM team. As an Analyst, you will typically report to a Manager / Director depending on the project, but could work directly with a Vice President as well.


Analysts are expected to demonstrate highly refined analytical and communication skills, as well as the ability to work effectively in both independent and group settings. You will have a direct impact on overall team goals while promoting your own personal growth. The ideal candidate for this role will either have recently graduated from an MBA program and have about a year of analytical, strategy or consulting experience or, alternatively, the ideal candidate will have at least a year of management consulting experience doing analytical and/or project work.

Primary Responsibilities
Analytical Support: Structure analyses—including defining logic, business rules and assumptions—needed to drive business decisions. Deliver analyses employing a variety of programs (MS Excel, MS Access, SQL Server, etc.) and business intelligence tools (Business Objects, Diver, Data Warehouse, etc.) to identify, extract and analyze data.
Presentation Support: Support team members in the development of PowerPoint slides to effectively communicate findings.
Research Support: Conduct ad hoc and ongoing research projects related to strategic initiatives
Project Management Support: Support team members with analytical support as needed
Minimum Qualifications
Education: Bachelor’s Degree is required (cumulative GPA of 3.0 or above). Preferably in business, finance, economics, engineering, accounting or applied math. MBA is preferred but not required.
Experience: Relevant analytical work experience is required. 1-3 years of work experience preferred but will consider applicants with strong academic results and internship experience
Project Management Skills: Must possess excellent organizational skills with strong attention to detail
Computer Skills: Must have knowledge of extracting data from a database (knowledge of relational databases and Structured Query Language (SQL) is a strong plus). Advanced proficiency in MS Excel. Must be proficient in MS Word, and MS PowerPoint, and must have a working knowledge of MS Access. Ability to learn various business solutions programs (i.e., Diver, Business Objects, Tableau, etc.)
Analytical/Problem-Solving Skills: Must demonstrate strong critical thinking capabilities and analytical / problem-solving skills. Must be comfortable interpreting and manipulating large amounts of data. Must demonstrate a structured, analytical thought process.
Communication Skills: Excellent communication skills, both written and oral, with the ability to tell a story with data.
Detail Oriented: Accuracy and attention to detail are imperative.
Commitment: Must demonstrate commitment to getting the job done. Hours will vary on a weekly basis based on workload and project deadlines.
People & Team Skills: Must have sufficient self-confidence, poise and interpersonal skills to be able to work effectively as part of a team and to take part in professional discussions. Also must be able to sustain performance under conditions of stress—such as tight deadlines and detailed questioning. Must demonstrate ability to be a team player and quick learner in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
Location: Must be willing to reside in South Florida.

Physical Demands
Physical demands with activity or condition for a considerable amount of time include sitting and typing/keyboarding using a computer (e.g., keyboard, mouse, and monitor) or adding machine
Physical demands with activity or condition may include occasional to rare amount of time include walking, bending, reaching, standing, and stooping
May require occasional lifting/lowering, pushing, carrying, or pulling up to 15lbs

The role you’ll contribute:

The Business Analyst (II) serves as a liaison between clinical and operational service lines supporting a variety of quality and performance measurement initiatives throughout the organization through participation in development and maintenance of reports, scorecards and dashboard tools. These initiatives include but are not limited to tracking clinical quality outcomes, monitoring and improving patient safety efforts, and benchmarking internal performance against external peers. The Business Analyst (II) analyzes qualitative and quantitative clinical, financial and administrative data from multiple sources, and synthesizes results into meaningful reports and presentations on a regular basis. The Business Analyst (II) develops and maintains a robust, working knowledge of the business area that they support. The Business Analyst (II) is the subject matter expert of the key drivers and measures of success for this business area and demonstrates thorough understanding of the short-term and long-term direction of the service line. The Business Analyst (II) is expected to actively demonstrate outstanding customer service and maintain relationships that are equally respectful to all.

The value you’ll bring to the team:

Demonstrates, through behavior, AdventHealth Orlando’s service standards.
Works with clinical and operational staff to develop and maintain performance measurement processes (database development, benchmarking, KPI development, systems documentation, and reporting/dashboard deployment).
Interacts frequently with leadership and quality personnel (including ancillary, safety, acute care, and integrated health services) to facilitate discussions of existing data products while assessing unmet analytic needs and potential enhancements.
Analyzes and interprets data to identify areas for improvement and provide meaningful data-driven insights and recommendations to leadership.
Develops key performance indicators (clinical outcomes, cost, length of stay, patient satisfaction, etc.) through gathering requirements, defining specifications and establishing goals or benchmarks.
Manages complex datasets by identifying, aggregating, cleaning and validating data from multiple sources in preparation for reporting use.
Uses analytical techniques to design, develop, and maintain reports, scorecards, and dashboards that provide insight to the organization.
Conducts financial and/or operational analyses and interprets results to support business stakeholders in making strategic decisions.
Collaborates with other analytics staff to develop and improve analytic products.
Supports system-wide quality improvement efforts through collaboration with multi-disciplinary audiences, from executives to front line staff.
Develops subject matter expertise around business/clinical operations and their relation to performance measurements.
Conducts regular data mining/extraction from database and tables.
Qualifications


The expertise and experiences you'll need to succeed:

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:

Bachelor's degree with two (2) or more years of relevant experience, preferably in a related field such as: business, health care, engineering, information systems, or mathematics discipline, or
Master's degree with one (1) year of relevant experience, preferably in a related field such as: business, health care, engineering, information systems, or mathematics discipline

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE PREFERRED:

Bachelor's degree preferably in a related field such as: business, health care, engineering, information systems, or mathematics discipline, or
Master's degree preferably in a related field such as: business, health care, engineering, information systems, or mathematics discipline, and
Two (2) or more years of experience in a related analytic position, and
One (1) or more years of experience in a healthcare organization

Title:

Business Analyst

Job Description

Acts as a liaison between IT development groups and business units for the development and implementation of new systems and enhancement of current systems. Evaluates new applications, system requirements, developments in field of expertise, and evolving business needs to recommend appropriate solutions and alternatives. Under general supervision, and occasional direct supervision, performs assignments requiring experience and knowledge of standard concepts within their field. Skills required for this job are typically acquired through the completion of an undergraduate degree and 2+ years of experience, or equivalent work experience in lieu of degree.

Performs systems analysis related functions to ensure the efficient operation of Oracle and PC-based supply systems. Heavily involved in creation/management/maintenance of Microsoft Access (SQL) databases. Prepares detailed program specifications, instructions for data retrieval and system enhancements. Plans and conducts system projects, necessitating the application of advanced computer systems knowledge. Designs, develops and validates information retrieval programs. Act as liaison with LOGCOM Albany GA., and SCMB BICmd for all function system requirements and report discovered issues. Provides training for information retrieval or technical knowledge as required on GCSS-MC, PC-Based programs or other related systems. Complies with all; Marine Corps Prepositioning Program (MCPP) ISO-9002 policies and procedures. Performs other related duties as assigned.

In lieu of a degree, a combination of education, training and directly related experience may be considered.

Eight (4) years of directly related work experience.

Knowledge of the Marine Corps Supply System (GCSS-MC) is desired.

Ability to design and use SQL, SharePoint, and MS Office Suite applications is required.

Working knowledge of Business Intelligence is desired.

U.S. Citizenship is required.

Must be able to obtain and maintain a CAC card.

Valid U.S. state driver’s license required.

Must be able to obtain and maintain a security clearance.

Data Analyst, Office of Data Analytics (01082)

The Florida Board of Governors is seeking qualified candidates for the position of Data Analyst within the Office of Data Analytics (ODA). This position will assist ODA with the analysis and review of data submitted to the State University Database System (SUDS) related to enrollment, retention, graduation, student outcomes and other measures.

The primary role of this position is to transform large data sets into actionable information for reporting purposes, including internal and external data requests, university Accountability Plans, and other projects as assigned. Other important responsibilities of this position include the ability to use contextual knowledge and statistical methods to discover patterns, trends and other salient points that can be used to inform decisions and policy discussions.

Responsibilities, duties, and activities may include, but are not limited to, the following:

Transform large data sets into actionable information for reporting purposes, including internal and external data requests Provides assistance office-wide as assigned; university Accountability Plans, and other projects as assigned;
Ability to use contextual knowledge and statistical methods to discover patterns, trends and other salient points that can be used to inform decisions and policy discussions.





Minimum Qualifications:

A bachelor’s degree in a social science or the humanities.
At least two years of professional experience.
Coursework or professional experience conducting research and analysis.
Strong and effective communication, presentation, and written skills.
MS Office tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
Ability to read and write SAS or SQL queries.
Strong narrative skills for technical and non-technical audiences.
Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively.
Detail-oriented problem solver.
Strong organization skills.
Excellent customer service.

Preferred Requirements

A master’s degree and/or two or more years of professional experience conducting research or data analysis.
Advanced Excel functions (Ex: Pivot Tables, Vlookup, Power Query).
Proficiency visualizing data (Ex: Tableau, Power BI, SAS Viya).

Experience in higher education administration or institutional research.




How to Apply
Submit cover letter; resume; and State of Florida application. This position requires pre-employment background screening. Applicants selected for interviews may be required to submit additional information.




Hiring Range
Salary range $60,000 - $65,000, based on qualifications and experience.

This position requires pre-employment background screening that includes fingerprinting.

Job Title: Supervisory Records Examiner / Analyst Supporting USMS
Job Description:
Be a part of the nationwide law enforcement initiative that removes the tools of crime from criminal organizations, depriving wrongdoers of proceeds from their crime and impacting the infrastructure of criminal enterprises. FSA Federal (FSA) is focused on delivering unsurpassed services in support of law enforcement and homeland security. We currently have a vacancy for a Supervisory Records Examiner/Analyst. In this role, you will be supporting the overall mission of the U.S. Marshals Service (USMS). If you are looking for a meaningful, mission driven career, Join FSA!
Responsibilities
Reviews and analyzes data and information from multiple sources.
Supervises the work of subordinate staff and coordinates with other support components to accomplish work. Sets goals and priorities in accordance with task order requirements and quality objectives.
Monitors work and is responsible for ensuring that work meets all requirements and is delivered on time.
Formulates administrative and technical procedures (to include quality control spot checks) to troubleshoot workflow issues and to improve quality and timeliness.
Develops systems and procedures to track, control and manage case files and exhibits, as well as other case related material.
Performs complex technical and factual research.
Keeps the customer and senior management updated on operational status and plans.
Provides all required reports on or ahead of schedule.
Manages personnel in accordance with contract and company requirements, to include:
Monitors employee productivity and provides constructive feedback and coaching.
Manages Vacation and other leave requests.
Reviews and approves timesheets, travel authorizations and expense reports.
Administers employee evaluations.
Acts with appropriate speed to resolve employee concerns.
Works with senior management and Human Capital Management (HCM) to appropriately address conduct and performance issues.
Performs other duties as assigned.



Requirements

Undergraduate degree or High School Diploma/GED and two years additional experience
Three-years related experience and one-year experience in asset forfeiture or a field related to law enforcement or related field (includes legal and military experience); direct asset forfeiture experience preferred
Ability to demonstrate supervisory experience (project management experience considered)
Must have working knowledge of legal system, to include legal research procedures, automated research tools, and sources of information
Superior communication skills; oral and written
Strong organizational and prioritization skills
Intermediate skills with the Microsoft Office suite of applications (Excel, PowerPoint, Word), and other common software applications and databases, advance skills preferred
Leads by example, maintains a professional disposition under extreme pressure
Ability to multitask and consistently deliver the highest quality of work and customer service

This position requires U.S. Citizenship and a 7 (or 10) year minimum background investigation

Agency Overview

The U.S. Marshals Service (USMS) is the nation's oldest and most versatile federal law enforcement agency. The Marshals Service occupies a uniquely central position in the federal justice system by being the enforcement arm of the federal courts. Among their many duties, they protect the federal judiciary, apprehend federal fugitives, manage assets seized from criminal enterprises acquired by criminals through illegal activities, house and transport federal prisoners and operate the Witness Security Program.

Benefits Overview

At FSA Federal, we recognize the diverse needs of our employees and strive to provide an excellent package to help meet those needs. Comprehensive benefits are offered with greater choice and flexibility to support your health, work-life balance, and professional growth. A package providing employee only coverage can be built around our basic plans at $0 employee cost for: Medical, Dental, Vision, Term Life Insurance, Accidental Death & Dismemberment Insurance, Short-Term Disability, and Employee Assistance Program. For more information, click here.


FSA is proud to be an Affirmative Action/ Equal Opportunity Employer. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote qualified persons in all job titles without regard to age, ancestry, color, gender, HIV status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation (including gender expression and identity) veteran status, family leave status, and any protected group status as defined by applicable law. FSA is proud to maintain a drug-free workplace. Satisfactory completion of a post-offer drug screening is a condition of employment. As a supplier of services to federal government agencies, such as DEA, FBI, USCIS, USPIS, etc., we also adhere to agency standards with respect to prior drug usage.

Overview:

The Data Governance Analyst will play a vital role in ensuring the accuracy, security, and compliance of HR data within our organization. You will collaborate with stakeholders to develop and enforce data governance policies, implement data quality standards, and drive data-related initiatives. This position also serves as a technical point-of-contact for the assigned functional area and assists subject matter experts with ensuring data integrity, testing of system changes, report writing and analyzing data flows for process improvement opportunities. This position will also support HRMS upgrades, patches, testing and other technical projects as assigned.

Responsibilities:

Essential duties include, but are not limited to:




Develop and enforce data governance policies, procedures, and data standards to ensure data integrity, accuracy, and security.
Collaborate with HR leadership to develop and implement a comprehensive data governance strategy for HR data, aligning with organizational goals and compliance requirements
Collaborate with functional users and IT in the review, testing and implementation of HR system upgrades or patches.
Maintain data integrity and facilitate effective decision-making across the HR function.
Recommend process/customer service improvements and serve as a key liaison with third parties and other stakeholders (e.g. Payroll or Training) providing overall project management for the given HR initiative.
Identify opportunities to leverage HR data for strategic initiatives, reporting, and analytics
Assist in the maintaining data integrity by running queries and analyzing data.
Qualifications:

Qualifications

Experience:




Degree in Human Resources, Data Management, Information Technology, Computer Science, HR Data Analytics or related field or equivalent work experience.
Professional certification such as CPP, CEBS, PHR is preferred
3 - 5 years of HRIS, HR generalist or specialist experience.
1 - 2 years of project management experience, to include systems implementation.
Exceptional analytical and problem solving skills.
Excellent interpersonal skills, able to build business partnerships with end users or IT and influence outcomes.
Strong communication skills - written, verbal, ability to communicate effectively with all levels of a global organization.
Self-motivated, work with minimal guidance, ability to work under pressure while delivering high quality results.
Requires strong mathematical, analytical, critical thinking and problem solving skills; must be highly detail oriented.
Ability to maintain the highest degree of confidentiality in all matters related to employee compensation and benefits.


Work Environment:

Duties and responsibilities are typically performed in a professional office setting, but there may be times where you will need to be in operating areas. In these areas, you may be exposed to environmental factors including, but not limited to, second hand smoke and excessive noise.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms, talk or hear; and taste or smell. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close, distance, color, and peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.

Senior Level

DORAL, FL

US Security Clearance is required (must be current/active and Secret level or higher)

Own your career as a Cyber Security Analyst Senior at GDIT. Here, you'll have the opportunity to build strong lines of cyber defense using cutting-edge technologies. Your work in cyber security at GDIT will have an impact on securing our clients' missions and ensuring we anticipate the threats of tomorrow.

At GDIT, people are our differentiator. As a Cyber Security Analyst Senior you will help ensure today is safe and tomorrow is smarter. Our work depends on Cyber Security Analyst Senior joining our team to help execute customer's mission.

HOW A CYBER SECURITY ANALYST SENIOR WILL MAKE AN IMPACT

Investigates, analyzes, and responds to cyber incidents within a network environment or enclave.

Track and report on relevant data tasked by the Battle Captain or key leadership.
Develop techniques and procedures for conducting cybersecurity risk assessments and compliance audits, the evaluation and testing of hardware, firmware and software for possible impact on system security, and the investigation and resolution of security incidents such as intrusion, frauds, attacks or leaks.

Required Experience: 3+ years of related experience on following technologies in addition to cybersecurity - HBSS/ESS, ACAS, SIEM.

Comprehensive health and wellness packages.
Internal mobility team dedicated to helping you own your career.
Professional growth opportunities including paid education and certifications.
Cutting-edge technology from which you can learn. This is one of the premier programs for learning.
Rest and recharge with paid vacation and holidays. We emphasize work/life balance.

Risk Management Analyst

Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company, operating 250 data centers across the globe and providing interconnections to all the key clouds and networks. Businesses need one place to simplify and bring together fragmented, complex infrastructure that spans private and public cloud environments. Our global platform allows customers to place infrastructure wherever they need it and connect it to everything they need to succeed.

We are a fast-growing global company with 20+ years of continuous growth. Through our innovative portfolio of high-performance products and services, we have created the largest, most active global ecosystem of 10,000+ companies, including 2,000+ networks and 3,000+ cloud and IT service providers in 32 countries spanning six continents.

A career at Equinix means you will collaborate on work that impacts the world and be surrounded by endless opportunities to learn new skills and grow in varied directions. We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success.

Job Summary

As part of the Equinix Global Risk and Security organization, which also includes Business Continuity and Corporate Security, Risk Management is a small team with a global reach responsible for managing the company’s global property and liability insurance programs.

The Risk Management Analyst provides a core support function for development, maintenance, and placement of global insurance programs. Responsibilities include research, gathering relevant information and analyzing data to identify issues and propose solutions.

Responsibilities

Risk Transfer and Analysis

Manage process and information flow across multiple functions globally for insurance renewals and internal and external audit requests

Evaluate systems to streamline data collection and identify process improvement opportunities

Assist with the research and evaluation of insurance coverage and risk transfer matters

Coordinate with insurers and brokers on insurance due diligence for mergers and acquisitions

Process certificate of insurance requests

Contract Review

Support the development and implementation of Equinix standard contract language for supplier contracts and construction agreements

Assist with review of insurance clauses for supplier contracts to ensure the transfer of risk based on exposure

Help foster better understanding of risk management and contractual insurance requirements through development of training and awareness campaigns

Accounting/Budget

Manage supplier set up, PO creation and invoice processing in global payment system

Reconcile broker premium invoices against bound policies, process invoices and maintain regular payment tracking

Reconcile department monthly insurance accounts

Department Communication & Planning

Assist with development and maintenance of all components of department intranet website, including enhanced self-service capabilities

Maintain updates to Risk Management manuals and information used in quarterly reports

Provide support and guidance to internal stakeholders related to insurance matters

Become SME for any department technology tools implemented to compile renewal and claims data as well as associated reporting

Claims Management

Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders (e.g brokers and insurance adjusters) on the reporting and tracking of global claims data

Create quarterly/annual claims reports and analyze data for trends and mitigation opportunities

Organize annual and quarterly reviews with brokers and/or insurance carriers to analyze claims and insurance issues as needed

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in Risk Management, Finance, or equivalent field of study

2-5 years of working experience with an insurance broker, insurer or risk management department, including related internships

A strong technical understanding of liability insurance with experience negotiating best terms and conditions in third party contractual insurance requirements

Excellent written and verbal communication, analytical and interpersonal skills, precise attention to detail and strong commitment to meeting deadlines in a fast-paced work environment

Superior systems capabilities including Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Teams, OneDrive), Sharepoint, and Smartsheets

Experience in construction or real estate risk management encouraged

Fluency in additional languages encouraged

Equinix is an Equal Employment Opportunity and, in the U.S., an Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to unlawful consideration of race, color, religion, creed, national or ethnic origin, ancestry, place of birth, citizenship, sex, pregnancy / childbirth or related medical conditions, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic partnership status, age, veteran or military status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, political / organizational affiliation, status as a victim or family member of a victim of crime or abuse, or any other status protected by applicable law.

As the Business Analyst - Supply Chain for the CAPP Division, you will be responsible for managing the metal material planning, procurement, and delivery to ensure the efficient and effective movement of materials from suppliers to the appropriate CAPP Sites. You will play a critical role in optimizing the supply chain processes by identifying and addressing bottlenecks, risks, and opportunities for improvement and support the organization's supply chain needs to run smoothly and efficiently to ensure a profit, material continuity.

Key Responsibilities:

Metal Material Management
Responsible for planning, purchasing, and monitoring the metal materials, track to production volume, monitor customers' purchase trends and determine the CAPP Metal needs by utilizing forecast inputs from Sales, other customer knowledge, information, market studies, historical information, market data, sourcing feedback/guidance and collaboration efforts with cross-functional teams.
Accountable to coordinate activities related to the planning and procurement of raw materials and contribute to the global balancing of Materials within Global Planning, ensuring efficient and effective procurement & inventory practices and optimizing the balance between quality, service, reliability, and cost.
Align and collaborate with Metals Sourcing to determine Metal Suppliers per Metal Specifications, tonnage, timing to ship, timing to receive, logistics and handle purchase order management based on the allocations defined.
Monitor supplier performance and assist sourcing with managing supplier relationships to ensure that materials are delivered on time and meet quality standards. Ensure Material deliveries are on time and work with appropriate stakeholders to uphold material continuity and on-time delivery.
Analyze data and methods to predict and improve a company's delivery of products and services to its customers. Manage and oversee the calculation of metal needs and be the SME for metal specification communications among cross-functional teams.
Extract and manage, monitor and all reports regarding Metal Planning, Deliveries, Specification, and overall strategy of metal materials.
Identify and mitigate supply chain risks, such as disruptions in supply, transportation, or demand, and implement contingency plans as needed. Publish key reports of Mill Tonnage supply Monthly, Post tons required, purchases and allocations by mill and ending coil tonnage each month.
Identify and support continuous improvement opportunities to reduce material leadtimes, specification segmentation, and improve efficiency to supply chain and operational process; Contribute to the development of business system initiatives and enhancements.
Inventory Management
Conduct demand forecasting and inventory planning to ensure that materials are available when needed and in the appropriate quantities.
Collaborate with key stakeholders and subject matter experts within each business unit to develop and implement appropriate inventory strategies and forecasting processes.
Maintain the required inventory to run the production and sales process smoothly, having material available, improve order fulfillment, right amount of stock and mitigate having the wrong inventory on hand.
Support supply chain metrics and key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure and monitor performance of material in inventory and supplier inventories.
Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements related to the supply chain.
Sales Inventory & Operations Planning (SIOP)
Support the setup and implementation of a scalable, sustainable process for Sales, Inventory and Operations Planning process. You will work with account managers, operations personnel, financial analysts, and senior leadership as we continue to define and develop SIOP to support an integrated business planning. Coordinate and support reviews as required and identify obstacles and roadblocks to implementing SIOP, develop and communicate possible solutions.
Drive transparency, accountability, and continuous improvement through solutions to track key assumptions, inputs, and outputs; Provide business data analysis to support and implement new business initiatives.





Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in supply chain management, logistics, business administration, or related field
Minimum of 7+ years of experience in supply chain management, preferably in the manufacturing industry with 3+ years' of analytics experience or working in an analyst role or similar to
Must be comfortable in a fast-paced environment with the demonstrated ability to effectively manage multiple priorities to completion
Ability to lead cross-functional teams in a matrixed, geographically dispersed environment and working across organizational boundaries to ensure successful project implementation.
Strong organizational, communication (oral and written) and time management skills
Strong computer skills and proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite and data visualization tools
Strong problem-solving skills
Strong analytical skills and experience with data analysis and modeling tools
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and suppliers
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and other analytical tools
Knowledge of supply chain management software systems and enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems
Familiarity with regulatory requirements related to supply chain management
Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment

Job Title: 2024 BNY Mellon Analyst Program - Engineering (Data Science)
Job Description:
Overview
2024 BNY Mellon Analyst Program - Engineering (Data Science)
Bring your ideas. Make history.
BNY Mellon offers an exciting array of future-forward careers at the intersection of business, finance, and technology. We are one of the world's top asset management and banking firms that manages trillions of dollars in assets, custody and/or administration. Known as the “bank of banks” - 97% of the world’s top banks work with us as we lead and serve our customers into the new era of digital.
With over 239 years of rich history and industry firsts, BNY Mellon has been built upon our proven ability to evolve, lead, and drive new ideas at every turn. Today, we’re approximately 50,000 employees across 35 countries with a culture that empowers you to grow, take risks, experiment and be yourself. This is what #LifeAtBNYMellon is all about.
We welcome you to apply! When applying to this general Analyst Programs posting, our expert BNY Mellon Talent Acquisition Team may also review your resume for consideration across other open early career roles within the company.
We’re seeking future team members for our 2024 BNY Mellon Analyst Program - Engineering (Data Science) with roles located in Pittsburgh , New York , and Lake Mary in hybrid positions.

Program highlights:
The 2024 BNY Mellon Analyst Program - Engineering (Data Science) aims to develop and retain high-potential entry-level technology professionals who are prepared and positioned to contribute to the successful execution of BNY Mellon’s technology strategy and initiatives.
Data Science
Apply scientific methods to find solutions to real business problems.
Perform data analysis, feature engineering, and advanced methods to prepare and develop decisions based on data.
Data mining using state-of-the-art methods
Provide insight into observed business outcomes through analytics.
Perform data profiling to identify and understand anomalies in data.
Automate data analysis and streamline analytical processes
Provide recommendations based on data trends uncovered when possible
Stays abreast of organization and management changes and has in-depth knowledge of company practices relevant to data science products.
Grow and develop skills across the 3 domain specialties: Machine Learning, Feature Engineering and Advanced Analytics capabilities. Stressing expertise in the core functional areas: Computer Programming, Math & Analytic Methodology, Distributed computing, and communications of complex results

Program Eligibility/Qualifications:
Must be enrolled in an accredited university/college pursuing bachelor’s degree or a 4+1 program in a relevant field (i.e., Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a similar major with extensive Data Science, Statistics, or related fields.) Graduating by summer 2024.
Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 or above
Does not require sponsorship for employment visa status (now or in the future) in the region where applying

Preferred skills:
A great attitude and desire for learning
Excellent problem solving, written and oral communication skills
Disciplined self-starter, capable of working independently or in close collaboration
Smart and driven individual who is passionate about learning new technologies
0-2 years of experience in software development preferred. Previous technology internship is a plus
At BNY Mellon, our inclusive culture speaks for itself. Here’s a few of our awards:
Fortune World’s Most Admired Companies & Top 20 for Diversity and Inclusion
Bloomberg’s Gender Equality Index (GEI)
Human Rights Campaign Foundation, 100% score Corporate Equality Index
Best Places to Work for Disability Inclusion , Disability: IN – 100% score
100 Best Workplaces for Innovators, Fast Company
CDP’s Climate Change ‘A List’
Forbes Blockchain 50

Our Benefits:
BNY Mellon offers highly competitive compensation, benefits, and wellbeing programs rooted in a strong culture of excellence and our pay-for-performance philosophy. We provide access to flexible global resources and tools for your life’s journey. Focus on your health, foster your personal resilience, and reach your financial goals as a valued member of our team, along with generous paid leaves that can support you and your family through moments that matter.

BNY Mellon assesses market data to ensure a competitive compensation package for our employees. The base salary for this position is expected to be between $75,000 and $100,000 per year at the commencement of employment. However, base salary if hired will be determined on an individualized basis, including as to experience and market location, and is only part of the BNYM total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, discretionary bonuses, short and long-term incentive packages, and company- sponsored benefit programs.
This position is at-will and the Company reserves the right to modify base (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, change in geographic location, Company or individual department/team performance and market factors.
BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer - Underrepresented racial and ethnic groups/Females/Individuals with Disabilities/Protected Veterans.

Employer Description:
For over 230 years, the people of BNY Mellon have been at the forefront of finance, expanding the financial markets while supporting investors throughout the investment lifecycle. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments and safeguards nearly one-fifth of the world's financial assets. BNY Mellon remains one of the safest, most trusted and admired companies. Every day our employees make their mark by helping clients better manage and service their financial assets around the world. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, clients count on the people of BNY Mellon across time zones and in 35 countries and more than 100 markets. It's the collective ambition, innovative thinking and exceptionally focused client service paired with a commitment to doing what is right that continues to set us apart. Make your mark: bnymellon.com/careers.

EEO Statement:
BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. Our ambition is to build the best global team – one that is representative and inclusive of the diverse talent, clients and communities we work with and serve – and to empower our team to do their best work. We support wellbeing and a balanced life, and offer a range of family-friendly, inclusive employment policies and employee forums.

Are you ready to make an impact at DTCC?

Do you want to work on innovative projects, collaborate with a dynamic and supportive team, and receive investment in your professional development? At DTCC, we are at the forefront of innovation in the financial markets. We're committed to helping our employees grow and succeed. We believe that you have the skills and drive to make a real impact. We champion a thriving internal community and are committed to creating a workplace that looks like the world that we serve.

Pay and Benefits:

Competitive compensation, including base pay and annual incentive
Comprehensive health and life insurance and well-being benefits, based on location
Pension / Retirement benefits
Paid Time Off and Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.
DTCC offers a flexible/hybrid model of 3 days onsite and 2 days remote (onsite Tuesdays, Wednesdays and a third day unique to each team or employee).

The impact you will have in this role:

DTCC is embarking on an exciting multi-year journey to bring new digital capabilities to our clients. Our vision is to deliver groundbreaking solutions, such as self-service capabilities and workflow automation tools, that enable clients to personalize their experience with DTCC at scale with minimal effort and risk, while also reducing operational burden on internal teams. As a Business Analyst in our Process and Data Analysis Squad, you will drive the realization of this vision by bringing analytical rigor and intellectual curiosity to the analysis and reimagination of key client onboarding processes and data structures.

Foundational to our success is a thorough understanding of our current-state processes, data inputs, and information flows. The Process and Data Squad will lead the detailed analysis of complex processes and tools that span across various systems and teams while incorporating a data-centric view (for example, how does the data we collect in a certain step in the process flow downstream?). The squad will also drive key re-imagination and transformational efforts, bringing key collaborators together to drive consensus on how best to organize teams and deploy new processes and leading-edge tools that minimize manual processing risk, effectively manage data, and enhance the client experience

Being a member of the Process and Data Squad, the Business Analyst should have advanced organizational and analytical skills with a focus on close attention to detail. The ideal candidate will be key in bridging the gap between IT, the business, and shared services (for example, Compliance) and requires the incumbent to access, profile, and analyze data, understand and document business requirements, and communicate clearly and concisely with a broad range of technical and business partners custodians.

Your Primary Responsibilities:

Support the leadership team in establishing, maturing, and driving the implementation of industry-leading data management practices
Partner with business and operational collaborators to assess logical data element names, create clear and accurate data definitions, and identify valid values for the data
Build the connection between data elements and specific process steps and collection methods (for example, web forms, legal agreements, etc.)
Assist data modelers in producing conceptual and logical data models, including entity and attribute names and definitions

Be a self-starter with a solid ability to prioritize, assist with projects, and quickly learn new concepts and frameworks

Microsoft office applications: PowerPoint, Word, Excel, Visio
Technical Skills preferred, such as reading data using SQL queries

ABOUT THE SHADE STORE

At The Shade Store, we have handcrafted the finest Shades, Blinds and Drapery for 75 years. We believe designing beautiful custom window treatments should be an effortless experience, so we offer outstanding services to help our customers every step of the way, from inspiration to installation.

WHY WORK AT THE SHADE STORE

We set out to create a company culture that is enjoyable, rewarding, and where there is continuous upward mobility and growth opportunity. THE POSITION: Supply Chain Analyst

The Supply Chain Analyst is responsible to complete daily, weekly, and monthly reporting requirements for performance, compliance, and invoicing, which requires report development and analytics. Perform a variety of calculations, analyses, and audits of financial and operational results; typically involves fundamental professional related supply chain principles. Analyze operational details to identify potential areas for improvement, savings, or efficiency, including innovative solutions. This is a full-time role with a chance to join a team of senior consultants and accelerate your career!

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Plan and implement supply chain optimization projects (e.g. inventory management, strategic sourcing, supply planning and scheduling, etc.)
Help define business requirements and system configuration specifications (e.g. packaging, procurement, delivery)
Analyze gathered information & data using descriptive analytics (basic mathematics & comparative analysis), diagnostic analytics (root cause analysis, gap analysis), predictive and prescriptive analytics (data interpretation, data correlation, forecasting with the use of advanced statistical tools, hypothesis testing)
Analyze data and summarize results by creating dashboards, graphs, tables, and charts.
Present findings to stakeholders by creating engaging presentations and clearly written documents incorporating compelling storytelling and visualization best practices.
Evaluate vendor operations (e.g. freight forwarders) according to quality standards.
Help design, document, and maintain business and system processes.
Configure the ePIC ERP system and work with internal customers to validate the design (and make changes to help them improve their supply chain operations).
Analyze data to identify problematic areas and make recommendations to improve system design/use.
Track KPIs and report on the supply chain’s performance.
Constantly be on the lookout for ways to improve monitoring, discover issues, and deliver better value to the customer processes and methods to gather supply chain data.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:

BSc/BA in Supply Chain, Business Analytics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Experience in data mining, analysis, and reporting.
Familiarity with supply chain processes (e.g. inventory, planning, warehouse management).
Analytical mind with business acumen.
Problem-solving aptitude, attention to detail.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to set long-term goals and communicate them to others.
Proficiency with MS Office, including spreadsheet, reporting, technical research, relational databases, and other ERP systems.
Ability to quickly build trusting relationships, gain credibility, and partner with leaders and peers.

Proof of legal authorization to work in the United States for The Shade Store, which will be confirmed by E-Verify within three business days of your hire date

Business Analyst

The Opportunity:

Are you looking for an opportunity to establish processes and drive technology innovation? You know that true progress is made at the intersection of business and tech, and as an IT business analyst, you’ll be highly skilled in both. Here, you’ll have the chance to work with an agile team as they develop digital products to support your clients’ most pressing missions. We’re looking for someone like you to propel business analytics and processes forward, as well as delve into technology trends to deliver user-friendly client experiences.

As an IT business analyst, you’ll develop leading-edge business solutions. Partnering with your team of architects, developers, testers and leading junior analysts and other key stakeholders, you’ll identify clients’ business needs, gather user requirements, and develop user stories. You’ll understand the overall direction and nuanced user needs clearly, and you’ll lead your team as they fulfill these needs by creating deployable features. Together, you’ll deliver high business value products to the Veterans Administration. Ready to make an impact by transforming and modernizing federal healthcare? Work with us as we build systems to change Veterans Affairs for the better.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

Position Summary:

The IT Business Analyst position is a full-time employment opportunity. Reporting to the Business Analyst Manager. The position is in Winter Park, Florida. This position is a critical role as part of the Business Analyst team. Business Analysts are responsible for analyzing business software needs, developing, refining, and documenting high-quality requirements for the company’s software products.

Essential Job Duties:

Elicit requirements from key stakeholders determining business needs and success factors.
Translate business needs into business requirements, and system design.
Scoping projects setting expectations.
Implement best practices for software requirement writing, following industry standards (User Story).
Ensure business solutions meet strategic goals.
Ensure requirements meet quality standards with business management approvals.
Demonstrates an advanced understanding of technical processes, architecture, environments, problems, and solutions.
Ensure plans are in place for adequate testing, deployment and ensures any issues are communicated and resolved.
Works with the business planning appropriate scheduling, communication and training systems are implemented.
Document decisions and supporting reasons for the actions made at design meetings.
Identify and communicate project risks to the project manager.
Facilitate knowledge transfer by presenting results of analysis and deliverables to project teams.
Maintain functional and user interface standards in the design of user interfaces, including screen layout, access, and navigation.
Ensures all application requirements are documented for HIPAA compliance, SOX compliance and software security vulnerabilities.
Requirements:


Additional Job Duties (include but are not limited to):

Partner with business users to obtain requirements.
Partner with business users to conduct user acceptance testing and ensure business sign-off.
Analyze data in support of business requests.

Demonstrates a strong understanding and knowledge of project management functions and processes.
Lead projects (under the overall leadership of a manager) with responsibility for work direction of less experienced team members.
Collaborate with team members to elicit, analyze, and evaluate information from multiple sources.
Demonstrates expertise in project management techniques, project documentation, and business communication as required by the project.

Expertise in software requirements quality and traceability concepts
Familiarity with Jira, Xray, SQL Server - .NET and Snowflake experience preferred

Job Title: Assistant Vice President - IT System Data Analyst, HYBRID
Job Description:
The IT System Data Analyst is an intermediate-level position responsible for liaising between business users and technologists to exchange information in a concise, logical and understandable way in coordination with the Technology team. It involves working iteratively throughout the data lifecycle, identifying and defining data needs, contributing to data model design and delivery of high value data products for prime intelligence initiative. Works with cross functional teams and business to understand the origin and lineage of data, document the flow, data models and provide valuable insights.

Responsibilities:

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring alignment with business objectives.

Explore and understand existing data flow, document and maintain data processes, including data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) workflows.

Assist in analyzing and documenting business processes, workflows, and use cases to identify pain points and areas for optimization.

Conduct research and data analysis to provide insights that support business decision-making.

Analyze and identify areas to perform data validation, quality checks, and data cleansing to ensure data accuracy and integrity.

Design and create meaningful reports, dashboards, and visualizations to present data insights to stakeholders.

Troubleshoot data-related issues, resolve data discrepancies, and implement preventive measures.

Collaborate with IT teams to ensure the availability, scalability, and security of data systems.

Participate in the design and implementation of data-related projects, including data migrations and system upgrades.

Participate in user acceptance testing (UAT) and provide feedback on system functionality and usability.

Assist in documenting user stories, functional requirements, and system specifications.

Provide end-user support and training on data systems and tools.

Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies in data analysis and data management.

Qualifications:

3-5 years of experience in data analysis, data management, or a related role.

Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts and ETL design principles.

Familiarity with data modeling, data governance, and data quality best practices.

Proficiency in SQL for data querying, manipulation, and analysis.

Strong analytical skills and attention to detail, with the ability to identify data discrepancies and anomalies.

Knowledge of data privacy regulations and best practices.

Excellent communication skills to collaborate with technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) for data analysis and presentation.

Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities.

Quick learner with a proactive attitude toward problem-solving and skill development.

Problem-solving mindset and the ability to troubleshoot technical issues.

Demonstrated ability to work under pressure to meet tight deadlines and approach work methodically with attention to detail

Education:

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, or a related field.

#LI-JB4

Data Protection Analyst

What Information Security and Risk contributes to Cardinal Health

Information Technology oversees the effective development, delivery, and operation of computing and information services. This function anticipates, plans, and delivers Information Technology solutions and strategies that enable operations and drive business value.

Information Security and Risk develops, implements, and enforces security controls to protect the organization's technology assets from intentional or inadvertent modification, disclosure, or destruction. This job family develops system back-up and disaster recovery plans. Information Technology also conducts incident response, threat management, vulnerability scanning, virus management and intrusion detection and completes risk assessments.

Headquartered in Dublin, Ohio, Cardinal Health, Inc. (NYSE: CAH) is a global, integrated healthcare services and products company connecting patients, providers, payers, pharmacists and manufacturers for integrated care coordination and better patient management. Backed by nearly 100 years of experience, with more than 50,000 employees in nearly 60 countries, Cardinal Health ranks among the top 20 on the Fortune 500.

We currently have a full-time job opening for a seasoned Data Protection Analyst. This position can be either at our Dublin center or remote.

Job Overview:

The Data Protection Analyst will report to the Manager of the Data Protection Team at Cardinal Health. The bulk of the role will be focused on performing event remediation and the development of business-facing data protection processes. This analyst will also support the data protection engineers in developing and maintaining technology solutions to protect data and will receive direction on various initiatives from the Manager. The analyst will have direct contact with Data Protection tools including Data Loss Prevention (DLP), Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB), GCP BigQuery, Proof-of-Concept Technologies and ultimately newer technologies to be adopted and operationalized by the team. This data protection analyst will also play a role as the SDM program is developed and continually aligned with the changing technological landscape as well as industry evolutions and trends.

Responsibilities include the following:

Perform analysis and remediation of event/incident traffic within multiple data protection platforms.
Continually look for opportunities to reduce the false positive rates in existing or new data protection controls.
Support the manager of data protection in the development of business support processes as part of relevant projects.
Review policies and the configuration of data protection tools to refine rulesets.
Collaborate with data protection team members and other IT teams to build and deploy security and monitoring controls for databases and develop data at rest processes for O365.
Assist data protection engineers with Google BigQuery reporting and analysis.
Determine current and anticipate future event remediation needs and support the development of security controls in collaboration with the data protection team.
Aid in educating business teams and application leaders on data identification, secure handling, storage, and transfer of sensitive data. This will be a joint effort with other data protection team members.
Assist the manager of data protection in streamlining data at rest remediation.
Support the technical lead and manager in collaboration across Information Security and Data Analytics teams to aid in the development, growth, and evolution of the SDM Program while advocating for Data Protection tools and techniques.


Required Qualifications:

Prior experience with industry DLP, CASB, data encryption and monitoring tools, and data protection best practices.
Demonstrated experience with incident remediation automation and data at rest process development, especially within O365 and GCP environments.
Demonstrated Information Security understanding and specifically industry best practices for the development of data protection processes.
One or more Information Security Certifications preferred: CISSP, CSSLP, CISM, CCSP, GSLC, GSEC, CISA, SSCP.
Bachelor’s Degree in related field or equivalent work experience.
5-7 years of experience in related field

What is expected of you and others at this level?

Contributes to the development of policies and procedures related to data protection.
Supports the development of technical solutions to a wide range of difficult problems. Solutions are innovative and consistent with organizational goals.
Continues to support the development of sensitive data processes to improve Cardinal Health enterprise security posture.
Provides general guidance and best practices with respect to remediation opportunities.
Recommends new practices, processes, metrics, or models.
Acts as a mentor to less experienced colleagues performing event analysis.

Candidates who are back-to-work, people with disabilities, without a college degree, and Veterans are encouraged to apply.

Johnson Brothers is a national family-owned wine, spirits, and beer distributor. Johnson Brothers has been providing, exceptional service to our customers since 1953, representing the world's most famous brands in the beverage industry.
Job Description:
The Business Operations Analyst position plays a critical role in ensuring that the flow of purchase orders, inventory receipts, customer invoices, and supplier invoices are processed in an accurate and efficient manner. This position will provide support to 4 critical departments: Customer Service, Purchasing, Chain teams, and Warehouse/Operations. The analyst will act as a bridge between all cross functional areas, providing coordination and communication between these teams. In this capacity, the analyst is responsible for ensuring that invoicing and receipt of inventory is accurate and timely. They are also responsible for maintaining all required documents with the bonded third-party warehouse as required by corporate accounts payable and the state of Florida’s DBPR.

Daily Job Functions:
Inventory
Processing Gallo Advance Ship Notices for Tampa warehouse and Pass-Thru orders
Building receiving documents for Tampa warehouse team
Receiving inventory into the AS400 for Tampa warehouse
Resolve inventory discrepancies and process inventory adjustments as needed
Furnish inventory reports, allocated item lists, and product return reports to sales

Chain Direct-Ship Customers
Verifying PO’s and receiving into inventory Pass-Thru orders
Ensuring accuracy of pricing on Pass-Thru purchase orders prior to billing
Billing Pass-Thru warehouse invoices to chain customer accounts
Verifying BOL’s after shipment to correct and receiving and invoicing discrepancies

Accounts Payable
Invoice cost analysis and revisions
Submitting prior day inventory receipts to A/P in St. Paul
Final processing of daily Gallo invoices for A/P in St. Paul
Reviewing invoice discrepancies related to FOB and Freight

ALDI/ABC Specific Functions
Assist in order analysis and processing of new purchase orders as they are received daily
Generating ALDI M&W delivery documents for bonded 3PL to ALDI warehouses
Processing inventory receipts to bonded 3PL and generating transfer documents
Bill of Lading processing and generating final transfer documents
Billing invoices for individual purchase orders
Reconciling M&W physical inventory with inventory in Warehouse 2 in AS400
Verifying BOL’s after shipment to correct and receiving and invoicing discrepancies

Additional Functions
Setup of all new suppliers and products
Daily analysis of potential billing issues related to product and gross profit
Providing reporting and analysis as requested by GM, Director of Trade Development, and Director of Operations

Additional Job Description

Competitive benefits package to full-time employees
401K plan
Medical-dental-vision and life insurance
Short and long-term disability
Generous PTO package and paid holidays
