Must have the physical, developmental, and mental ability to perform job tasks, work efforts, responsibilities and duties of the job illustrated below:
MAJOR FUNCTION
Responsible for monitoring contractual requirements and performance guaranties of claims processed by Third Party Administrator (TPA) for off-site County Jail inmate healthcare services. Reconcile TPA invoices and submit invoices for payment through the County’s Accounts Payable system. Prepare claims reports and analysis as needed.
ILLUSTRATIVE DUTIES
Duties include, but are not limited to:

Monitoring and evaluate of Third-Party Administrator (TPA) contract performance against expected; analyzes data to distinguish patterns and recognize trends in contract performance
Serve as point of contact for TPA.
Review, monitor, reconcile, and process TPA invoices.
Develops and performs claims analytical and planning functions to support leadership decision making.
Demonstrates independent thinking and creativity in development of contract models, standard reports, and ad-hoc analyses.
Handle inquiries regarding off-site the County Jail medical healthcare.
Manages and completes ad-hoc projects in a fast-paced environment within timeframes outlined in the division procedures and as specified by Leadership.
Identify needs and makes recommendations of action as indicated to assure adequate and cost-effective access to health care.
Review regulations and communicates their impact, either verbally or in writing, through designated channels of authority.
Assist leadership during budget process.
Assure TPA ongoing compliance with quality and industry regulations.
Performs related duties as required.
KNOWLEDGE, ABILITIES AND SKILLS:
Knowledge of claims medical terminology and billing, including ICD-9/10, HCPCS, CPT, Revenue and Place of Service Codes. Ability to make mathematical computations and tabulations accurately and with reasonable speed. Ability to establish and maintain an effective working relationship with employees, officials and the public. Ability to develop effective work methods and procedures. Ability to understand and follow written and oral instructions. Ability to work independently and adhere to office practices, procedures, and equipment. Skillful writing, reporting, communicating, and record keeping abilities. Ability to research, investigate, detect, verify, recognize, and recommend solutions. Must be able to understand, analyze, and evaluate data in order to provide recommendations to leadership. Ability to troubleshoot and problem solve using critical thinking. Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing. Must be able to utilize computer terminal and software features offered by Microsoft, including, Outlook, Word, and Excel. Ability to maintain confidentiality of sensitive information (medical and legal). Ability to lift, move and/or maneuver equipment. Ability to hear and see at normal levels.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Associate degree from accredited college or university with a concentration in business administration, healthcare administration, or a related field; two (2) years of experience in adjudication of medical claims and understanding of ICD-9/10, CPT, HCPCS II, DRG, and revenue codes.
Must possess a valid driver’s license or be able to secure a valid Florida driver’s license at the time of employment.
A comparable amount of related training and experience may be substituted for the minimum qualifications.
SPECIAL REQUIREMENT:
When circumstances warrant, such as a time of impending or declared disaster (i.e.
hurricanes, tornados, flooding, etc.), the person filling this position will be expected to be
available to participate in the Polk County Emergency Management Plan. The
Emergency Management duties may require the employee to be away from their home
and family for several consecutive days.
This position may be required to report for work when a declaration of emergency
has been declared in Polk County.
SPECIAL PREFERENCES:
Experience in managed care, health plan, health care billing, Medicaid, and/or Medicare
setting. Bilingual, Spanish/English.

Migration Execution Support – ability to coordinate and facilitate runbook execution

Job Description


In the role of Financial Data Analyst for the Shipboard Financial Analytics group, you will be a key contributor to the success of Carnival Cruise Lines by providing technical guidance and analytical support to the organization's shipboard financial and operational teams. You will work with management to develop, track, and analyze recommendations for important strategic initiatives. This role will be responsible for executing the technical analysis, design, development, and implementation of data warehousing and reporting platform solutions for various teams, focusing on PowerBI and Tableau as the systems of end-user data consumption. Other responsibilities may include ensuring the accuracy of the data through data validation and ongoing maintenance of reporting systems and other special projects or processes.

Essential Functions

Collect, clean, and preprocess data from various sources, ensuring data quality and accuracy.
Generate regular and ad-hoc reports for different departments and teams
Create visually compelling charts, graphs, and dashboards to present data-driven insights to stakeholders. Use data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar software.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business objectives and provide data-driven recommendations.
Constantly self-improve, in addition to developing other members of the team and promote an environment of teamwork and high professional standards

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Applied Math, or related field required or a related discipline Required.
Masters in Data Analytics / Data Science preferred.
2+ years of preferred experience in cruise industry or hospitality focusing on operational and / or financial data analytics. Working knowledge of SAS, R or similar statistical software. Working knowledge of Power Automate or similar robotic process automation tools.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Strong problem-solving skills and a keen attention to industry-specific details. Excellent communication and presentation abilities, tailored to cruise industry stakeholders. An understanding of the cruise industry, its unique challenges, and data sources is highly beneficial. Self-starter who can push projects forward and develop analytical frameworks with a general understanding of a problem statement. Ability to drive business results and behaviors through financial data, reporting and analytics.
Strong data visualization skills and experience with tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar software. Understanding of Office 365 capabilities.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to adapt easily to change in dynamic environment

Physical Demands Must be able to remain in a stationary position at a desk and/or computer for extended periods of time. Requires regular movement throughout CCL facilities.

Travel No travel

Work Conditions Work primarily in a climate-controlled environment with minimal safety/health hazard potential.

The range for this role’s base salary is $51,600 - $75,300. Offers to selected candidates will be made on a fair and equitable basis, taking into account specific job-related skills and experience.

At Carnival, your total rewards package is much more than your base salary. All non-sales roles participate in an annual cash bonus program, while sales roles have an incentive plan. Director and above roles may also be eligible to participate in Carnival’s discretionary equity incentive plan. Plus, Carnival provides comprehensive and innovative benefits to meet your needs, including:

Health Benefits:
Cost-effective medical, dental and vision plans
Employee Assistance Program and other mental health resources
Additional programs include company paid term life insurance and disability coverage
Financial Benefits:
401(k) plan that includes a company match
Employee Stock Purchase plan
Paid Time Off
Holidays – All full-time and part-time with benefits employees receive days off for 7 company-wide holidays, plus an additional floating holiday to be taken at the employee’s discretion.
Vacation Time – All full-time employees at the manager and below level start with 14 days/year; director and above level start with 19 days/year. Part-time with benefits employees receive time off based on the number of hours they work, with a minimum of 84 hours/year. All employees gain additional vacation time with further tenure.
Sick Time – All full-time employees receive 80 hours of sick time each year. Part-time with benefits employees receive time off based on the number of hours they work, with a minimum of 60 hours each year.
Other Benefits
Complementary stand-by cruises, employee discounts on confirmed cruises, plus special rates for family and friends
Personal and professional learning and development resources including tuition reimbursement
On-site preschool program and wellness center at our Miami campus

Job Opening Summary

Manages the web-based organ donor information system. Organizes and executes control functions, including input-output validation and quality control, security and maintenance. Designs, develops and conducts special studies pertaining to quality improvement. Collects data and assists with analysis, as appropriate. Is a resource to OPO staff regarding system computer operations and is the project manager for naviGATOR, the internal web-based program. Responsible for compiling, maintaining and dispatching monthly, quarterly and annual required statistical information regarding donors, organs, tissues and transplant recipient information to state, regional and federal agencies. Accountable for participation in the quality assurance (QA) program related to donor record review, participation in internal and external audits and through the facilitation of continuous quality improvement (CQI) activities. Strong interpersonal skills required, as customers include 30 employees at LifeQuest and multiple transplant center personnel around the country. Travel requirements are two to three times per year.

Job Opening Qualifications

Minimum Education and Experience Requirements:

AA or AS degree in information technology or related field or equivalent work experience.
Five+ years of experience and familiarity with application processing environment and relational databases; or equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
Technical experience includes knowledge of computer programming, website programming, Oracle Apex, Microsoft Excel, Access and other current software.
Organizational skills, end user support, analytical abilities and problem-solving skills are required.
Must have strong verbal and written communication skills.
Knowledge of continuous quality improvement (CQI) activities desired.




Motor Vehicle Operator Designation:

Employees in this position will operate vehicles for an assigned business purpose as a "non-frequent driver."

NOTE: A frequent driver is defined as one who uses his/her personal or Shands automobile a) at least once daily, b) at least five individual trips per week or c) drives, on average, over 150 miles per week in the performance of his/her job.

Shift hours: 8 a.m. - 5 p.m., Monday-Friday

POSITION SUMMARY
Responsible for configuration of assigned system modules, verification and mapping of financial, operational, and clinical healthcare data related to medical, prescription, eligibility, claims and other types of data files. Maps raw customer healthcare data into standardized and custom formats and handle research on data issues and respond to data indicating opportunities for changes by providing detailed documentation of requirements for resolution. Serve as a liaison between the business and Data Management teams and provide evaluation, prioritization, and implementation support for new and existing customers.

PRIMARY ACCOUNTABILITIES
1. Responsible for identifying discrepancies and patterns in data from multiple systems.
2. Configures system to business specifications.
3. Reviews daily production and extract jobs for errors.
4. Manages assigned tickets from multiple areas.
5. Adheres to all standardized processes and procedures within the team.
6. Uses SQL and other tools to interpret data and trends to support business activities.
7. Work closely with team members to support successful outcomes.

Qualifications:

Education\: Associates degree in business administration, data analytics, information technology, computer science or related field.
Licensure\: None Required
Certification\: None Required
Work Experience\:
o 1 year experience in a data analysis or related role
o Experience working with data sets

Work Experience in lieu of Education\:
Knowledge/Skills/Abilities\:
o Knowledge of data query language.
o Microsoft Office – Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Licensure\: No additional required
Certification\: No additional required
Work Experience\: Healthcare Payer or Provider experience
Knowledge/Skills/Abilities\:
o Knowledge of SQL

Majority of time involves sitting or standing; occasional walking, bending, stooping
Long periods of computer time or at workstation

Communicating with others to exchange information.
Visual acuity and hand-eye coordination to perform tasks
Workspace may vary from open to confined; on site or remote
May require travel to various facilities within and beyond county perimeter; may require use of personal vehicle

Details on the Role

Founded in 1965, Herc Rentals is one of the leading equipment rental suppliers in North America with trailing twelve month total revenues of nearly $2.7 billion as of September 30, 2022. Herc Rentals’ parent company, known as Herc Holdings Inc., listed on the New York Stock Exchange on July 1, 2016, under the symbol “HRI.” Herc Rentals serves customers through approximately 350 locations and has approximately 6,600 employees in North America.


We serve a diverse group of customers in a wide array of industries. We support professional con-tractors in construction and remediation. Our industrial customers include large industrial plants, reﬁneries and petrochemical operations, automotive and aerospace manufacturers. We support government and infrastructure projects at the municipal, state and federal level. And, we continue to expand our services for customers in commercial and retail, healthcare, hospitality, recreation, and entertainment and special events.

Short Description

As the IT Business Analyst at Herc Rentals, you will be a liaison between our business partners and IT the organization, supporting our technology that enhances our employee experience and drives our overall goal of being an employer of choice. You will assess the changing needs of the business, analyze the impact, support communication between relevant groups, and capture requirements. You will work with the systems administrators and developers to ensure that they understand the specifications and assist in documenting all use cases.
Successful candidates will

Work with business stakeholders and other subject matter experts to assess current capabilities to understand and document business requirements.
Develop and maintain good relationships with key business groups to enable improved decision-making within the business.
Support testing teams in translating requirements and use cases into test conditions and expected results for product, performance, user acceptance, and operational acceptance testing
Actively participate and/or manage Business Acceptance Testing and User Acceptance Testing.
Develop and provide project status updates.
Participate in quality management reviews, reviews of the designs, prototypes, and other requirements work products to ensure they fulfill the requirements
Assist Project Manager with the overall day-to-day management of multiple projects including maintaining accurate project plans, producing meeting minutes, and ensuring that project objectives are achieved within time/cost/quality constraints.
Plan and manage internal and external project communications, make certain of effective exchange of project information, status, issues, risks, and deliverables.

Responsibilities
Support our HR business partners for all HR system solutions.
Support our Infrastructure partners for IT projects.
Analyze user needs, facilitate process improvements, and document complete solutions.
Develop project documentation for systems, projects, and processes.
Coordinate testing of new patches or software releases and assist as required.
Maintain all SOX and Internal Audit Controls to ensure overall compliance.
Maintain familiarity with other IT system/business application capabilities within the Herc portfolio.
Requirements
Professional Experience
Experience working with SaaS solutions
Knowledge around Project Management
Understanding of HR business processes (HR, Benefits, Payroll, Time, etc.) is beneficial
Understanding of ITIL practices and ServiceNow is beneficial
Educational Background

Formal training in Project Management is preferred

Title: IT Financial Business Analyst
Location: TAMPA, FL 33610
Duration: 6 months+

Job Description:

We are seeking an IT Financial Business Analyst to support the Compliance Technology Services (CTS) leadership team.
This role will be responsible for supporting activities with respect to direct financials including reporting, metrics, and analysis of the allocations and overall business office activities.
The resource will also be responsible for ensuring that all regular reporting and ad hoc tasks are delivered in a timely and consistent manner across all areas of the organization.
The benefit of this role to the organization is the oversight of the delivery of business office services ensuring a focus on accuracy, timeliness, consistency, efficiency, and elimination of duplication.

Responsibilities

Provide support leadership to the Sr. Technology Managers on the financial activities related to Software and Fixed Price contract execution.
Assist with the management of all Fixed-priced and Software contract end-to-end activities with Internal teams and Sourcing.
Support forensic analysis and investigation of all FPC and SW financial impacts and proactively address any potential negative impacts
Facilitate payments through the AP workflow and audit invoices on a monthly basis for reporting purposes.
Track all Financial Transfer Requests across groups in GFT for both Fixed-price and Software projects.
Provide information on financial re-forecasting cycles and manage the entries in the financial tools.
Work with Financial Controllers on the monthly accrual process and ensure all finances are reported accurately.
Track cross-sector financials and analyze the monthly trend/forecast across CTS
Analyze financial reports on a monthly basis to find saving opportunities validate the charges and reverse as necessary
Collaborate across GFT on refining systems and global processes. Providing feedback, insight, and guidance on efficiency improvements regarding Fixed Price and software financial processes along with system enhancements to the financial systems (Renault & PTS 2.0).

Title: IT Security Analyst

Location: Tampa, FL

Duration: 6 months

Comp: 45-55


SUMMARY: The IT Security Analyst monitors AUEM’s networks for security breaches and investigates when one occurs. The ideal candidate will use and maintain software, such as firewalls and data encryption, to protect sensitive information while checking for vulnerabilities in computer and network systems.

RESPONSIBILITIES: Those duties are necessary to meet the minimum requirements of the position. Other duties may be assigned.




This position, reporting to the Global IT Director, will assist in the management of the security policy framework and relevant standards and overseeing applicable security and compliance requirements (i.e. CIS, SOC2, ISO27001, NIST) through strategy development, controls definition and assessment and process oversight




Responsibility and maintenance for policies, procedures, and controls to assure compliance with applicable regulatory, legal and audit requirements as well as good business practices.




Lead in the establishment and overseeing of formal IT Security Audit and self-assessments program for various information services, systems, processes, and recognized industry standards




Identify, assess, manage, and track remediation of standards, processes, and procedures relating to the IT infrastructure, applications, platforms, and suppliers and drive explicit requirements and timelines in all environments.




Develop strong relationships with our Application Development team as well as all other departments and key stakeholders to ensure standards and compliance oversight is understood, managed appropriately and current with all standards, guidelines, and regulations that are applicable




Drive in the development of security compliance strategy and approach and ensure compliance with NIST, SOC2, ISO27001, Critical Infrastructure, contractual requirements and globally recognized standards and guidelines




Identify regulatory, legislative, and industry specific compliance requirements and define controls that can be used to meet those requirements




Assist Universal Contract, Marketing and Account Management department teammates with both current and pre-sales customer questionnaires and security assessments




Attend training seminars, conferences, and trade shows to broaden knowledge of current and future cybersecurity and risk management issues and technologies




This will be a management position with no direct reports.

QUALIFICATIONS: To perform this job successfully, the individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or experience required in order to be hired. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Proven track record of developing and maintaining Corporate IT Security policies and procedures.


Formal Education, Licenses, and Certifications Required:


Bachelor’s degree in IT, Management, or Leadership related fields


Type and Length of Specific Experience Required:

Two (2) plus years of Cyber Security work

Five (3) plus years of IT Compliance or Security Risk Assessments/Audits experience

Relevant Certifications: Security+, CRISC, CISA, or CISSP (not required but a huge plus)

Strong knowledge of industry frameworks, such as CIS, ISO and NIST

Prior experience in the electronic monitoring industry preferred but not required


PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS AND ENVIRONMENT:

Office environment with minimal to no exposure to extreme temperatures expected

Major activities include working on PC while sitting, telephone use

Physical effort is limited, to include some standing, bending, light lifting, and limited stretching and reaching

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions

This is a hybrid role with the expectation of 2-3 days on-site/in-person collaboration with teammates and stakeholders. May require up to 10% travel.

Why USAA? Let’s do something that really matters.

At USAA, we have an important mission: facilitating the financial security of millions of U.S. military members and their families. The Opportunity

The Business Strategy Analyst – Deposit Offers is an individual contributor role accountable for insights, analysis, and tactics to plan and measure deposit promotional offer campaigns.
The role will set Deposits’ promotional offer learning agenda, develop recommendations for offer improvements, build business cases and influence the bank planning process to secure investments in Deposit offers. Also be accountable for setting and all leading offer related key performance indicators and key risk indicators to include designing and implementing automated monitoring to ensure compliant execution of offer campaigns (e.g., offer fulfillment dashboards to validate offers operating in line with terms and conditions). Partner closely with multiple partners to include Marketing, Bank Growth Engine, Finance, Product Strategy, and Information Technology. Successful candidates will have significant experience analyzing bank product offer campaigns and building robust financial models, while also having strong technical skills necessary to access, manipulate, and analyze data from disparate data sources.

Uses quantitative and qualitative analysis to provide thought-leadership on evolving industry trends, market developments, USAA’s strategic direction, regulatory environment, and macroeconomic trends for the business unit. Provides insights and information-based context for key stakeholders in the business unit to effectively manage, influence, and impact line of business strategy.

We offer a flexible work environment that requires an individual to be in the office 4 days per week. This position can be based in one of the following locations: San Antonio, TX, Plano, TX, Phoenix, AZ, Colorado Springs, CO, Charlotte, NC, Chesapeake, VA or Tampa, FL. Relocation assistance is not available for this position.

What you'll do:
Leads discussions with key collaborators to communicate information learned from analyses, provide input into line of business strategy development, and drive and influence business decisions.
Leads integration of the analytic strategy and business strategy.
Leads and oversees efforts to identify key business assumptions and hypotheses around line of business strategy. Continuously refines hypotheses and identifies business questions to explore further.
Develops the analytical framework and blueprint to answer business questions identified in the business portfolio, product, or member experience.
Collaborates with key stakeholders to evaluate and uncover strategic insights related to Profit & Loss performance including Product Strategy, Pricing, Marketing, Sales, Credit Risk, Distribution Channels, and Member Experience.
Applies expert analytical rigor to define outcome measures, improve prioritization, increase agility in decisioning, improve ability to evaluate progress towards business outcomes, and to evaluate risks to strategic goals.
Effectively influences and drives strategic agreement using subject matter expertise and interpersonal and negotiation skills.
Serves as a team lead and provides guidance and on-the-job training to team members.
Ensures risks associated with business activities are effectively identified, measured, monitored, and controlled in accordance with risk and compliance policies and procedures.

What you have:
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Science, Finance, Economics or related discipline; OR 4+ years of related experience (in addition to the minimum years of experience required) may be substituted in lieu of degree.
8+ years of data & analytics or strategy consulting experience; OR a minimum of 6+ years of data & analytics or strategy consulting experience and up to 2+ years of progressive functional business relevant experience within the respective industry of responsibility (i.e. P&C, Bank, Finance, Marketing etc.) for a total of 8+ years of combined experience; OR Advanced Degree in Business, Science, Finance, Economics or related discipline and 6+ years of experience in data/analytics, strategy consulting or functional business experience within the respective industry of responsibility (i.e. P&C, Bank, Finance, Marketing, etc.).
Experience identifying business needs and leading strategic plans driven by qualitative/quantitative analysis and market insights.
Strong analytical skills with experience using hypotheses-driven problem solving.
Extensive experience leading and performing complex data analysis using various data analytics tools (i.e. Microsoft Excel, Tableau, R, Python).
Experience influencing business decisions.
Experience working with leadership teams to identify key opportunities to develop and enhance business strategy using quantitative and qualitative analytics.

What sets you apart:
5+ years of deposit, credit card or payments product management experience
Significant experience analyzing deposits data, prospect databases, and transactional insights
Demonstrated experience conducting offer based performance analyses with deposit, credit card, or payments products
Strong verbal and written communication skills, especially PowerPoint
US military experience through military service or a military spouse/domestic partner

The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job.

The Technology Transfer Office (TTO), under USF Research & Innovation, USF System, is responsible for the identification, evaluation, development, protection, and utilization of intellectual property rights that result from USF System research activities and from the activities of USF System researchers in affiliated hospitals and other off-site facilities. TTO has 18 full-time employees and 8-10 graduate student interns and undergraduate student assistants. Clients are mainly USF faculty, staff and student researchers and innovators, but also include venture and technology companies desiring to license USF inventions and technologies. The annual budget is approximately $5 million.

POSITION SUMMARY:


The Fiscal & Business Analyst I serve as a liaison among departments stakeholders in order to gain understanding of the structures, policies, and operations of an organization and recommends solutions to enable the organization to achieve its goals.The position works with department administration to define, validate and implement the optimal solutions for the Technology Transfer Office needs. The position performs professional accounting activities for specialized, complex and/or functional areas requiring the expert knowledge and professional application of accounting principles, practices, and techniques in accordance with industry standards, current laws, and university policies.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Plans, directs, organizes, and schedules activities of one or more specialized accounting functions for the Technology Transfer Office Accounts. Analyzes, develops and documents accounting and cost procedures and controls related to assigned tasks. Researches and evaluates pertinent professional and related legal literature to establish and/or recommend changes to accounting procedures and operations.

Provides operating cost visibility, direction and consultation to university officials relative to fiscal planning, control, and expending of university assets. Prepares and/or directs the preparation of special statistical reports, detailed cost accounting information, surveys or analyses of complex and difficult nature for management. Provides internal/external training both orally and in writing on accounting systems, procedures, and practices.

Interprets various accounting data, analyzes reports and recommends and/or initiates actions to be taken. Ensures all financial records, and statements are in line with laws, regulations, and generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP). These records and statements may include the balance sheet, the profit and loss statement, the cash flow statement, and tax returns.

Working with the Minuet database software to process royalty distribution according to University policy 0-300. Generate various invoices complying with license deals performed by the Technology Transfer Office. Advise users on the functionality and capabilities of specific applications. Advise department leadership in acquisition of new software. Aid in the formation and accounting practices for all IP related revenue and expenditures.

Performs other duties as assigned

POSITION QUALIFICATIONS:

MINIMUM:

This position requires a Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business Administration or other field directly related to the position's specific responsibilities and two years of fiscal related work experience; or a Bachelor's degree in no specific required field and three years of fiscal related work experience; or six years fiscal related work experience.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor's degree and four years of fiscal related work experience: knowledge regarding technology commercialization business practice. Expertise in Microsoft suite platform (Excel, Access, Power BI).

The Opportunity:
The Department of Philanthropy and Alumni Data Services is currently recruiting for a Business Analyst to work with department leadership and staff to develop technology-driven solutions for Philanthropy and Alumni Engagement (PAE) that focus on two key themes: business process improvements and enabling the division’s staff success by providing seamless access to information and tools required for that success. The Business Analyst will lead the PAE division through process improvements and system changes, always reviewing to ensure we are leveraging best practices in data management and access. This position will understand the core business processes of the department and work with Information Technology (IT) to ensure the technology solutions enable efficient and effective use of the tools. The Business Analyst integrates business knowledge of the University with technical knowledge of the systems. This position is highly analytical by nature and can identify and implement efficiencies within the various process and systems used in PAE.

The Business Analyst will also provide ad hoc reporting for the division, which includes creating, updating queries and communication lists. They will be expected to gather the data requirements and understand how the data will be used to ensure we are providing all the data required to enable a process or decision. Works in conjunction with the Sr. Business Analyst and the AVP to support technology and reporting needs of the entire office and those of external constituents, as well as analyzing and improving processes across work areas.

The Business Analyst plays a crucial role as the department’s liaison to the University Information Technology, providing vital support for advancement systems and support the implementation of UC Innovation’s Ascend product (Salesforce CRM platform). In this capacity, the Business Analyst actively contributes to the development, configuration, testing, and implementation of new initiatives and system enhancements. This involves the gathering of requirements and close collaboration with the IT team to deliver innovative solutions. The role encompasses a range of responsibilities, including researching and applying best practices for philanthropic organizations, in-depth analysis of constituent data (including Alumni, Donors, and Prospects), evaluating CRM system data, and providing support for 3rd party philanthropic tools integrated within Salesforce such as iWave and Double the Donation. Additionally, the Business Analyst examines constituent history, creates reports utilizing Salesforce Report Builder for key stakeholders, modifies Salesforce List views for improved data accessibility, and designs tailored Salesforce dashboards to meet the specific needs of various business departments, and automation of Salesforce Documents using 3rd party generation tools. The Business Analyst plays a pivotal role in making recommendations regarding relationship strategies and constituent data based on industry best practices. The ideal candidate is characterized by their proactive, energetic, and tenacious approach, coupled with an attention to detail. They possess the ability to work collaboratively with University staff, furthering the University’s mission to fund-raise and friend-raise from its constituencies.
Qualifications
Bachelors degree in statistics, business, data analytics or a related field.
At least one year of experience working with CRM technology and data.
Experience using various data analytics and reporting tools including Salesforce Reports & Dashboards and Microsoft Excel. Create reports based on the findings, and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to identify successful initiatives.
Basic troubleshooting and root cause analysis skills
Ability to read and interpret data, draw conclusions from the data, and propose strategies or recommendations based on those conclusions
Ability to effectively communicate and influence key stakeholders to support proposed strategies, process improvements and operational decisions
Ability to effectively document solutions to support departmental continuity and sustainability
A broad understanding of fundraising and alumni engagement processes and data, preferably in higher education • Experience as a data analyst or business analyst.
Knowledge of, and proficiency in, Salesforce CRM based business systems and technology applications.
Familiarity with Ellucian Advance or similar fundraising applications/constituent relationship management systems.

Description

Job Summary

The NCPS Access Improvement Analyst is responsible for analyzing scheduling processes, resource allocation, referral coordination and patient flow to optimize access to care at NCPS. The analyst will support through creating reports/updating dashboards, creating policies, and implement process improvement initiatives. The analyst will collaborate amongst project teams, NCPS team, Scheduling, Contracts, Finance, IT, Revenue Cycle, Procurement, and operations process owners.

Job Specific Duties

Supports in planning and implementation of projects to include program design, creating, and executing project plans. Supports stakeholders in multiple and simultaneous projects through all phases of implementation including tracking timelines and deliverables.

Identifies access process improvement opportunities and proposes/implements data-driven solutions to optimize service locations, fill rates, volumes, and available appointment times by specialty.

Runs reports and analyzes data to ensure projects are within scope, on budget, and assigned to the appropriate team(s).

Creates ad hoc reports via Excel and/or PowerBI dashboards.

Interprets data and reports to develop conclusions and recommendations.

Assesses clinician schedules for opportunities to improve slot fill rates, availability, and no-show rates.

Responsible for managing access and scheduling initiatives through the life cycle including planning, tracking, analysis, and reporting.

Works closely with leaders and staff to define opportunities, plan improvements, and track towards future performance.

Assists in the preparation of performance reports, risk assessments, executive briefings, and required progress status reports and deliverables.

Provides financial and performance status information to the project team.

Assesses appointment scheduling process and workflow for continual improvement at both the practice and medical group level.

Ensures project reporting reliability and sustainability, through data analytics and internal reporting sources.

Coordinates the development of best management practices and disseminates lessons learned to appropriate staff.

Monitors and evaluates the efficiency and effectiveness of service delivery methods and procedures.

Supports the team with Practice Plan informatics and overall reporting needs.
Qualifications

Minimum Job Requirements

Bachelor's Degree in Healthcare, Business, Accounting, Engineering, Information Technology, or related field

1-3 years of experience in the healthcare environment, preferably in patient financial services, project management, and/or medical group practice

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

Master’s degree preferred.

Ability to plan time effectively, balance multiple tasks, work within stringent timeframes, and drive projects to completion.

Conflict resolution skills and team approach to resolve challenges to advance project.

Able to handle multiple assignments, set priorities, and meet deadlines.

Ability to effectively plan/organize large and complex projects.

Understanding of cost, schedule development, and controls.

Ability to analyze project control requirements and develop tools and processes to enhance overall effectiveness.

Solid analytical ability with excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Ability to prepare written and verbal reports to project team and management regarding program performance.

Hands-on experience with earned value methodology and monitoring including calculation and analysis.

Able to communicate at all levels to convey project information.

Able to deliver engaging, informative, and well-organized presentations.

Able to work in a team environment.

Ability to maintain confidentiality of sensitive information.

Broad knowledge regarding practice operations, revenue cycle/insurance requirements, and best practice implementation.

Able to analyze clinician schedules and identify process improvement opportunities.

Demonstrates experience in process improvement, patient flow, and throughput.

Computer Savvy with advanced proficiency in Microsoft office tools, including Excel (pivot tables and advanced formulas), Teams, Visio, and PowerPoint. Ability to learn appropriate software application(s).

The Payroll & Business Analyst will lead the payroll process for Mowi USA business unit. Will be responsible for processing payroll, providing technical aid and supporting process improvement for Human Resources. The Payroll & Business Analyst will establish the developing of automated payroll processes: increasing payroll functionality, preparing monthly reports and managing payroll functions. Will also be in charge of preparing monthly payroll accrual, assisting with general accounting tasks and the monthly close process. The Payroll & Business Analyst will develop a robust understanding of all business unit regulatory standards, in order to ensure governance and compliance.

Responsibilities

Ensure payroll is processed timely and accurately.
Enter weekly payroll changes (not processed through self-service and HR processes). Audit the payroll register to ensure changes were captured and payroll is accurate.
Develop strong relationships with HR, through partnering with the team and assisting in process improvement related to HR functions and payroll systems. Provide excellent customer service to Mowi employees.
Support HR in the development of resources within Workforce Now, including: recruitment, employee goals and appraisals, reporting and analytical resources.
Provide support in the development of electronic employee files, including: assistance with self-audits and recommendations for improvements.
Support continued development of Workforce Now to provide improved self-service experience and increase self-service use.
Lead annual benefit and compliance reporting and audit processes, including: 401k audit, workers compensation audit, Self-Insured Medical Plan audit, 1095 review, EEO1 filing, etc.
Process weekly 401k contribution upload and reconcile payroll and 401k data.
Manage all garnishments, deductions, and Paid Time Off (PTO) balances in ADP Workforce Now.
Manage ACA compliance within Workforce Now.
Maintain knowledge of trends, best practices, regulatory changes, and new technologies in payroll.
Assist with the maintenance of fixed assets including processing additions, dispositions and running monthly depreciation.
Reconcile bank accounts including checking,

Qualifications and Skills

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Outstanding interpersonal, negotiation, and conflict resolution skills.
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to prioritize tasks and to delegate them when appropriate.
Ability to act with integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality.
Experience using ADP Workforce Now preferred.
Must possess thorough knowledge of employment-related laws and regulations.
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite.
Ability to develop strong trusting relationships, in order to gain support and achieve results, within a diverse group of employees, ranging from a field environment to a corporate setting.
Flexibility and ability to interact with employees at all levels.

Education:

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Business Administration or related field preferred.
Minimum 5 years’ of experience in a corporate environment preferred.
Minimum 5 years’ of experience in Payroll preferred.

The Sanford Airport Authority is seeking a detail-oriented Procurement Analyst to join our team. This position willwork closely with the Procurement Manager who is responsible for managing and overseeing the procurement processes for the airport authority, including developing solicitations, evaluating proposals, and awarding and administering contracts. The ideal candidate will have experience in procurement, contract management, and administration. We are looking for someone who has excellent analytical, organizational, communication, and problem-solving skills. If you have a background in procurement and are interested in using your skills to support a fast-paced, growing organization, we encourage you to apply for this opportunity with the Sanford Airport Authority today!

Responsibilities:

Research and compile required information to prepare and facilitate requests for quotes and competitive solicitations.
Assist with preparation of contracts, amendments, and agenda memorandums.
Maintain established records management system for all competitive solicitations.
Manage contracts database and provide reports as assigned.
Assist in the solicitation process which includes pre and post award functions including proposal evaluations, bid openings, and pre-proposal conferences.
Assist with post award contracts and documents including bond and insurance certificates.
Process purchase requisitions and purchase orders for the Agency.
Manage and train existing and new suppliers.
Observe and ensure compliance with applicable policies, laws, rules, and regulations in procurement and assigned responsibilities.
Research and provide aggregate expenditure reports as assigned.
Coordinate and resolve performance and billing issues between suppliers, internal customers, and supporting departments.
Track key performance indicators and provide data analytics for department.
Train internal customers and supporting departments with procurement policies and procedures.
Handle confidential materials related to the competitive solicitation process in accordance with all applicable policies, laws, rules, and regulations.
Attend and participate in various vendor outreach events including professional conventions, and seminars.
Perform other duties as assigned.

Knowledge, Skills, Abilities:

Knowledge of basic Purchasing/Contract standards and Florida Statutes concerning local government purchasing laws and best practices or a willingness to learn.
Knowledge of the principles and practices of project management.
Knowledge of technology and computer applications related to specific job functions.
Skill in reading, interpreting, and applying information in technical manuals and other documents.
Desire to learn about airport operations, compliance, as well as state and federal grant requirements.
Effective skills in oral and written communications.
Ability to work with a variety of personnel and the public.
Ability to be flexible, handle a variety of tasks, and manage multiple tasks.
Ability to collect, organize and analyze data and make logical decisions.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Contract Administration, or Supply Chain Management, along with a minimum of two (2) years of procurement experience, preferably in Government procurement. Alternatively, an Associate's degree with a minimum of four (4) years of procurement experience, preferably in Government procurement, or a High School Diploma or equivalent, including a Florida Special Diploma, with a minimum of five (5) years of procurement experience, preferably in Government procurement. Candidates with an equivalent combination of experience, training, and education will also be considered.
NIGP Certified Professional Public Buyer (CPPB) or NIGP Certified Procurement Professional (CPP) certification is required at the time of hire or must be obtained within three (3) years of hire.

Job Summary
Responsible to perform in-depth evaluation and research related to potentially fraudulent activity against BCBSF. This role will provide support & development of integral investigative information related to moderate to complex cases or matters review within BEIC and/or SIU. These investigative duties may involve high-dollar impact cases, sensitive issues, or matters which otherwise meet criteria for key initiatives or areas focus for the Unit and this role may be relied upon as a resource by other team members as needed.

Note: This role is eligible to work in a hybrid format to support the needs of the business. Preferably, the candidate selected for this role will live within a commutable range of Jacksonville, FL. Leadership for this position are open to discussing candidates’ individuals need.

What You Will Be Doing:

Complete in-depth research and investigative steps in support of ongoing moderate to complex investigations in order to combat fraud, waste and abuse, including, but not limited to things such as reviewing key contract information, enrollment, and other systems and resources.
Work responsibilities include analysis of IT reports, data analysis and proactive research work. Offers investigative administrative support as needed for certain functions (may require claims research, analysis and compilation) in support of case/complaint disposition or referral.
May be requested to complete phone calls or initiate correspondence with members, providers, or other stakeholders.
Utilizes key internal and external systems, databases and internet resources in research and investigative support activities. Responsible to document findings and analyze data and synthesize elements of investigative research into key reports and documented findings in order provide relevant summary of information discovered.
Role requires strong collaborative partnerships inter and intra-departmentally in order to effectively engage other business units and stakeholders to ensure appropriate investigative outcomes.
Maintains confidentiality of all sensitive information and secures PHI/PII as required by law and regulations.
May assist with investigative data requests, or support data collection for requests for information and subpoenas received from government partners as requested.
Participates in team projects as needed and provides education and training to team members.
Seeks and completes opportunities for personal and professional growth and development.
Demonstrates strong initiative and demonstrated results-driven leadership qualities, including problem-solving techniques.
The essential functions listed represent the major duties of this role, additional duties may be assigned.

What You Must Have:
3+ years related work experience to include demonstrated work experience in fraud research, investigation and utilizing data analytics.
Related Bachelor’s degree or additional related equivalent work experience

Strong working knowledge using Microsoft: Excel (Advanced skills needed), Word & PowerPoint

Technical skills to include intermediate SQL querying skills
Working knowledge of investigative research steps and processes

Strong oral and written communication skills and an ability to communicate effectively with all levels of the organization

Demonstrated ability to handle multiple and conflicting priorities Proficient working knowledge of data analysis.

Ability to work with minimal supervision

What We Would Prefer Have:

Bachelor’s degree

Strong preference for prior experience in FWA (Fraud, Waste, and Abuse) in health care
Designated CFE, AHFI, coder or other recognized certification in a related field

Intermediate knowledge of claims, enrollment systems, processes, and areas

Strong user-oriented technical knowledge of systems.

Demonstrated skills effectively interfacing with other key business areas, within a matrixed environment to meet targeted outcomes and deliverables.

Working knowledge of BCBSF organization and operations

General Physical Demands
Sedentary work: Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally to move objects. Jobs are sedentary if traversing activities are required only occasionally.

Physical/Environmental Activities
Must be able to travel to multiple locations for work (i.e., travel to attend meetings, events, conferences). Frequently.

Other data-related tasks as requested by the principal investigator

The HRIS Analyst will manage our Human Capital Management (HCM) system (Oracle Cloud) and lead the documentation process of all HR functions. HR lead for troubleshooting the HCM system issues, upgrades, and enhancements.

Regularly audit and clean HR data to ensure accuracy and completeness.
Develop and enforce data entry protocols to maintain data integrity.
Manage all HR security access levels for users.

Documentation:

Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for all HR processes, including but not limited to recruitment, onboarding, performance management, case management, offboarding, benefits, and compensation.

Training and Support:

Offer ongoing support to resolve system-related issues and address user queries.

Reporting:

Analyze data trends to provide insights for strategic decision-making.

Compliance:

Ensure HCM and documentation practices align with legal requirements.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent attention to detail and organizational abilities.

Proficient in HRIS/HCM software and Microsoft Office Suite.

Master’s degree in human resources, Information Systems, or a related field.
Oracle Cloud HCM experience

The Citi Security and Investigative Services (CSIS) Global Intelligence and Analysis (GIA) Data Analytics Lead Analyst will be responsible for conducting strategic business analysis and optimization of structured and unstructured data available within the CSIS program at Citi. The lead analyst will work with stakeholders across the globe and execute complex statistical / business analyses in support of CSIS functional areas. The analyst will prepare data visualizations, and or build forecast simulation models, develop algorithms to discover and classify activity or behavioral patterns that help in business decision making, and present executive summary findings to business audiences. The focus area for this role is translating complex data into meaningful and digestible insights for a broad and diverse audience of clients and decision makers across the organization up to and including the Chief Security Officer.

Strong background in a quantitative or business discipline such as business administration, management information systems, computer science, statistics or related field is required for this role. Preferred skills include programming experience for data visualization (Cognos, Power BI, Tableau), data analysis, data processing, and statistical tools such as SQL, SAS, or Python.

Business Overview:

CITI Security and Investigative Services (CSIS) is a full-service security and investigative team that protects the assets, integrity, and reputation of Citi and its clients. We accomplish this by offering in-house professional security services and independent investigations to clients across all of Citi's businesses and regions, and partnerships with other Citi business groups, law enforcement agencies, governments and industry counterparts.

Global Intelligence and Analysis (GIA) is a strategic analytic unit within CSIS that provides business analytics, threat intelligence, and open-source intelligence products to Citi executives, CSIS leadership, and clients. We operate an all-source analytical unit to understand emerging threats in the banking/financial industry, risk trends for the company, and opportunities to improve or adapt business practices. GIA is globally dispersed with analysts in the US, Mexico, Singapore, India, and Hungary that utilizes a follow the sun model to meet our clients’ needs.

We are a quickly evolving organization charged with solving some of the most challenging intelligence and analytical questions posed to Citi. The work we do will engage your whole brain (as well as a fair amount of your time) and our most impactful achievements have one crucial feature in common: Colleagues who embrace our three Citi Leadership Principles:

We Take Ownership – We challenge one another to a higher standard in everything we do. #ProblemSolvers, #ThinkingOutsideTheBox
We Deliver with Pride – We strive for client excellence, controls excellence and operational excellence. #MakingAnImpact, #LifeLongLearners
We Succeed Together – We value and learn from different perspectives to surpass stakeholder expectations. #Respect, #DreamTeam

A little about this role:

Based in Tampa, the CSIS Data Analytics Lead Analyst will report to the Business Analytics Lead Program Manager. The Lead Analyst will be responsible for conducting strategic business analysis and optimization of structured and unstructured data available within the CSIS programs at Citi. The lead analyst will work with stakeholders across multiple regions and execute complex statistical / business analyses in support of CSIS functional areas. The analyst will prepare data visualizations, and or build forecast simulation models, develop algorithms to discover and classify activity or behavioral patterns that help in business decision making, and present executive summary findings to business audiences. The focus area for this role is translating complex data into meaningful and digestible insights for a broad and diverse audience of clients and decision makers across the organization up to and including the Chief Security Officer.

Key Responsibilities:

Develop, analyze and report key performance indicators (KPIs) and key risk indicators (KRIs) for the existing business model. Ensure these KPIs and KRIs are aligned to the business model and modified in lines with changing business objectives
Conduct data-driven analyses and prepare reports; apply quantitative data analysis methods; prepare statistical and non-statistical data exploration in relation to transactional data as well as internal business indicators
Apply measurement practices to organize, analyze, and interpret data related to provide actionable information to decision makers.
Detect data anomalies and identify source of data problems. Recommend data quality solutions and outlier detection, and extreme value normalization techniques to overcome
Use advanced visualization techniques to display data and the results of analysis in clear presentations and dashboards that can be understood by non-technical readers
Design statistically valid samples, design and conduct statistical experiments. Perform statistical inference and draw conclusions from sample data
Display critical thinking in the creation of succinct narrative reports, presentations, visual mapping and link charts or similar diagrams to report analytical assessments. Display data and the results of analysis in clear straightforward business report that can be understood by non-technical readers. Provide written explanations of approach and analysis in plain language that supports the conclusions and observations
Change Management Advocate - Innovate and generate new ideas, concepts, and models to improve methods of obtaining and evaluating quantitative and qualitative data. Identify relationships and trends in data across the firm, as well as any factors that could affect the research results. Question and validate assumptions and status quo. Escalate identified risks and sensitive areas in terms of methodology and processes

Qualifications/Experience:

Master’s degree in business administration (MBA)/ computer science/ mathematics/ statistics/ quantitative methods (degree in economics/banking may be considered if strong analytical skills proved)
5+ years of experience in data mining methods and their application in business practice (PhD degree may be considered for the fulfilment of work experience requirements)
5+ years of experience with relational databases such as Oracle, SQL Server, and Data Marts/Data Warehouses
Programming and statistical/data analytical skills (VBA, R, Python)
Experience in providing the results of analyses in clear written form and presenting the findings to the audience
Demonstrated ability to collect, organize, analyze, evaluate, and interpret complex data with a strong understanding and application of analytical techniques, including estimating, forecasting, and/or predictive modeling experience
Advanced expertise in Microsoft Office products - Word, Excel, Access, Outlook, PowerPoint – demonstrated creativity in use of these products to solve analytical problems
Experience in strategy and implementation of new technology and software tools for analytical improvements and information management
Established project management skills, such as Agile or Scrum. Ability to coordinate several projects simultaneously and execute daily duties with minimal supervision
Excellent communication, negotiation and presentation skills. Ability to effectively communicate, both verbally and in writing, through all levels of the organization
Demonstrated self-starter and resourceful individual with the ability and maturity to make decisions in the absence of detailed instructions and with experience of operating in fast paced and dynamic operational settings

Overview:
Welcome Home! Build your career with Lennar:

As one of the nation’s largest builders, Lennar has built over one million new homes for families across America. Since 1954, our communities have catered to all lifestyles and family dynamics, whether you are a first-time or move-up buyer, multigenerational family, or active adult.
At Lennar, Everything’s Included in our homes, and Everyone’s Included on our team. Our Everyone’s Included vision is to be as inclusive and diverse as the communities we build unleashing the power of diversity within our workforce to drive innovation & sustainable growth.

Lennar's Core Values:

Our commitment to Quality, Value, and Integrity is the underlying foundation upon which Lennar was built, and these three fundamental principles still guide us in caring for our customers, associates, trade partners, shareholders, and community.

Your Purpose:

The Business Analyst for the corporate Business Analytics team, works with the BI Engagement Lead and other key stakeholders to design and implement strategic solutions that drive key operational metrics focused on improving financial results. The Business Analyst feels very comfortable analyzing various relevant data points to arrive at, and concisely communicate, fact-based recommendations that impact revenue and various other Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for the division.

Responsibilities:

Principal Duties and Responsibilities:




Actively seeks out new areas of potential improvement and drilling into the details to find the root cause of problems.
Question results and assumptions, and an internal drive for continuous improvement.
Provide an objective point of view to complex business issues based on a deep understanding of data and analytics as well as business principals.
Regularly analyze historical market trends including home sales and price, key commodity, and material prices, as well as overall market supply and demand dynamics.
Collaborate with relevant lines of business to develop a deep understanding of the process, strategies, and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) impacting things like sales price, pace, cycle time…etc.
Interpret insights from existing dashboards and reports, and as needed, augment with analysis from separate data sources or research.
Translate data and insights into actionable and relevant recommendations by utilizing visualization and/or data analysis tools, presentations, and other means to effectively communicate clear and concise conclusions.
Owns of the data and work to ensure that data is as complete and accurate. This requires working with Division functional leaders to understand business processes behind the data and with corporate analytics and IT teams to understand how the data is sourced, processed, and stored.
Oversee day-to-day implementation and analysis of the different initiatives.
Performs related duties as assigned.
Qualifications:


Education and Experience Requirements:




Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Finance, Accounting, Statistics or other related business or quantitative field.
1-3 years as a Business Analyst, Pricing Analyst, Supply Chain Analyst, or comparable analytical role.
Demonstrated skills and experience developing and performing quantitative analysis which may include financial and/or statistical modeling.
Experience presenting to and communicating with Executives including delivering concise conclusions based on fact-based analysis.
Homebuilding experience preferred.
High proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Microsoft PowerPoint and other Microsoft Office products.
Experience with business software helpful (Salesforce, JDE, Business Intelligence


Additional Requirements:




Analytical – Strong quantitative and analytical foundation with the ability to translate data into actionable and relevant insights and answers to questions such as:
How do results impact business processes?
What kind of actions and decisions can be made differently when supported by data?
Communication – Strong oral, written, listening and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to effectively communicate in business terms using simple, concise, and relatable examples.
Collaboration – Ability to successfully engage and establish cooperative working relationships with Associates at various lines of business.
Flexibility – Display a nimble mind that can adapt thinking based on new points of view and/or changes in operating environments - an inability to be flexible can result in missed revenue opportunities
Multi-tasking – Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously delegate work and provide leadership across functions.
Planning/Organizing – Prioritizes and plans work activities; Uses time efficiently; Sets goals and objectives; Organizes or schedules other people and their tasks; Develops realistic action plans.
Problem Solving – Thinks critically to identify and resolve problems in a timely manner; Gathers and analyzes information skillfully; Develops alternative solutions; Works well in group problem solving situations; Uses reason even when dealing with emotional topics.
Quality – Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness; Looks for ways to improve and promote quality; Applies feedback to improve performance; Monitors own work to ensure quality.
Process Improvement: Identify inefficiencies in existing processes and propose improvements to streamline operations and reduce costs. Work with cross-functional teams to implement process changes.
Market Research: Analyze demographic and economic data to identify target markets and customer segments. Conduct market research to assess current market conditions, competitor activities, and potential opportunities.
Technical Skills – Expert Microsoft Office Suite skills (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, etc.). Experience with SQL, DAX as well as PowerBI, Tableau or another business intelligence platform a plus in addition to ability and willingness to quickly learn technologies.
Physical Requirements:


This is primarily a sedentary office position which requires the incumbent to have the ability to operate computer equipment, speak, hear, bend, stoop, reach, lift, and move and carry up to 25 lbs. Finger dexterity is necessary.

Job Description
Performs professional, technical, and administrative work with responsibility for planning, installing, maintaining, and updating the City's major software applications, data services, and communications systems and networks. Monitors application software performance regarding availability, security, and response time. Provides user training on designated software and/or coordinates vendor-provided training. Work includes application deployment onsite and "in the cloud," along with troubleshooting and resolving complex problems related to application software. Work is performed in concert with multiple application user groups under the general direction of the IT Supervisor with considerable latitude for individual initiative and judgment.
Essential Functions
100.00% - The list of essential functions, as outlined herein, is representative of the tasks performed within this classification. It is not necessarily descriptive of any one position in the class. The omission of an essential function does not preclude management from assigning duties not listed herein if such duties are a logical assignment to the position.

Through interviews of application users and self-research, document existing work processes and software functions.
Facilitate identification of desired additional functionality by the application user group, along with any needed changes in the work process the application supports.
Develop software application specifications documents that combine the existing and desired functional characteristics specified by the user group. Such documents should typically include a flowchart demonstrating the basic work process(es) to be supported.
Research the acquisition of commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) products conforming to the established written specifications. Performing this task may require the IT Business Analyst to contact users in other jurisdictions to identify candidate products/vendors.
Assist the user group in selecting suitable COTS software applications that conform to the established specifications. Such assistance includes identifying candidate vendors and applications, scheduling software demonstrations, establishing a scope of work suitable for prospective vendor(s) to provide price proposals, and drafting agenda reports and other documents needed to acquire the selected product.
Work with Purchasing Unit staff and senior staff in Support Services and/or other city departments to develop the required RFP package, as necessary.
Install, configure, and test single- and multi-user computer systems, including additions, enhancements, and upgrades to existing software as part of the deployment process.
Support the internal users of key applications after deployment.
Assist in evaluating maintenance agreements and services appropriate to maintain availability and function of city software-based solutions according to established service-level agreements.
Work with the IT Supervisor to document and maintain written guidance describing how to backup data resident on multi-user computer systems and servers.
Design and produce technical training programs for software used by the City.
Perform related duties, as directed, when such duties are a logical and appropriate assignment to the position.
Minimum Qualifications
Vocational / technical certification / training in information technology with emphasis on software administration; supplemented by one (1) to three (3) years of experience in the installation, configuration, and problem analysis and repair of software management issues; or an equivalent combination of training, education, and experience. Position requires FDLE background check prior to start date to ensure capability of candidate to provide services to law enforcement users; CJIS certification required within three (3) months of hire. Possession of a valid Florida driver"s license.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
KSA's - Ability to work with other staff who may be less knowledgeable about IT topics but are subject-matter experts (SMEs) on the work function currently or to be supported by a software application for which the IT Business Analyst has been assigned lead responsibility.
Significant skill in identifying and documenting process workflows and user needs, including the construction of flowcharts, particularly when the user group has difficulty in describing its current and proposed operational needs.

Ability to follow standard practices and testing procedures for software installation, configuration, operation, maintenance, troubleshooting, and repair.

Ability to interpret and work from technical manuals, schematics, and other software documentation and training.

Ability to specify, acquire, install, and configure computer software; skill in specification, procurement, installation, operation, and troubleshooting of communications software.

Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with employees, consultants, and vendors.

Ability to communicate clearly and concisely, orally and in writing. Requirements
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
Tasks involve the ability to exert light physical effort in sedentary to light work, but which may involve some lifting, carrying, pushing and/or pulling of objects and materials of light weight (5-10 pounds). Transport of computer equipment and tools may occasionally require lifting and transporting materials of up to 50 lbs. Installation tasks may require physical dexterity in order to work within confined spaces.
ENVIRONMENTAL REQUIREMENTS
Work requires the intermittent installation, moving, and modification to computer/network systems equipment and peripheral components. Due to the varying nature and locations of the work environment, tasks include potential for intermittent exposure to disagreeable elements consistent with electronics installations and wiring systems. Some tasks include materials handling where physical risks are predictable and/or controllable by observance of standard safety precautions.

Johnson & Johnson Vision is recruiting for a Demand Planning Data and Analytics Lead . This position will report within the Vision Global Demand Planning team, which is responsible to advance planning process maturity by driving improvements across our demand planning system (OMP) and key KPIs (MAPE/Bias) through strong collaboration with our regional partners.

The Demand Planning Data and Analytics Lead supports the Vision Global and Regional Supply Chain Demand Planning teams to reduce complexity and to advance business process maturity. The analyst is responsible for driving value realization of investments, prioritization and execution of all planning system enhancements and for leading issue resolution on system and process-related challenges within the demand planning group.

This individual will work closely with various internal and external partners, with the following key responsibilities:

Strategy Development:

Shape process and systems improvements recommendations, aligned to enterprise best practices and business requirements.
Partnering with JJT team as lead Demand Planning business partner to ensure alignment in business priorities.
Partnering with other supply chain functions (data & analytics, planning excellence, etc.) to build working relationships across all teams that directly or indirectly impact business process performance.
Partnering with global MedTech teams where relevant to identify and prioritize the desired process & systems enhancements intended to strengthen planning capabilities.
Capability development:
Drive specific global process improvements as well as continuous business process improvements with a focus on Vision demand planning platforms and reporting systems (OMP, Tableau, PowerBI)
Establish a global Super User community with a common approach on establishing, assessing and improving business processes within Plan Systems.
Facilitate process management trainings and knowledge & experience sharing and drive awareness on business process management.
Drive business adoption of process improvements by defining and implementing appropriate organizational change and communications plans.
Operational effectiveness:
Driving improvements in line with the Global Demand Planning Roadmaps for Surgical Vision & Vision Care
Ensuring all system processes are consistently meeting the needs of the Vision Supply Chain and Global Plan community, taking action to address break-fix issues while also leading efforts to improve business capabilities via system enhancements where applicable.
Collect business requirements for prioritized enhancements, and collaborate with key business partners to design and shape the appropriate business solution.
Communications – Provide proactive, concise, and pertinent communications to the Regional and Global Demand Planning community as they relate to project execution, business transformations, change impacts, etc.
On an on-going basis, gauge the organizational “pulse” through various means (i.e. dialog, surveys, process walkthroughs, etc.) to identify improvement opportunities.
Organize / lead workshops to support investigation / alignment work.
Governing operational stability of legacy processes and tools to ensure appropriate business process execution where applicable.
QUALIFICATIONS

Education:

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent required
Degree in Supply Chain, Operations, Engineering or equivalent/Advanced degree/MBA preferred
PMP, FPX, Green Belt or equivalent certifications desired
APICS certification (CPIM, CFPIM or CIRM) preferred
Experience:
Minimum Three (3) years of relevant experience required
Experience in system or process change projects desired
Knowledge of value stream mapping
Knowledge, Skills and capabilities:
Strong grasp of planning processes and functions, with a solid understanding of end-to-end planning processes required.
Understanding of planning and ERP systems, such as OMP and SAP required.
Good presentation skills with the ability to adjust to the audience (business vs. technical, professionals vs. sr. leadership) is required
Ability to translate complex topics into simple, workable solutions required.
Pro-active, can-do attitude. High level of personal initiative, ability to function autonomously and self-confidence.
Self-starter with ability to build and develop new relationships quickly, and influence/collaborate to get to desired results.
Big Picture orientation with Attention to Detail – align strategic and tactical
Results Orientation and ability to drive towards committed timelines.
Creative problem-solving skills.
Microsoft Office Applications knowledge
Stays ahead of emerging trends and standard processes within the Advanced Planning area
