Description

The City of Fort Myers strives to be an employer of choice and most of our employees turn jobs into long term careers. The salary shown in the job description is the full range for this position from entry to later career.

NEW EMPLOYEES ARE HIRED AT, OR NEAR THE ENTRY POINT SHOWN, DEPENDING ON QUALIFICATIONS AND RELEVANT EXPERIENCE.

FLSA Status: Exempt Safety Sensitive: NO Level II Screening: NO

Under the general direction of the Superintendent, the incumbent is responsible for monitoring, analyzing and reporting software programs. The programs include but are not limited to; Fleetboss Global Position System (GPS), Asset Management using Geographic Information System (GIS), Lift Station Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition System (SCADA), Closed Circuit Television (CCTV), Work Orders System Software, KRONOS time keeping software, and Potable Water Leak Detection. Work involves analysis of gathered data and providing the Superintendent of the necessary reports. Liaison with the City’s ITS Department as needed for effective execution of software functions. Work is performed with limited direction and considerable latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.

Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the City’s policies and applicable laws if applicable. Responsibilities include planning, assigning, and directing work, addressing complaints and resolving problems.

Responsibilities and Reporting During an Emergency Situation:
Essential Employees may be required to work during a declared emergency. Depending on the nature of the emergency, this may require working around the clock for several days on short notice.
Non Essential Employees will not be required to work during a declared emergency. The employee’s Department Head will determine when the employee will be required to work.

Duties/Responsibilities

Prepare monthly and other written reports as needed to management.
Operates a vehicle when travel is required to perform assigned tasks.
This position requires regular and reliable attendance and the employee’s physical presence at the workplace.
Will be required to work in on-call status during assigned periods.
Perform related duties as assigned.
Monitor City owned vehicles with the Company-wide FLEETBOSS GPS tracking system.
Support the field personnel regarding dispatch to any alarms and notifications.
Maintain driver qualification files.
Coordinate with Engineering Division GIS Technician to locate and update City assets in the GIS.
Monitor and maintain SCADA system using Data Flow software.
Monitor yard security video camera system with CCTV software.
Monitor work order database entries for accuracy, completeness, and timely turnaround on complaints from external/internal customers with Lucity/GBA software.
Monitor traffic sign software.
Monitor daily employee time entry with KRONOS software.
Monitor water distribution system remote sensing devices such as leak detection, pressure monitor, and flow monitor.
Monitor Network for performance and make recommendations for improvement.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES
Proficient in the use of word processing, spreadsheet, database and presentation software.
Knowledgeable of operating systems, data and file structure.
Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.
Ability to performing under frequent deadlines and/or in response to emergencies.
Ability to exercise sound judgment and make decisions in accordance with established laws, regulations, ordinances, departmental policies and procedures.
Ability to speak clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships.
Ability to communicate effectively in oral and written form.
Ability to operate necessary equipment, including but not limited to a personal computer, and testing and diagnostic equipment.
Ability to learn and master new software quickly and easily.
Knowledge of and ability to create, complex queries using the SQL & Python query language.
Knowledge of Client/Server database applications.
Knowledge of Windows operating systems.
Knowledge and skill in automating and maintaining database datasets.
Skill in data extraction
Skill in written, verbal, electronic, and visual communications for effective expression and clarity
Skill in critical thinking, analysis and problem-solving, specifically related to data quality
Skill in organization, prioritization, and time management
Skill in the use of Microsoft development tools.
Skill in the use of word processing, spreadsheet, database and presentation software.
Skill in the development of Crystal reports.

Minimum Requirements

Associate’s degree in Information Systems, Computer Science or closely related field which emphasizes computer software/hardware; or equivalent experience and training that provides the required knowledge, skills and abilities to perform the essential job functions may be substituted for the Associates’ degree.
Two years of experience working as a System Analyst or related work
A valid Florida Driver’s License with an acceptable driving record.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
CNE, MCSE, CCNE or equivalent certification, preferred.
Experience working with SCADA systems preferred when assigned to Public Works
Bachelor’s degree preferred

Minimum Requirements

This work typically requires the following physical activities to be performed.

Balancing – maintain equilibrium to prevent falling while walking, standing, or crouching.
Climbing – ascending, descending ladders, stairs, ramps, requires body agility.
Pushing – use upper extremities to press against objects with force, or thrust forward, downward, outward.
Reaching – extending hands or arms in any direction.
Repetitive Motion – substantial movements of wrists, hands, fingers.
Speaking – expressing ideas with spoken word, convey detailed, important instructions accurately, concisely.
Standing – for sustained periods of time.
Stooping – bending body downward, forward at waist, with full motion of lower extremities and back.
Talking 1- expressing ideas by spoken word
Talking 2 – shouting to be heard above ambient noise.
Visual Acuity 1 - prepare, analyze data, transcribing, computer terminal, extensive reading.
Crouching – bending body forward by bending leg, spine.
Feeling – perceiving attributes of objects by touch with skin, fingertips.
Fingering – picking, pinching, typing, working with fingers rather than hand.
Grasping – applying pressure to object with fingers, palm.
Handling – picking, holding, or working with whole hand.
Hearing 1 – perceiving sounds at normal speaking levels, receive information.
Hearing 2 – receive detailed information, make discrimination in sound.
Visual Acuity 2 - color, depth perception, field of vision.
Visual Acuity 3 - determine accuracy, neatness, observe facilities/structures.
Visual Acuity 4 - operate motor vehicles/heavy equipment.
Kneeling – bending legs at knee to come to rest at knees.
Lifting – raising objects from lower to higher position, moving objects side to side, using upper extremities, back.
Mental Acuity – ability to make rational decisions through sound logic, deductive reasoning.
Pulling - use upper extremities to exert force, haul or tug.
Visual Acuity 5 -close acuity for inspection of small defects, machines, use measurement devices, or fabricate parts.
Walking - on foot to accomplish tasks, long distances, or site to site.
Work performed is primarily:
Medium work: Exerting up to 50 pounds of force occasionally, and/or up to 30 pounds of force frequently, and/or up to 10 pounds of force constantly to move objects.
WORK ENVIRONMENT
Contact with internal and external customers, vendors, outside agencies and the general public.
May be required to work hours other than the regular schedule including nights, weekends, and holidays.
May be required to work in on-call status during assigned periods.

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the essential job functions satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the primary job functions described herein. Since every duty associated with this position may not be described herein, employees may be required to perform duties not specifically spelled out in the job description, but which may be reasonably considered to be incidental in the performing of their duties just as though they were actually written out in this job description.

Job Title: Traffic Data Analyst, Express Lanes - 100% Onsite
Job Description:
Company Description

Work with Us. Change the World.

At AECOM, we're delivering a better world. Whether improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water, or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive. We are the world's trusted infrastructure consulting firm, partnering with clients to solve the world’s most complex challenges and build legacies for future generations.

There has never been a better time to be at AECOM. With accelerating infrastructure investment worldwide, our services are in great demand. We invite you to bring your bold ideas and big dreams and become part of a global team of nearly 50,000 planners, designers, engineers, scientists, digital innovators, program and construction managers and other professionals delivering projects that create a positive and tangible impact around the world.

We're one global team driven by our common purpose to deliver a better world. Join us.

Job Description

AECOM is actively seeking a highly motivated Managed Express Lanes Traffic specialist in Fort Lauderdale, Florida. This role will serve as Managed Express Lanes Traffic specialist for the Florida Department Transportation (FDOT) district’s Transportation System Management & Operations (TSM&O) Unit projects including but not limited to data management, analytics, and reporting, maintenance and construction management, and support of Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS) projects.

Specific duties include:
+ Data collection, processing, analysis, and routine reporting.

+ Gathers and correlates basic engineering data using well-defined procedures.

+ Quality assurance and quality control of various components of Intelligent Transportation Systems.

+ Preparation and review of operations plans, documents, and related calculations.

+ Coordinate closely and act as liaison with outside partners/agencies to ensure the efficient incorporation of the TSM&O program objectives through the project delivery process.

+ Assist in developing, operating, and managing a performance reporting system for current and future critical networks defined by the managed lanes program.

+ Coordinate with other Department of Transportation offices within the districts

Qualifications

Minimum Requirements:
+ BA/BS + 4 Years of relevant experience or or AA/AS (US) + 6 Years of relevant experience or HS/GED + 8 Years of relevant experience or demonstrated equivalency of experience and/or education

+ Must pass a pre-employment drug screen

+ Constantly operate a computer and other monitoring equipment

+ Must be able to remain in a stationary position for long periods of time monitoring Intelligent Transportation Systems such CCTV camera displays, meters, law enforcement radio broadcasts, answering/responding to calls and communicating to other staff or partner agencies

Preferred Qualifications:
+ Experience with data analysis and reporting.

+ Experience with traffic engineering concepts, such as roadway capacity analysis, operations impact assessments, benefit-cost analysis.

+ Experience with Intelligent Transportation Systems is preferred but not required.

+ Skilled in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and common computer applications

+ Solid analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.

+ Proactive, strategic, and detail oriented.

+ Good verbal, written, and interpersonal skills.

+ Ability to coordinate and lead multi-disciplinary meetings.

+ Skilled in task management and scheduling.

+ Ability to work in a professional office environment.

Additional Information

+ Sponsorship opportunities for US Employment Authorization is not available for this position

+ Relocation assistance is not available for this position

+ This position is 100% onsite opportunity in Fort Lauderdale, Florida

+ _NON-Exempt Position: Offered rate of compensation (Florida) will be based on individual education, qualifications, experience, and work location. The Hourly range for this position is $27.00 - $32.00 per hour._

+ _AECOM is proud to offer a comprehensive benefits program to meet the diverse needs of our employees. Depending on your employment status, AECOM benefits may include medical, dental, vision, life, AD&D and disability benefits, paid time off, leaves of absence, voluntary benefits, perks, wellness and global well-being, and global EAP, Business Travel and Service Awards programs._

About AECOM

AECOM is the world’s trusted infrastructure consulting firm, delivering professional services throughout the project lifecycle – from advisory, planning, design and engineering to program and construction management. On projects spanning transportation, buildings, water, new energy and the environment, our public- and private-sector clients trust us to solve their most complex challenges. Our teams are driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world through our unrivaled technical and digital expertise, a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion, and a commitment to environmental, social and governance priorities. AECOM is a Fortune 500 firm and its Professional Services business had revenue of $13.1 billion in fiscal year 2022. See how we are delivering sustainable legacies for generations to come at aecom.com and @AECOM.

Freedom to Grow in a World of Opportunity

You will have the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.

You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.

AECOM provides a wide array of compensation and benefits programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. We also provide a robust global well-being program. We’re the world’s trusted global infrastructure firm, and we’re in this together – your growth and success are ours too.

Join us, and you’ll get all the benefits of being a part of a global, publicly traded firm – access to industry-leading technology and thinking and transformational work with big impact and work flexibility. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

ReqID: J10098670

Business Line: Transportation

Business Group: DCS

Strategic Business Unit: East

Career Area: Operations & Maintenance

Work Location Model: On-Site

The Part-Time Medical Supply Analyst is responsible for conducting formative and summative data collection on medical supplies, managing and monitoring the availability of materials, resources and distribution of medical equipment and supplies for Medical Campus.

Duties & Responsibilities
Performs quantitative data collection; integrates and analyzes data to purchase medical supplies and equipment from multiple departments at MDC-Medical campus using People-Soft and the Omnicell Supply Management System
Provides feedback on data collection instruments and protocols and analysis plans
Produces detailed technical reports on medical supplies utilization based on courses and programs
Maintains data reports and documentation needed to ensure best practices and compliance with accreditation
Maintains departmental budget allocated for supply purchases and oversees cost containment initiatives
Ensures accurate inventory of materials and supplies
Oversees the efficient distribution of items from Central Supply to multiple labs; oversees restocking of assigned areas
Works closely with faculty/staff and lab managers to ensure appropriate availability of medical supplies and resources
Maintains inventory of associated technology equipment and computer systems for medical instruments, tracking and reporting
Manages and ensures efficient delivery of teaching supply carts and associated materials
Provides technical assistance and information to faculty and students
Performs other duties as assigned
Minimum Requirements
Bachelor's degree in a related field and three (3) years of related work experience in inventory control
Knowledge and understanding of College organization, goals and objectives, and policies and procedures
Knowledge of computer software and department related applications
Knowledge of medical supplies, medical equipment, and understanding a wide range of medical products and their applications
Ability to understand and adhere to OSHA regulations
Working knowledge of proper handling of hazardous chemicals and waste
Knowledge of computer based instrument tracking system and inventory control
Possess excellent communication skills (verbal and written)
Ability to communicate effectively and work well in a multi-ethnic and multi-cultural environment with students, faculty and staff
Additional Requirements



The final candidate is to successfully complete a background screening and reference check process.

Description


All the benefits and perks you need for you and your family:

Benefits from Day One
Paid Days Off from Day One
Career Development
Whole Person Wellbeing Resources
Mental Health Resources and Support



Our promise to you:

Joining AdventHealth is about being part of something bigger. It’s about belonging to a community that believes in the wholeness of each person, and serves to uplift others in body, mind and spirit. AdventHealth is a place where you can thrive professionally, and grow spiritually, by Extending the Healing Ministry of Christ. Where you will be valued for who you are and the unique experiences you bring to our purpose-minded team. All while understanding that together we are even better.

Schedule: Full Time

Shift: Monday - Friday

Location: 893 Hope Way Altamonte Springs, FL 32714

The role you’ll contribute:

The Design & Construction Center of Excellence (D&C CoE) Business Analyst position is responsible for financial analysis and reporting in the areas of budgeting, forecasting, reporting, and analysis. Additional responsibilities may include monthly reports; monitoring and analyzing financial, statistical, and operational data trends; and special projects as requested.

This individual will work with the Director of Finance and the CoE Leaders to translate strategy into actionable plans, leverage in-depth analysis to provide the story behind the numbers and respond to business changes with agility. Also providing analytical support to Operations through the creation and maintenance of various BI reports, analysis, PowerPoint presentations, data models, and analytical tools.

The AdventHealth Design & Construction Center of Excellence (D&C CoE) will centralize and enable standard processes, policies, and industry-best practices, while also improving the execution, consistency, stewardship, and delivery of projects

The value you’ll bring to the team:

Budgeting and Forecasting: Includes the preparation of appropriate analysis to support the development of financial guidelines as well as the development and implementation of financial planning schedules and procedures at all levels of the Organization. Review and analyze budgets and make appropriate recommendations to management.
Financial Analysis: Provide financial and analytical support to internal customers. Review and analyze actuals versus budget.
Financial Reporting: Support the development, implementation, and maintenance of comprehensive internal financial reporting package to support the monthly preparation of business unit, department and consolidated financial statements. This includes maintenance of hierarchies to keep reporting in sync. Work with Power BI, Smart Sheets.
Process Improvement: Identify and lead process improvement initiatives. Assist on cross-functional teams, as required, to improve budgeting and financial reporting processes.
Continuously seek new ways to leverage business data to offer fresh insights and aid decision making.
Translate business strategies, initiatives, and projects into effective financial modeling.
Act as Finance representative for cross-functional projects
Understand the business and information needs of business owners and translate those needs into BI/analytics/reporting requirements.
Support the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, data mining, analyses, dashboards, PowerPoint presentations etc. that drive meaningful, timely, and actionable insights and can be easily interpreted by users.
Work with Operations team and utilize data insights to help drive predictive operational behavior.
Qualifications


The expertise and experiences you’ll need to succeed:

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:

Bachelor's degree with five (5) or more years of relevant experience, preferably in a related field such as: business, health care, engineering, information systems, or mathematics discipline, OR Master's degree with three (3) or more years of relevant experience, preferably in a related field such as: business, health care, engineering, information systems, or mathematics discipline
5+ years' relevant work experience in accounting, financial forecasting, reporting, and analysis required. Experience in Construction accounting and/or public accounting preferred.
Ability to work in a fast-paced unstructured environment; excellent financial skills; expertise with financial reporting and analysis including balance sheets, profit and loss, return on asset and investment, metrics and measurements, etc.
Strong Excel skills including pivot tables.
Strong communication (oral and written), interpersonal, and organizational skills required. Must demonstrate ability to successfully interact effectively with all levels in the organization.
High level of initiative and critical thinking to formulate business issues into analytical problems and devise actionable solutions.



LICENSURE, CERTIFICATION OR REGISTRATION REQUIRED:

Graduate certificate in business analytics, business intelligence, or data science

This facility is an equal opportunity employer and complies with federal, state and local anti-discrimination laws, regulations and ordinances.

Job Title: Sr Analyst, Portfolio Planning & Project Management (Project Hire)
Job Description:
Enterprise Technology organization within Disney mission is to deliver technology solutions that align to business strategies while enabling enterprise efficiency and promoting cross-company collaborative innovation. The Enterprise Technology organization drives competitive advantage by enhancing our consumer experiences, enabling business growth, and advancing operational excellence. Our business customers encompass all domestic and international businesses and brands across The Walt Disney Company including Disney Studios, Walt Disney Parks & Resorts, ESPN, ABC, Marvel Studios, & Pixar to name a few.

About the Role & Team:

The Sr. Analyst, Portfolio and Planning, is a project planning role within Enterprise technology, responsible for supporting the portfolio planning and delivery management of the S/4 HANA platform and services ensuring technology solutions are delivered end-to-end and aligned with business capability and collaboration with support operations.

What You Will Do:

Partner with matrix projects, resources, and 3rd party resources.

The span of the role will encompass portfolio planning, project management, delivery execution, and strategic planning.

Role Responsibilities and Duties:

Actively leads and/or contributes to team and project planning and overall strategy, to include resource needs identification and forecasting

Actively leads and/or contributes in establishing and tracking progress to key performance indicators

Actively leads and/or contributes in monitoring and evaluating overall project health and status; analyzes data and produces actionable insights

Actively leads and/or contributes in identifying problems and shortfalls and proposing solutions

As directed, responsible for inputs into the Risks, Actions, Issues and Decisions (RAID) log pertaining to the S/4H Tech Conversion project; work resolution of items; work with project management team

Proactively identifies issues and actively leads and/or contributes options to resolve

Identifies and actively leads and/or contributes in the resolution of issues and conflicts

Actively leads and/or contributes in the management of escalations to leadership and to vendors as appropriate to drive results

Continually apprises leadership and relevant business stakeholders of status and anything not on track

Collaborates closely with partners across the organization including business partners, solution architects, and delivery managers

Builds strong relationships with and partners with large and diverse groups of stakeholders at multiple levels, from end users to executives, across the enterprise

Required Experience:

Project management or project coordination background with a minimum of 5 years of experience.

Experience supporting large enterprise wide projects.

Ability to complete projects and achieve results in an ambiguous work environment.

Ability to solve complex problems

Innovative thinking and embraces innovation by constantly seeking new or contrary ideas and approaches to what has been done in the past.

Exemplary communications skills as well as presentation skills, both oral and written.

This is a 18-month Project Hire position with no guarantee of permanent placement. Disney Worldwide Services, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer.

POSITION SUMMARY\:
To be fully engaged in supporting the Hospital Division to accomplish goals and initiatives by providing analytics for operations including but not limited to staffing, throughput, length of stay, and financial savings. The Operations Business Analyst proactively forecasts the throughput of patients using AI technology, serves as the primary liaison to IT, analyzes data, designs reports, investigates barriers and proposes solutions. The Operations Business Analyst collaborates with hospital leadership and front line staff to facilitate safe and efficient transport of patients and equipment.

PRIMARY ACCOUNTABILITIES\:
1. Utilizes data from throughput applications to proactively identify opportunities to improve patient pull times and room turnaround for exceptional customer experience.
2. Trains clinical transport associates, volunteers, hospital leaders and others new to patient throughput software on daily use, metric collection, report creation and best practice understanding.
3. Serves as hospital division expert in throughput software providing technical support and acting as liaison to IT.
4. Tracks and trends inefficiencies in the patient throughput data initiating collaboration on action plans to correct and escalating any barriers to Director of Patient Throughput.
5. Conducts educational in-services and communicates timely information regarding software and/or throughput process updates in huddles and staff meetings.
6. Respects the patient’s rights, under state law, to strict confidentiality concerning condition, care and treatment.
7. Provides support for the collection, analysis, and interpretation of data for reports, proposals, and presentations.
8. Performs analysis to adjust for staffing volumes to enhance throughput and patient care; performs trend analysis to identify patterns in patient care, usage of facilities, equipment, or other areas of interest.
9. Assists with the design or implementation of new systems to store, manage, and retrieve data.
10. Collects and presents information into user friendly dashboards to enhance the management and throughput process.
11. Works on strategic projects as assigned by management, at times working on and/or overseeing more than one strategic project at a time.
12.Participates in providing gap analyses, highlighting current state, future state, operational needs, and best practices.

Qualifications:
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS\:

Education\: Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, IT, Finance, Health Care Administration, Statistics, or related field
Work Experience\: At least two years of experience in data, reporting and/or analysis including experience with trend analytics, observing workflows, identifying opportunities, and working with teams to enhance throughput
Work Experience in lieu of Degree\: Six (6) years’ experience in data, reporting and/or analysis including experience with trend analytics, observing workflows, identifying opportunities, and working with teams to enhance throughput
Licensure/Certification\: Lean Yellow Belt preferred
Knowledge/Skills/Abilities\:
o Demonstrated proficiency with spreadsheet and word processing applications
o Strong written and oral communication skills to produce clear, understandable data reports, dashboards, oral presentations and trainings
o Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities with calm and effective response
o Organizational and assessment skills to effectively prioritize and coordinate requests for data, reports and projects
o Interpersonal skills to promote collaboration across diverse work teams
o Ability to flex hours to support hospital operations
PHYSICAL DEMANDS\:

Majority of time involves sitting or standing; occasional walking, bending, stooping
Long periods of computer time or at workstation
Light work that may include lifting or moving objects up to 20 pounds with or without assistance.
May be exposed to inside environments with varied temperatures, air quality, lighting and/or low to moderate noise
Communicating with others to exchange information.
Visual acuity and hand-eye coordination to perform tasks
Workspace may vary from open to confined; on site or remote
May require travel to various facilities within and beyond county perimeter; may require use of personal vehicle

The role you’ll contribute:

A Primary Research Programmer Analyst for Consumer Insights in the Strategic Planning and Research department is principally responsible for survey design, programming, managing vendors, developing data architecture, ensuring data quality, and providing initial analysis. The Analyst must have strong initiative and follow-through and be able to anticipate the needs of clients. They must also be resourceful, professional, and a team player.



The position requires coordination of projects with diverse groups, including internal and external stakeholders, and an ability to clearly and concisely communicate both verbally and in writing. Must be a skilled communicator and have the ability to interact with all client and internal teams.

The value you’ll bring to the team:

PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

Assess, evaluate, program, and manage surveys, while interpreting project needs and requirements, managing budgets, quotes, timelines, and deliverables.

Survey Design and Programming:
o Participate in methodology and survey design meetings to identify key questions and ensure all project needs are being met.
o Support survey writing and ensure programming notes and pathways are incorporated for ideal survey efficiency and minimal respondent fatigue.
o Review survey questionnaires and provide recommendations to ensure accurate programming and optimal data layout.
o Interact with the project management team and clients to better clarify the technical requirements of the project.
o Conduct quality control checks to ensure error-free deliverables.
o Keep track of, and document, programming changes with detailed updates and logs.
o Identify and implement programming techniques and non-standard solutions to programming challenges.
o Flawlessly use software to program a multitude of questions, including inserting graphic/multimedia/ other specialty survey components, incorporate lists, grids/matrixes, etc., as well as build complex skip logic and pipe-in lists.
o Perform maintenance and updates for ongoing projects and surveys.




Survey Administration:
o Identify respondent profiles and demographic needs to meet research objectives.
o Work with external vendors to manage consumer databases and panels.
o Review quotes, keeping market populations, incidence rates, completion expectations, and screening criteria priorities in mind.
o Frequently communicate and maintain relationships with survey and consumer panel vendors and partners.
o Maintain survey response rate data and continuous survey fielding.




Data Management:
o Clean raw data files and manage data quality checks including data merges.
o Develop protocol for processing custom data requests and manage the data delivery.
o Create and maintain data architecture for optimal analysis; review and proof data files for ETL Processes.

o Manage qualitative coding and cleaning. Execute standard analyses using SQL, SPSS, DisplayR, Excel, or similar data analysis tools.

o Identify and implement opportunities for process optimization and automation to streamline data collection, reporting, and other manual tasks wherever possible.

o Maintain SQL queries, tracker surveys, and department dashboards (e.g., Brand Tracker, Physician Engagement, etc.).




KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS REQUIRED:

Experience in programming software such as Qualtrics, Forsta+/Decipher, SSI Sawtooth, etc.
Demonstrated proficiency in database programs and data analysis software such as Excel, SPSS, DisplayR, QlikView, SQL, etc.
Proficiency in MS Office, including Microsoft Excel, Microsoft PowerPoint, Microsoft Word, etc.
Proven primary market research analysis experience.
Ability to design, execute, and analyze varying survey methodologies, including Conjoint Analysis, MaxDiff Studies, etc.
Strong analytical, problem solving, and critical thinking skills to work with complex survey structures and build efficient surveys.
Proven ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage multiple projects simultaneously to meet deadlines.
Be adaptable, flexible, and responsive to changing department and system needs, adjusting priorities accordingly and in a timely manner.
Clear and effective written and verbal communication skills, i.e., expresses thoughts, ideas, and data analysis, both written and verbally, incorporating necessary feedback from leaders and clients
Exhibits good listening and comprehension skills.
Strong, proactive initiative and follow-through.
Strong organizational skills with acute attention to detail.
Team player with the ability to work independently.
Qualifications


The expertise and experiences you’ll need to succeed:

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:

Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Market Research, or related field
Experience with programming market research online surveys using software such as Qualtrics, Forsta+/Decipher, SSI Sawtooth, etc.




EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE PREFERRED:

Master’s degree in Business Administration, Healthcare, Computer Science, or related field

Job Title: Senior Data Analyst Marketing and Sales
Job Description:
The Senior Data Analyst will be responsible for CCI's efforts to develop and expand an analytically driven business performance evaluation framework. You will support the testing, analysis, and reporting function in projects across multiple functional areas of the business, including Marketing, Pricing, Sales, Operations and others. This role requires a creative individual who possesses skills in data handling, model development, analytics, and storytelling. Innovation is encouraged and a desire to collaborate well with our team, boundary partners, and leaders across the organization is a must.

Cox Communications is seeking a Senior Data Analyst who is experienced in:

Data mining, modeling, analysis, and visualization.
Analytical capabilities building and continuous improvement.
Using data analysis to assess the performance and identify insights of strategies and tests.




In this role you are part of a team responsible for CCI's efforts to develop and expand an analytically driven business performance evaluation framework. You will support the testing, analysis, and reporting function in projects across multiple functional areas of the business, including Marketing, Pricing, Sales, Operations and others. This role is a unique opportunity to help deliver on the vision to grow analytical capabilities, as well as support the development of key strategies critical to the business.

What You'll Do:


Serve as a subject matter expert supporting effectiveness analysis, including:

A/B testing and multivariate experiments.
Sales, Marketing, Pricing performance, including evaluation of strategy objectives.
Performance of offers, customer migration, churn, etc.
Designs and develops big data-based models and reporting tools using tools like SQL and Python in the Snowflake environment.
Identifies and mine new data resources to enable reporting and advanced analytics.
Translates data and trends into actionable insights via regular and ad-hoc reports that tell our competitive story.
Understands organizational objectives and helps improve reporting, analytics, and development projects to meet these goals.
Provides support to ad-hoc requests from senior leaders and boundary partners.
Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and consistency by implementing data validation and quality assurance procedures .
Provides Data Analysis services across multiple products, business or organizational areas.
Interacts with business leaders to understand key objectives and concerns.
Develops database logic to extract required information for reporting.
Supports efforts to distill massive amounts of complicated data into meaningful and actionable insights.
Designs, develops and implements dashboards and reports to facilitate data review and analysis.
Manage and prioritize multiple projects, ensuring that they are delivered on time and within budget.
Drives successful projects by providing action-oriented analyses, optimization and a data-driven approach.




What's In It For You:

At Cox, we reward your hard work with meaningful benefits.

First, we offer a highly competitive compensation package, 401(k) with a generous company match, comprehensive healthcare, life, and disability benefits, plus numerous other benefits, including adoption assistance, pet insurance, and discounts on travel and cars!

We value people more than technology. That means you'll work within a culture and with a team that values your leadership, your experience, your contributions, and you - yes, you - as a person. We believe recognition is important, and Cox strives to celebrate those who help make us successful every day. We also encourage diversity and support inclusion; we want you to do you and feel comfortable doing so.

We also offer boundless opportunities for growth; you can sharpen your skills, learn a new talent, join a mentoring program, even earn an advanced degree. You'll find the potential for lateral or upward career growth within the Cox family businesses, including the innovative startups in transportation mobility, clean tech and more.

Who You Are:

Minimum



Bachelor's degree in a related discipline and 4 years of experience in a related field (Marketing, Data Analytics or related field). The right candidate could also have a different combination, such as a master's degree and 2 years of experience, a Ph.D. and 1 year of experience or 8 years of experience in a related field with no degree.
Analytical/financial analysis background.
Strong multitasking, analytical and creative skills.
Self-starter with strong organizational, detail and follow-up skills.
Excellent interpersonal, leadership, presentation, and collaborative skills to work effectively with teams throughout the organization.
Demonstrated business acumen, problem solving and critical thinking skills.
Develop framework to analyze effectiveness of offer recommendations, strategy rules and processes; provide insights to strategy teams for improvements.
Ability to translate and communicate complex analyses clearly and concisely.
Conducts business/strategy impact analyses, validations, and measurement through all stages from concept formulation, definition of metrics, determination of appropriate statistical methodology, research evaluation, and final presentation
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
Deadline driven, ability to work with a sense of urgency.
Proficiency with quantitative tools including Excel and presentation tools such as PowerPoint and willingness to learn new tools that may be valuable to the team.
Continuous learner mindset.
Comfort setting direction and drawing insight from multiple (and often unclear) data sources.
Hands on experience with SQL.
Hands on experience with BI and dashboarding tools (MicroStrategy, Tableau, Power BI, or similar reporting tools.)




Preferred



Bachelor's degree in marketing, data analytics, engineering, computer science, economics, finance or similar analytical or technical field.
Telecommunications, cable industry, high tech, or consulting experience.
Familiarity with financial and data modeling techniques.
Interest in learning (or prior experience with) statistical analysis methods.
Strong knowledge of programming languages SQL, Python, R.
Experience working with Snowflake, AWS (Amazon Web Services) and/or ThoughtSpot.
Process management tools such as Airtable.

We are a thriving energy services company that provides solar options for home and commercial projects as well as storage battery solutions. A DAY IN THE LIFE OF A DATA ANALYST

As a Data Analyst, your efforts help us improve our business model, resulting in more satisfied customers! Each day, you log customer cancellations and research customer complaints. Thorough and detail-oriented, you investigate issues and document your findings. You facilitate productive communication between our owner and our supplier partners to resolve problems.

You know that tracking analytics is a key element of a solid business development strategy, which is why you faithfully input data into Google Sheets and Microsoft Excel spreadsheets. Trustworthy and discrete, you maintain a high level of confidentiality when creating reports that deal with our customers' personal information. Computer proficiency, including advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel and/or Google Sheets
Ability to operate standard office equipment
Must live in or near Gainesville, FL

Business Group: DCS

Strategic Business Unit: East

Career Area: Program & Project Management

Work Location Model: Hybrid

POSITION PURPOSE:

This position is responsible for the management of departmental report development and implementation. Collects and analyzes data, reports results, and presents in written and graphical formats. The Operations Analyst plays a vital role within the Operations Department, encompassing various areas such as bus operations, van operations, the operations control center, the customer service call center and the paratransit eligibility team. This position is responsible for overseeing and collecting data, with a primary focus on analyzing operations and call center data to generate meaningful insights. The Operations Analyst will leverage their analytical skills to create comprehensive dashboards that effectively display trends and performance indicators. Additionally, the Operations Analyst regularly meets with department managers and stakeholders to discuss data-driven findings, share insights, and collaborate on improvement initiatives. By providing valuable analyses and strategic guidance, the Operations Analyst contributes significantly to optimizing operations and facilitating informed decision-making within the Operations Department. Manages project oversight and coordination of ongoing goals and objectives throughout the operations department. Performs policy research and implementation using analytical, writing, and organizational skills. Writes, maintains, and supports a variety of reports of queries utilizing appropriate reporting tools. This position will have oversight of updating and maintaining department Standard Operating Procedures to be compliant with revision criterion.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

Prepare statistical reports, graphs, spreadsheets, and forecasts identifying specific performance metrics and trend analysis.
Conduct data analysis to identify trends and potential problem areas or adverse trends and recommend opportunities for improvements.
Participate in industry related meetings, workshops, seminars, and conferences [as necessary] for the purpose of increasing self-education, gathering information, conveying information, networking, developing contacts, and representing the various divisions within Operations.
Meet with key personnel to define and understand reporting needs, providing recommendations based on statistical analysis.
Offer recommendations and assist in developing strategies to improve operations and efficiencies within the Operations department.
Perform statistical research and develop reports from various software used within the organization.
Track overall service key performance indicators (KPIs).
Develop and maintain departmental dashboards, including Customer Service Call Center, Bus Operations, Van Operations, and the Operations Control Center.
Ensure data integrity by running queries and analyzing data.
Develop internal process controls to remain in compliance with various reporting requirements.
Collect data from multiple software systems (such as Trapeze, Cisco Finesse, SeeClickFix) to generate trend and need analysis.
Test software for operations and determine effectiveness.
Develop departmental reporting for communication of transactional, statistical, and historical activities related to the Transportation Department's activities.
Study existing data to evaluate current effectiveness and develop new or modify existing applications and databases to streamline production and increase efficiency.
Assist with the preparation of annual budgets.
Act as an interdepartmental liaison.
Compile, monitor, and prepare various operational and statistical data related to performance tracking, benchmarking, and scorecard tracking for different divisions within Operations.
Audit daily database input to ensure accuracy and quality of information.
Monitor trends and forecast requirements based on data-driven forecast models.
Perform a variety of administrative tasks related to vacation bids, payroll, shift bids, etc., as required by collective bargaining agreements.
Maintain confidentiality and integrity while providing excellent internal and external.
Monitors and ensures all established operating procedures, work rules, and contractual provisions are properly followed.
Reviews attendance records, miss-out records, operator extra board records and operator pay claim inquiries ensuring compliance with work rules and contractual provisions.
Prepare and maintain a library of standard operating procedures, work instruction documents, workflow charts, process maps, and diagrams to specify in detail current business processes.
Fulfill daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual reporting requirements by developing queries and reports from data systems using Trapeze, home-grown databases, SQL, MS Access, Crystal Reports, or other appropriate software.
Tracks overall service key performance indicators (KPIs) for transportation
Oversees the revision and update of Standard Operating Procedures

MARGINAL FUNCTIONS:

Performs other work-related duties, special projects, assignments, or tasks as assigned by the Director of Transportation.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:

This position has no supervisory responsibilities.

REQUIREMENTS:

Education and Experience:

Bachelor's Degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics.
Minimum of three (3) years' experience performing business analysis, complex report building and data analysis; for example, as Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst. Strong experience graphing data in order to display statistical data and trends.
An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered in lieu of the above requirements.
Experience utilizing – with high proficiency – Excel, Access, PowerPoint and Word, including V-Lookups, Pivot Tables, Math Functions, Linking, and Conditional Formatting.

Machines, Tools, & Equipment Used:

Ability to operate small office equipment, including copy machines or multi-line telephone systems, as well as a computer for both data entry, word processing, and/or accounting purposes.

Licenses/Certifications:

Valid Florida Driver's License or be able to obtain one within in 10 days of hire of moving to the State of Florida.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Knowledge of: Business operations analysis, trending and forecasting, math including fractions, percentages, and ratios. General office practices and administrative procedures. Excellent business writing skills including grammar, spelling, punctuation, and composition. Establishment and maintenance of record-keeping systems and procedures. Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques. Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (e.g. - Excel, SPSS, SAS etc.)
Intermediate to advanced use of MS Excel, Word, Outlook, Access, and PowerPoint. Statistical data analysis skills. Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. Interpersonal, customer service, and listening skills. Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings.
Abilities: Create accurate and visually effective spreadsheets, reports, and graphs which represent complex information in a clear way. Conduct research, analyze findings, and prepare clear and concise reports and recommendations. Establish and maintain effective working relationships with all levels of employees; maintain confidential information; prioritize work based on the ongoing demands of the department; prepare clear, concise and complete reports and correspondence; exercise initiative and work independently; operate a variety of office equipment and machines. Follow written and oral instructions. Demonstrate integrity, ingenuity, and inventiveness in the performance of assigned tasks.
Strong analytical skills to perform statistical research, analyze data, and identify trends.
Proficiency in using software applications such as Trapeze, Cisco Finesse, relational databases, SQL, MS Access, Crystal Reports, etc.
Ability to develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs).
Knowledge of operations and processes within a public transit agency or similar industry.
Excellent problem-solving skills to identify operational issues and develop effective solutions.
Strong attention to detail to ensure data integrity and accuracy.

Excellent communication skills to collaborate with key personnel, vendors, and departmental teams.

Familiarity with CAD/AVL systems for importing and managing transportation data.

Strong teamwork and collaboration skills to work with different functional teams and stakeholders.
Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities and handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
Knowledge of industry best practices and willingness to stay updated with industry trends and developments.

Who You Will Be

As a Business Analyst at Simple Syllabus and key member of the product management team, it will be your responsibility to help strategically shape the direction and development of the Simple Syllabus product. You will research customer needs, reviewing historical data and interviewing existing customers to explore feature requests and their specific use cases. You will consider internal resources and timelines, conduct market research and develop comprehensive cost/benefit analyses to support new initiatives. You will partner with multiple business units to gather stakeholder input and create comprehensive specifications on new features the engineering team can use to build functionality that aligns with customers needs. A functional expert, you will help create, organize, and manage development tickets to ensure the product vision is accurately executed. This position will also regularly collaborate with management and review project progress and report on barriers to success.

Strong information gathering
Data analysis
Attention to detail

Reporting and presentation

What’s In It For You

A chance to change the world, of course, or at the very least how higher education delivers information to students.

In a young and rapidly growing SaaS software company, you will have the ability to impact change and greatly affect the trajectory of the business. You will also receive a competitive base salary, company sponsored healthcare, 401K with matching, paid time off, and other benefits.

About Us

Based in Tampa Florida, Simple Syllabus is the fastest growing provider of syllabus management technology in North America and is used by institutions of higher learning ranging from prestigious research universities to small, private colleges with less than 1,000 students and everything in between. Simple Syllabus is a centralized, template-driven platform that enables instructors to quickly personalize and publish interactive class syllabi for mobile, web, and print formats. The application’s unique approach pulls together established institutional data such as policies, learning objectives, and course section content so faculty and staff don’t have to—saving time and ensuring easy compliance and reporting for accreditation.

The Opportunity

The Business Strategy Analyst – Deposit Offers is an individual contributor role accountable for insights, analysis, and tactics to plan and measure deposit promotional offer campaigns.
The role will set Deposits’ promotional offer learning agenda, develop recommendations for offer improvements, build business cases and influence the bank planning process to secure investments in Deposit offers. Also be accountable for setting and all leading offer related key performance indicators and key risk indicators to include designing and implementing automated monitoring to ensure compliant execution of offer campaigns (e.g., offer fulfillment dashboards to validate offers operating in line with terms and conditions). Partner closely with multiple partners to include Marketing, Bank Growth Engine, Finance, Product Strategy, and Information Technology. Successful candidates will have significant experience analyzing bank product offer campaigns and building robust financial models, while also having strong technical skills necessary to access, manipulate, and analyze data from disparate data sources.

Uses quantitative and qualitative analysis to provide thought-leadership on evolving industry trends, market developments, USAA’s strategic direction, regulatory environment, and macroeconomic trends for the business unit. Provides insights and information-based context for key stakeholders in the business unit to effectively manage, influence, and impact line of business strategy.

We offer a flexible work environment that requires an individual to be in the office 4 days per week. This position can be based in one of the following locations: San Antonio, TX, Plano, TX, Phoenix, AZ, Colorado Springs, CO, Charlotte, NC, Chesapeake, VA or Tampa, FL. Relocation assistance is not available for this position.

What you'll do:
Leads discussions with key collaborators to communicate information learned from analyses, provide input into line of business strategy development, and drive and influence business decisions.
Leads integration of the analytic strategy and business strategy.
Leads and oversees efforts to identify key business assumptions and hypotheses around line of business strategy. Continuously refines hypotheses and identifies business questions to explore further.
Develops the analytical framework and blueprint to answer business questions identified in the business portfolio, product, or member experience.
Collaborates with key stakeholders to evaluate and uncover strategic insights related to Profit & Loss performance including Product Strategy, Pricing, Marketing, Sales, Credit Risk, Distribution Channels, and Member Experience.
Applies expert analytical rigor to define outcome measures, improve prioritization, increase agility in decisioning, improve ability to evaluate progress towards business outcomes, and to evaluate risks to strategic goals.
Effectively influences and drives strategic agreement using subject matter expertise and interpersonal and negotiation skills.
Serves as a team lead and provides guidance and on-the-job training to team members.
Ensures risks associated with business activities are effectively identified, measured, monitored, and controlled in accordance with risk and compliance policies and procedures.

What you have:
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Science, Finance, Economics or related discipline; OR 4+ years of related experience (in addition to the minimum years of experience required) may be substituted in lieu of degree.
8+ years of data & analytics or strategy consulting experience; OR a minimum of 6+ years of data & analytics or strategy consulting experience and up to 2+ years of progressive functional business relevant experience within the respective industry of responsibility (i.e. P&C, Bank, Finance, Marketing etc.) for a total of 8+ years of combined experience; OR Advanced Degree in Business, Science, Finance, Economics or related discipline and 6+ years of experience in data/analytics, strategy consulting or functional business experience within the respective industry of responsibility (i.e. P&C, Bank, Finance, Marketing, etc.).
Experience identifying business needs and leading strategic plans driven by qualitative/quantitative analysis and market insights.
Strong analytical skills with experience using hypotheses-driven problem solving.
Extensive experience leading and performing complex data analysis using various data analytics tools (i.e. Microsoft Excel, Tableau, R, Python).
Experience influencing business decisions.
Experience working with leadership teams to identify key opportunities to develop and enhance business strategy using quantitative and qualitative analytics.

What sets you apart:
5+ years of deposit, credit card or payments product management experience
Significant experience analyzing deposits data, prospect databases, and transactional insights
Demonstrated experience conducting offer based performance analyses with deposit, credit card, or payments products
Strong verbal and written communication skills, especially PowerPoint
US military experience through military service or a military spouse/domestic partner

The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job.

About Paysafe

Paysafe (NYSE: PSFE) (PSFE.WS) is a leading payments platform with an extensive track record of serving merchants and consumers in the global entertainment sectors. Its core purpose is to enable businesses and consumers to connect and transact seamlessly through industry-leading capabilities in payment processing, digital wallet, and online cash solutions. With over 20 years of online payment experience, an annualized transactional volume of over $130 billion in 2022, and approximately 3,300 employees located in 12+ countries, Paysafe connects businesses and consumers across 100 payment types in over 40 currencies around the world. Delivered through an integrated platform, Paysafe solutions are geared toward mobile-initiated transactions, real-time analytics and the convergence between brick-and-mortar and online payments. Further information is available at www.paysafe.com.


Are you ready to make an impact? Join our team that is inspired by a unified vision and propelled by passion.


Position Summary:

Paysafe is looking for a Financial Analyst to join our thriving Residuals Team to drive the calculation, audit, reporting and delivery of a growing portion of our external business partner’s compensation using Paysafe proprietary systems and payments data. This role is based in Jacksonville, FL and offers a flexible hybrid work environment where you will have a blend of office days and remote working days.


You will be in the Finance organization in this role but working together in several functions such as business analytics, customer profitability, financial reporting, expense & revenue management as well as engaging other teams such as Information Technology, Risk and Operations. You enjoy following a routine monthly schedule but also enjoy figuring things out and have a bit of an innate sense of curiosity. You like working with technical things like Excel but also enjoy talking together with people.




This role will require you to bring all your calculation, process management and people skills to solve a plethora of challenges and opportunities, improving Paysafe for our employees, customers, and investors.


Your responsibilities would include:

Use Paysafe’s proprietary systems and tools to gather, interpret and analyze data in relation to customer billing and external business partner compensation
Resolve open internal and external requests for detailed compensation information using Paysafe’s intake queues
Prepare the reconciliation of:
Commissions and bonuses
Negative commissions/residuals
Analyzing monthly sales organization month over month variances
Provide necessary recurring and ad hoc reporting required for external business partners
Communicate with external business partners via email and telephone as needed on a case-by-case basis as directed by your manager. This role is not primarily external facing.
Improve existing processes and controls by establishing new data gathering and analysis techniques within the organization
Set up new external business partners in Paysafe’s systems such Oracle Incentive Compensation modules.
Make changes to rates and external business partner resources in Oracle Incentive Compensation modules
Prepare and submit various ad-hoc reports as requested by Controller, CFO and Residual Manager
Other duties as assigned by your manager.


Qualifications and Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or any related discipline required, or the equivalent combination of education, training, or working experience
One (1) to two (2) years of experience in a finance or accounting related role required
Highly proficient in Microsoft Excel using such features as Pivot Tables and the VLOOKUP function
Experience with SQL is a plus but not required
Attention to detail and accuracy
Ability to work with senior management
Advanced follow up, analytical, and organizational skills
Has a demonstratable high level of integrity and trustworthiness (due to the sensitivity and confidentiality of information and data being managed)
Professional and effective written and oral communication skills with management, colleagues, and external business partners
Conscientious about quality and timeliness of deliverables
Must be able to take initiative, make efforts to improve the department without being asked
Customer service oriented

Dependable and consistent

The University of Miami is currently seeking Research Analyst to work at Soffer Clinical Research Center in Miami. The incumbent prepares data, conducts statistical analysis and summarizes results for a variety of research projects.

Core Job Functions

1. Analyzes data and interprets research findings.
2. Identifies appropriate data sources to conduct and execute analyses.
3. Verifies accuracy and internal consistency of reports, including required state and federal reports.
4. Ensures proper technical documentation and preparation of tabular and written reports and gives oral presentations.
5. Completes surveys and reports, discipline-specific accreditation, and admission and grant proposals.
6. Provides feedback and assistance on honing conclusions and recommendations into actionable findings.
7. Adheres to University and unit-level policies and procedures and safeguards University assets.



Department Specific Functions

Participates in the management of assigned clinical trials within the Department of Epidemiology and Health Sciences.

Responsibilities include conducting survey interviews, distributing interview workload, abstracting, assembling, and organizing research data while monitoring the clinical course of patients entered into research protocols.

Participates in developing protocols with a particular focus on data collection through telephone surveys.

Maintains a working knowledge of all assigned protocols to ensure the validity of clinical research data.

Verifies patient eligibility, develops, maintains, and/or monitors case report forms or individual patient research charts, and enters clinical findings into a study-related database.

Prepares reports on individual patients or a study population in response to investigator requests.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities:

Protocol Management

Identifies, recruits, and enrolls eligible patients, their families, and/or healthy control subjects onto specified Epidemiology research protocols.

Administers questionnaires and self-report inventories to enrolled research participants (patients, parents, controls). Performs protocol-directed procedures under the supervision of the principal investigator and other study staff.

Organizes and maintains a system for monitoring subjects enrolled in longitudinal studies and ensuring the collection of data in a timely manner.

Prepares and organizes data to promote efficient computer entry.

Demonstrates knowledge of Good Clinical Practice Guidelines, IRB review, reporting requirements, and regulatory affairs.

Compiles, analyzes, and summarizes data and prepares reports for review by the principal investigator; makes recommendations for practical application of protocol.

Participates in the development of protocol roadmaps or flow sheets and may participate in the completion of reports and forms.

Data Management

Completes reports and forms and assists with developing tools to record data.

Enters research data into the study database after finalizing the data with the principal investigator.

Completes enrollment of patients.

Monitors quality of data and applies knowledge of medical terminology and physiology to create entries.

Participates in activities as a peer reviewer.

Assists with the development and/or design of tracking and analysis tools for assigned protocols.

Adheres to guidelines regarding honest reporting of sensitive and confidential clinical and administrative information.

Conceptualizes research studies and participates in the development of research designs and methodologies as well as the design of data collection instruments.

Edits received questionnaires, records refusals, and assigns non-respondents to interviewers for tracing and/or telephone interview.

Education Requirements (Essential Requirements):

A master’s degree in public health or biostatistics is preferred.

At least one year of relevant work experience

Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, and Qualtrics) preferred.

Proficiency in statistical analysis programs. The ideal candidate would be proficient with a variety of software programs, including SUDAAN or STATA.

Strong bilingual (English and Spanish) reading, writing, and oral communication skills preferred. .

This list of duties and responsibilities is not intended to be all-inclusive and may be expanded to include other duties or responsibilities as necessary.

Core Qualifications

Education:

Bachelor’s Degree in relevant field

Experience:

Minimum 2 years of relevant experience

Knowledge, Skills and Attitudes:

Skill in collecting, organizing, and analyzing data.

Ability to recognize, analyze, and solve a variety of problems.

Ability to exercise sound judgment in making critical decisions.
