Job Title: Information Security Associate - Technology Risk Assessments & Cyber Data Analysis
Job Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION


To do that, you will participate in a broad range of regulatory and non-regulatory assessments including firm wide technology risk assessment program (CORE), SOX, PCI, Application Risk (ARA) and Infrastructure Control Assessment (ICA). You will analyze evidence requirements for the firm’s technology assets against multiple control requirements and become a subject matter expert in the Technology Control and Regulatory Assessment data ecosystem. You will play an important role in engaging respective Program and Assessment Leads / Information Security Managers / Asset Owners across multiple business areas and domains. You will work to identify commonalities amongst control requirements and aligned measurement step lists that would allow for a unified “Assess Once, Use Many” approach. You will reduce effort and time spent to create readily consumable risk assessment results by utilizing software such as Alteryx, SQL, Tableau and Excel Pivots. Your objective is to help modernize and automate the manual risk identification process. You will do collaborate with risk programs, and through creative outside the box thinking, create new ways that blend collected risk data into ready-to-assess results, in an effort to modernize and reduce costly manual assessment overhead.

Your support of the noted risk assessment programs will require you to work with various global teams to understand their technical requirements and assess controls against them. You will make recommendations, based on your experience, of how we can automate the way we perform assessments across the firm as we move towards a Continuous Controls Monitoring (CCM) and as we apply other compliance automation tools. You may work on other regulatory and process risk assessment programs as well as our Evidence Management Team controls to grow and expand. Your assessment duties extend to all lines of business in the firm and will include continuously enhancing your knowledge on specific controls across a range of technologies, applications, processes, and infrastructure.

PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Assist with the ongoing firm wide technology risk controls assessment programs, test and evaluate the evidence of the controls and identify any significant control deficiencies, work with the appropriate Assessment Leads / Information Security Managers to identify and assess proposed remediation steps to adhere to those controls, and address other assessment findings where necessary.
Assist with other compliance and risk assessment programs for Global Technology, including participating in workshops to improve our ability to identify inherent risk and to adjust the descriptions of and approaches to properly obtain evidence of control effectiveness.
Use innovative data analysis methodologies and tools such as Alteryx, SQL, Tableau, and Microsoft Excel to identify the assets to be assessed and analyze the available evidence
Through tools such as Alteryx: Compile, analyze, and effectively present trending reports to identify opportunities that increase efficiency, ensure quality and support prioritization of work.
Experience with data mining methods, statistical analysis, & data visualization methods utilizing tools such as Alteryx, Tableau, Qlik Sense , Excel etc.
Test the evidence of the technical controls and document the tests in our assessment results systems of record.
Conduct Assessments to gather risk specific information about technology applications.
Conduct initial quality reviews of submitted evidence through internal tools. Ensuring basic evidence standards are meet as well as program specific standards.
Work with technology teams to gather control design requirements and facilitate discussions to bring to closure identified control issues.
Interface with the UAT and Quality Assurance team to improve assessment testing processes. Work actively with the Assessment Leads and Information Security Managers to improve technical assessment guidance.
Participate in additional key control projects related to the overall enhancement of the assessment function.
Exhibit a continuous learning mindset for security education & awareness.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor's degree, preferably in Cybersecurity (information assurance), Computer Science or Information Technology.
Two years internal or external technology audit or risk assessment experience.
Experience with Tableau, Qlik Sense, Cognos etc. a plus.
Have experience with audit and / or technology risk assessment processes and an understanding of internal controls and how they protect the firm and its clients.
Ability to effectively develop and communicate recommendations based on various technical compliance and control assessment results.
Experience with, or willingness to learn, Alteryx, Tableau, Excel Pivots.
Detail oriented with ability to examine and evaluate processes, controls and issues to determine risk areas.
Ability to eloquently describe and defend the process followed in performing assessments and evaluating results to stakeholders and management.
Can work independently and can collaborate comfortably in a matrix organization within a broader team.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to effectively participate in and sometimes lead discussions and meetings with internal management and other groups involved in technology control assessments.
Proficient in MS Office - Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Quickly adapt to new tools and software applications.
Basic time management and project management skills.
CRISC, CISM / CISA, or other industry-recognized risk and information assurance certifications preferred.

ABOUT US

JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world’s most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents and perspectives that they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs. (If you are a US or Canadian applicant with a disability and wish to request an accommodation to complete the application process, please contact us by calling the Accessibility Line (US and Canada Only) 1-866-777-4690 and indicate the specifics of the assistance needed.)

We offer a competitive total rewards package including base salary determined based on the role, experience, skill set, and location. For those in eligible roles, we offer discretionary incentive compensation which may be awarded in recognition of firm performance and individual achievements and contributions. We also offer a range of benefits and programs to meet employee needs, based on eligibility. These benefits include comprehensive health care coverage, on-site health and wellness centers, a retirement savings plan, backup childcare, tuition reimbursement, mental health support, financial coaching and more. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided during the hiring process.

JPMorgan Chase is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including Disability/Veterans







ABOUT THE TEAM

The Cybersecurity & Technology Controls group at JPMorgan Chase aligns the firm’s cybersecurity, access management, controls and resiliency teams. The group proactively and strategically partners with all lines of business and functions to enable them to design, adopt and integrate appropriate controls; deliver processes and solutions efficiently and consistently; and drive automation of controls. The group’s number one priority is to enable the business by keeping the firm safe, stable and resilient.



High Risk Roles (HRR) are sensitive roles within the technology organization that require high assurance of the integrity of staff by virtue of 1) sensitive cybersecurity and technology functions they perform within systems or 2) information they receive regarding sensitive cybersecurity or technology matters. Users in these roles are subject to enhanced pre-hire screening which includes both criminal and credit background checks (as allowed by law). The enhanced screening will need to be successfully completed prior to commencing employment or assignment.

The VIE will be in charge of supporting the commercial finance team of the Travel Retail Americas business by successfully partnering with commercial, marketing and other finance teams.
This role is expected to supply in depth, insightful commercial and financial reporting, and analysis across the region. The output should inform and understand our performance towards influencing the trajectory of the TR Americas business and improving decision making.
The VIE will also be contributing to the Revenue Growth Agenda of GTR by implementing adequate strategy driven by thorough analysis of the specificity of TR Americas as well as following the allocation of high value products.
Finally, the VIE will be responsible for managing the financials of the Canada business in collaboration with other teams, including the local domestic affiliate of Pernod Ricard, ensuring strong process are kept in place and performance is reviewed on a monthly basis.
Profile Description
Excellent interpersonal skills are critical
Adaptation and multitasking skills to evolve in a dynamic environment with multiple priorities
Proficiency with IT tools (Excel, PowerPoint, ERP, Web-apps, …) & generally keen to learn new tools
Database management: capacity to develop and implement support solution to facilitate reporting
Ability to anticipate and to respect tight deadline. Hard worker
Self-motivated and result oriented Ability to work with tight deadlines
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Work well with others on a team
Positive mindset, entrepreneurial spirit, and ability to adapt
University/School graduate (Master Degree) from an accredited university/school
Ideally have a first experience as a business analyst with exposure to reporting process
Preferably one year experience
Fluent in English
Pernod Ricard values diversity and solidarity within its organization and in its relations with stakeholders. Our recruitment methods focus on skills, and we welcome all types of talents.
WHAT IS THE V.I.E FRENCH INTERNATIONAL INTERNSHIP PROGRAM ?
Becoming an International Intern means having a secure job abroad for 6 to 24 months with a company or French administration. Whatever your background, if you are aged between 18 and 28, French or citizen of the European Economic Area (EEA), then V.I.E or V.I.A may be for you !
Please note, it is not voluntary work. Whether you are at the start of your career or doing a job with real responsibilities, you will be paid. V.I.E and V.I.A are a professional springboard.

Position Highlights:

The Research Data Analyst II (Bioinformatics) will be responsible for conducting bioinformatics analyses requiring 2 years of experience programming in Stata, SAS, R, Python, or other bioinformatic software packages under supervision of Principal Investigators from the Health Outcomes and Behavior and Cancer Epidemiology Programs. This position would support Moffitt’s Cancer Care Delivery lab (https://lab.moffitt.org/cancercaredelivery/). Examples of projects include 1) pragmatic clinical trials evaluating the effectiveness of supportive care interventions for individuals with cancer and 2) mixed methods studies to examine disparities in care delivery for individuals with cancer.




The Ideal Candidate: The ideal candidate will have a degree in health services research, health policy, economics, quantitative psychology, epidemiology or a related field and have prior experience working with diverse data types commonly used in health service research (e.g., insurance claims, complex survey, electronic health record, patient-reported outcomes). Stata programming skills are preferred but we are open to hiring candidates with experience using other statistical software packages.




Responsibilities:

Under the supervision of the PI, conducts advanced analysis requiring programming in Stata, SAS, R, Python, or other relevant statistical software package. Analysis may include but is not limited to survival analysis, casecontrol analyses, cohort analyses, etc.
Performs bioinformatic data quality control prior to analysis implementation.
Determines appropriate statistical methods to achieve project aims.
Collects and manages survey, insurance claims, and clinical data. Develops custom databases with oversight from the PI.
Collects big data from multiple resources and determining appropriate merging procedures with existing analytic data.
Reviews data, ensuring accuracy and completeness of data.
Assures adherence to quality control standards established for data management.
Assists in scientific interpretation and writing/reporting of research for publication.
Effectively communicates the results of analyses to researchers.
Summarizes complex analyses in visual form that is interpretable by many levels of expertise, including clinicians.
Document all stages of data cleaning, analysis and visualization with an eye towards reproducibility.
Serves as contact for coinvestigators and other research affiliates.
Performs literature and software tool searches. Reads, summarizes and implements applicable relevant findings.
Under the direction of the PI, coordinates and develops correspondence and responses to various outside agencies regarding research activities.



Credentials and Qualifications:

Master’s degree in health services research, health policy, economics, quantitative psychology, epidemiology, biostatistics, bioinformatics, computer science, computational biology or related field with 2 years of relevant experience with bioinformatic packages is required.
Or Bachelor's Degree in related field and 7 years of relevant experience with bioinformatic packages is required.
Completion of an intense data boot camp is equivalent to 1 year of experience.
Experience programming in Stata, R, Python, SAS or some other statistical software required.

Location: H. Lee Moffitt Cancer Center & Research Institute · Health Outcomes-Staff
Schedule: Full Time, Day Shift, M-F 8-5 pm

The Opportunity:
The Department of Philanthropy and Alumni Data Services is currently recruiting for a Business Analyst to work with department leadership and staff to develop technology-driven solutions for Philanthropy and Alumni Engagement (PAE) that focus on two key themes: business process improvements and enabling the division’s staff success by providing seamless access to information and tools required for that success. The Business Analyst will lead the PAE division through process improvements and system changes, always reviewing to ensure we are leveraging best practices in data management and access. This position will understand the core business processes of the department and work with Information Technology (IT) to ensure the technology solutions enable efficient and effective use of the tools. The Business Analyst integrates business knowledge of the University with technical knowledge of the systems. This position is highly analytical by nature and can identify and implement efficiencies within the various process and systems used in PAE.

The Business Analyst will also provide ad hoc reporting for the division, which includes creating, updating queries and communication lists. They will be expected to gather the data requirements and understand how the data will be used to ensure we are providing all the data required to enable a process or decision. Works in conjunction with the Sr. Business Analyst and the AVP to support technology and reporting needs of the entire office and those of external constituents, as well as analyzing and improving processes across work areas.

The Business Analyst plays a crucial role as the department’s liaison to the University Information Technology, providing vital support for advancement systems and support the implementation of UC Innovation’s Ascend product (Salesforce CRM platform). In this capacity, the Business Analyst actively contributes to the development, configuration, testing, and implementation of new initiatives and system enhancements. This involves the gathering of requirements and close collaboration with the IT team to deliver innovative solutions. The role encompasses a range of responsibilities, including researching and applying best practices for philanthropic organizations, in-depth analysis of constituent data (including Alumni, Donors, and Prospects), evaluating CRM system data, and providing support for 3rd party philanthropic tools integrated within Salesforce such as iWave and Double the Donation. Additionally, the Business Analyst examines constituent history, creates reports utilizing Salesforce Report Builder for key stakeholders, modifies Salesforce List views for improved data accessibility, and designs tailored Salesforce dashboards to meet the specific needs of various business departments, and automation of Salesforce Documents using 3rd party generation tools. The Business Analyst plays a pivotal role in making recommendations regarding relationship strategies and constituent data based on industry best practices. The ideal candidate is characterized by their proactive, energetic, and tenacious approach, coupled with an attention to detail. They possess the ability to work collaboratively with University staff, furthering the University’s mission to fund-raise and friend-raise from its constituencies.
Qualifications
Bachelors degree in statistics, business, data analytics or a related field.
At least one year of experience working with CRM technology and data.
Experience using various data analytics and reporting tools including Salesforce Reports & Dashboards and Microsoft Excel. Create reports based on the findings, and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to identify successful initiatives.
Basic troubleshooting and root cause analysis skills
Ability to read and interpret data, draw conclusions from the data, and propose strategies or recommendations based on those conclusions
Ability to effectively communicate and influence key stakeholders to support proposed strategies, process improvements and operational decisions
Ability to effectively document solutions to support departmental continuity and sustainability
A broad understanding of fundraising and alumni engagement processes and data, preferably in higher education • Experience as a data analyst or business analyst.
Knowledge of, and proficiency in, Salesforce CRM based business systems and technology applications.
Familiarity with Ellucian Advance or similar fundraising applications/constituent relationship management systems.

Associate Risk Analyst


Centauri Specialty Insurance is a growing property and casualty insurance carrier with a ton of positive energy regarding the future of our organization. Summary:

Responsible for supporting the Company’s risk management process through data modeling and analysis.


Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Assist in managing the month-end modeling data process, including preparing and analyzing data, running queries and updating macros.
Assist with automating procedures around exposure/loss data from SQL and R/Python scrips.
Complete all business owner’s policy, commercial residential property, and high value home quoting.
Run daily NOAA severe convective storm (SCS) query and manage the output.

Experience with one or more of the following programming languages: Python, R, SQL, VBA.
Knowledge of P&C insurance, underwriting principles, and catastrophe risk management (preferred, but not required).

Your Specific Responsibilities:

This is a highly responsible professional position located in the Early Steps program, which is in the Bureau of Early Steps and Newborn Screening. The Early Steps program performs the functions and oversight required under the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA), Part C and Part III of Chapter 391, Florida Statutes. The individual in this position is responsible for the fiscal monitoring of programs and activities in the state to ensure that the state complies with all requirements in IDEA, Part C, state statutes, and enforce any obligations imposed on agencies, in addition to performing program manager activities. The position requires travel, and the incumbent is responsible for the following.




Assists with fiscal oversight and monitoring activities for the Early Steps program. Provide methods to ensure the provision of financial responsibility for Part C services per 34 CFR §303.120, §303.225, §303.414, §303.500, §303.510, §303.511, §303.520, §303.521.




Prepares and conducts financial reconciliation of Division contracts using quarterly and annual expenditure review documents. This position works with the Division's contract managers and Early Steps programmatic subject matter experts to complete testing of expenditures, including sampling line-item expenditures for salaries, travel and non-salary expenses from the contract provider’s formal accounting records. Ensures that contracts remain compliant with Department contractual policies and procedures. Tracks quarterly and annual reconciliations across the Division’s contracts to ensure completion and prompt return of funding to the Department.




Performs technical assistance to Early Steps contract managers and fiscal unit staff as it relates to reconciling financial records including payment issues, invoice corrections, FACTS reconciliation, assisting in resolving disputes or questions raised by external auditing entities (Auditor General and federal), DOH Finance and Accounting or the Department of Financial Services.




Serves as a technical expert for audits of contracts and contractual services. Gathers requested documentation and prepares documents in response to auditor inquiries. Works closely with the Division Contract Liaison and the Office of Contracts to communicate audit findings internally and ensure contracts remain compliant with statutes, rules and policies.




Review, evaluate, and track implementation of corrective action plans to ensure correction of any noncompliance identified through monitoring and complaint investigations as soon as possible and, within one year after identification of noncompliance.




Participate in teams conducting onsite and desk review monitoring of assigned Local Early Steps (LES) programs in the state.




Performs other work-related duties as requested.




Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Skills in mathematical computation and review of detailed accounting and numerical documents; Knowledge of fiscal and administrative policies and procedures; Ability to organize and manage time wisely; Skills in problem solving and analytical skills; knowledge of generally accepted budget and contract management policies and procedures; computer software skills to include experience with FLAIR, FACTS, Word, Outlook and Excel. Skills in customer service orientation; ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing; ability to interpret, understand and apply applicable rules, regulations and policies and procedures; Ability to search the internet for business related information; review, classify, categorize, prioritize, and/or analyze data and/or information; work independently on difficult or complex tasks; understand and carry out complicated oral and written instructions; prioritize workload and manage multiple projects simultaneously; follow through on issues in a timely manner; be flexible, work effectively with lots of interruptions and at a fast pace and produce quality work in highly stressful situations; work under stress and maintain a pleasant, courteous interaction with others; Ability to travel.

Additionally, this position will work with individual users and design, code and test reports, and determine specific reporting requirements, working collegially with colleagues in University Initiatives, Data Information Systems and schools/college/units.

University Initiatives Data Support

Oversee quarterly Leadership Annual Giving Officer portfolio refreshes, working directly with Leadership Annual Giving Officers to compile records and assign regions/areas to each LAGO.
Partner with University Initiatives to add immediate referrals from annual giving directly to LAGO portfolios.

Create visually pleasing and easy to read reports that support lead generation and pipeline development strategies within the LAGO program and University Initiatives.

Lead Generation and Referrals

Oversee process for screening donor lists from Annual Giving activity to determine leads for pipeline.
Utilize donor model scores to create and track referrals for vetted overflow for LAGO program or research for prospect research.

Reports and Dashboards

Provide annual giving reporting services to partners in colleges and units with a focus on the following types of reporting: audience analysis, annual giving results, and prospect identification.

Analysis

Modify interactive dashboards, on-demand reports, and visualizations, utilizing existing software such as Cognos, Salesforce, Tableau and other web platforms, to drive the strategic decisions and daily workflow of annual giving team and strategies that generate leads for major gift pipeline.

Position Type :

Full time

Associate Development Program (Full Time Hire)

Job Description

Are you curious, motivated, and forward-thinking? At FIS, you will have the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging and relevant issues in financial services and technology. Our talented people empower us, and we believe in being part of a team that is open, collaborative, entrepreneurial, passionate, and above all, fun.


Join the 2024 FIS University Program!


As a 2024 FIS University Program full-time employee, you will have the opportunity to participate in team projects, community service activities, professional development seminars and work with a team that is invested in your growth, development, and success; including bi-annual performance connects with your manager.


This two-year full-time program has start dates in January, March, June, and September with a dedicated “Learning Week” where you will:

Learn how to work within a corporate environment

Learn about the exciting world of Fintech and the role FIS plays

Hear from FIS leadership about their journey and participate in senior leader networking opportunities

Build a network of your peers from across the organization


This position is for a January 2024 start.


About the team

As part of the global fintech firm, FIS, the Wealth business is a leading, award-winning, global provider of technology and service solutions to the wealth management industry across North America and the UK. FIS Wealth supports banks, investment houses, asset managers, and family offices in growing their businesses, against a backdrop of an explosive digital evolution of the industry and during a period of complete reframing of the global wealth management sector. The business services some $3trn of clients’ assets annually and holds assets under administration of c. $1.6trn.


What you will be doing

Working closely with Enterprise Strategist to analyze market landscape and corporate-wide research and development decisions and align with corporate vision and strategy

Working closely with strategic pricing personnel to advise and influence the Head of Strategy on revenue and profit-maximizing pricing, pricing strategy, and key account revenue structure

In conjunction with competitive intelligence personnel, analyze and create presentations including details on competitors, mega-trends, strategic threats, and industry inflection points

Help define and create the Strategy Team roadmap containing relevant meetings/sessions and timely creation of updates to ensure the Strategy is continually broadcast across relevant corporate teams.

Analyze the financial data across the Wealth business units and present the raw data and the relevant informed insights and conclusions

Analyze and identify possible new growth initiatives, and build a pipeline of opportunities for partnerships that will result in growing the business


What you bring

Bachelor’s degree in relevant field of study

Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite

Fluent in English; Strong written and verbal communication skills

Adaptability, a drive to learn, and strong problem-solving skills

Ability to work well independently and within a team


Bonus if you have

Good analytical and dissemination skills

Understanding of and ability to analyze business financial numbers

An interest in technology and themes affecting and driving the wealth management and asset servicing industry

***NEW ROLE***IT SECURITY ANALYST***6 MONTH CONRACT


Title: IT Security Analyst

Location: Tampa, FL

Duration: 6 months

Comp: 45-55


SUMMARY: The IT Security Analyst monitors AUEM’s networks for security breaches and investigates when one occurs. The ideal candidate will use and maintain software, such as firewalls and data encryption, to protect sensitive information while checking for vulnerabilities in computer and network systems.

RESPONSIBILITIES: Those duties are necessary to meet the minimum requirements of the position. Other duties may be assigned.




This position, reporting to the Global IT Director, will assist in the management of the security policy framework and relevant standards and overseeing applicable security and compliance requirements (i.e. CIS, SOC2, ISO27001, NIST) through strategy development, controls definition and assessment and process oversight




Responsibility and maintenance for policies, procedures, and controls to assure compliance with applicable regulatory, legal and audit requirements as well as good business practices.




Lead in the establishment and overseeing of formal IT Security Audit and self-assessments program for various information services, systems, processes, and recognized industry standards




Identify, assess, manage, and track remediation of standards, processes, and procedures relating to the IT infrastructure, applications, platforms, and suppliers and drive explicit requirements and timelines in all environments.




Develop strong relationships with our Application Development team as well as all other departments and key stakeholders to ensure standards and compliance oversight is understood, managed appropriately and current with all standards, guidelines, and regulations that are applicable




Drive in the development of security compliance strategy and approach and ensure compliance with NIST, SOC2, ISO27001, Critical Infrastructure, contractual requirements and globally recognized standards and guidelines




Identify regulatory, legislative, and industry specific compliance requirements and define controls that can be used to meet those requirements




Assist Universal Contract, Marketing and Account Management department teammates with both current and pre-sales customer questionnaires and security assessments




Attend training seminars, conferences, and trade shows to broaden knowledge of current and future cybersecurity and risk management issues and technologies




This will be a management position with no direct reports.

QUALIFICATIONS: To perform this job successfully, the individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or experience required in order to be hired. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Proven track record of developing and maintaining Corporate IT Security policies and procedures.


Formal Education, Licenses, and Certifications Required:


Bachelor’s degree in IT, Management, or Leadership related fields


Type and Length of Specific Experience Required:

Two (2) plus years of Cyber Security work

Five (3) plus years of IT Compliance or Security Risk Assessments/Audits experience

Relevant Certifications: Security+, CRISC, CISA, or CISSP (not required but a huge plus)

Strong knowledge of industry frameworks, such as CIS, ISO and NIST

Prior experience in the electronic monitoring industry preferred but not required


PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS AND ENVIRONMENT:

Office environment with minimal to no exposure to extreme temperatures expected

Major activities include working on PC while sitting, telephone use

Physical effort is limited, to include some standing, bending, light lifting, and limited stretching and reaching

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions

This is a hybrid role with the expectation of 2-3 days on-site/in-person collaboration with teammates and stakeholders. May require up to 10% travel.

Overview:

The Data Governance Analyst will play a vital role in ensuring the accuracy, security, and compliance of HR data within our organization. You will collaborate with stakeholders to develop and enforce data governance policies, implement data quality standards, and drive data-related initiatives. This position also serves as a technical point-of-contact for the assigned functional area and assists subject matter experts with ensuring data integrity, testing of system changes, report writing and analyzing data flows for process improvement opportunities. This position will also support HRMS upgrades, patches, testing and other technical projects as assigned.

Responsibilities:

Essential duties include, but are not limited to:




Develop and enforce data governance policies, procedures, and data standards to ensure data integrity, accuracy, and security.
Collaborate with HR leadership to develop and implement a comprehensive data governance strategy for HR data, aligning with organizational goals and compliance requirements
Collaborate with functional users and IT in the review, testing and implementation of HR system upgrades or patches.
Maintain data integrity and facilitate effective decision-making across the HR function.
Recommend process/customer service improvements and serve as a key liaison with third parties and other stakeholders (e.g. Payroll or Training) providing overall project management for the given HR initiative.
Identify opportunities to leverage HR data for strategic initiatives, reporting, and analytics
Assist in the maintaining data integrity by running queries and analyzing data.
Qualifications:

Qualifications

Experience:




Degree in Human Resources, Data Management, Information Technology, Computer Science, HR Data Analytics or related field or equivalent work experience.
Professional certification such as CPP, CEBS, PHR is preferred
3 - 5 years of HRIS, HR generalist or specialist experience.
1 - 2 years of project management experience, to include systems implementation.
Exceptional analytical and problem solving skills.
Excellent interpersonal skills, able to build business partnerships with end users or IT and influence outcomes.
Strong communication skills - written, verbal, ability to communicate effectively with all levels of a global organization.
Self-motivated, work with minimal guidance, ability to work under pressure while delivering high quality results.
Requires strong mathematical, analytical, critical thinking and problem solving skills; must be highly detail oriented.
Ability to maintain the highest degree of confidentiality in all matters related to employee compensation and benefits.


Work Environment:

Duties and responsibilities are typically performed in a professional office setting, but there may be times where you will need to be in operating areas. In these areas, you may be exposed to environmental factors including, but not limited to, second hand smoke and excessive noise.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms, talk or hear; and taste or smell. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close, distance, color, and peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.

The Florida Office of Insurance Regulation (OIR) Strives to promote a stable and competitive insurance market for consumers. With a workforce of approximately 250 staff members, OIR regulates one of the largest, most complex insurance markets in the world.




OIR offers a range of challenging and rewarding opportunities for individuals looking to grow in their career and offers a wide variety of top insurance – related courses and professional certifications to ensure that its staff has the industry knowledge needed to succeed. OIR employees also have access to the State of Florida’s tuition waiver program, which offers educational assistance to full time, salaried employees.




As a State Agency, OIR offers excellent benefits such as health insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, retirement plans, flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, and much more. OIR also offers annual and sick leave, a generous holiday schedule, and flexible work schedules.

https://myfrs.com/ContactUs.htm




Brief Description of Duties and Responsibilities:




Perform independent complex actuarial calculations related to the review and analysis of Office regulated entities filings. Exercise discretion and judgement to determine compliance with state laws and whether the requests received are reasonable and adequate.




Assembles, reviews and analyzes data submitted using computer applications to perform actuarial work.




Responds to ad hoc requests from management.




Assists in the development and implementation of new policies and procedures.




Represents the Office by participating in conference calls and meetings with other state regulators and industry representatives to discuss compliance requirements, develop standards, and address concerns.




Performs other related work as required.




Minimum Qualifications for this position include the following REQUIRED ENTRY LEVEL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:

Knowledge of methods of compiling, organizing, and analyzing data.
Knowledge of actuarial practices and procedures.
Ability to use computer applications to perform actuarial work.
Ability to communicate effectively verbally and in writing.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with others.



Other KSAs:

Ability to work independently and organize time effectively.
Ability to solve problems and make decisions.



SPECIAL NOTES:




This position requires a security background check, including fingerprint as a condition of employment.




This position requires a Bachelor’s degree or higher from an accredited college or university with a major in mathematics, statistics, insurance or related field.




This is a non-remote on-site position located in Tallahassee, FL.




A work sample will be given to all qualified candidates.

Job Title: Business Analyst I, FIS University Program
Job Description:
Position Type :

Full time

Type Of Hire :

Associate Development Program (Full Time Hire)

Education Desired :

Bachelor's Degree

Travel Percentage :

0%

Job Description

Are you curious, motivated, and forward-thinking? At FIS, you will have the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging and relevant issues in financial services and technology. Our talented people empower us, and we believe in being part of a team that is open, collaborative, entrepreneurial, passionate and above all, fun.

Join the 2024 FIS University Program!

As a 2024 FIS University Program full-time employee, you will have the opportunity to participate in team projects, community service activities, professional development seminars and work with a team that is invested in your growth, development, and success; including bi-annual performance connects with your manager.

This two-year full-time program has start dates in January, March, June, and September with a dedicated “Learning Week” where you will:

Learn how to work within a corporate environment
Learn about the exciting world of Fintech and the role FIS plays
Hear from FIS leadership about their journey and participate in senior leader networking opportunities
Build a network of your peers from across the organization

This position is for a January 24, 2024 start.

About the team

The Travel Management Team is a diverse and multicultural group responsible for FIS Global Travel including 41 countries. Through effective teamwork, we ensure to enable exceptional support while maximizing value and enduring a good return on the trip expense and the traveler’s time. Our Business Travel Program focuses on simplicity, quality of care, employee experience and cost efficiency.

What you will be doing

Collect and analyze data from various reporting sources, including booking information, expense statistics, surveys, financial data, procurement spend, and market research.
Develop and maintain travel reports and dashboards to communicate travel program performance and key metrics.
Conduct benchmarking and industry research to stay updated on best practices and emerging trends in travel management.
Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation, including business process flows, systems diagrams, and user guides.
Assist in the developing and implementing AI-generated insights and powered travel policies and procedures.

What you bring

Bachelor’s degree in relevant field of study (such as: Economics, Finance, Hospitality, Industrial Engineering, Accounting, Business)
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite
Fluent in English; Strong written and verbal communication skills
Adaptability, a drive to learn, and strong problem-solving skills
Ability to work well independently and within a team

Bonus if you have

Ability in using data analysis tools and software (Excel, SQL, Power BI)
Familiarity with AI technologies and tools such as machine learning algorithms and natural language processing.
Minor in Hospitality, Sustainability, or any other field related to Travel.

What we offer you

Competitive salary and excellent benefits
The chance to work on some of the most challenging, relevant issues in financial services & technology
A broad range of professional education and personal development possibilities – FIS is your final career step!
Time to support charities and give back to your community
A work environment built on collaboration, flexibility, and respect
Student Loan Repayment Program: FIS will PAY OFF participants’ undergraduate loan balance over 10 years of service! Eligibility starts after one year of tenure in the program. The benefit applied to undergraduate student loans for US-based degrees and must be in the employee’s name.

*Current and future sponsorship are not available for this position*

Florida Crystals is a leading domestic sugar producer and North America’s first fully integrated cane sugar company, guiding our sugar from farm to table. We are America’s first and only producer of certified organic sugar, grown and harvested in the United States. Our renewable energy facility is the largest of its kind in North America and provides clean energy that powers our sugar operations, which helps us reduce our use of fossil fuels. Florida Crystals also sustainably farms rice, sweet corn and other vegetables in rotation with our sugarcane. Our rice mill is the only rice mill in Florida.


OVERVIEW

Conducts sample collection and Quality Testing to support the Sem Chi Rice Products Harvesting, Milling and Packaging Operations.


DETAILED ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Conducts sample collection and testing for chemical / physical testing of rice, rice brokens / Brewer’s Rice and rice flour following established methods.
Maintains records, databases, procedures and other documentation related to testing and reporting and checking food safety and food quality attributes.
Sample submission to external labs for testing not completed at the facility or within the network.
Participates in laboratory Proficiency Testing to demonstrate proficiency.
Conduct daily, recorded walk through inspections of the operation to verify quality standards are being maintained and supports the Direct Observation program for quality inspections.
Support role in Food Safety and Food Quality training programs.
Support role-maintaining plant Food Safety/HACCP plan.
Participate in / contributes to monthly internal food safety audits.
Performs routine quality analyses
Monitors and maintains calibrations for lab equipment
Monitors lab instrument performance makes adjustments and/or alerts supervision to instrument problems
Reports to Supervisor the general condition of equipment and recommends replacement when necessary
Entering raw data into multiple databases and maintain chronology of entries
Analyzes environmental samples collected at throughout the facility as required by environmental regulations
Maintains the inventory of reagents, chemicals, and supplies needed for analyses within the lab
Provides coverage for the as needed
Upholds standards for work area cleanliness
Maintains required records and documentation
Prepares reports for interested stakeholders and abides by the Lab’s high customer service standards
Performs other duties as may be assigned
Must be able to work with minimal supervision
Must be able to maintain varied hours
Must be able to communicate both in written and verbal formats to various skill levels of employees
Must support food safety and food quality systems by auditing refinery areas and systems as well as by data collection and analysis
Must be familiar with effective inventory management practices
Must be able to effectively multi-task and prioritize workload
Must be able to analyze data for trends and to interpret and apply company and customer specifications
Performs testing used to make significant financial decisions
Able to work both independently and in a team environment
High regard safety as a core value
Must have technical writing skills
Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word, and other Office applications
High attention to detail and accuracy
Ability to walk, stand, and lift up to 50 lbs. on a regular basis


ESSENTIAL CAPABILITIES (KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES AND PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES)

Change Management- Challenges the status quo; encourages people to question existing methods, practices, and assumptions. Responds positively and enthusiastically to novel ideas and suggestions; supports people in their efforts to try new things; seeks ways to implement new ideas. Coordinated, structured period of transition from one situation to another in order to achieve sustainable positive outcome.
Accountability: Takes accountability for delivering on commitments; owns mistakes and uses them as opportunities for learning and development; openly discusses his/her actions and their consequences both good and bad.
Credibility - Adheres to a set of core values that are represented in decisions and actions. Does the right thing, even when it is difficult. Demonstrates technical proficiency, reliable customer service and delivery of results in supporting clients; speaks with authority and is respected by others; maintains objectivity in dealing with issues. Removes/ minimizes bias from decisions.
Quality Management- Knowledge and application of food industry quality systems; Knowledge and application of procedures required for testing food quality.
Acting with Integrity: Clearly states goals and beliefs; lets people know his/her true intentions; does what he she said they would do; follows through on commitments; Understands and follows company policies
Communication & Interpersonal Skills: Expresses ideas and information in a clear and concise manner; tailors message to fit the interests and needs of the audience; delivers information in a manner that is interesting and compelling to the listener
Energy & Initiative: Takes action on his/her own without being prompted; handles problems independently; able to resolve issues without relying on extensive help from others; does more than is expected or asked; asserts one's influence over events to achieve goals
Judgment & Decision-Making: Bases decisions on a systematic review of relevant facts and information; avoids making assumptions or rushing to judgment; provides clear rationale for decisions
Customer Orientation – Addressing internal and/or external customer needs by providing and delivering professional, helpful, high quality service and support


EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS

An entry laboratory background (or one years’ related experience). College degree preferred but not required in Food Science, Chemistry, Biology, or 1-3 years of food safety and food quality experience. Preferred familiarity with USDA standards for Rice Inspection and Evaluations.


LOCATION OF ROLE

Sem Chi

Raymond James is seeking a Senior ServiceNow Technical Business Analyst for the ServiceNow Platform Team. The ServiceNow Platform Team provides technology solutions and support across the entire Raymond James Organization built on the ServiceNow platform.

As a Senior ServiceNow Technical Business Analyst, you will work closely with business owners across the Raymond James organization to maintain a solid knowledge of the functional capabilities of the various areas on the ServiceNow platform. You will use agile methods to analyze, define and document requirements. You will work with business owners, the development team(s), and leadership to drive consensus on scope, design, and implementation decisions. You will also conduct agile ceremonies to your assigned area of focus. This role will follow a hybrid workstyle in one of the following locations: Saint Petersburg, FL (33716), Memphis, TN (38120), or Southfield, MI (48075).

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Manage stakeholders, collect requirements, and design solutions to meet business process and application requirements.
Establishes story acceptance criteria, necessary metrics, and overall intent/goal.
Translates technical complexities to business owners to drive solutions.
Communication and coordination between the relevant business owners and the agile development team.
Ensures the scrum team has a clear understanding of end-user stories to be developed in the system.
Create and maintain issue logs, schedule meetings, and take meeting minutes (when needed).
Communication and coordination between the relevant business owners and the agile development teams.
Participates in sprint reviews by representing business owner’s interests and coordinating with them to elicit feedback.
Performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Qualifications


Education/Previous Experience:

Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, MIS, Business or related degree and three (3) to five (5) years of relevant experience or a combination of education, training and experience.
Minimum of three (3) to five (5) years of experience as an IT Business, Data, or Systems Analyst.
Minimum of three (3) to five (5) years of experience documenting and analyzing business processes in the form of end-user agile stories.
Minimum three (3) years of experience supporting business analyst work within ServiceNow is desired.
Experience supporting two (2) or more ServiceNow products: ITSM, ITOM, SecOps, IRM, SPM, etc.
Financial Services experience highly preferred.

Licenses/Certifications:

None required.
ITIL Certification is nice to have.

Raymond James Guiding Behaviors
At Raymond James our associates use five guiding behaviors (Develop, Collaborate, Decide, Deliver, Improve) to deliver on the firm's core values of client-first, integrity, independence and a conservative, long-term view.

We expect our associates at all levels to:
Grow professionally and inspire others to do the same
Work with and through others to achieve desired outcomes
Make prompt, pragmatic choices and act with the client in mind
Take ownership and hold themselves and others accountable for delivering results that matter
Contribute to the continuous evolution of the firm
At Raymond James – as part of our people-first culture, we honor, value, and respect the uniqueness, experiences, and backgrounds of all of our Associates. When associates bring their best authentic selves, our organization, clients, and communities thrive. The Company is an equal opportunity employer and makes all employment decisions on the basis of merit and business needs.

Headquartered in Dublin, Ohio, Cardinal Health, Inc. (NYSE: CAH) is a global, integrated healthcare services and products company connecting patients, providers, payers, pharmacists and manufacturers for integrated care coordination and better patient management.

Cardinal Health’s Information Security team is on a tremendous growth journey adding several new team members in our CyberOps, Resiliency, Security Architecture, and IT Risk and Compliance teams. We aim to be a world-class cybersecurity and risk management organization that enables Cardinal Health to be healthcare’s most trusted partner.

We currently have a career opening for an IT Business Analyst.

Responsibilities

Business Analysis is responsible for deeply understanding the business in multiple functional areas and across Business Units, as well as understanding the application landscape and capabilities. They maintain relationships with the business and leverage requirements engineering practices and methods to enable improved business processes to drive business success. They align business strategies and capability needs into business and technical requirements to ensure IT systems enable the desired value.

Leads sessions using variety of requirements gathering methods such as interviews, documentation analysis, surveys, site visits, business models with executives, managers, developers and subject matter experts.
Facilitates the team through the analysis of, and makes recommendations towards, complex business decisions.
Mediates across different IT teams utilizing knowledge of IT and roles and responsibilities within the organization.
Focuses on process analysis and re-engineering, with an understanding of technical problems and solutions as they relate to the current and future business environment.
Demonstrates excellent listening, communication, and facilitation skills.
Knows and executes best practices for business analysis processes and functions (from an industry and strategic standpoint.
Defines requirements in accordance with SDP/SDLC, management and project/product scope. Ensures problem statements and objectives are clearly defined. Ensures requirements are aligned to project scope, objectives and strategies.

Qualifications

Proven experience as an IT Business Analyst in a corporate environment.
Experience gathering end user requirements and coordinating solutions with a technical team.
Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent work experience preferred.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office products preferred.
Experience in creating application relevant reporting.

Accountabilities

Work closely with the business, IT and Security Teams.
Provide documentation for new Operational Technology Security applications, processes, and services.
Collaborate with the Security Architecture, OT Security, Network, and Enterprise Architecture teams.
Document Security Architecture standards and patterns into consumable playbooks to be leveraged by IT Solution Delivery teams.
Work to develop an Agile process or modified Waterfall for delivery of defects and enhancements.
Work with IT and Business teams to develop reporting on application performance, customer experience, issue trending, etc.…
Work from Home opportunity

Candidates who are back-to-work, people with disabilities, without a college degree, and Veterans are encouraged to apply.

We believe that the way we work can add meaning and value to the world. That ideas inspire positive change. That coloring outside the lines can illuminate fresh perspectives. And that small details yield important realizations. Above all, we believe that collaboration is the best way forward.

We are currently seeing a driven professional with an existing analytical background in the Seaware platform to join the Windstar team! This new role works in conjunction with corporate and ship-based IT team members, Windstar (WSC) and Xanterra management teams, and the Seaware Operations team to provide overall support and technology product ownership for the Seaware reservations platform. You will work closely with all WSC departments to oversee the end to end use of the reservations platform to ensure that it meets the current and future needs and preferences of all business stakeholders. The position is also actively involved in the planning, design, training, and ongoing support of the reservations platform as well as other duties assigned by the Windstar Regional Director of IT.

Responsibilities (Text Only):

Develop a complete understanding of how Windstar uses the Seaware platform.
Collaborate and coordinate with users from Guest Services, Revenue, Inventory, Accounting, Sales, Marketing, Hotel Operations and IT departments to determine the overall vision and roadmap for the reservations platform.
Work with business users to understand and anticipate platform needs and translate them into actionable product requirements.
Serve as primary liaison between WSC and its software vendors to track prospective product enhancements and bug fixes, managing these backlog items, and their prioritization, to ensure the evolution of the product and its ability to meet and adjust to the company’s needs.
Oversee all stages of product evolution including long-term planning, budget, design, and delivery.
Meet regularly with the Seaware Operations team and other interested stakeholders to monitor and evaluate product progress at each stage in the application lifecycle. Regularly publish meeting notes and artifacts to keep all team members apprised of the product roadmap.
Serve as primary subject matter expert (SME) on the reservations platform to provide suggestions to end users on optimal use and configuration of the various application modules.
Monitor and enforce compliance with multiple industry and government data security and data privacy mandates including PCI-DSS, GDPR, CCPA, and others.
Serve as a technical business liaison and project management counterpart while working with application software vendors used by the organization and identified as core business partners and software providers. While working with the application software vendors, this individual is responsible for business requirements gathering, functional analysis, specification and software design and documentation on needs/requirements requested in future releases of the product.
Oversee vendor system documentation and the catalog of company internal system documentation and application knowledge to ensure that it conforms to the current state and use of the application.
Manage, design, and maintain application permissions, including user roles and permissions. Perform regular audits of system permissions to ensure the application conforms to principles of least privilege.
Review, audit logins for the internal Guest Service team, travel agents, and consumer web portals. Track the usage of all Seaware environments – including production, development, test and training – by both internal and external users. Work with the Infrastructure team to make sure that virtual environments are properly provisioned to meet performance and cost objectives.
Manage and maintain reporting requirements and the reporting change list, and work with WSC and corporate resources to monitor the backlog of reporting and analytics requests.
Assist with the implementation and service delivery change process of incremental vendor software releases and interfaces. (Scheduling, Communications, System & User documentation)
Track the usage of all Seaware environment(s).
Internal and External Usage
Current Dev, Test & Train environments
Assists in the patching of environments supported by Windstar and Xanterra IT to address updates as well as security vulnerabilities identified by the Infrastructure & Security team.
Work with other members of the IT team to proactively monitor the Seaware platform to identify and report issues and track their resolution.
Serve in an on-call capacity for after-hours/non-business hour support.
Monitor Revenue and Pricing, Sales and Marketing Chat(s), TEAMS, email and meetings for Seaware, My Windstar general reservation issues.
Qualifications (Text Only):

Strong existing knowledge of the Seaware reservations platform, including data dictionary, third-party interfaces and integrations.
Will follow and implement Information Security Policies
Will be familiar with basic ITIL framework.
Will be Guest and Crew focused.
Solid understanding of operational and analytical reporting requirements.
Able to read and write step by step instructions to implement and pass on operational knowledge.
Familiarity with PCI-DSS and data privacy compliance requirements
Communicate with outside sources in relation to the integrations of the reservation platform.
Basic understanding of Application development, SQL, and cloud services.

Role Overview:

Do you want to make an impact on a growing team? Do you want to work for a company with a great culture that values you? Come join us at Trazi as a Business Analyst! The Business Analyst will turn data into actionable insights to improve our business process and help create and manage our business intelligence infrastructure. You’ll have direct contact with company leaders and will be key to interpreting complex information and translating it in a way that’s understandable to all. The ideal candidate will possess a strong analytical mindset, exceptional problem-solving skills and a deep understanding of Power BI.

Trazi Ventures is a web management company that owns and manages several online e-commerce businesses. We have been a leader in this space for the last 5 years and continue to grow year after year.

Responsibilities and Duties:
Data Analysis, Interpretation, and Application
Apply a deep understanding of Power BI’s data visualization capabilities to interpret complex datasets and convey key insights to both technical and non-technical audiences
Transform raw data into actionable intelligence, enabling stakeholders to make informed decisions
Proactively identify challenges and bottlenecks in data processes, proposing and implementing innovative solutions
Present findings and insights derived from Power BI reports to stakeholders
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify issues, troubleshoot and optimize Power BI solutions for enhanced performance
Collaborate with stakeholders across various business units to understand their information needs and requirements
Conduct thorough analysis of business processes and data sources to identify opportunities for improvement
Work closely with database administrators and data engineers to ensure seamless data flow
Provide training to end-users on navigating and interpreting Power BI reports.
Provide support for Power BI-related issues and troubleshoot problems as they arise
Report Development and Data Management:
Design, develop, and maintain Power BI reports and dashboards.
Create visually appealing and user-friendly reports to convey complex data insights.
Analyze business requirements and translate them into technical specifications for Power BI reports.
Develop data models and relationships to support accurate reporting.
Extract data from various sources and transform it for effective use in Power BI.
Implement data cleansing and transformation processes to ensure data accuracy.
Write and optimize SQL queries to retrieve and manipulate data from databases.
Utilize Power Query M language for data transformation within Power BI.
Quality Assurance and Continuous Improvement:
Conduct thorough testing of Power BI reports to ensure accuracy and reliability.
Implement quality assurance measures to validate data integrity.
Stay informed about Power BI updates and new features to leverage the latest functionalities.
Requirements and Experience:
Education:
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Business, Information Technology, Data Science
Experience and Technical Proficiency Requirements:
2-3 years of experience as a BI Developer or Analyst.
2+ years of hands-on experience specifically with Power BI.
2+ years of practical experience with SQL, including data querying and manipulation.
Proficiency in Power M, DAX calculations, and formulas for Power BI.
Solid understanding of database management systems, preferably experience with Postgres.
Familiarity with online analytical processing (OLAP) and the extract, transform, load (ETL) framework.
Experience in designing and implementing effective data models to support reporting requirements.
Interpersonal Skills and Attributes
Strong analytical and problem-solving aptitude to address complex business challenges through data analysis.
Proven ability to take initiative, be innovative, and drive improvements in BI solutions.
Ability to prioritize tasks effectively and manage competing priorities in a dynamic work environment.
Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in a team environment, including cross-functional collaboration.
Strong communication skills to translate business needs into technical specifications and present findings to stakeholders.
Analytical mindset with a keen attention to detail.
Adaptability to evolving business needs and technologies.
Strong commitment to continuous learning and professional development.
Authorization and Workspace:
Must be authorized to work in the United States.
Must have a stable internet connection and a dedicated workspace.
Nice to Have (Not Required):
Experience with Google Analytics.
Experience with Sprints, Scrum, and/or Agile methodologies.
Familiarity with subscription metrics and models.
Familiarity with how payment processing works.

Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money, where value can finally travel like other digital data — globally, nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure – including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar – helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.

What you'll be part of:

Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder, Mindfulness, Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.

What you'll be responsible for:

Circle is looking for a treasury analyst who will support day-to-day treasury banking operations. You will help to ensure the successes of critical operational functions, including bank accounts, cash flow, AP, internal controls, and wire processing. You will also participate in the development of related processes and help lead projects to ensure alignment with Treasury objectives, as it relates to cash and financial risk management.

What you'll work on:

Supporting corporate treasury needs including accounting, accounts payable, funding, and month-end close support.
Monitoring the settlement of fiat movement across all payment rails for both corporate and customers transactions. Performing reconciliation and troubleshooting payment issues according to process and procedures.
Performing bank account maintenance including signer maintenance, access audits, debit blocks.
Assisting in bank account openings, closings, and regular account maintenance.
Collaborating closely with internal stakeholders to ensure end to end process flows are executed according to regulatory requirements and internal controls/processes, as well as documenting evidence of compliance. Internal stakeholders include Compliance, Customer Care, various Treasury teams, Audit, Accounting, Product, Engineering, etc.
Supporting the relationships with key external payment operations stakeholders at banks and other payment service providers, coordinating and resolving process issues, as well as building new processes as the company and product offerings scale.
Performing day to day reporting needs for the Treasury team including FBAR reporting, cash reporting, report maintenance, automation and other associated reporting needs. Providing insights into spending trends, cash flow analytics, as well as inputs into forecasting processes for Circle.
Developing our internal treasury management system for bank account maintenance and utilization for reporting and cash positioning.

You will aspire to our four core values:

Multistakeholder - you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
Mindful - you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.
Driven by Excellence - you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals.
High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards. You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.

What you'll bring to Circle:

2+ years of experience in treasury, banking, payments industry or related field.
Strong work ethic and ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to manage multiple competing priorities.
Established ability to independently organize and analyze data; attention to detail and high level of accuracy.
Experience in core cash and bank management or payments industry preferred.
Experience with treasury management systems; Kyriba experience preferred.
Experience/familiarity with Slack, Apple MacOS and GSuite.

Additional Information:

This position is eligible for day-one PERM sponsorship for qualified candidates.

Circle is on a mission to create an inclusive financial future, with transparency at our core. We consider a wide variety of elements when crafting our compensation ranges and total compensation packages.

Actual starting pay is determined by various factors, including but not limited to: relevant experience, skill set, qualifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note that compensation ranges may differ for candidates in other locations.

Base Pay Range: $87,500 - $110,000

Annual Bonus Target: 10%

Also Included: Equity & Benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). Circle has a discretionary vacation policy. We also provide 10 days of paid sick leave per year and 11 paid holidays per year in the U.S.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Additionally, Circle participates in the E-Verify Program in certain locations, as required by law.

Job Title: Sr. Technical Lead, Data and Analytics
Job Description:
Overview:
As the Sr. Technical Lead within the Data and Analytics Team, you will be responsible for leading a group of talented data engineers and analysts in designing, implementing, and maintaining our data warehouse infrastructure and analytics solutions. You will be a hands-on leader with deep technical expertise in AWS/Azure and Snowflake, driving the team to deliver high-quality data products leading to key dashboards and actionable insights. The position sits in our Enterprise Data and Analytics team, which aims to drive improved business outcomes using insights gleaned from data and analytics and infuse them into Lennar’s corporate fabric.
Responsibilities:
Technical leadership of the data engineering and analytics team, ensuring best practices and efficient utilization of AWS, Azure, and Snowflake technology.
Perform design and code reviews with data engineers.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and deploy scalable and robust data architectures, data pipelines, and analytics solutions.
Apply data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL and ELT) techniques to integrate large data sets from a variety of sources.
Create data collection frameworks for structured and unstructured data to transform complex raw data into highly performant usable information.
Develop and maintain infrastructure systems (e.g., data warehouses, data lakes) including data access APIs.
Lead dimensional / Vault data modeling activities.
Continuously monitor and optimize the data and analytics infrastructure for performance, cost-efficiency, and scalability.
Implement and enforce data governance policies, data security, and compliance standards across all data assets.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their data needs and make technical recommendations that meet their needs.
Develop user story estimates using story points.
Create and maintain comprehensive design documentation for data processes, architectures, and standards.
Lead troubleshooting efforts to identify and resolve data and analytics-related issues promptly.
Qualifications:
Technical Skills:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience with a focus on information technology, data analytics or related discipline strongly preferred.
8+ years of progressive data and analytics technical work experience
5+ years of experience with SQL
5+ years of Snowflake experience designing and deploying dimensional/Vault data warehouses.
3+ years of experience with AWS /Azure development.
3+ years of experience interpreting data models, schemas, and E-R diagrams.
A proven track record of successful technical team leadership in a cross-functional IT organization.
Strong analytical skills including proficiency in querying, analyzing, and summarizing data.
A proven ability to understand and communicate complex, interconnected systems and the data flowing between them.

Additional Skills:
Establishes and maintains effective working relationships, supporting company leadership and team
Influences changes in area of expertise
Influence trust in others and works with integrity and ethically; upholds organizational values
Sensitive and responsive to internal and external needs; maintains a positive attitude, willing to seek solutions
Improves business productivity by proposing innovative and creative solutions
Promotes a supportive and collaborative team environment
Behaves as a role model for proper behavior related to diversity
Foster a culture that values critical thinking and problem solving

Education and Experience Requirements:
12+ years of relevant experience
Bachelor’s degree or certification required
Must have hands-on experience in the following in Azure or AWS
Technology stack (Data Factory/Glue, RDBMS, DevOps, Blob)
Building services, function apps, logic apps, web apps using Java, JavaScript-based technologies like NodeJS
Building containerized applications (Docker or Kubernetes Service)
CI/CD using Azure/AWS DevOps for automated testing and deployment.
Building REST APIs, GraphQL queries
Building end-to-end solutions (development and deployment)
Knowledge of languages such as UNIX/Shell, Python, R, SQL, Spark, and/or Java or Scala
Experience with data files/ types such as JSON, YAML, Parquest, HDF5 or other big data file formats
Experience with PowerBI, Tableau, SSRS and SSAS
Must have worked in a tech lead position.
Must have worked in an agile development environment (Scrum, Kanban)
Experience in design, architect, development and implementation of complex, high volume solutions
Experience applying Software Development best practices and following SDLC processes

Physical Requirements:
This is primarily a sedentary office position which requires the incumbent to have the ability to operate computer equipment, speak, hear, bend, stoop, reach, lift, and move and carry up to 25 lbs. Finger dexterity is necessary.

Lennar is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws.
