Founded in 1965, Herc Rentals is one of the leading equipment rental suppliers in North America with trailing twelve month total revenues of nearly $2.7 billion as of September 30, 2022. Herc Rentals’ parent company, known as Herc Holdings Inc., listed on the New York Stock Exchange on July 1, 2016, under the symbol “HRI.” Herc Rentals serves customers through approximately 350 locations and has approximately 6,600 employees in North America.


We serve a diverse group of customers in a wide array of industries. We support professional con-tractors in construction and remediation. Our industrial customers include large industrial plants, reﬁneries and petrochemical operations, automotive and aerospace manufacturers. We support government and infrastructure projects at the municipal, state and federal level. And, we continue to expand our services for customers in commercial and retail, healthcare, hospitality, recreation, and entertainment and special events.

Short Description

This position is responsible for supporting the ERP upgrade initiatives. The IT Business Analyst will be responsible for understanding the changing technological needs of the business, analyzing the impacts of change, documenting, and supporting communication between relevant groups and stakeholders, and translating requirements into technology-driven initiatives that help the business achieve its goals.
The role will demand the ability to lead discussions, communicate clearly and concisely, deal with evolving and dynamic project priorities, work calmly under pressure, and represent the brand at the highest standards within and outside of the organization.

Responsibilities
Elicits, analyzes, specifies, and validates the business needs of stakeholders, be they customers or end users.
Collaborates with project sponsors to determine project scope and vision.
Conducts and leads interviews to gather customer requirements via workshops, questionnaires, surveys, site visits, workflow storyboards, use cases, scenarios, and other methods.
Identifies and establishes scope and parameters of requirements analysis on a project-by-project basis to define project impact, outcome criteria, and metrics.
Works with stakeholders and project team to prioritize collected requirements.
Participates in the QA of build and purchased solutions to ensure features and functions have been enabled and optimized.
Partner with development and technical teams to ensure that they understand the specifications, conduct business process modeling, and generate applicable scenarios for QA and UAT.
Drive investigations by validating and translating business requirements into functional requirements (what) and solutions (how) and contribute throughout the enhancement and new development process with analysis, solutions, user acceptance testing and training.
Analyzes and verifies requirements for completeness, consistency, comprehensibility, feasibility, and conformity to standards.
Develops and utilizes standard templates to write requirement specifications accurately and concisely.
Translates conceptual customer requirements into functional requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to developers/project team.
Creates process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to developers and/or the project team.
Develops and conduct peer reviews of the business requirements to ensure that requirement specifications are correctly interpreted.
Assists with the interpretation of customer requirements into feasible options and communicating these back to the business stakeholders.
Manages and tracks the status of requirements throughout the project lifecycle; enforce and redefine as necessary.

Requirements
Professional Experience
Experience developing test plans and test cases.
Experience with JIRA, Confluence, Trello, FIGMA or similar tools
Experience in projects related to ERP implementation and upgrade projects an advantage
Formal training in disciplines of Business Analysis and/or Project Management
Educational Background
Bachelor’s degree in computer or information Science-related field an advantage
Conditions of Employment
Willing to travel for meetings, shows and events.
At least 3 years of IT business analysis experience required with gradually increasing responsibilities and a demonstrated understanding of Business analysis processes, artifacts, and tools.
Skills
Highly organized, self-sufficient, with attention to detail.
Excellent analytical, logical thinking, and problem-solving skills.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with stakeholders, leadership, developers, product owners, and subject matter experts.
Thorough understanding of information technology software development lifecycle, procedures, and practices.
Strong MS Office Skills (Excel, Visio, PowerPoint, Word)
Microsoft Access and/or SQL experience strongly preferred.
Access or SQL Server database creation, administration

Chewy is looking for a E-commerce Data Analyst to join our Healthcare Analytics Team. In this role, you will own critical initiatives to develop analytics tools and insights on website funnel metrics and customer behavior across multiple business verticals. Further, you will support deep dive analyses and site measurement to evaluate performance of tests which enhance features and customer experience.

In this role your key responsibilities will include:

Developing new and efficient data visualizations which allow users to clearly extract insights on customer behavior, traffic trends, and funnel performance.
Driving continuous improvement of the end user experience in our reporting environment by delivering enhancements along with promoting dashboard utilization through demos and training sessions
Partnering with Enterprise Datawarehouse teams to ensure data pipelines are optimized for performance and deliver high quality and timely data

The ideal candidate will demonstrate exemplary skills in retrieving and analyzing data sets with millions of records and is highly proficient in SQL, Excel and Tableau. They will have proven experience creating metrics and dashboards using customer, marketing, ecommerce, and financial metrics. In addition to a strong analytics background, this individual will have the ability to apply data visualization techniques that present abstract and complex topics in a clear and concise manner.

What you'll do:

Partner with analytics and data engineering teams to develop and QA new data tables and data sources across multiple platforms
Support the development and creation of insightful and intuitive Tableau dashboards using multiple data sources, parameters, and measures
Partner with business leaders and report end-users to continuously improve the Tableau experience and ensure that KPI’s are both actionable and insightful
Partner with other analytics team members on deep dive analyses and explaining trends of the business
Partner cross-functionally to promote data governance standards in both Tableau and underlying data sources
Develop and maintain reusable SQL scripts that can source multiple business cases and reporting needs
Perform complex analyses on customer behavior, marketing mix, and funnel performance by leveraging data sets with millions of records from multiple systems
Partner with various analytics teams to scope and build scalable, self-service reporting for cross-functional stakeholders
Partner with stakeholders to construct and prioritize product release roadmaps using JIRA, Confluence, and other workflow management and documentation tools

What you'll need:

Proven experience in Marketing Science and Web Analytics platforms such as Google Analytics, Segment, Adobe Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and UTM parameter implementation and tracking
Bachelor’s degree in Math, Statistics, Economics, Finance, Information Management or a related degree with analytical emphasis
Experience working directly with business analysts or business sponsors to gather and validate functional requirements and translate to report design specifications.
2+ years of directly related work experience analyzing customer, marketing, and ecommerce data and building metrics decks and dynamic dashboards
3+ years of advanced tableau experience, including sourcing data directly from DBMS servers (Vertica, Snowflake, Redshift, Azure, etc), using complex table functions, dynamic filters and parameters, and optimizing end user experience through effective dashboard design
Intermediate to advanced proficiency in SQL, Excel, and statistics
Strong understanding of website metrics, customer behavior, marketing, and ecommerce metrics
Strong understanding of data warehousing and relational or columnar database structure
High degree of proficiency executing complex and large-scale data analyses across millions of records
Working understanding of Financial KPIs and P&L statement
Proven experience delivering high quality results on tight timelines
Superior attention to detail and experience creating mechanisms to monitor data integrity
Ability to operate in ambiguous environments with speed and commitment to quality
Ability to travel up to 10% of the time

Bonus:

Business Intelligence experience building tools in an Ecommerce, retail, product, or marketing setting
Advanced technical skills using Python, R, Knime or other advanced analytics applications
Masters or equivalent advanced academic degree

Description:
Job Title: Sr. Specialist, IT Business Analyst
Job Code: CHQ20233110-107688
Job Location: Remote Opportunity
Job Schedule: Employees work 9 out of every 14 days – totaling 80 hours worked – and have every other Friday off

Job Description:

This position will be a key member of the L3Harris Technologies SAP Maintenance/Repair/Overhaul (MRO) and Plant Maintenance team supporting the go-live SAP. This person does not have any formal direct reports and will require excellent team work and collaboration skills to work with key business leaders from across L3Harris Technologies to support current processes for MRO and Plant Maintenance and help define new processes going forward. The SAP Analyst will possess an effective mix of leadership, communication, business and project management skills to provide support. Utilizing these skills, the person in this role will be responsible for working within a team to provide support for SAP Applications to all of L3Harris Technologies.

The ASSA ABLOY Door Group is growing and to support that growth, we are looking to add an experienced JD Edward (JDE) Business Analyst to our Team.




This role will be based on-site out of one of our regional manufacturing facilities preferably in Orlando, Florida, Carol Stream, Illinois, Mesquite, Texas or Austell, Georgia.




ASSA ABLOY is a global leader in opening access solutions, dedicated to helping our customer’s needs for security, safety, and convenience. What you would do as JDE Business Analyst

The role will drive the implementation of these standards while working as a part of the various JDE implementation and production support project teams.




You will also:

Work within the JDE implementation and support projects as a functional lead and subject matter expert, participating in implementation for a broad spectrum, (Order to Cash, Procure to Pay, Inventory Management, Plan to Manufacture).
Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather and document system requirements.
Analyze existing business processes and identify areas for improvement and optimization.
Help to design, develop, document, and implement JDE solutions to address business needs.
Configure and customize JDE applications to align with business requirements.

Keep up-to-date with JDE enhancements and best practices to recommend system improvements.
Partner closely with cross-functional teams to develop and nurture positive working relationships with all enterprise applications teams and with other business and IT teams.
Special projects as assigned.
Actively participates in providing a safe and harmonious working environment for all employees.
Assures compliance with federal, state, local and corporate governance policies, regulations and laws, AADG programs and policies and the ASSA ABLOY Code of Conduct

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Technology, or a related field
Proven experience as a JDE Business Analyst or similar role

Excellent influencing and interpersonal skills with a customer-centric focus

Ability to present ideas to all levels of the organization and ability to effectively communicate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Previous understanding of operational processes in a manufacturing environment and experience supporting either a highly configured product or an engineered to order environment is highly desired.
Previous experience with using MS SQL and the ability to write SQL queries is a plus.
Exposure to DSI dcLINK data collection, Gentran EDI Software, SAP Business Objects, Docpath / JetForms forms printing, imaging systems (TransformAP), and credit card collection systems preferred.
Approx. travel (less than 15%) within the continental US and Canada.

The Business Analyst, Information Technology will be the discipline of enterprise analysis and planning strategic methods to meet the business goals of our organization. You will strive to meet the company needs by understanding business models and our business operations and integrating them with technology. You will be tasked with analyzing our organization’s efficiency by studying its needs, its business model, its workflows, and its technological systems. Making recommendations to the CIO. This employee will be asked to research possible software solutions to increase work efficiency, estimating costs and time requirements of projects and ensuring deliverables.

MAJOR RESPONSIBLITIES:

Serves as the project level liaison, between the IT organization and business partners, is business oriented with good technical understanding.
Experience with business and technical requirements gathering, analysis, vetting, prioritization and documentation, business process modeling/mapping, testing and implementation.
The key responsibility is to help derive and manage the requirements, work with inhouse and external developers to build solutions or integrate, or customize cloud/SAAS/custom type solutions etc. to ensure requirements are met in technology deliverables.
Captures business requirements and translates them actionable technical specifications, functional specifications, and system and data mappings, and works seamlessly with Information Technology engineers to translate, construct and deliver the technical solution. This includes researching and analyzing user’s business requirements, technical specifications, writing test plans in support of business functions, process knowledge and system requirements.
Serves as the SPOC to varied business functions across the IT portfolio of work. Will possess and continuously develop process expertise in the business units supported, as well as functional expertise in the suite of applications supporting those processes. These suite of applications include and are not limited to – custom inhouse developed franchise solution, Greatplains, SSRS and Power BI dashboards, SharePoint, MS Office, MS Project Online etc.
Experience in project management. Has had some exposure managing projects, scope, milestones to deliver on time, within budget and scope. Set and manage meetings and deadlines cross functionally. Direct and oversee project teams manage issue resolutions and communicate progress of projects to all stakeholders, etc.
Vendor management experience for technical escalations a plus. Experience creating SOW’s and RFP’s to vendors when needed and reviewing proposals and statements of work in response a plus.
Some weekend, off hour work required for maintenance and production releases

Qualifications:

8+ years in a technical BA role
8+ years enterprise IT experience
8+ years managing enterprise projects ie ERP implementations, Inventory and supply chain etc.
Bachelor’s degree required in MIS/CIS, computer science, or related role 3-5 years quality assurance or business analyst experience in a software development environment
Understanding of Agile programming; working with shorter release cycle/continuous delivery environment
Strong knowledge of Business Analyst techniques and tools
Please provide portfolio of business / functional requirements, technical specifications, test cases, UAT feedback, deployment plans, process analysis, timelines, RFP’s and other relevant documents
Relevant certifications– CBAP, PMP
ITIL exposure
Experience in franchise industry is highly desirable.
On Site work is a must

PTO, wellness days and Paid Holidays

As the Business Analyst - Supply Chain for the CAPP Division, you will be responsible for managing the metal material planning, procurement, and delivery to ensure the efficient and effective movement of materials from suppliers to the appropriate CAPP Sites. You will play a critical role in optimizing the supply chain processes by identifying and addressing bottlenecks, risks, and opportunities for improvement and support the organization's supply chain needs to run smoothly and efficiently to ensure a profit, material continuity.

Key Responsibilities:

Metal Material Management
Responsible for planning, purchasing, and monitoring the metal materials, track to production volume, monitor customers' purchase trends and determine the CAPP Metal needs by utilizing forecast inputs from Sales, other customer knowledge, information, market studies, historical information, market data, sourcing feedback/guidance and collaboration efforts with cross-functional teams.
Accountable to coordinate activities related to the planning and procurement of raw materials and contribute to the global balancing of Materials within Global Planning, ensuring efficient and effective procurement & inventory practices and optimizing the balance between quality, service, reliability, and cost.
Align and collaborate with Metals Sourcing to determine Metal Suppliers per Metal Specifications, tonnage, timing to ship, timing to receive, logistics and handle purchase order management based on the allocations defined.
Monitor supplier performance and assist sourcing with managing supplier relationships to ensure that materials are delivered on time and meet quality standards. Ensure Material deliveries are on time and work with appropriate stakeholders to uphold material continuity and on-time delivery.
Analyze data and methods to predict and improve a company's delivery of products and services to its customers. Manage and oversee the calculation of metal needs and be the SME for metal specification communications among cross-functional teams.
Extract and manage, monitor and all reports regarding Metal Planning, Deliveries, Specification, and overall strategy of metal materials.
Identify and mitigate supply chain risks, such as disruptions in supply, transportation, or demand, and implement contingency plans as needed. Publish key reports of Mill Tonnage supply Monthly, Post tons required, purchases and allocations by mill and ending coil tonnage each month.
Identify and support continuous improvement opportunities to reduce material leadtimes, specification segmentation, and improve efficiency to supply chain and operational process; Contribute to the development of business system initiatives and enhancements.
Inventory Management
Conduct demand forecasting and inventory planning to ensure that materials are available when needed and in the appropriate quantities.
Collaborate with key stakeholders and subject matter experts within each business unit to develop and implement appropriate inventory strategies and forecasting processes.
Maintain the required inventory to run the production and sales process smoothly, having material available, improve order fulfillment, right amount of stock and mitigate having the wrong inventory on hand.
Support supply chain metrics and key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure and monitor performance of material in inventory and supplier inventories.
Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements related to the supply chain.
Sales Inventory & Operations Planning (SIOP)
Support the setup and implementation of a scalable, sustainable process for Sales, Inventory and Operations Planning process. You will work with account managers, operations personnel, financial analysts, and senior leadership as we continue to define and develop SIOP to support an integrated business planning. Coordinate and support reviews as required and identify obstacles and roadblocks to implementing SIOP, develop and communicate possible solutions.
Drive transparency, accountability, and continuous improvement through solutions to track key assumptions, inputs, and outputs; Provide business data analysis to support and implement new business initiatives.





Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in supply chain management, logistics, business administration, or related field
Minimum of 7+ years of experience in supply chain management, preferably in the manufacturing industry with 3+ years' of analytics experience or working in an analyst role or similar to
Must be comfortable in a fast-paced environment with the demonstrated ability to effectively manage multiple priorities to completion
Ability to lead cross-functional teams in a matrixed, geographically dispersed environment and working across organizational boundaries to ensure successful project implementation.
Strong organizational, communication (oral and written) and time management skills
Strong computer skills and proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite and data visualization tools
Strong problem-solving skills
Strong analytical skills and experience with data analysis and modeling tools
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and suppliers
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and other analytical tools
Knowledge of supply chain management software systems and enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems
Familiarity with regulatory requirements related to supply chain management
Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment

Job Title: Business Analyst I, FIS University Program
Job Description:
Position Type :

Full time

Type Of Hire :

Associate Development Program (Full Time Hire)

Education Desired :

Bachelor of Business Administration

Travel Percentage :

0%

Job Description

Are you curious, motivated, and forward-thinking? At FIS, you will have the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging and relevant issues in financial services and technology. Our talented people empower us, and we believe in being part of a team that is open, collaborative, entrepreneurial, passionate, and above all, fun.


Join the 2024 FIS University Program!


As a 2024 FIS University Program full-time employee, you will have the opportunity to participate in team projects, community service activities, professional development seminars and work with a team that is invested in your growth, development, and success; including bi-annual performance connects with your manager.


This two-year full-time program has start dates in January, March, June, and September with a dedicated “Learning Week” where you will:

Learn how to work within a corporate environment

Learn about the exciting world of Fintech and the role FIS plays

Hear from FIS leadership about their journey and participate in senior leader networking opportunities

Build a network of your peers from across the organization


This position is for a January 2024 start.


About the team

As part of the global fintech firm, FIS, the Wealth business is a leading, award-winning, global provider of technology and service solutions to the wealth management industry across North America and the UK. FIS Wealth supports banks, investment houses, asset managers, and family offices in growing their businesses, against a backdrop of an explosive digital evolution of the industry and during a period of complete reframing of the global wealth management sector. The business services some $3trn of clients’ assets annually and holds assets under administration of c. $1.6trn.


What you will be doing

Working closely with Enterprise Strategist to analyze market landscape and corporate-wide research and development decisions and align with corporate vision and strategy

Working closely with strategic pricing personnel to advise and influence the Head of Strategy on revenue and profit-maximizing pricing, pricing strategy, and key account revenue structure

In conjunction with competitive intelligence personnel, analyze and create presentations including details on competitors, mega-trends, strategic threats, and industry inflection points

Help define and create the Strategy Team roadmap containing relevant meetings/sessions and timely creation of updates to ensure the Strategy is continually broadcast across relevant corporate teams.

Analyze the financial data across the Wealth business units and present the raw data and the relevant informed insights and conclusions

Analyze and identify possible new growth initiatives, and build a pipeline of opportunities for partnerships that will result in growing the business


What you bring

Bachelor’s degree in relevant field of study

Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite

Fluent in English; Strong written and verbal communication skills

Adaptability, a drive to learn, and strong problem-solving skills

Ability to work well independently and within a team


Bonus if you have

Good analytical and dissemination skills

Understanding of and ability to analyze business financial numbers

An interest in technology and themes affecting and driving the wealth management and asset servicing industry


What we offer you

Competitive salary and excellent benefits

The chance to work on some of the most challenging, relevant issues in financial services & technology

A broad range of professional education and personal development possibilities – FIS is your final career step!

Time to support charities and give back to your community

A work environment built on collaboration, flexibility, and respect

Student Loan Repayment Program: FIS will PAY OFF participants’ undergraduate loan balance over 10 years of service! Eligibility starts after one year of tenure in the program. The benefit applied to undergraduate student loans for US-based degrees and must be in the employee’s name.

*Current and future sponsorship are not available for this position*

As part of the Bank Technology Development team, this Senior Analyst role is critical to support Bank Technology users. There are two main responsibilities of this role. One responsibility is the traditional Business Analyst role of creating business requirements and supporting those requirements through implementation. The other responsibility is to work with several vendor banking applications, primarily Fiserv, in a Business Administrator capacity. This provides a dynamic opportunity to fulfill a variety of user requests, to interact with multiple business groups at Raymond James Bank as well as groups across IT. There will be collaboration with the vendor support teams as well, which provides for additional professional partnerships and requires excellent communication skills. This position will be based out of our corporate headquarters in Saint Petersburg, FL (Hybrid).

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Creates detailed business requirements for functional (e.g., business processes, rules) and non-functional (e.g., data, security) capabilities.
Creates process documentation or workflow diagrams as needed.
Learns system specifications for vendor app configurations, user role and new product setup.
Collaborates with vendor representatives to fulfill user requests and/or document new features.
Validates test cases to ensure that scripts will evaluate the business function being performed.
Gathers and interprets information from multiple sources (including databases, interviews, etc.) and makes recommendations.
Provides support for application development teams including documenting business processes.
Translates technical concepts to business audience and business information to a technical audience.
Participates in developing estimates and implementation plans for technical solutions.
Partners with team members to develop project schedules, reports and documentation. May be required to act as project lead on small to medium projects and/or provide direction to others on the team.
Understands and applies principles in risk management, issue tracking and change management.
After-hours on-call support is needed for file transmission issues and as part of IT software upgrades.
Performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Qualifications


Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Knowledge of:

General knowledge of SDLC, IT methodologies, and IT procedures.
Key IT concepts, such as application access management, IT policies, and audit requirements.
Issue tracking, change management, requirements gathering.
Waterfall or Agile processes.

Skill in:

Excellent verbal and written communication, analytical skills, troubleshooting, quickly learning new tools and applications; taking initiative to get to the root cause of support items, making recommendations for process/workflow improvements, requirements gathering, managing project implementation timelines.
Proficient in using tools such as Microsoft Office suite, SharePoint.
Knowledge of tools such as Service Now, Microsoft Team Foundation Server (TFS), SQL query capabilities, BMC job scheduling, SFTP support nice to have, but can be learned on the job.

Ability to:

Ability to act as a liaison between product owners and technology implementers – translate technical concepts to business audience and business information to a technical audience.
Identify and understand issues, problems and opportunities; compare data from different sources to draw conclusions.
Clearly convey information and ideas through a variety of media to individuals or groups in a manner that engages the audience and helps them understand and retain the message.
Use effective approaches for choosing a course of action or developing appropriate solutions; recommend or take action that is consistent with available facts, constraints and probable consequences.
Demonstrate a satisfactory level of technical and professional skill or knowledge in position-related areas; remains current with developments and trends in areas of expertise.
Develop and use collaborative relationships to facilitate the accomplishment of work goals.
Make internal and external clients and their needs a primary focus of actions; develop and sustain productive client relationships.
After sufficient cross-training, join on-call support rotation for the team (every 6-8 weeks). On a predetermined schedule, a few times a year, manage software releases and/or testing during non-standard hours, in the evening and/or weekends.
Team collaboration is key for this role, to follow and improve processes, for cross-training and for effective support.

Education/Previous Experience:

Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, MIS or related degree and three (3) to five (5) years of relevant experience or combination of education, training and experience.
May occasionally work weekends and/or have on-call responsibilities.
Previous banking industry experience is a nice to have.

Licenses/Certifications:

None required.

Job Summary:

BCBAs conduct behavior evaluations, write treatment plans, present plans, and comply with insurance requirements, write treatment programs for clients, supervise RBTs, and analyze data for progress monitoring.

Job Responsibilities:

Conduct behavioral evaluations including caregiver interview, standardized assessment, behavioral assessment, and observation with client.
Select appropriate assessment instruments and data to develop and implement programs.
Create a comprehensive behavior evaluation and treatment plan with prescribed hours of treatment submission to insurance.
Ensure that all treatment plans and programs comply with contract requirements, satisfy all relevant insurance certification and other expectations, and meet or exceed professional standards.
Conduct peer to peer review alongside clinical director or supervisor to gain insurance hour approval.
Develop, monitor, and maintain behavior treatment plans, graphs, and programs.
Maintain highly organized, consistent, thorough, and systematic recordkeeping (session notes, data sheets, etc.)
Oversee, supervise, and provide written and verbal feedback to Registered Behavior Technicians.
Provide staff development, training, and modeling for team members (including client caregivers) in strategies and methodologies for successful implementation of the treatment plan.
Timely provide documentation for billing for insurance/Medicaid/private pay.
Accepts other responsibilities as assigned.
Qualifications

Education and Training:

Master’s Degree – Applied Behavior Analysis or Organizational Behavior Management
CPI Trained (Current)

Minimum Experience:

MAJOR FUNCTION: The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst works within the Department of Juvenile Justice (DJJ) and will report to the Director of Research and Data Integrity. This position will assist in designing and conducting analyses of assessment data. This position will assist in conducting research and developing research projects, and implement procedures to maintain the quality of assessment program data and statistics.
Primary duties will include, but are not limited to:
Using classical and modern test theory and its practice including pre-equating, to assist with reviewing and interpreting statistical data generated by the Office of Research & Data Integrity assessments. Correctly utilize advanced statistical techniques such as propensity score matching, coarsened exact matching, hierarchical linear modeling, OLS regression, and logistic regression to conduct quasi-experimental research to inform policy and practice. Describe findings in both written and verbal form in the context of a thorough understanding of classical and modern criminological theories.
Using classical and modern test theory and its practice including post-equating to assist in the review of the Office of Research & Data Integrity accumulated data and policies.
Using classical and modern test theory and its practice to assist in the construction or modification of new or existing assessment and evaluation tools to be administered by the Office of Research & Data Integrity. This includes designing and conducting validation studies of risk-needs assessments as well as applying findings of validation studies to improve upon existing assessments.
Utilizing SPSS, STATA and other statistical analysis software to assist the Office of Research & Data Integrity in answering inquiries for descriptive statistics generated by the field of Juvenile Justice regarding policies, statistics, and data.
MINIMUM TRAINING AND EXPERIENCE: Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution, and three (3) years of related experience conducting and presenting research including development of academic literature reviews, and data analysis using advanced statistical methods such as multivariate regression, propensity score matching, and/or multilevel modeling. A Master’s degree may substitute for one year of the required experience. A doctoral candidate is preferred and may substitute for all relevant work experience.
SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATES WILL DEMONSTRATE THE FOLLOWING: Advanced knowledge in the use of statistical software, such as SAS, SPSS, Stata, S-plus, R, Bilog-MC, Parscale, Testfact, IRTPRO, HLM, and M-Plus. Advanced Knowledge of social science theory including the major theories of criminal and juvenile crime and corrections. Knowledge of research methodology and appropriate data analysis procedures (minimum of Proficiency with experimental and quasi-experimental statistical methods such as propensity score matching, coarsened exact matching, multi-level modelling, and multivariate regression. Knowledge of building and manipulating large datasets (i.e., tens to hundreds of thousands of cases). Impeccable organizational skills including detailed notations in easily replicated written syntax. Ability to design, carry out, and translate findings for program, policy, and practice evaluations. Ability to translate complex research findings and methodology to a practitioner audience. Ability to conduct comprehensive and succinct reviews of the academic and practitioner written literature surrounding a given criminal or juvenile justice topic. Demonstrated ability to publish in peer-reviewed academic journals. Willingness and ability to stay up to date on the literature and best practices regarding research methodology as well as theory, practice, and program evaluations.

Job Title: Senate Health Care Legislative Analyst (Minority/Democratic Office)
Job Description:
Do not click the Apply button. Applications are available Here.




The Florida Legislature
The Florida Senate




Job Title

Health Care Legislative Analyst (Minority/Democratic Office)




General Summary

This is work functioning as a technical expert to the Democratic leadership, Democratic legislators, and the public on the subject matters of the policy committees to which the successful candidate is assigned. Under close supervision of a staff director and the Democratic leadership, the legislative analyst applies this expertise when researching and preparing staff analyses, reports, legislation, and amendments; responding to inquiries; and developing correspondence pertaining to health care proposals and initiatives.

Attorneys are welcome to apply.




Examples of Work Performed

Analyzes and objectively summarizes proposed legislation to determine its effectiveness based on Democratic principles and the impact of its passage on the state and other entities and individuals.
Researches and drafts legislation and amendments to legislation at the direction of the Democratic leadership, Democratic Senators and the staff director.
Prepares and distributes meeting packets analyzing bills and issues on each agenda for committees to which the analyst is assigned. These pre-meeting packets must be distributed to Democratic Senators on that committee in advance of the meeting.
Monitors and coordinates the progress of legislation through committees of reference and on the floor.
Helps prepare calendar packets of all bills on the Senate Floor and must be prepared to brief Democratic Caucus members on bills prior to going into session.
Monitors the implementation of legislation in the Executive and Judicial Branches to ascertain that legislative intent is met.
Briefs legislators verbally or in writing on issues to be discussed in committee, on the floor, or with constituents.
Prepares a pre-session agenda and strategy for advancing Democratic principles and ideas within the policy areas covered.
Prepares written post-session reports summarizing major issues that were addressed during the legislative session and important votes taken by Democrats on the Senate floor.
Provides information and problem-solving assistance to legislators, their constituents, and the public.
Prepares letters, summaries, talk-sheets or speeches, reports, and informational memoranda on committee issues at the request of the Democratic leadership, other legislators or staff director.
Keeps abreast of new and ongoing issues affecting assigned policy area of responsibility by collecting resource materials, attending workshops and conferences, reading industry publications, and communicating with lobbyists and agency personnel.
Assists in the coordination of the work of the Administrative Assistant, legislative intern, and other staff members.
Serves as liaison with state agencies for the Democratic Caucus.
Must operate a computer to perform spreadsheet, word processing, and database management applications.
Performs other related duties as required.



Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Knowledge of legal terminology and legal research.
Knowledge of committee subject area.
Knowledge of applicable computer, spreadsheet, databases, and word processing programs.
Knowledge of Florida state government, legislative rules, ethics and procedures.
Skill in reading comprehension, analysis, and organization.
Ability to communicate effectively and concisely, both orally and in writing.
Ability to take action in situations which lack clear direction.
Ability to take initiative on independent research projects.
Ability to produce quality work under pressure.
Ability to deal tactfully and courteously with the demands of members, their staff, the public, press, and lobbyists.
Ability to plan, organize, and coordinate work assignments.
Ability to work cooperatively as a team member and to contribute to the efficient internal functioning of the committee staff.
Ability to conduct in-depth, carefully documented and credible analysis under minimal supervision within established deadlines.
Ability to conduct meetings and to make presentations.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with others. Ability to work independently.
Ability to collect and analyze data.
Ability to organize data into logical format for presentation in reports, documents, and other written materials. Ability to solve problems and make decisions.
Ability to exercise discretion and confidentiality.



Minimum Qualifications

A bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university and three years of professional experience in research, analysis, program planning and evaluation, or administrative work.

A master’s degree from an accredited college or university can substitute for one year of the required experience.

A juris doctorate or doctorate from an accredited college or university can substitute for two years of the required experience.

Professional experience as described above can substitute on a year-for-year basis for the required college education.

Salary

Salary commensurate with experience.
The Legislature offers a competitive benefits package.




Application Deadline

Open until filled.




Submission of Application

Qualified applicants should send a completed Legislative Employment Application and resume to:

Office of Legislative Services
Human Resources Office
RE: Health Care Legislative Analyst - Senate Minority (Democratic) Office
Suite 701, Claude Pepper Building
111 West Madison Street
Tallahassee, FL 32399-1400

Or e-mail to: olshrs@leg.state.fl.us




Applications are available through the Florida Legislature's web site Online Sunshine and in Room 701 of the Claude Pepper Building.




Accommodation for Disability

If an accommodation is needed for a disability, please notify Human Resources at (850) 488-6803.

HR Analyst

JOB SUMMARY

The Human Resource (HR) Analyst will collect, compile, analyze HR data, metrics, and statistics, and apply this data to make recommendations related to recruitment, retention, and legal compliance.



Collects and compiles HR metrics and data from a variety of sources including the human resource information system (HRIS) and payroll outputs, management and employee surveys, exit interviews, employment records, government labor statistics, competitors’ practices, and other sources.
Analyzes data and statistics for trends and patterns with attention to recruitment, hiring practices, motivation, turnover, and compliance with employment laws and regulations.
Prepares reports of data results, presenting and explaining findings to senior leadership.
Identifies and recommends reasonable short- and long-term goals, milestones, and benchmarks for key performance metrics.
Based on metrics and analysis, makes recommendations for policies and activities to improve the organizational culture including suggestions to attract and hire qualified candidates, to motivate and retain employees, to address staffing issues, and to maintain legal compliance.
Facilitates implementation of new training, development, recruiting, and other related initiatives.
May conduct or assist with conducting classification audits to ensure that jobs are properly classified as exempt or nonexempt.
Ensures compliance with data privacy regulations and best practices.
May assist HR leadership with staffing, recruiting, and departmental budgets.
May guide and/or assist with performance, benefit, and compensation review and evaluation processes.
Performs other duties as assigned

Required Skills/Abilities:

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Thorough understanding of local, state, and federal laws involving employment, HR, and HR policies.
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software.
Proficient with or the ability to quickly learn the organization's HRIS, payroll, and similar employee management software.

Education and Experience:

Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Industrial Psychology, or related field required.
At least three years of experience in related areas such as job classification and compensation, recruitment, selection, training, employee benefits, and/or equal opportunity compliance preferred.

Physical Requirements:

Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at times

Job Title: Senior Business Analyst

Location: Boca Raton, FL




Who We Are:

At Mutual of America Financial Group, we help people build the assets they need to achieve greater financial security. Our Company is built upon a solid foundation of integrity, excellence, and social responsibility. Since 1945, we have specialized in providing small and mid-sized not-for-profit organizations and companies with pension and retirement-related services, along with leading customer support. We work diligently to understand the needs of plan sponsors. We provide them with competitively priced solutions so they can help their employees achieve their financial savings goals.

We are committed to bringing talented and motivated people together to help our customers achieve a financially secure future.




Role Summary:

As a Senior Business Analyst, you will serve as a senior liaison between the Office of Technology and business departments by translating high-level business requirements into detailed functional specifications for the programming staff. Participate as a senior analyst in cross-functional teams to implement new systems applications and engage with senior leadership in buy-versus-build decisions. This opportunity requires working a hybrid onsite/remote work schedule, onsite 3 days in our Boca Raton, Florida office, and 2 days remotely each week.




Responsibilities:

Our Businesses are structured within Product Teams that support various functionality using the OMNI System. This individual will be the Product Owner for a Product Team which supports critical initiatives within the Operations Group. Critical initiatives are approved by MOA Leadership and support: Business Growth; Cost Reductions; Process Efficiencies. This product team has a backlog that requires Business knowledge across all types of Retirement products in support of: Document Issuance (Contracts, Certificates, etc.), Plan Setup, Plan Maintenance. In addition, this individual will act as backup for functionality within the Payment Administration group (Distributions, Life Claims, Plan terminations, Loans).
In addition to prioritizing and driving the critical business initiatives, the Product Owner is also responsible for driving the analysis and resolutions of Production issues that impact the business. Keep the lights on (KTLO) is a key responsibility of the Product Owners
Responsible for effectively applying technology to support business priorities, including revenue and asset retention goals, streamlining and automating business processes, satisfying regulatory requirements and reducing operating costs
Serve as a senior liaison between the Office of Technology and business departments by translating high-level business requirements into detailed functional specifications for the programming staff
Participate as a senior analyst in cross-functional teams to implement new systems applications and engage with senior leadership in buy-versus-build decisions
Troubleshoot and identify system related production problems and coordinate the evaluation and implementation of system enhancements
Function as the liaison between users and technical team throughout the product and project life cycle and ensure alignment with technology standards.
Provide insight on technology trends, best practices and emerging capabilities
Analyze business technology requirements and specifications against value and risk of potential solutions
Identify suitable technological solutions for the business
Conduct cost-benefit and risk assessment analyses for proposed solutions to determine suitability
Recommend proposed solutions and/or enhancements to improve and optimize processes, workflows, performance, and systems
Manage risk associated with new solutions and/or proposed enhancements
Work with the product owner and other stakeholders to identify requirements and priorities.
Escalate business decisions as required
Leadership responsibilities include core team participation within an Agile product owner team
Translate business requirements and user needs into functional specifications; incorporate all customer and stakeholder feedback to ensure business requirements are fully captured and adjust priority of deliverables according to evolving business needs
Ensure that business requirements are incorporated into the solution design
Review technical documentation of the design documents, coding documents and user manual
Resolve ambiguous business priority conflicts
Maintain the integrity and guide the evolution of features and user stories based on the Epics established by the Product Manager/Owner and provide guidance to clearly define and articulate business value for each team sprint and release



Required Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree is required; Finance and/or Information Systems degree preferred
7+ years’ experience required in business analysis and technology solution design and integrations; Financial Services and/or Web experience preferred
Excellent oral and written communications skills for frequent interaction with end users and preparation of functional specifications and other written documents
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a high attention to detail
Team-player with the ability to work within a collaborative environment to reach consensus among business users
Proficiency in Agile methodology and measuring analysis effectiveness.
Groom and develop effective acceptance criteria for user stories and collaborate with product team to successfully deliver value to the end business users
Excellent interpersonal skills to develop and maintain sound working relationships
Both strong data and business acumen are required
Self-motivated and capable of managing multiple priorities and tasks as delegated
Creative and efficient in proposing solutions to complex, time-critical problems
Ability to handle multiple concurrent projects and deadlines
Proficient understanding of designing and delivering project portfolio level reporting
Comfortable in working with large, multi-dimensional projects
Experience in working within cross-divisional product teams
Proficient in Microsoft Office product suite; advanced with MS Excel and PowerPoint, as well as MS Project



Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with Omni products preferred
Experience in database and SharePoint development and management preferred
Basic proficiency in Agile and Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) is preferred
Basic proficiency with Atlassian’s Jira project management and Confluence collaboration software is preferred



What we offer you:

Competitive base salary
Annual Bonus
Comprehensive Benefits Package (medical, dental, and vision) that starts day one of employment
401(k) Match: You will be eligible to receive up to 9% of your pay (salary and incentive compensation) in company contributions. A non-elective employer contribution of 3%, plus a 100% employer match on employee contributions of up to 6% of pay.
Parental Leave: 8 weeks fully paid
Paid time off: 20 days plus two floating personal holidays
Matching Gift Program: Mutual of America matches donations of $25 or more to your favorite organizations

Job Summary:

This position involves the input and management of data in a variety of systems both internal and external.

Duties include:

Focus on data quality and integrity and work with users to proactively ensure correct entry of information into data sources

Maintenance and preparation of existing reports including Excel pivot table charts and slicers in a timely manner.
Assist with data clean-up activities in various systems
Analysis of current processes and improvement to existing processes, systems, and reports

A deep knowledge of child welfare, the data that supports decision making, and how to obtain that data from various systems.
In depth knowledge of data modeling tools and techniques
Additionally, expert knowledge of Excel including pivot tables and charts is required.

Perform review and analysis of FSSNF data, including comparative analytics to assess trends on a macro- and micro-level. 50%
Answer ad-hoc data requests, as requested, by internal stakeholders to include narrative analysis and recommendations. 15%
Develop and share expertise in FSSNF data systems including—but not limited to—Qlik, FSFN, Mindshare, etc. 15%
Maintain and update data sources to ensure data integrity. 10%
Conduct quality review of Performance Analytics team products and reports. 10%
Other duties as assigned. As needed

Supervisory/Decision Making Authority:

This position does not require customary supervision and management of at least 2 or more full-time employees.

Two examples of the most common decisions made independently by this position on a regular basis without following prescribed procedures are as follows:

1. Analysis and presentation of System of Care trends and FSSNF performance to bridge operational understanding of strengths and gaps to drive successful child welfare outcomes
2. Proactively working to ensure data integrity to ensure performance output is accurate and reliable

Contribution and Impact:

Ensuring data integrity to thoughtfully analyze system performance to bridge operational understanding and drive successful outcomes for our children and families served in Circuit 6.

Strategic Value:

This position contributes to the business unit’s overall strategy. Quality and timely analysis via FSFN and other database systems ensures system success and recognizes areas for process and program improvement.

ITA is seeking an Resource Advisor / Financial Analyst to join the team at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida.
Responsibilities:
The Resource Advisor/Financial Analyst will offer direct support for the management, evaluation, and coordination of all financial and budgetary programs within the 350th Spectrum Warfare Group (SWG) Detachment 1. The incumbent will assess all assigned duties to determine their suitability for integration into the ITA created ARENA Tool and the expansion of the 350th SWW operationalized data picture. This will involve incorporating data metrics from all relevant assigned duties into the 350th SWW operationalized data picture.

Functional Areas of Responsibility:
Assist and advise organization leadership team on design and implementation of ARENA Tool software to track and assign financial resources.
Perform a variety of resource advisor and financial management functions to include program management reviews and assessments of programs, completion of budgetary forms in DEAMS and other financial programs.
Provide complex substantive resource management support services in the areas of program analysis, annual/multi-year/long range programs.
Resolve funding and programming issues as they pertain to the execution of the current fiscal year budget.
Assess problem areas within the resource advisor area of responsibility and recommends timely financial requirement changes in order to provide a quality product.
Assistant focal point for the execution and implementation budgetary resource allocation policies and guidance.
Identify and analyze financial problems, conduct research, summarize results, and make appropriate corrective recommendations.
Helps with monitoring actual obligations/charges, analyzes financial requirements, and prepares fund utilization plans.
Utilize ARENA Tool capabilities to analyze data and provide process improvement recommendations to the organization leadership team.
Qualifications:
Qualification Requirements:
U.S. citizenship required.
Associate degree or accounting/finance program certification.
2 years DoD financial, budgeting or resource advisor experience with financial systems such as DEAMS, CRIS, and/or ABIDES.
Must be capable of obtaining and retaining a Secret security clearance.
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities
Knowledge of Air Force Financial Analysis and Accounting and Finance procedures.
Knowledge of practical techniques of financial analysis.
Ability to modify organization spending practices.
Ability to gather, assemble, and analyze data to prepare budget estimates, develop alternatives, and to develop, apply, and adjust financial plans and policies to solve complex budget/funding problems.
Ability to devise resource allocation options for complex and diverse organizations including the application of commonly used budgetary methods, practices, procedures, regulations, policies, and processes.
Ability to communicate efficiently and effectively, both written and verbally.

Overview:
Stellar is seeking to hire a Business Analyst to work as part of our Enterprise Projects team as the primary liaison between Information Services and business partners. You would be responsible for ensuring the requirements identified for a business solution are comprehensive, aligned with the actual needs of the business, and successfully delivered. Additionally, this role will perform project management and business analysis, create test scripts, and facilitate testing both unit and user acceptance. You may perform project tasks to drive measurable improvements. Some travel may be required as needed to support initiatives.

Explore, identify, and document business requirements (exposing root cause) focusing on understanding and prioritizing business dependencies
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, assemble low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs
Develop functional requirements based on the gathered business requirements
Participate in technical design to ensure requirements are met
Maintain proficient working knowledge of use case writing and other requirement analysis techniques
Perform testing and facilitate user-acceptance testing of systems
Develop training materials in support of systems
Evaluate application software packages for alignment with business needs
Recognize and articulate business and technical decision trade-offs
Develop and maintain a general understanding of business functions and processes as needed to support requirement sessions
Facilitate, capture, and design sessions with business teams and/or conduct interview-style meetings with subject matter experts to validate and document policy, inputs, outputs, activities, exceptions, and workflows
Work with the business partners to identify opportunities to improve productivity or efficiency in business processes and define requirements with the business to create solutions to achieve those improvements
Maintain proficient knowledge and adhere to project management and software delivery methodologies
Serve as subject matter expert on projects and related applications
Participate in key IT projects and serve as project manager as assigned
Ensure required project documentation is current and accurate including but not limited to as-is and to-be business process documents, business requirements, functional requirements, communication plans, training plans, test plans, scenarios and scripts, organizational change management plans, and operational support plans
Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously
Qualifications:
BS/BA degree in Business, Information Technology, Industrial Engineering, or a related field
2+ years of business or consulting experience in business analysis, project management, process improvement/re-engineering, or related experience
Experience with requirements gathering for technical solutions, requirements analysis, or business process re-engineering
Knowledge of BPMN preferred
Excellent verbal and written communication skills as well as facilitation and collaboration skills
Independent self-starter with excellent time management skills and must be able to consistently meet deadlines
Good negotiation, problem-solving, and organizational skills
Ability to listen/capture complex information, prioritize and interpret the appropriate level of granularity for documentation

The Unified Communications Analyst acts as the primary point on contact for the MVW Corporate Offices and Contact Centers with Global telephony needs. Responsible for assisting resource teams for Field Services, Network Engineering, Voice Engineering and Site Deployment infrastructure related projects ranging in complexity to ensure activities are completed timely and within budget. Responsible for financial aspects covering multiple areas to include projects, departmental, site inquiries; provides estimates for projects and manages against budgets. The Unified Communications Analyst is primarily responsible to address all incidents and user requests whenever possible to ensure SLAs are met and the customer acknowledges the incident or request has been satisfied. Provide Operational Cherwell closure rates on a day-to-day basis, call out tickets in progress extended beyond the SLA and the reason to Manager, IT Voice Operations Corporate & Contact Centers.

The BCBA (board-certified behavior analyst) is primarily responsible for conducting functional behavior assessments and developing behavior plans based on these assessments. The BCBA is to ensure the effective implementation of all treatment plans and programming for their clients on their caseload as described by the fundamental responsibilities listed below.

Fundamental Responsibilities

Adheres to professional and legal requirements, the principles of behavior analysis and demonstrates sound professional judgment at all times.

Collaborates with families, caregivers and all service providers as necessary to ensure continuity of care.

Performs direct and indirect assessments to identify the function of client’s behaviors.

Develops a treatment plan (including behavior support plan) based on the functions of the behavior and treatment methodologies that are evidence-based.

Attends all relevant meetings for clients, including treatment team meetings, IEP/ISP (as allowed/needed) and staffing. Adequately demonstrates their abilities to work effectively as a part of a clinical team.

Attends any insurance authorization review calls for any individual on their caseload.

Collects data before and during the implementation of the plan so that the plan’s efficacy can be assessed and data-based decisions can be made.

Provides direct instruction/ongoing supervision, training and support to clients, staff members and family members during regularly-scheduled visits. This includes visiting each client twice a month in all relevant environments.

Evaluates the effectiveness of the implemented treatment plan and modifies the plan as necessary.

Upon receiving information from the director, the BCBA will initiate services with new clients in a timely manner.

Manages caseload and prepares and submits all required documentation on time. This includes, but is not limited to: assessments, treatment plans/BSPs, insurance updates as required, session notes after every session, at least monthly analysis of the data, updating the treatment plans as needed, participation in calls with insurance companies, etc.

Generates reports mandated by in a timely manner.

Supervises Registered Behavior Technician’s (RBTs) and BCaBAs if assigned to their caseload.

Performs other duties as requested/assigned.

Qualifications

Must have MA degree in related field and BCBA certification number. Certification must be kept up to date.

Must be able to identify and resolve obstacles in a timely manner; gather and analyze data; develop alternative solutions; must work well in group problem solving situations.

Must maintain confidentiality at all times.

Must write clearly and informatively; edit work for grammar and spelling and complete sentences; vary writing style to meet the needs of the agency/client; must be able to explain anything in reports in layman’s terms to families.

Must follow policies and procedures; complete tasks on time or notify the appropriate parties if a deadline will not be met; support the organization’s goals and values.

Must display original thinking and creativity; meet challenges with resourcefulness; generate suggestions for improving work, develop innovative approaches and ideas.

Flexible work from home options available.

Cross-Training of SW Developers in Analysis and Tradecraft
Cross-train other team personnel in analysis, tools, etc. to enable them to be more productive in handling raw datasets and signals tradecraft.

The Medical Economics Analyst is involved in short and long-term financial forecasting, budget development, measuring actual performance, developing updates of forecasts, and conducting ongoing analytics regarding performance. This position will liaise with the clinical and network teams regarding the financial implications of appropriate utilization and contractual structures.

Duties and Responsibilities


Analyze utilization, claims, and authorization data, to identify trends including querying data warehouses and repositories.
Analyze provider behavior including NPs, PCPs, specialists, ancillary, and inpatient providers.
Create analyses comparing results to actuarial data to evaluate program performance for management and external partners.
Analysis of specialty and ancillary medical costs to detect high-cost markets, potentially unjustified or inappropriate costs arising from providers, practice patterns, and unit costs.
Develop and use additional decision support tools to assist in Longevity’s strategic planning, business planning, capital planning, financial planning, and performance measurement.
Developing data-driven reporting on market and partner facility-level performance.
Developing rapid reporting and analysis of trends to Chief Financial Officer, appropriate senior management, and affected departments and business leaders.
Plan and oversee execution of annual budgeting and re-forecasting processes by market and department, including the development of calendar and activity plan, interfacing with all areas of company management, and preparation of budget presentations, for senior-level management.
Coordinate with technology team leadership to construct and maintain adequate data warehouses to facilitate analytics and reporting.
Coordinate with clinical leadership to translate activity to financial terms for assurance of properly reporting revenue and identifying opportunities for optimal accuracy.
Manage ad-hoc reporting for special projects to executive management.
Support account management functions including reporting and market-specific analytics related to enrollment, utilization, and growth.
Partnership with project management office to create dashboards and analytics.
Perform other duties as assigned.


Qualifications / Education / Licenses


Bachelor of Arts/Bachelor of Science Degree in accounting, finance, business, or equivalent combination of education and relevant work experience required.
Previous experience in healthcare industry preferred.
Previous experience with Medicare Advantage plans or medical groups helpful.
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
Strong working knowledge of SQL required.
Strong working knowledge of PowerBI or similar business intelligence tools required.
Ability to execute multiple tasks and adhere to strict deadlines in a fast-paced, changing, environment required.
Team working skills, persistence, high energy, initiative, and creativity - with a proven ability to manage significant initiatives across organizations and across geographies required.
Hands-on approach, with high attention to detail and accuracy required.
Effective communication and interpersonal skills, including the ability to interact effectively with all areas and levels required.
Proactive, assertive, and creative, approach to problem-solving required.
Team-oriented & flexible, able to work closely with all levels of management required.

MS Office (proficient/expert in Word, Excel, and PowerPoint).

Awarded World’s Best Small Ship Cruise line, Windstar Cruises is known for intimate yacht style experience and unique voyages to the world’s best small ports and hidden harbors. Its three sailing yachts and three all-suite yachts carry just 148 to 342 guests and cruise around the world.

Our Mission: We imagine and deliver personalized and immersive experiences 180 degrees from ordinary
Our Vision: Enriching people’s perspective through inspired travel
Our Values: Welcoming, Innovative, Now, Discipline, Serve, Teamwork, Authentic, Responsible

We are currently seeking a creative, thoughtful analytics professional to join our team. As Windstar Cruises’ Customer Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in managing and analyzing customer and travel agent data, optimizing marketing strategies, and enhancing the overall consumer experience. Working closely with marketing, sales, and IT teams, you will utilize your data-driven insights to drive consumer engagement, loyalty, and revenue growth. This position has the ability to be based out of our offices in either Doral, FL or Greenwood Village, CO.

Responsibilities (Text Only):Customer Database Management:

Oversee the collection, integration, and maintenance of customer and travel agent data from various sources (e.g. reservation systems, website, external lists, etc.) into the marketing data platform.
Ensure data accuracy, hygiene, and integrity to provide a reliable foundation for analysis and marketing campaigns.
Continuously assess and enhance the data structure to align with Windstar Cruises and Xanterra Travel Collection business needs and customer segmentation strategies.
Customer Data Analysis:

Utilize advanced analytics tools and techniques to analyze customer, prospect, and travel agent data to identify trends, behaviors, and preferences.
Derive actionable insights from data analysis to inform marketing and sales strategies, personalized messaging, and targeted campaigns.
Measure the effectiveness of marketing initiatives and provide recommendations for optimization.
Segmentation Strategy:

Collaborate with the marketing team to develop and refine customer segmentation strategies.
Create and manage customer segments based on demographic, behavioral, and transactional data to tailor marketing efforts and enhance customer experiences.
Reporting and Visualization:

Maintain existing and develop new standardized reports and dashboards to provide stakeholders with regular updates on customer engagement, campaign performance, and other key metrics.
Utilize data visualization tools to present complex data in a clear and compelling manner to facilitate decision-making.
Campaign Optimization:

assessing the marketing team to design A/B tests and conduct post-campaign analysis to assess the effectiveness of marketing initiatives.
Provide insights and recommendations for improving campaign performance and increasing ROI.
System Support:

Collaborate with IT and vendors to troubleshoot system issues and ensure seamless data flow and system upgrades as it relates to Sales and Marketing.
Document business rules, segmentation strategies, and workflows to facilitate system maintenance and knowledge sharing.
Customer Journey Mapping:

Analyze the customer and travel agent journey to identify pain points and opportunities for enhancing the overall experience.
Collaborate with the marketing, sales, and guest service teams to develop strategies to improve customer satisfaction and retention.
Qualifications (Text Only):

Proven experience 3 years as a customer data analyst or a similar role in the travel or hospitality industry required.
Bachelor’s degree in marketing, statistics, business, or a related field.
Strong proficiency in database management and SQL querying.
Experience working with CDP, customer data systems and related tools (e.g., RedPoint, Salesforce, etc.).
Proficiency in data analysis and visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, and/or Google Data Studio.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to translate data into actionable insights.
Excellent communication and presentation skills to convey complex data to non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work independently, manage multiple projects, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

Job Title: Americas and European Region Data Analyst
Job Description:
Americas and European Region Data Analyst
St. Petersburg, Florida




At Webull, we believe that everyone should have an equal opportunity to control their own financial future.In order to make this a reality, we work tirelessly to make sure all the key trading features (a comprehensive news cycle, real-time market data, and analytical tools) are completely free. We pride ourselves on our consistent platform innovation and granular datasets that will drive our customers to make smarter financial decisions. We are looking for a Data Analyst to join the Marketing team to support Americas and European Regions.

Roles & Responsibilities

Collaborate closely with the leadership/management team to gain a deep understanding of the company's overall growth strategies and objectives for the Americas and European region. Produce high-quality analysis reports that offer insights and recommendations, with a strong emphasis on measuring progress against key engagement, retention, and profitability targets.
Conduct in-depth analysis of user behavior data to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies. Develop and fine-tune user hierarchical models to enhance our understanding of user interactions with our platforms in the context of growth strategies.
Create compelling and informative data visualizations, using tools like PowerBI and Tableau, to effectively communicate progress and performance against key engagement, retention, and profitability metrics.
Utilize your proficiency in Python, SQL, and Excel to collect, clean, and transform data from diverse sources to support the analysis of growth strategy effectiveness.

Implement data validation and cleaning processes to ensure the accuracy and consistency of data used in analyses, particularly about key growth metrics.

Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, software engineers, and business analysts. Share insights and contribute to data-driven decisions aimed at optimizing growth strategies and achieving profitability.


Requirements:

Bachelor's degree or above in a relevant field such as mathematics, statistics, computer science, or a related discipline.
A minimum of 3 years of professional experience in data analysis, with a strong preference for experience in roles focused on supporting growth strategies.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages, including Python, SQL, and Excel.
Experience with data visualization tools such as PowerBI and Tableau, with a strong focus on key engagement, retention, and profitability metrics.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to communicate complex findings clearly and concisely.
Exceptional attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy and integrity.
Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills to facilitate effective collaboration with colleagues from various departments.
An understanding of the fintech industry and financial data is advantageous.


At Webull, we provide competitive and exciting benefits such as:

Full Paid Medical & Dental Insurance
Vision Insurance
401k & Commuter Benefits
Short term disability & Paid Parental Leave
Fitness Reimbursement Program
In office events & fun culture events
15 days’ vacation, 2 personal days, 7 sick days

Webull promotes diversity and provides equal opportunity for all applicants and employees. We are dedicated to building a company that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We believe that the more inclusive we are, the better our work (and work environment) will be for everyone.

Apply for this position
