Our promise to you:

Joining AdventHealth is about being part of something bigger. It’s about belonging to a community that believes in the wholeness of each person, and serves to uplift others in body, mind and spirit. AdventHealth is a place where you can thrive professionally, and grow spiritually, by Extending the Healing Ministry of Christ. Where you will be valued for who you are and the unique experiences you bring to our purpose-minded team. All while understanding that together we are even better.

Schedule: Full Time

Shift: Monday – Friday, 8am-5pm

The community you’ll be caring for:

Located on a lush tropical campus, our flagship hospital, 1,368-bed AdventHealth Orlando
We offer great benefits with immediate Health Insurance coverage
Career growth and advancement potential

The role you’ll contribute:

The Clinical Nurse Analyst is a registered professional nurse whose primary responsibilities include: leading and improving nursing clinical processes based on evidence based practices, formulating plans based on assessing the “best practice” at top tier of pediatric/adult institutions. Works with the nurses to determine best practices and implement a plan for change. Develops benchmarks and monitors for performance. Compiles and maintains data related to predetermined performance metrics. Whenever possible, benchmarks data with other hospitals. Collaborates closely with leadership to ensure work processes are aligned to NCQF, NQF(adult) and regulatory accreditation agencies. Utilizes the hospital performance improvement process (assess, plan, implement, and evaluate) to achieve goals. Actively participates in outstanding customer service and accepts responsibility in maintaining relationships that are equally respectful to all.

The value you’ll bring to the team:

Based on EBP, leads clinical process improvement teams.
Provides assessment of targeted pediatric or adult nursing processes and develops and leads work teams to reengineer work processes. Develops monitoring tools to evaluate the effectiveness of change. May enter patient rooms to complete patient safety and physical environment rounding.
Works collaboratively with Nursing leadership to improve patient care.
Prepares and maintains clinical close data or ICU Governance data and prepares information for Pediatric PPC or ICU Governance.
Researches clinical data to prepare for future compliance regulations according to State and National Standards. Participate in EBP, NACHRI, regulatory/accreditation and other hospital-based forums.
Oversee grass roots projects developed by the nursing units; provide clinical oversight to the projects.
Compiles and maintains data repositories.
Maintains and re-evaluates scorecards and dashboards weekly, monthly, and annually.
Researches and maintains validity to any and all reportable data.
Maintains open communication with all interdisciplinary departments.
Functions as a resource for event/incidents regarding patient admissions, transfers, transports, and discharges.
Maintains professional competency by participating in continuing education and appropriate learning experiences, both internal and external. Utilize in-house administration and specialists as resources. Attends pertinent conferences and seminars regarding clinical nursing business or nurse management.
Qualifications


The expertise and experiences you'll need to succeed:

KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS REQUIRED:

Pediatric/Adult nurse skills that take into account the developmental needs of the patient.
Extremely knowledgeable in “patient and family centered care” concepts.
Ability to lead work teams through process improvement activities
Personal qualities such as kindness, understanding, integrity, respect, sense of humor, discretion and confidentiality
Advanced computer skills in Excel and PowerPoint applications (pivot tables, basic statistical analysis)

KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS PREFERRED:

Basic statistical analysis

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:

Progressive nursing leadership experience
Graduate of School of Nursing
Minimum of 5 years’ experience as a nurse (pediatric nurse required for 6072; ICU/equivalent nursing experience required for 0831)

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE PREFERRED:

Baccalaureate and/or Master’s Degree in nursing
Pediatric or Adult nurse experience

LICENSURE, CERTIFICATION, OR REGISTRATION REQUIRED:

Current, valid State of Florida license as a registered professional nurse (RN)

Job Title: Analyst – Mobility, Parking, Operations, and Technology Planner
Job Description:
Analyst – Mobility, Parking, Operations, and Technology Planner
Work Location: Tampa, FL
Employment Type: Full-time regular
Are you looking for a challenging and rewarding environment where you will work alongside the industry’s best and most talented, with the opportunity to have a front row seat in planning analyses and decisions for the public and private sector? If so, you have found the perfect opportunity! Walker Consultants is seeking a seasoned individual to assist our planning, operations, and technology practice as we serve our clients throughout our southeast US market share. Our services apply decades of best practices that enhance the users’ experiences and advance the owners’ goals.
Our primary objectives always focus on achieving the following:
Make it easier for people to reach their destinations
Support and encourage transportation mode of choice
Optimize parking and transportation customer service and bottom lines
Improve quality of lives through economic growth and built environments that work for people
Perform due diligence services helping gauge market risk and upside potential
Responsibilities
At this continuing developmental level, this role performs:
Conduct extensive research and analyze data in specific or general parking, mobility, and transit areas using a variety of methods.
Define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
Write and present formal and technical reports, working papers, and correspondence.
Identify common problems, issues, and opportunities based on observation, research, and data analysis.
Develop strategies, actions, and projects to address identified issues consistent with community goals, best practices/standards, and applicable regulations.
Develop recommendations and implementation strategies.
Prepare information (i.e. project fact sheets, display boards, slides, online platforms, etc.) to explain projects to and gather input from stakeholders and the public.
Work with and communicate effectively with a broad range of team members, clients, review agencies, and others as appropriate for a range of project types.
Participate in a range of challenging parking, mobility, and transit projects including strategic urban plans, corridor and curb management studies, feasibility studies, and alternative analyses.
Support development of planning, operations, and technology documents with a primary focus on research, data collection, field assessment, data analysis, mapping, writing, and editing reports.
Prepare information to explain projects clearly and succinctly to stakeholders and public, as well as gather feedback and input from community members and stakeholders.
Assist with coordinating projects among team members, clients, and external consultants.
Communicate and interact with team members, clients, and review agencies.
10% travel required - overnight and air travel to client sites.
Qualifications
Two years demonstrated proficiency as an entry-level analyst or planner, or
Master’s degree in business, marketing, planning, architecture, engineering, or other degree appropriate to the area of concentration (mobility and parking planning, parking operations, parking technology, etc.), or
Five years transferable experience in parking, mobility and transportation industry, and
Appropriate verbal, writing, analytical and/or software skills for the specialty area.

Benefits of Joining Walker
As a skilled member of the Walker family, you will be given the opportunity to grow and develop your skills surrounded by committed, talented and enthusiastic co-workers. In addition to competitive compensation, as a full-time employee, Walker offers vacation retreats, tuition and professional certification reimbursement, professional organization membership reimbursement, 401(k) match and HSA employer contribution, commuter benefit accounts, medical, dental, vision insurance, flexible work schedules, and more!
Who We Are
Walker is a 100% employee-owned company of many capabilities offering professional services to clients in the private and public market sectors. Walker maintains a strong foundation as an industry leader in all aspects of parking planning, design, engineering, restoration, and consulting that encompass operations, technology, and mobility solutions engaging a wide spectrum of specialists and renowned experts who have been advancing standards in the industry for several decades.
Walker works collaboratively as a national team to provide sustainable planning and transportation solutions. From small towns to large urban metros and transit agencies, we help our clients build communities that are places people want to live, work, and have fun. For every project, we develop creative strategies that both put people first and are rooted in data and in line with overall goals for transportation, economic development, climate, and land use. We are focused on the future, and our plans and policies are shaped by technology, data, and infrastructure that optimize current and future investments.
You’ll join a dedicated team working with a variety of clients (cities, transit agencies, metropolitan planning organizations, hospitals, airports, universities, developers, and others) on cutting edge projects to plan for the future of transit, manage curb space, and provide more sustainable mobility options for people. This includes planning transit around a system of solar microgrids to power electric bus fleets and local resiliency/mobility hubs.
You’ll have an opportunity to directly test ideas, shape policy, and see your plans implemented. At Walker we go beyond planning, we guide implementation.
Walker Consultants is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). We invite all qualified applicants to apply and do not discriminate against individuals because of their race, color, religion, national origin, gender, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or age.

Responsibilities:

Manage the quality, integrity, and validity of security, pricing, and analytics data for DWS.

Strong experience in Data Quality, root cause analysis, and identification of process improvements.
Subject matter expertise in Data Management complex issues.
Ability to ensure tasks are followed according to Operating Procedures and provide support to offshore teams.
Act as an escalation point for Front Office queries - Pricing and Data-related issues.
Detailed understanding of Pricing and Analytics across multiple asset classes.

Skills That Will Help You Excel:

Proactive problem-solving and the ability to work under time-sensitive and high-pressure environments.
Continual improvement mindset and a focus on seeking more efficient solutions.
Ownership mentality, demonstrating commitment to organizational values and beliefs.
Sound judgment in raising concerns and escalating with management.
Strong critical thinking skills and the ability to learn quickly.
Building and maintaining strong internal and external working relationships.
Excellent organization and communication skills.
Thoroughness and attention to detail.

2 years

Streamline Defense is seeking an exceptionally qualified candidate to serve as an Operation Research System Analyst (ORSA) in support of Headquarters, United States Special Operations Command (HQ USSOCOM) J52 Integration.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Supports USSOCOM J52 in developing USSOCOM strategy, policy, and plans that provide key and critical insights through structured and analytic studies of SOF strategies, plans, and posture to inform USSOCOM senior leaders' strategic understanding and articulation of risk that drive decisions on forces, footprints, and agreements; planning guidance and implementation; and force development. Formulate and apply mathematical modeling and other optimizing methods to develop and interpret information that assists management with decision making, policy formulation, or other managerial functions. May collect and analyze data and develop decision support software, service, or products. May develop and supply optimal time, cost, or logistics networks for program evaluation, review, or implementation. Provide structured analysis and strategic assessment during the development of strategic planning, command strategy, posture, readiness, risk assessments, and operational return on investments that support evidence-based recommendations to and decisions by USSOCOM senior leaders.

Support assigned Operational Planning Teams (OPTs), Crisis Action Teams (CATs), and other boards, bureaus, centers, cells and working groups (B2C2WG) as needed.
Support the development of USSOCOM strategic documents by providing ORSA expertise, document preparation and coordination, data collection and analysis, and seminar/symposium, conference, and wargame support.
Provide technical expertise and capability for conducting ORSA projects, which are studies and analyses efforts using ORSA methods and tools in support of joint planning and contingency operations (refer to Joint Publications 3-0 and 5-0).
Execute high-visibility, urgent, and critical ORSA projects, requiring a variety of ORSA methods and tools. Such projects may be very large, extremely complex and of major importance to national security.
Apply operation research methods to identify and solve real-world problems for USSOCOM. Exercise sound military and analytic judgment in applying standard professional ORSA practices. Be creative and innovative in selecting and applying methods and tools to solve problems, enhance performance, or increase efficiency and effectiveness.
Use statistical analysis, simulations, stochastic and deterministic modeling, or other methods to analyze information and develop practical solutions to fit specific situations.
Perform analysis of program/project performance and design of experiments.
Understand and explain underlying, unique, and very difficult to define relationships that may require unconventional approaches or the application and adaptation of sophisticated analytical techniques producing original results.
Develop analytical approaches and supporting processes to address a wide variety of ambiguous, complex, compounding problems given only a skeletal framework or foundation for departure characterized by either their expansive breadth or depth where analytic precedents and guidelines often do not exist.
Design, develop and advocate for new analytic capabilities and technical improvements consistent with evolving requirements within the command (e.g., data mining and analysis, systems analysis, social analysis, wargaming, survey design and analysis).

REQUIREMENTS

Current TOP SECRET security clearance with SCI eligibility
Civilian Education: MA/MS Preferred Disciplines: Social Sciences, Public Policy, Applied Statistics, Operations Research, Systems Analysis; OR Military Education: CGSC Equivalent or Higher (SAMS or equivalent; War College or equivalent; JPME II).
MS degree or higher in Operations Research and 10-15+ years operations research systems analyst (ORSA) experience.
Optional Specializations (One or More Areas Preferred): 5+ years in SOF; PSYOP; MILDEC; CWMD; CYBER; AT/FP; SNA; Special Programs; Interagency Experience, Intelligence, CCMD.

The Air Force Civil Engineer (AFCEC) community has identified the cybersecurity of Civil Engineer (CE) Control Systems as essential in securing the infrastructure at Department of the Air Force (DAF) installations. The AFCEC Operations Directorate (AFCEC/CO) is tasked to support securing this infrastructure by contracting for cybersecurity service capabilities on behalf of the CE enterprise. AFCEC manages cyber risk; and identifies, mitigates, monitors, and predicts cyber vulnerabilities related to CE Control Systems worldwide. By Light is looking to staff positions that would provide innovative, customer-focused, and cost-effective Information Assurance/cybersecurity support services by applying industry standard best practices in addressing mission requirements.

Monitor assets and respond to active threats affecting various types of components

Oversee detection and assessment of, reporting upon, and general response to information security incidents.
Provide timely, detailed, and complete reports on security events and incidents to leadership and client executive stakeholders.
Lead investigations towards identifying root cause for security events, evaluating anomalous activity, and tuning for frequent false positives.
Maintain up-to-date detailed knowledge of the IT security industry including awareness of new or revised security solutions, improved security processes, and the development of new attacks and threat vectors.
Document best practices with the Cybersecurity and Operations staff using available collaboration tools and workspaces.
Develop and maintain both internal and client-facing documentation and procedures for reviewing and enforcing end-to-end client security and compliance.
Anticipate new security threats and stay-up to date with evolving infrastructures.
Provide an areas of improvement report that aligns to SOC processes and tools to enhance security operations.
Provide tactical implementation reports of the incident reporting processes, staffing, and technologies.
Provide guidance to Junior and different tier level resources supporting operations.

Understanding of attacker tactics, techniques and procedures

Ability to multitask and have practical time management skills.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Teams, and SharePoint.

The Data Analyst to join our Investment Portfolio Loss Recovery & Claims Filing team. You will be responsible for supporting the department through accessing data, building report, and providing analytical insights.

Our ideal candidate is an experienced professional with demonstrable data management and analytical skills. Handles routine data bases including planning, installation, configuration, database design, migration, performance monitoring, security, troubleshooting, as well as backup and data recovery.

Secures information by completing database backups.

Establishes workflow, and analyst project priorities.

Solid analytical, problem solving and research skills.

Ability to QA and troubleshooting data.
Strong written, verbal communication skills.

SHRSS is seeking a highly motivated, goal-oriented, dedicated Data Protection & Compliance Analyst to join our exciting and fast-paced Global Data Protection team in Davie, Florida. Working with the GDPO, the Data Protection & Compliance Analyst will assist in providing advice to business teams, while providing compliance support on all aspects of Global privacy laws and regulations, with primary emphasis on GDPR, CCPA, Privacy Shield and state data breach notification laws. The Data Protection & Compliance Analyst will also assist in refining and standing up new data protection readiness programs necessitated by evolving global data protection laws and regulatory frameworks. Our team is growing and if you are equally passionate about privacy, data management, and career growth, an opportunity at Seminole Hard Rock may be a great match!

High level of personal integrity and confidentiality.

Job Title: Treasury Transformation Lead Business Analyst – VP/ C13
Job Description:
The Treasury Transformation Team works closely with stakeholders to define, drive and execute end-to-end process design and implementation efforts for controls, infrastructure and operational toolsets required to support the day-to-day Liquidity Risk Management and reporting functions. These functions include but are not limited to liquidity regulatory reporting and metrics, management reporting and liquidity stress testing which span global Treasury groups, Finance functions, technology partners and business partners. The Treasury Transformation Controls Team is responsible for the delivery of Treasury’s transformation objectives related to liquidity risk and controls, and collaborates with stakeholders to identify priorities, coordinate efforts, track progress, define and implement best practices. The Treasury Transformation Controls Lead Business Analyst will be responsible to manage a set of supporting activities under the assigned book of work. The position will require coordination of activities across multiple liquidity functions, the ability to identify and recommend informed process improvements to the Project Manager and senior stakeholders. Additionally, this position will work closely with the Transformation Delivery Leads, Program Managers, Project Manager, PMO, QA/QC & IA.

Responsibilities:

Provides support and own a set of activities, working closely with the Treasury Transformation Controls Program and Project Manager.
Provides support on transformational efforts related to consent order and target state priorities, aligned with the firm-wide transformational goals.
Responsibilities can include but are not limited to: contributing to the creation and drafting of project plans and other project related artifacts, decks and stakeholder communications.
Provides support on project plan tracking, status reporting, creating and/or managing project governance forums, prioritizing workflow and resource management.
Supports transformation projects, organizational change initiatives, and the improvement, development and implementation of existing and new controls.
Applies in-depth knowledge of the business impact of process design and technical contributions.
Provides advice to internal and external clients on the implications of business trends, issues, operating environment changes and firm or business unit strategy.
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
Performs other duties and functions as assigned.
Qualifications:
6-10+ years of relevant experience, within the Financial Service.
Experience in a Project Manager and/ or Business Analyst Role, with exposure to Treasury, Liquidity Risk Management & controls strongly preferred.
Requires communication and diplomacy skills in order to guide and influence others.
Experience and demonstrated ability to manage competing priorities in a complex and dynamic environment.
Analytical mindset to resolve issues in a variety of complex situations and excellent quantitative and qualitative skills; being able to analyze data, draw conclusions, identify trends and issues, and diagnose root cause of issues.
Track record of success in delivering high quality work in a fast paced and dynamic environment.
Self-motivated with the ability to make decisions in the absence of detailed instructions.
Advanced Microsoft Office skills.
In depth knowledge of financial & regulatory reporting/ banking products / systems preferred.
Successful project management knowledge and experience preferred.
Excellent Verbal and Written Communication Skills required.
JIRA and/or Project Management System knowledge preferred or ability to quickly learn Citi’s Project Management Systems and Methodologies.
Education:
Bachelors degree required, Masters degree preferred

Job Description
About Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University:

At Embry-Riddle, we take pride in our position as the world's largest and most comprehensive university dedicated to aviation and aerospace. Located in Daytona Beach, Florida, and Prescott, Arizona, our esteemed residential campuses offer a prestigious educational experience. However, our commitment to education knows no borders as our Worldwide campus expands our reach globally, providing a world-class education online and at approximately 110 locations across the United States, Asia, Europe, and Central and South America. This breadth of reach ensures that students can access our exceptional programs without geographical limitations.

With a history spanning nearly a century, we have continually adapted to the dynamic needs of the industries we support. In the Academic Year 2022-23, we welcomed over 11,100 students to our residential campuses and over 19,000 students at our worldwide campus.

Join our global community and embark on a journey of academic excellence and limitless possibilities. Employees working more than 30 hours a week can enjoy medical, dental and vision benefits, an amazing retirement plan with immediate vesting that includes a 6% gift and up to 4% match, free tuition for employees and their immediate family members, and a generous personal leave program. To find out more about our benefits and why ERAU has been named a “Great College to Work For” for 13 consecutive years, visit our
careers page
.

The Opportunity:
The Department of Institutional Research at Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University is currently recruiting for a Data Analyst to join the team. The Data Analyst will provide critical support in the facilitation of timely and accurate collection and retrieval of University data for official external reporting and internal decision-making. The Data Analyst will focus on data provision and analyses of academic course and faculty-related information, and will serve as a central data provider in a multi-campus environment, each with their own distinct profiles, reporting requirements, and decision-making needs.
Responsibilities include the following:
Develop a thorough understanding of university data sources and the flow of data throughout university systems. Understand the appropriate use of each.
Extract data from university enterprise and warehouse sources. Verify data accuracy; initiate and resolve data quality issues.
Use statistical software programming language to manipulate data and produce vetted, official datasets for multiple uses.
Maintain an understanding of external reporting requirements and activities such as IPEDS, Common Data Set, college directories/rankings, etc. Prepare and submit university summative data.
Develop and maintain reports and dynamic visualizations for university decision-making. Use appropriate applications and data to assist administrators, faculty, and staff in obtaining timely, accurate, and relevant information. Provide training for the use of self-service tools and dashboards to university personnel and/or teams.
Maintain up-to-date documentation on all projects, processes, and reports. Independently establish and manage project timelines.
Collaborate with other IR, IT, and Business Intelligence staff, as well as functional area subject matter experts, to clarify reporting methodologies, establish data standards and definitions, provide consistency and ensure accuracy in reporting.
Provide input for developing and improving systems and procedures. Represent IR on campus-wide committees as needed.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree with an area of concentration in Data Science, Data Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, or any field with a strong analytical focus.
At least one year of experience working with data analytics.
Experience working with a multitude of higher education divisions, especially Academic Affairs and Registrars.
Experience with a statistical programming software package (e.g. SPSS, SAS, R) and creating tabular/graphical representations of data. Preference for SPSS.
Experience with data analytics/visualization software, such as PowerBI, Tableau, or OBIEE.
Knowledge of relational and dimensional databases.
Understanding of a database querying language, such as SQL.
Knowledge of institutional research and its practices..

Job Title: Business Analyst I, FIS University Program
Job Description:
Position Type :

Full time

Job Description

Are you curious, motivated, and forward-thinking? At FIS, you will have the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging and relevant issues in financial services and technology. Our talented people empower us, and we believe in being part of a team that is open, collaborative, entrepreneurial, passionate, and above all, fun.


Join the 2024 FIS University Program!


As a 2024 FIS University Program full-time employee, you will have the opportunity to participate in team projects, community service activities, professional development seminars and work with a team that is invested in your growth, development, and success; including bi-annual performance connects with your manager.


This two-year full-time program has start dates in January, March, June, and September with a dedicated “Learning Week” where you will:

Learn how to work within a corporate environment

Learn about the exciting world of Fintech and the role FIS plays

Hear from FIS leadership about their journey and participate in senior leader networking opportunities

Build a network of your peers from across the organization


This position is for a January 2024 start.


About the team

As part of the global fintech firm, FIS, the Wealth business is a leading, award-winning, global provider of technology and service solutions to the wealth management industry across North America and the UK. FIS Wealth supports banks, investment houses, asset managers, and family offices in growing their businesses, against a backdrop of an explosive digital evolution of the industry and during a period of complete reframing of the global wealth management sector. The business services some $3trn of clients’ assets annually and holds assets under administration of c. $1.6trn.


What you will be doing

Working closely with Enterprise Strategist to analyze market landscape and corporate-wide research and development decisions and align with corporate vision and strategy

Working closely with strategic pricing personnel to advise and influence the Head of Strategy on revenue and profit-maximizing pricing, pricing strategy, and key account revenue structure

In conjunction with competitive intelligence personnel, analyze and create presentations including details on competitors, mega-trends, strategic threats, and industry inflection points

Help define and create the Strategy Team roadmap containing relevant meetings/sessions and timely creation of updates to ensure the Strategy is continually broadcast across relevant corporate teams.

Analyze the financial data across the Wealth business units and present the raw data and the relevant informed insights and conclusions

Analyze and identify possible new growth initiatives, and build a pipeline of opportunities for partnerships that will result in growing the business


What you bring

Bachelor’s degree in relevant field of study

Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite

Fluent in English; Strong written and verbal communication skills

Adaptability, a drive to learn, and strong problem-solving skills

Ability to work well independently and within a team


Bonus if you have

Good analytical and dissemination skills

Understanding of and ability to analyze business financial numbers

An interest in technology and themes affecting and driving the wealth management and asset servicing industry


What we offer you

Competitive salary and excellent benefits

The chance to work on some of the most challenging, relevant issues in financial services & technology

A broad range of professional education and personal development possibilities – FIS is your final career step!

Time to support charities and give back to your community

A work environment built on collaboration, flexibility, and respect

Student Loan Repayment Program: FIS will PAY OFF participants’ undergraduate loan balance over 10 years of service! Eligibility starts after one year of tenure in the program. The benefit applied to undergraduate student loans for US-based degrees and must be in the employee’s name.

*Current and future sponsorship are not available for this position*

The Payroll & Business Analyst will lead the payroll process for Mowi USA business unit. Will be responsible for processing payroll, providing technical aid and supporting process improvement for Human Resources. The Payroll & Business Analyst will establish the developing of automated payroll processes: increasing payroll functionality, preparing monthly reports and managing payroll functions. Will also be in charge of preparing monthly payroll accrual, assisting with general accounting tasks and the monthly close process. The Payroll & Business Analyst will develop a robust understanding of all business unit regulatory standards, in order to ensure governance and compliance.

Responsibilities

Ensure payroll is processed timely and accurately.
Enter weekly payroll changes (not processed through self-service and HR processes). Audit the payroll register to ensure changes were captured and payroll is accurate.
Develop strong relationships with HR, through partnering with the team and assisting in process improvement related to HR functions and payroll systems. Provide excellent customer service to Mowi employees.
Support HR in the development of resources within Workforce Now, including: recruitment, employee goals and appraisals, reporting and analytical resources.
Provide support in the development of electronic employee files, including: assistance with self-audits and recommendations for improvements.
Support continued development of Workforce Now to provide improved self-service experience and increase self-service use.
Lead annual benefit and compliance reporting and audit processes, including: 401k audit, workers compensation audit, Self-Insured Medical Plan audit, 1095 review, EEO1 filing, etc.
Process weekly 401k contribution upload and reconcile payroll and 401k data.
Manage all garnishments, deductions, and Paid Time Off (PTO) balances in ADP Workforce Now.
Manage ACA compliance within Workforce Now.
Maintain knowledge of trends, best practices, regulatory changes, and new technologies in payroll.
Assist with the maintenance of fixed assets including processing additions, dispositions and running monthly depreciation.
Reconcile bank accounts including checking,

Qualifications and Skills

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Outstanding interpersonal, negotiation, and conflict resolution skills.
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to prioritize tasks and to delegate them when appropriate.
Ability to act with integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality.
Experience using ADP Workforce Now preferred.
Must possess thorough knowledge of employment-related laws and regulations.
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite.
Ability to develop strong trusting relationships, in order to gain support and achieve results, within a diverse group of employees, ranging from a field environment to a corporate setting.
Flexibility and ability to interact with employees at all levels.

Education:

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Business Administration or related field preferred.
Minimum 5 years’ of experience in a corporate environment preferred.
Minimum 5 years’ of experience in Payroll preferred.

Job Purpose

This role is responsible for developing and implementing analytics leveraged by merchandising and SEG Compass. Analytics are utilized to execute merchandising strategy for pricing, promotions, assortment, and vendor management. Analytics include querying information for ad hoc requests directly from merchandising stakeholders and building dashboards that stakeholders leverage on a daily basis. Provides recommendations & actionable insights that merchants can leverage. Executes white tags retails to align with pricing strategy.

The Florida Legislature
Florida House of Representatives




Job Title

Analyst (Transportation & Modals)




General Summary

This position primarily focuses on issues related to transportation through multiple modes, including highways and streets, air, rail, sea, spaceports, public transit, and bicycle and pedestrian facilities. The position also works on issues related to transportation services and noncriminal traffic infractions. Under close supervision of the staff director and policy chief, the analyst conducts research and prepares staff analyses, reports, legislation, and amendments; responds to inquiries; and develops correspondence.




Examples of Work Performed

Analyzes and objectively summarizes proposed legislation to determine its effectiveness and the impact of its passage on the state and other entities and individuals.
Researches and drafts legislation and amendments to legislation at the direction of the committee chair, committee members, and other legislators.
Assists in planning full committee and/or subcommittee meetings to include agenda, speakers, presentations, and materials.
Monitors the implementation of legislation in the Executive and Judicial Branches to ascertain that legislative intent is met.
Briefs legislators verbally or in writing on issues to be discussed in committee, on the floor, or with constituents.
Conceives, plans, and conducts research projects and performs legislatively mandated studies.
Prepares oral and written reports on research and committee work such as end of session committee reports, interim projects, and oversight reports which include recommendations for legislative action.
Provides information and problem-solving assistance to legislators, their constituents, and the public.
Prepares letters, summaries, talk-sheets or speeches, reports, and informational memoranda on committee issues at the request of the committee chair, other legislators, or staff director.
Keeps abreast of new and ongoing issues affecting assigned area of responsibility by collecting resource materials, attending workshops and conferences, reading industry publications, communicating with agency personnel, and the public.
Assists in the coordination of the work of the administrative assistant, legislative intern, and other staff members.
Serves as liaison with state agencies.
May utilize word processing and/or spreadsheet applications.
Performs other related duties as required.



Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Knowledge of legal terminology and legal research.
Knowledge of applicable computer programs.
Knowledge of Florida state government, legislative rules, and procedures.
Skill in reading comprehension, analysis, and organization.
Ability to communicate effectively and concisely, verbally and in writing.
Ability to take action in situations which lack clear direction.
Ability to take initiative on independent research projects.
Ability to produce quality work under pressure.
Ability to deal tactfully and courteously with the demands of Legislators, their staff, and the public.
Ability to plan, organize, and coordinate work assignments.
Ability to work cooperatively as a team member and to contribute to the efficient internal functioning of the committee staff.
Ability to conduct in-depth, carefully documented and credible analysis under minimal supervision within established deadlines.
Ability to conduct meetings and to make presentations.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with others.
Ability to work independently.
Ability to collect and analyze data.
Ability to organize data into logical formats for presentation in reports, documents, and other written materials.
Ability to solve problems and make decisions.
Ability to exercise discretion and confidentiality.



Minimum Qualifications

A bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university and three years of professional experience in research, analysis, program planning and evaluation, or administrative work.

A master's degree from an accredited college or university can substitute for one year of the required experience.

A doctorate from an accredited college or university can substitute for two years of the required experience.

Professional experience as described above may substitute on a year-for-year basis for the required college education.




Salary

Commensurate with experience. The Legislature offers a competitive benefits package.

This position is not eligible for remote work.




Application Deadline

Open until filled.




Submission of Application

Qualified applicants should send a completed legislative application and resume to:

Office of Administration & Professional Development
Florida House of Representatives
402 South Monroe Street, 1201 Capitol
Tallahassee, Florida 32399

Or email HouseAPD@myfloridahouse.gov




Applications are available through the Florida Legislature's web site Online Sunshine and in Room 701 of the Claude Pepper Building.




Accommodation for Disability

If an accommodation is needed for a disability, please notify Human Resources at (850) 488-6803.

The Identity and Access Management Senior IAM Analyst is a hands-on role involved in the day-to-day administration of Identity and Access Management specific to the Joiner/Mover/Leaver process. Position is responsible for a broad range of tasks, including administration of IDAM tools and process development, as well as access control administration and assisting the Security Analysts, Security Engineers, and Security Architects in first level support initiatives.

The individual in this position interacts closely with personnel from the entire IT team, including User Services, Systems Engineering, and with business departments. A working knowledge of Flowers’ operating systems, applications, and IT processes is required.


Job Responsibilities
Perform access management security administration on designated technology platforms, including operating systems, applications in accordance with the defined policies, standards and procedures of the organization, as well as with industry best practices and vendor guidelines.
Investigating and implementing an IDAM and privileged identity management (PIM) system to align with access policy and processes.
Create/Maintain documentation for IDAM and PIM
Provide support for onboarding of new applications to Identity Management tool
Assist with designing and implementing the Joiner/Mover/Leaver (JML) process
Assist with Audit evidence gathering
Assist with quarterly SPEC campaign (Privileged Access Reviews)
Assist Security Analyst as needed to monitor system logs, SIEM tools and network traffic for unusual or suspicious activity.
Identifying monitoring opportunities and developing standard operating procedures for the SOC around access granting, usage and removal
Assist Security Analyst as needed to produce exception and management reports.
Stay up to date on industry trends in IDAM and PIM.
Help coach and train team members to grow the SAP knowledgebase of the team.
Provide oversight and leadership to team members regarding tickets, escalations, issues and training opportunities.
Other assigned duties as needed.

Desired Experience
InfoSec certifications from organizations such as CompTIA, ISC2, EC Council, or GIAC Essentials a plus.
Must obtain an entry level industry security certification within 12 months of accepting the position.
4+ years of information technology experience including at least 3 years IT security experience.
4+ years of applicable IT (or similar) service department experience, required
Experience with customer service ticketing systems & managing SLAs.
Supervisory experience, preferred.
Strong working knowledge of IT technical requirements.
Strong knowledge of application onboarding practices
Basic knowledge of quarterly Privileged Access Review process
Ability to analyze data and capture & present Audit evidence
Ability to anticipate challenges and effectively resolve conflict.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment while maintaining high work standards.
Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively.
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple initiatives simultaneously.
Ability to take responsibility for assignments and see them through to a successful completion with little oversight.
Ability to be diplomatic, resourceful and persuasive; effective negotiation skills.
Experience with SAP Access Control and user maintenance
Working technical knowledge of current systems' software, protocols and standards.
Basic knowledge of TCP/IP and network administration/protocols.
Desired Education
A degree in a computer-related field such as computer science, management information system or information science. Five years of relevant IT job experience may be substituted for the degree requirement.

Role Description:

We are seeking a Last Mile Operations Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will be responsible for managing and optimizing the final stage of our delivery process. Your key duties will include building efficient routes, utilizing Excel to create comprehensive spreadsheets, and ensuring smooth communication with the Logistics AGS team regarding AWB delivery and flight status. You will play a crucial part in fostering collaboration across various departments, conducting follow-ups with cross-functional teams, and keeping the supervisor updated on all relevant data. Additionally, you will contribute to the continuous improvement of our last mile operations through data-driven insights and analysis.

Key Responsibilities:

- Develop and optimize delivery routes for efficient last mile operations.

- Utilize Excel to create detailed spreadsheets for tracking and analysis purposes.

- Establish and maintain effective communication channels with the Logistics AGS team to ensure timely delivery and flight coordination.

- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to address any operational challenges and ensure smooth last mile delivery.

- Provide regular updates to the supervisor on all aspects of last mile operations, including data analysis and performance metrics.

- Conduct regular follow-ups to ensure the timely resolution of any operational issues.

- Actively participate in data analysis to identify areas for operational improvement and efficiency enhancement within last mile operations.

- Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all relevant last mile operation data for reporting and analysis purposes.

- Proactively identify and suggest process improvements based on data-driven insights.

- Work closely with the team to implement any recommended changes and enhancements for better last mile performance.

Please note that the outlined roles and duties are not exhaustive and may be subject to additional responsibilities as per the evolving requirements of the company. The role may require flexibility in task allocation and the undertaking of other duties as assigned by the supervisor or management. The company reserves the right to modify, interpret, and apply this job description at its discretion.

The responsibilities are intended to provide a general overview of the primary duties associated with the Last Mile Operations Data Analyst role. However, the nature of the job may necessitate the inclusion of other tasks or the modification of existing ones, considering the dynamic nature of the logistics and last mile delivery industry. Employees may be required to undertake additional responsibilities, as needed, to ensure the smooth functioning of operations and the attainment of organizational objectives.

The company is committed to providing a dynamic and inclusive work environment that fosters professional growth and development. Employees are encouraged to demonstrate flexibility, adaptability, and a proactive approach to meet the demands of the role and contribute to the overall success of the organization.

Skills and Qualifications:

- Proficiency in building and optimizing delivery routes using relevant tools and software.

- Advanced knowledge of Excel and other data analysis tools for creating detailed spreadsheets and performing data analysis.

- Excellent communication skills to effectively liaise with the Logistics AGS team and cross-functional departments.

- Strong organizational skills to manage and prioritize multiple tasks and responsibilities.

- Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and meet tight deadlines.

- Analytical mindset with a keen eye for detail and the ability to translate data into actionable insights.

- Proactive attitude with a focus on continuous process improvement and operational efficiency.

- Previous experience in last mile operations or a related field is preferred.

Join our team and contribute to the optimization of our last mile operations, ensuring timely and efficient delivery to our valued customers.

If you are a highly motivated individual with a passion for data analysis and a desire to make an impact through actionable insights, we encourage you to apply. Join our team of talented professionals dedicated to driving data-driven decision-making and unlocking the full potential of our organization.

Job Title: SVP O&T Data Modeling Senior Analyst
Job Description:
Operations & Technology (O&T) enables Citi to achieve its day-to-day operational and long-term growth goals, enabling execution of Citi’s Strategy by providing services, technical solutions and infrastructure across the bank. Within O&T, the Enterprise Chief Data Office drives adoption and adherence to the Citi Data Governance Policy including standards, tools, and processes. Ensure a consistent and controlled approach across O&T to create, maintain and use Enterprise Data as a critical corporate asset and execute on O&T’s Vision and Strategy.

The Data Modeling Senior Analyst is a newly created role and is a key function in the Data Authority & Capabilities team within O&T CDO. The Data Authority & Capabilities function is responsible for Authoritative Data Sources and Data Roles Designation, Data Quality Monitoring, Data Lineage, and Logical Data Models etc.

Responsibilities:

Plan, coordinate and execute creation and registration of logical data models across O&T
Design and maintain logical and physical data models for business applications across EO&T functions including Technology, Operations, Third Party, Employee Services
Partner with enterprise model team to continuously improve modeling program and tooling used.
Participate and drive engineering solutions that are scalable and sustainable to ensure alignment with Citi Data Policy and Citi Data Standard

Title: Business Analyst
Location: Boca Raton
Duration: 7 Months
Interview Type: In Person

Job Description:

Serves as a liaison between the business community and the IT organization in order to provide technical solutions to meet user needs.

Possesses expertise in the business unit(s) they support, as well as, an understanding of the IT organization's systems and capabilities.

Analyzes business partner's operations to understand their strengths and weaknesses to determine opportunities to automate processes and functions.

Assists in the business process redesign and documentation as needed for new technology.

Translates high level business requirements into functional specifications for the IT organization and manages changes to such specifications.

Educates the IT organization on the direction of the business.

Negotiates agreements and commitments by facilitating communication between business unit(s) and IT from initial requirements to final implementation.

Possesses an understanding of technological trends and uses this knowledge to bring solutions to business units supported to enhance the enterprise's competitive edge.

May make recommendations for buy vs. build decision.



Education:

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, or other related field. Or equivalent work experience

Bachelor's degree in finance is also acceptable.



Experience:

Typically has 3 to 5 years of relevant technical or business work experience. Five years preferred.

Complexity:

Intermediate professional level role. Works with business partners within one business function to align technology solutions with business strategies.

Demonstrates an informed knowledge of a business area to resolve problems on an ongoing business.

Supports several moderately complex business processes.

Works on multiple projects as a project team member, occasionally as a project leader.

May coach more junior staff.



Other Requirements & Qualifications:

The business analyst will be responsible for identifying specific business opportunities and collecting and analyzing the data; simplifying requirements with the help of flow diagrams and use cases; influencing stakeholders to support business projects; leading projects and coordinating with other teams to produce better business results; testing business processes and recommending improvements; preparing, reviewing, revising and maintaining technical documents, including software and systems engineering, system operations, testing and user documentation; gathering and analyzing technical and product information from various sources to document new or changing product functionality; and assisting in the business process redesign and documentation as needed for new technology.

The ideal candidate should have high-level written and verbal communication skills, with an emphasis on technical writing.

There is a need for a candidate with analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving abilities, with high-level presentation and negotiation skills.

A strong ability to adapt and work in a fast-paced environment is critical, as is the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously, with an eye for prioritization.

The candidate should possess an in-depth understanding of organizational data flow and its use in management decision making.

High-level SQL skills and a clear understanding of web services is required

This position is responsible for providing direct support to end users in the efficient and accurate utilization of the IS Imaging Informatics applications and the electronic medical record as it relates to imaging. Analysts participate in building, testing and validating new functionality and engaging in custom configuration activities. Analysts perform in-depth analysis of workflows, data collection, report details and other technical issues associated with the use of clinical applications. Conduct clinical workflow analysis and assess need for workflow redesign and process improvement.

Participate in the evaluation, testing and validation of new release and upgrade functionality.
Develop project management skills and utilize project management methodology in daily work to ensure achievement of project goals. May lead projects impacting multiple teams.
Facilitate change and employ change management methods in advancing innovation, technology and decision support.
Respond to assigned Service Now tickets within the defined timeframes.

Project Management experience preferred.

The Business Analyst, Information Technology will be the discipline of enterprise analysis and planning strategic methods to meet the business goals of our organization. You will strive to meet the company needs by understanding business models and our business operations and integrating them with technology. You will be tasked with analyzing our organization’s efficiency by studying its needs, its business model, its workflows, and its technological systems. Making recommendations to the CIO. This employee will be asked to research possible software solutions to increase work efficiency, estimating costs and time requirements of projects and ensuring deliverables.

MAJOR RESPONSIBLITIES:

Serves as the project level liaison, between the IT organization and business partners, is business oriented with good technical understanding.
Experience with business and technical requirements gathering, analysis, vetting, prioritization and documentation, business process modeling/mapping, testing and implementation.
The key responsibility is to help derive and manage the requirements, work with inhouse and external developers to build solutions or integrate, or customize cloud/SAAS/custom type solutions etc. to ensure requirements are met in technology deliverables.
Captures business requirements and translates them actionable technical specifications, functional specifications, and system and data mappings, and works seamlessly with Information Technology engineers to translate, construct and deliver the technical solution. This includes researching and analyzing user’s business requirements, technical specifications, writing test plans in support of business functions, process knowledge and system requirements.
Serves as the SPOC to varied business functions across the IT portfolio of work. Will possess and continuously develop process expertise in the business units supported, as well as functional expertise in the suite of applications supporting those processes. These suite of applications include and are not limited to – custom inhouse developed franchise solution, Greatplains, SSRS and Power BI dashboards, SharePoint, MS Office, MS Project Online etc.
Experience in project management. Has had some exposure managing projects, scope, milestones to deliver on time, within budget and scope. Set and manage meetings and deadlines cross functionally. Direct and oversee project teams manage issue resolutions and communicate progress of projects to all stakeholders, etc.
Vendor management experience for technical escalations a plus. Experience creating SOW’s and RFP’s to vendors when needed and reviewing proposals and statements of work in response a plus.
Some weekend, off hour work required for maintenance and production releases

Qualifications:

8+ years in a technical BA role
8+ years enterprise IT experience
8+ years managing enterprise projects ie ERP implementations, Inventory and supply chain etc.
Bachelor’s degree required in MIS/CIS, computer science, or related role 3-5 years quality assurance or business analyst experience in a software development environment
Understanding of Agile programming; working with shorter release cycle/continuous delivery environment
Strong knowledge of Business Analyst techniques and tools
Please provide portfolio of business / functional requirements, technical specifications, test cases, UAT feedback, deployment plans, process analysis, timelines, RFP’s and other relevant documents
Relevant certifications– CBAP, PMP
ITIL exposure
Experience in franchise industry is highly desirable.
On Site work is a must

Benefits: After 90 days of employment

401k (50% match up to 6% after a year with the company)
Medical, Dental Vision and Life
PTO, wellness days and Paid Holidays
Growth Opportunities

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

401(k)
Dental insurance
Health insurance

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Kforce has a client in Fort Myers, FL that is seeking an IT Data Analyst who will communicate highly complex data trends to organizational leaders in a way that's easy to understand. The IT Data Analyst will be collaborating with the existing BI/Analytics teams, Software and Database developers to manage a centralized repository and platform to be used by all data consumers in the organization.

Responsibilities:

Interpreting data, analyzing results using statistical techniques
Developing and implementing data analyses, data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Collaborates with analytics and business teams to improve data models that feed business intelligence tools, increasing data accessibility and fostering data-driven decision making across the organization
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Implements processes and systems to monitor data quality to ensure production data is always accurate and available
Writes unit/integration tests, contributes to engineering wiki, and documents work
Using automated tools to extract data from primary and secondary sources
Developing and maintaining databases, data systems - reorganizing data in a readable format
Performing analysis to assess quality and meaning of data
Using statistical tools to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets that could be helpful for the diagnosis and prediction
Preparing final analysis reports for the stakeholders to understand the data-analysis steps, enabling them to take important decisions based on various facts and trends.
Mining data from primary and secondary sources, then reorganizing said data in a format that can be easily read by either human or machine
REQUIREMENTS:

Associate degree and 2+ years of prior experience required in Computer Science, Information Technology, Informatics, Engineering, Statistics or equivalent
Advanced SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases
Familiarity with Cloud Datawarehouse technologies (Snowflake/Redshift) and AWS Cloud services
Strong mathematical skills to help collect, measure, organize and analyze data
Proficiency in statistics and statistical packages like Excel, SPSS, SAS to be used for data set analysis
Knowledge of data visualization software like Tableau, Qlik, etc.
Knowledge of how to create and apply the most accurate algorithms to datasets in order to find solutions
Strong analytical & problem-solving skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Adept at queries, writing reports, and making presentations
Team-working, Verbal and Written communication skills
Proven working experience in data analysis
Experience designing and maintaining data systems and databases; This includes fixing coding errors and other data-related problems

Job Title: Treasury Transformation Lead Business Analyst – VP/ C13
Job Description:
The Treasury Transformation Team works closely with stakeholders to define, drive and execute end-to-end process design and implementation efforts for controls, infrastructure and operational toolsets required to support the day-to-day Liquidity Risk Management and reporting functions. These functions include but are not limited to liquidity regulatory reporting and metrics, management reporting and liquidity stress testing which span global Treasury groups, Finance functions, technology partners and business partners. The Treasury Transformation Controls Team is responsible for the delivery of Treasury’s transformation objectives related to liquidity risk and controls, and collaborates with stakeholders to identify priorities, coordinate efforts, track progress, define and implement best practices. The Treasury Transformation Controls Lead Business Analyst will be responsible to manage a set of supporting activities under the assigned book of work. The position will require coordination of activities across multiple liquidity functions, the ability to identify and recommend informed process improvements to the Project Manager and senior stakeholders. Additionally, this position will work closely with the Transformation Delivery Leads, Program Managers, Project Manager, PMO, QA/QC & IA.

Responsibilities:

Provides support and own a set of activities, working closely with the Treasury Transformation Controls Program and Project Manager.
Provides support on transformational efforts related to consent order and target state priorities, aligned with the firm-wide transformational goals.
Responsibilities can include but are not limited to: contributing to the creation and drafting of project plans and other project related artifacts, decks and stakeholder communications.
Provides support on project plan tracking, status reporting, creating and/or managing project governance forums, prioritizing workflow and resource management.
Supports transformation projects, organizational change initiatives, and the improvement, development and implementation of existing and new controls.
Applies in-depth knowledge of the business impact of process design and technical contributions.
Provides advice to internal and external clients on the implications of business trends, issues, operating environment changes and firm or business unit strategy.
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
Performs other duties and functions as assigned.
Qualifications:
6-10+ years of relevant experience, within the Financial Service.
Experience in a Project Manager and/ or Business Analyst Role, with exposure to Treasury, Liquidity Risk Management & controls strongly preferred.
Requires communication and diplomacy skills in order to guide and influence others.
Experience and demonstrated ability to manage competing priorities in a complex and dynamic environment.
Analytical mindset to resolve issues in a variety of complex situations and excellent quantitative and qualitative skills; being able to analyze data, draw conclusions, identify trends and issues, and diagnose root cause of issues.
Track record of success in delivering high quality work in a fast paced and dynamic environment.
Self-motivated with the ability to make decisions in the absence of detailed instructions.
Advanced Microsoft Office skills.
In depth knowledge of financial & regulatory reporting/ banking products / systems preferred.
Successful project management knowledge and experience preferred.
Excellent Verbal and Written Communication Skills required.
JIRA and/or Project Management System knowledge preferred or ability to quickly learn Citi’s Project Management Systems and Methodologies.
Education:
Bachelors degree required, Masters degree preferred

Description:

Prevailance is seeking an experienced, mission-focused professional to support Naval Education and Training Command (NETC) as a Training Program Analyst at Naval Education and Training Professional Development Center (NETPDC), in Pensacola, FL. Travel may be required.

Responsibilities may include a range of these tasks:

Design, review, develop, revise and implement programs and projects related to learning center rate training at a variety of proficiency levels
Analyze data, create reports, and develop strategies to improve training program performance
Assist in defining program objectives and requirements
Direct and coordinate all project efforts
Interface with senior government technical and administrative personnel as well as other contract personnel
Identify data requirements
Develop integrated conclusions and insights
Implement actions in support of defined agenda and project objectives
Provide project, financial and technical progress reports
Prepare Program Management Reviews and Milestone decision templates
Design and implement program planning timelines
Track program execution, financial execution, and expenditures
Plan, develop, and review objectives, content, methods, resources, and procedures of evaluation
Develop testing instruments to measure cognitive, psychomotor, and performance accomplishments, as well as formative and summative evaluations
Conduct analytical studies for the design, development and adaptation of education / training programs
Formative and summative evaluations
Manage and evaluate data to improve training delivery operations
Analyze course content to integrate the latest advances in a designated subject
Complete needs assessments, task analyses, and gap analyses to determine learning objectives
Coordinate the types and capabilities of instructional methods, materials, and media used in training programs
Design and implement the development of instructional material to support the training program
Plan and coordinate the development of curricula for training courses
Analyze effectiveness of new and existing training, training plans, and programs
Coordinate training schedules, costs, instructors, and required materials with organizations and outside contractors
Provide training

The Training Program Analyst will be required to administer, design, develop, and provide advice on educational /training services in formal education / training programs. They will also provide Instructional Systems Development (ISD) model practices in developing new and/or revised instructional materials. This work includes the development of lesson plans, on the job training handbooks, and student materials.

Requirements:

The Training Program Analyst shall have the following qualifications:

5 years experience in applying analytical and evaluative techniques to studies concerning the efficiency and effectiveness of training programs related to instructional development and delivery, maintenance, and providing technical assistance and advice to Training Management, OR
5 years experience in managing an educational design and development project, with two or more years professional experience working on a contract for the Navy, or another Department of Defense (DoD) agency, OR
5 years specific experience or related experience in training systems, force designs, or educational programs management, OR
5 Years Experience, or related experience, performing all aspects of training system analysis and design, leading a multi-disciplinary training design implementation team

Clearance:

Must be able to obtain and maintain a SECRET security clearance

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following, but are not limited to:

Collect, analyze, monitor, and report on operational safety trends based on analysis of relevant data at an aggregate level.
Develop dashboards and automated reporting related to key safety performance metrics.
Build data visualization by leveraging existing tools, as well as providing ongoing enhancements to business dashboards.
Design, develop and distribute safety information in a visually compelling manner to Operational Leaders.
Identify appropriate data sources, analyze data, perform trend analysis, present findings, and make recommendations in response to current safety concerns and in support of policy and process development.
Performs all additional tasks as assigned by the Safety Manager.
May perform other responsibilities as assigned. Responsibilities and duties may change when circumstances dictate (e.g., emergencies change in workload, rush jobs or technical developments).
Support effectiveness of our corporate safety management system, safety training initiatives, and safety policies/procedures.
Ensure field managers have the appropriate safety support and guidance on systems, programs, and processes.
Provide additional training, support, knowledge, and leadership to stations management as needed.
Support the consistency of established processes and standards to meet or exceed Safety Metrics and Compliance goals.
Ensure integration of all safety policies, programs and operational efficiencies into all new product lines and initiatives.
Provide safety leadership and support to internal customers and ensure all established policies / procedures / processes are in place as required.
Support the addition of new and expanding technology as it relates to safety and compliance.
Responsible for maintaining and updating various quality department software programs i.e. SharePoint, ProsafeT.
Support the development of strategies for improving safety/quality performance with quantitative outcome targets.
Investigate customer complaints and non-conformance issues and perform root cause and corrective action investigations to improve the quality and safety management system.
Track to closure the status of improvement opportunity undertakings, audit findings, and corrective actions
Maintain Investigations and Findings tracker and prepare status for weekly meetings.
Perform process-based performance audits to ensure compliance with contract criteria, and applicable regulatory requirements
Identify nonconformities, analyze nonconformities that do occur, and help set priorities for improvement to prevent re-occurrence
Quantify performance through Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), metrics
Other duties may be assigned

EDUCATION, LICENSE, and/or CERTIFICATION

Bachelor’s degree and/or relevant experience



EXPERIENCE and/or KNOWLEDGE

Excellent computer skills with various software systems. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (PowerPoint, Word, SharePoint, and Advanced Excel Skill)
2 year or more of preferred aviation safety or quality experience

SKILL and/or ABILITIES

Ability to speak and understand Spanish / English
Demonstrated ability to read and understand the documented processes and procedures needed
Excellent writing and communication skills
Excellent organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills
Strong attention to detail
Strong self-organization and self-management skills, with emphasis on self-initiation and follow through
Must pass pre-employment drug screen and background check.
